name: 3/4 Sit-Up
instructions: Lie down on the floor and secure your feet. Your legs should be bent at the knees.
Place your hands behind or to the side of your head. You will begin with your back on the ground. This will be your starting position.
Flex your hips and spine to raise your torso toward your knees.
At the top of the contraction your torso should be perpendicular to the ground. Reverse the motion, going only ¾ of the way down.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Engage Your Core
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back, bend your knees, and secure your feet.
2. Place your hands behind your head or by your ears.
3. Lift your torso towards your knees using your abs.
4. Stop when your torso is upright, forming an L-shape.
5. Lower your back until it's about 3/4 down.
6. Repeat the movement for the recommended reps.
tip: Imagine holding a small ball between your chest and knees to keep the motion controlled. 🏀
short_description: Strengthen your abs with 3/4 Sit-Ups. This beginner-friendly exercise focuses on engaging your core. Perfect for building a strong foundation! 💪

name: 90/90 Hamstring
instructions: Lie on your back, with one leg extended straight out.
With the other leg, bend the hip and knee to 90 degrees. You may brace your leg with your hands if necessary. This will be your starting position.
Extend your leg straight into the air, pausing briefly at the top. Return the leg to the starting position.
Repeat for 10-20 repetitions, and then switch to the other leg.
subtitle: Stretch Your Hamstrings
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with one leg extended out.
2. Bend the other leg at the hip and knee to 90 degrees.
3. Brace your leg with your hands if needed.
4. Extend your bent leg straight into the air.
5. Pause briefly at the top.
6. Return the leg to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling with your foot to fully extend your leg. 🦶
short_description: The 90/90 Hamstring stretch targets your hamstrings and calves. It helps improve flexibility and reduce muscle tension. Great for beginners! 🧘

name: Ab Crunch Machine
instructions: Select a light resistance and sit down on the ab machine placing your feet under the pads provided and grabbing the top handles. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle as you rest the triceps on the pads provided. This will be your starting position.

At the same time, begin to lift the legs up as you crunch your upper torso. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Be sure to use a slow and controlled motion. Concentrate on using your abs to move the weight while relaxing your legs and feet.
After a second pause, slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Target Your Abs
new_instructions:
1. Select a light resistance and sit on the ab machine.
2. Place your feet under the pads and grab the top handles.
3. Rest your triceps on the pads with arms bent at 90 degrees.
4. Lift your legs and crunch your upper torso together, exhaling.
5. Pause for a second while squeezing your abs.
6. Slowly return to the starting position while inhaling.
tip: Imagine squeezing an orange between your abs to make sure you're engaging them fully. 🍊
short_description: The Ab Crunch Machine focuses on isolating and strengthening your abs. This machine helps you achieve a strong core by guiding your movements. 💪

name: Ab Roller
instructions: Hold the Ab Roller with both hands and kneel on the floor.
Now place the ab roller on the floor in front of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a kneeling push up position). This will be your starting position.

Slowly roll the ab roller straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the floor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and keep your abs tight at all times.
subtitle: Core Strength with Ab Roller
new_instructions:
1. Hold the Ab Roller with both hands and kneel.
2. Place it in front, on all fours like a kneeling push-up.
3. Roll it forward, stretching your body into a straight line. Breathe in.
4. Go as far as you can without touching the floor.
5. Pause at the stretched position.
6. Pull back to the start while breathing out, keeping abs tight.
tip: Imagine you're pulling your belly button towards your spine to engage your abs more effectively. 🧲
short_description: Strengthen your core and shoulders with the Ab Roller. This exercise challenges your stability and builds strong abs. Great for intermediate levels! 💪

name: Adductor
instructions:
🏋️‍♂️ Intermediate | 💪 Adductors | 🔧 Foam Roll

1. Lie face down, one leg on foam roll
2. Position roll against inner thigh
3. Roll between hip and knee
4. Hold tense spots for 10-30 seconds
5. Switch legs and repeat

Tip: Relax your muscles and adjust pressure as needed. Your adductors will thank you! 😌
subtitle: Inner Thigh Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Lie face down with one leg extended on the foam roller.
2. Place the roller against your inner thigh near the groin.
3. Slowly roll down towards your knee.
4. Hold on tight spots for 10-30 seconds.
5. Roll back up, avoiding the knee.
6. Switch legs and repeat.
tip: Imagine you’re a dough being gently rolled out. Don't rush; let the roller work out the knots. 🥖
short_description: This foam roller exercise targets your adductors, helping to release tension and improve flexibility in your inner thighs. Perfect for a soothing stretch. 🧘‍♂️

name: Adductor/Groin
instructions: Lie on your back with your feet raised towards the ceiling.
Have your partner hold your feet or ankles. Abduct your legs as far as you can. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to squeeze your legs together for 10 or more seconds, while your partner prevents you from doing so.

Now, relax the muscles in your legs as your partner pushes your feet apart, stretching as far as is comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.
subtitle: Groovy Groin Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back and lift your feet towards the ceiling.
2. Ask a buddy to hold your feet or ankles.
3. Spread your legs wide apart, like you're making a big 'V'. This is your starting position.
4. Try to squeeze your legs together while your buddy keeps them apart. Hold for 10 seconds.
5. Relax your legs as your buddy gently pushes them wider. Stretch as far as it feels good.
6. Let your buddy know when the stretch is just right to avoid overstretching or injury.
tip: Think of your legs as butterfly wings 🦋. Gently flutter them to find the perfect stretch.
short_description: The Groovy Groin Stretch is perfect for loosening up those inner thigh muscles (adductors). Grab a buddy and let's make stretching fun and effective! 🦋

name: Advanced Kettlebell Windmill
instructions: Clean and press a kettlebell overhead with one arm.

Keeping the kettlebell locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out kettlebell. Keep the non-working arm behind your back and turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the kettlebell.
Lower yourself as far as possible.
Pause for a second and reverse the motion back to the starting position.
subtitle: Windmill Power Push
new_instructions:
1. Press the kettlebell overhead with one arm.
2. Push your butt out towards the kettlebell, keeping it locked out.
3. Turn your feet out at a 45-degree angle.
4. Lower yourself as far as you can go, keeping the non-working arm behind your back.
5. Pause for a moment.
6. Reverse the motion to return to the start.
tip: Imagine you're a windmill turning with the breeze – stay strong and steady! 🌬️
short_description: The Advanced Kettlebell Windmill is perfect for working those abs, glutes, and shoulders! It's a fun, dynamic move that'll make you feel like a fitness pro. 🌟

name: Air Bike
instructions: Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. For this exercise, you will need to put your hands beside your head. Be careful however to not strain with the neck as you perform it. Now lift your shoulders into the crunch position.
Bring knees up to where they are perpendicular to the floor, with your lower legs parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position.

Now simultaneously, slowly go through a cycle pedal motion kicking forward with the right leg and bringing in the knee of the left leg. Bring your right elbow close to your left knee by crunching to the side, as you breathe out.
Go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Crunch to the opposite side as you cycle your legs and bring closer your left elbow to your right knee and exhale.
Continue alternating in this manner until all of the recommended repetitions for each side have been completed.
subtitle: Pedal to the Core!
new_instructions:
1. Lie flat on your back with your hands beside your head. Keep your neck relaxed.
2. Lift your shoulders into a crunch position.
3. Bring your knees up so they're perpendicular to the floor, with lower legs parallel to the floor. This is your starting position.
4. Kick forward with your right leg while bringing your left knee in. Twist your torso to bring your right elbow towards your left knee. Exhale as you do this.
5. Return to the starting position while inhaling.
6. Repeat on the other side, kicking forward with your left leg and bringing your right knee in, while twisting to bring your left elbow towards your right knee. Exhale. Continue alternating sides.
tip: Imagine you're riding a bicycle in the air. Keep the motion smooth and steady, like pedaling through the clouds! ☁️🚴
short_description: Feel the burn in your abs with the Air Bike! This beginner-friendly move mimics cycling in the air, giving your core a fantastic workout. Keep it up, and pedal your way to a stronger core! 🚴‍♂️

name: All Fours Quad Stretch
instructions: Start off on your hands and knees, then lift your leg off the floor and hold the foot with your hand.
Use your hand to hold the foot or ankle, keeping the knee fully flexed, stretching the quadriceps and hip flexors.
Focus on extending your hips, thrusting them towards the floor. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.
subtitle: Happy Quad Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Get on your hands and knees like you're about to crawl.
2. Lift one leg up and grab your foot with the same side hand.
3. Hold your foot or ankle, keeping your knee bent.
4. Feel the stretch in your thigh and hip.
5. Push your hips towards the floor gently.
6. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch legs.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the ceiling with your knee! 🦵
short_description: Stretch out your thighs and hips with this fun move! It's perfect for anyone looking to improve flexibility and relax those muscles. Feel the happy vibes as you stretch! 😊

name: Alternate Hammer Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boostin' Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides.
2. Keep your palms facing your torso. This is your starting stance.
3. Curl the right dumbbell up to your shoulder, squeezing your bicep. Breathe out as you do this.
4. Hold for a second at the top, really feeling that burn!
5. Lower the dumbbell back down slowly while breathing in.
6. Now, switch to your left hand and repeat. Keep alternating till you're done!
tip: Imagine you're holding a hammer, and you're about to drive in a nail. 🛠️ Keep that grip strong and steady!
short_description: Pump up your biceps and forearms with Alternate Hammer Curls. This beginner-friendly move is perfect for sculpting those arms. Let's get curling and feel that awesome burn! 💪

name: Alternate Heel Touchers
instructions: Lie on the floor with the knees bent and the feet on the floor around 18-24 inches apart. Your arms should be extended by your side. This will be your starting position.
Crunch over your torso forward and up about 3-4 inches to the right side and touch your right heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement.
Now go back slowly to the starting position as you inhale.

Now crunch over your torso forward and up around 3-4 inches to the left side and touch your left heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement and then go back to the starting position as you inhale. Now that both heels have been touched, that is considered 1 repetition.
Continue alternating sides in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.
subtitle: Tap Those Toes!
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, about hip-width apart.
2. Stretch your arms straight down by your sides. This is your starting spot.
3. Lift your shoulders slightly off the floor and reach your right hand towards your right heel. Exhale as you reach.
4. Lower back to the starting spot while inhaling.
5. Now, lift your shoulders again and reach your left hand towards your left heel. Exhale as you reach.
6. Repeat this toe-tapping action, alternating sides for the entire set!
tip: Imagine you're a puppet and someone's gently pulling your strings to make you reach your toes! 🎭
short_description: Alternate Heel Touchers are a fun way to work your abs. You'll feel the burn as you reach for your heels, one side at a time. Great for building core strength! 🔥

name: Alternate Incline Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. Tip: Keep the elbows close to the torso.This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. As you do so, rotate the hand so that the palm is facing up. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbell back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boost Bonanza!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** down on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended. Keep those elbows close to your torso. 
2. **Curl** the right dumbbell up while rotating your hand so the palm faces up. Squeeze that bicep at the top! 
3. **Pause** for a second to feel the burn, then slowly lower the weight back to the start. 
4. **Repeat** the curl with your left hand to complete one rep. 
5. **Alternate** arms and keep the motion smooth for the recommended reps. 
6. **Breathe** out as you curl up, and breathe in as you lower down.
tip: Imagine you're lifting a heavy shopping bag 🍎. Keep your forearms steady and feel the bicep burn!
short_description: This fun and effective move will fire up your biceps and forearms! Grab some dumbbells and feel the pump! 💪

name: Alternate Leg Diagonal Bound
instructions: Assume a comfortable stance with one foot slightly in front of the other.
Begin by pushing off with the front leg, driving the opposite knee forward and as high as possible before landing. Attempt to cover as much distance to each side with each bound.
It may help to use a line on the ground to guage distance from side to side.
Repeat the sequence with the other leg.
subtitle: Diagonal Leg Jumps
new_instructions:
1. Stand with one foot slightly in front of the other, ready to jump.
2. Push off with your front leg, bringing your opposite knee up high.
3. Leap to the side, aiming to cover as much distance as you can.
4. Land softly on the opposite foot.
5. Repeat the jump with the other leg, going in the opposite direction.
6. Keep alternating legs, jumping side to side.
tip: Imagine you're leaping over a small stream 🏞️—lift your knees and reach far!
short_description: Diagonal Leg Jumps are a fun plyometric move that works your quads, glutes, and more! Perfect for boosting your leg power and coordination. Ready, set, leap! 🌟

name: Alternating Cable Shoulder Press
instructions: Move the cables to the bottom of the tower and select an appropriate weight.
Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to press one side directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
subtitle: Cable Shoulder Press Party
new_instructions:
1. Move the cables to the bottom of the tower and pick a weight you can handle.
2. Grab the cables and hold them at shoulder height with your palms facing forward. This is your starting spot.
3. Keep your head and chest up tall, and push one cable straight up over your head.
4. Pause at the top, feeling the stretch, then bring it back to shoulder height.
5. Now, do the same thing with the other arm. Alternate like you're having a shoulder party!
6. Keep alternating arms, pressing and pausing at the top each time.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling higher with each press! 🚀
short_description: The Alternating Cable Shoulder Press works your shoulders and triceps while giving you a fun twist with alternating arms. Perfect for beginners, it's a great way to build strength and coordination. 🎉

name: Alternating Deltoid Raise
instructions: In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
Return the weights to your side.
On the next repetition, raise the weights laterally, raising them out to your side to about shoulder height.
Return the weights to the starting position and continue alternating to the front and side.
subtitle: Shoulder Power Dance
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with dumbbells at your sides.
2. Slightly bend your elbows and lift the weights straight in front of you to shoulder height.
3. Lower the weights back to your sides without swinging.
4. Next, raise the weights out to your sides to shoulder height.
5. Lower them back to the starting position.
6. Keep alternating between front and lateral raises.
tip: Think of your arms as graceful bird wings 🕊️—move smoothly and avoid jerky motions!
short_description: Get ready to sculpt those shoulders with the Alternating Deltoid Raise! This beginner-friendly move isolates your shoulder muscles for maximum burn. You'll be rocking those tank tops in no time! 🏋️

name: Alternating Floor Press
instructions: Lie on the floor with two kettlebells next to your shoulders.
Position one in place on your chest and then the other, gripping the kettlebells on the handle with the palms facing forward.
Extend both arms, so that the kettlebells are being held above your chest. Lower one kettlebell, bringing it to your chest and turn the wrist in the direction of the locked out kettlebell.
Raise the kettlebell and repeat on the opposite side.
subtitle: Chest Press Party!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie** on the floor with kettlebells by your shoulders.
2. **Grip** the handles with palms facing forward.
3. **Press** both kettlebells up above your chest.
4. **Lower** one kettlebell to your chest, turning the wrist slightly.
5. **Raise** it back up and **switch** to the other side.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps.
tip: 🎯 Imagine shooting lasers from your chest to the ceiling. Keep those beams straight and steady!
short_description: Pump up your chest and triceps with the Alternating Floor Press! It's perfect for beginners and a blast to do with kettlebells. Keep it steady and feel those muscles working! 💪

name: Alternating Hang Clean
instructions: Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.

Clean one kettlebell to your shoulder and hold on to the other kettlebell in a hanging position. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so.
Lower the cleaned kettlebell to a hanging position and clean the alternate kettlebell. Repeat.
subtitle: Swing and Clean Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Position**: Place two kettlebells between your feet and push your butt back.
2. **Focus**: Look straight ahead, engage your core.
3. **Lift**: Clean one kettlebell to your shoulder by extending your legs and hips. Rotate your wrist as it reaches your shoulder.
4. **Switch**: Lower the cleaned kettlebell back to a hanging position.
5. **Alternate**: Clean the opposite kettlebell to your shoulder.
6. **Repeat**: Continue alternating in a fluid motion.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a big jacket! 🧥 Keep the kettlebell close to your body as you lift to maintain control and power.
short_description: Get ready to swing and clean your way to stronger hamstrings and more! This move alternates lifting kettlebells to your shoulders, working multiple muscles for a full-body workout. Stay strong and have fun! 💪

name: Alternating Kettlebell Press
instructions: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Press one directly overhead by extending through the elbow, turning it so the palm faces forward while holding the other kettlebell stationary .
Lower the pressed kettlebell to the starting position and immediately press with your other arm.
subtitle: Kettlebell See-Saw Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Push one kettlebell overhead, turning your palm forward.
3. Hold the other kettlebell steady at your shoulder.
4. Lower the pressed kettlebell back down to your shoulder.
5. Immediately press the other kettlebell up, turning its palm forward.
6. Keep alternating presses, like a see-saw, with control.
tip: Think of each arm as a piston in an engine—smooth and powerful! 🔧
short_description: Boost your shoulder strength with the Alternating Kettlebell Press! This exercise targets your shoulders and triceps, helping you build a powerful upper body. 🌟

name: Alternating Kettlebell Row
instructions: Place two kettlebells in front of your feet. Bend your knees slightly and push your butt out as much as possible. As you bend over to get into the starting position grab both kettlebells by the handles.

Pull one kettlebell off of the floor while holding on to the other kettlebell. Retract the shoulder blade of the working side, as you flex the elbow, drawing the kettlebell towards your stomach or rib cage.
Lower the kettlebell in the working arm and repeat with your other arm.
subtitle: Row, Row, Row Your Kettlebells!
new_instructions:
1. Place two kettlebells in front of your feet.
2. Bend your knees slightly and push your butt out.
3. Bend over and grab the kettlebells by the handles.
4. Pull one kettlebell off the floor, retracting your shoulder blade and flexing your elbow.
5. Draw the kettlebell towards your stomach or rib cage.
6. Lower it back down and switch to the other arm.
tip: Imagine you're starting a lawnmower—give it a strong, steady pull! 🏋️‍♂️
short_description: Get ready to row your way to a stronger back with the Alternating Kettlebell Row! This move targets your middle back, biceps, and lats in a fun and effective way. Grab those kettlebells and let's get rowing! 🚣‍♂️

name: Alternating Renegade Row
instructions: Place two kettlebells on the floor about shoulder width apart. Position yourself on your toes and your hands as though you were doing a pushup, with the body straight and extended. Use the handles of the kettlebells to support your upper body. You may need to position your feet wide for support.
Push one kettlebell into the floor and row the other kettlebell, retracting the shoulder blade of the working side as you flex the elbow, pulling it to your side.
Then lower the kettlebell to the floor and begin the kettlebell in the opposite hand. Repeat for several reps.
subtitle: Row, Row, Renegade!
new_instructions:
1. Place two kettlebells on the floor, shoulder-width apart. 
2. Get into a push-up position with your hands on the kettlebell handles, body straight. 
3. Push one kettlebell into the floor while rowing the other towards your side. 
4. Retract your shoulder blade and flex your elbow as you pull the kettlebell. 
5. Lower the kettlebell back down and switch to the opposite hand. 
6. Keep alternating for several reps, maintaining a strong core.
tip: 🧲 Imagine you're a magnet pulling the kettlebell towards you. Keep your core tight like you're holding a superhero pose!
short_description: The Alternating Renegade Row is an expert-level move that targets your middle back and core, while also working your biceps, chest, lats, and triceps. It's a compound exercise that will make you feel like a superhero! 🦸‍♂️

name: Ankle Circles
instructions: Use a sturdy object like a squat rack to hold yourself.

Lift the right leg in the air (just around 2 inches from the floor) and perform a circular motion with the big toe. Pretend that you are drawing a big circle with it. Tip: One circle equals 1 repetition. Breathe normally as you perform the movement.
When you are done with the right foot, then repeat with the left leg.
subtitle: Toe Twirls
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall and hold onto something sturdy, like a wall or a squat rack. 
2. Lift your right foot slightly off the ground, about 2 inches. 
3. Start drawing a big circle in the air with your big toe, moving it smoothly. 
4. Complete one full circle, breathing normally as you go. 
5. Repeat this circling motion 10 times with your right foot. 
6. Switch to your left foot and do the same thing, drawing big circles.
tip: Imagine you're tracing a giant pizza in the air with your toe. 🍕 Keep it smooth and controlled for the best stretch.
short_description: Ankle Circles are a fun and easy way to stretch and strengthen your calves. They're perfect for beginners and can be done anywhere. Give your ankles some love and make those circles! 🔄

name: Ankle On The Knee
instructions: From a lying position, bend your knees and keep your feet on the floor.
Place your ankle of one foot on your opposite knee.
Grasp the thigh or knee of the bottom leg and pull both of your legs into the chest. Relax your neck and shoulders. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.
subtitle: Knee's Best Friend
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back and bend your knees, feet flat on the floor.
2. Place one ankle on the opposite knee, making a figure-four shape.
3. Reach and grab the thigh or knee of the bottom leg.
4. Gently pull both legs towards your chest.
5. Keep your neck and shoulders relaxed.
6. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides.
tip: Think of your legs like a figure-four 🕺. Keep it gentle and smooth!
short_description: Stretch out and relax with the Ankle On The Knee stretch. This move targets your glutes, making it perfect for relieving tension and increasing flexibility. Give it a try and feel the difference! 🧘‍♂️

name: Anterior Tibialis-SMR
instructions: Begin seated on the ground with your legs bent and your feet on the floor.

Using a Muscle Roller or a rolling pin, apply pressure to the muscles on the outside of your shins. Work from just below the knee to above the ankle, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat on the other leg.
subtitle: Shin Relief Roller!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the ground with your legs bent and feet on the floor.
2. **Grab** a Muscle Roller or rolling pin.
3. **Press** the roller against the outside muscles of your shins.
4. **Roll** from just below your knee to above your ankle.
5. **Pause** at any tight spots for 10-30 seconds.
6. **Repeat** on your other leg.
tip: Imagine you're smoothing out dough with a rolling pin. 🍞 Keep the pressure even and steady!
short_description: Roll away shin tightness with this intermediate stretch! It targets your calf muscles, helping to relieve tension and improve flexibility. Give your shins some love! 🦵

name: Anti-Gravity Press
instructions: Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbell up from the floor. Flex the elbows, performing a reverse curl to bring the bar near your chest. This will be your starting position.
To begin, press the barbell out in front of your head by extending your elbows. Keep your arms parallel to the ground throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat to complete the set.
subtitle: Fly High Press
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Place a barbell on the ground behind the head of an incline bench. 
2. **Get Ready**: Lay face down on the bench and grab the barbell with an overhand grip. 
3. **Lift Off**: Perform a reverse curl to bring the bar near your chest, elbows bent. 
4. **Press Forward**: Extend your elbows to press the barbell out in front of your head, arms parallel to the ground. 
5. **Return**: Bring the barbell back to the starting position near your chest. 
6. **Repeat**: Continue for the desired number of reps.
tip: 🛫 Imagine you're a superhero taking off! Keep your arms steady and parallel like you're gliding through the sky.
short_description: The Anti-Gravity Press works your shoulders, back, and triceps. It's a fun way to strengthen and lift off into stronger shoulders! 🌟

name: Arm Circles
instructions: Stand up and extend your arms straight out by the sides. The arms should be parallel to the floor and perpendicular (90-degree angle) to your torso. This will be your starting position.
Slowly start to make circles of about 1 foot in diameter with each outstretched arm. Breathe normally as you perform the movement.
Continue the circular motion of the outstretched arms for about ten seconds. Then reverse the movement, going the opposite direction.
subtitle: Circle Up Those Shoulders
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall and stretch your arms out to your sides. Keep them parallel to the floor.
2. Start making small circles with your arms, about the size of a dinner plate.
3. Keep breathing normally as you move your arms.
4. Continue circling for 10 seconds.
5. Switch direction and circle the other way for another 10 seconds.
6. Bring your arms down slowly and relax.
tip: Imagine you're drawing circles on a chalkboard with your fingertips 🖍️. This helps keep your movements smooth and controlled!
short_description: Arm Circles are a super easy way to wake up your shoulders and traps. Perfect for beginners, this move helps stretch and strengthen. Give it a whirl and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Arnold Dumbbell Press
instructions: Sit on an exercise bench with back support and hold two dumbbells in front of you at about upper chest level with your palms facing your body and your elbows bent. Tip: Your arms should be next to your torso. The starting position should look like the contracted portion of a dumbbell curl.
Now to perform the movement, raise the dumbbells as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
Continue lifting the dumbbells until your arms are extended above you in straight arm position. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement.

After a second pause at the top, begin to lower the dumbbells to the original position by rotating the palms of your hands towards you. Tip: The left arm will be rotated in a counter clockwise manner while the right one will be rotated clockwise. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Power Press
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with back support and hold dumbbells at chest level, palms facing you. 
2. Position your arms next to your torso like you're ready to curl. 
3. Lift the dumbbells while rotating your palms forward.
4. Extend your arms fully above you as you breathe out. 
5. Pause for a second at the top. 
6. Lower the dumbbells back, rotating your palms towards you, and breathe in.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling up with your hands! 🏋️‍♂️
short_description: The Arnold Dumbbell Press is an awesome move to power up your shoulders and triceps. Named after the legendary Arnold Schwarzenegger, this exercise will have you feeling like a champion! 🏆

name: Around The Worlds
instructions: Lay down on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with the palms of the hands facing towards the ceiling. Tip: Your arms should be parallel to the floor and next to your thighs. To avoid injury, make sure that you keep your elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position.

Now move the dumbbells by creating a semi-circle as you displace them from the initial position to over the head. All of the movement should happen with the arms parallel to the floor at all times. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Reverse the movement to return the weight to the starting position as you exhale.
subtitle: Spin and Win!
new_instructions:
1. Lay down on a flat bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up. 
2. Keep your arms parallel to the floor, next to your thighs, with elbows slightly bent. 
3. Start creating a semi-circle with the dumbbells, moving them from your thighs to over your head. 
4. Keep your arms parallel to the floor during the entire movement. 
5. Breathe in as you move the weights over your head. 
6. Reverse the movement, bringing the weights back to the starting position while you exhale.
tip: Imagine you're drawing a big rainbow 🌈 with the dumbbells. Keep that arch smooth and controlled.
short_description: Around The Worlds will set your chest and shoulders on fire in the best way! This move combines strength and control as you create a big, circular motion with dumbbells. 🌟

name: Atlas Stone Trainer
instructions: This trainer is effective for developing Atlas Stone strength for those who don't have access to stones, and are typically made from bar ends or heavy pipe.
Begin by loading the desired weight onto the bar. Straddle the weight, wrapping your arms around the implement, bending at the hips.

Begin by pulling the weight up past the knees, extending through the hips. As the weight clears the knees, it can be lapped by resting it on your thighs and sitting back, hugging it tightly to your chest.
Finish the movement by extending through your hips and knees to raise the weight as high as possible. The weight can be returned to the lap or to the ground for successive repetitions.
subtitle: Lift Like an Ancient Titan!
new_instructions:
1. Load the bar with your chosen weight.
2. Stand over the weight and bend at your hips, wrapping your arms around it.
3. Pull the weight up past your knees, extending your hips.
4. As it clears your knees, rest it on your thighs and sit back, hugging it to your chest.
5. Extend your hips and knees to lift the weight high.
6. Return the weight to your lap or ground for the next rep.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a giant boulder like a strongman. 💪 It helps you keep the weight close to your body!
short_description: Unleash your inner strongman with the Atlas Stone Trainer! This intermediate exercise targets your lower back, legs, and arms, turning you into a lifting legend. 🗿

name: Atlas Stones
instructions: Begin with the atlas stone between your feet. Bend at the hips to wrap your arms vertically around the Atlas Stone, attempting to get your fingers underneath the stone. Many stones will have a small flat portion on the bottom, which will make the stone easier to hold.
Pulling the stone into your torso, drive through the back half of your feet to pull the stone from the ground.
As the stone passes the knees, lap it by sitting backward, pulling the stone on top of your thighs.

Sit low, getting the stone high onto your chest as you change your grip to reach over the stone. Stand, driving through with your hips. Close distance to the loading platform, and lean back, extending the hips to get the stone as high as possible.
subtitle: Lift Like a Strongman!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with the atlas stone between your feet.
2. **Bend at your hips** and wrap your arms around the stone, sliding your fingers underneath.
3. **Pull the stone** into your torso and drive through your feet to lift it off the ground.
4. **Lap the stone** by sitting back as it passes your knees, pulling it onto your thighs.
5. **Grip over** the stone and stand up, driving through your hips to lift it onto your chest.
6. **Close the gap** to the platform, lean back, and extend your hips to place the stone high.
tip: Imagine you’re hugging a giant, heavy beach ball! 🌊 Keep it close to your body for better control.
short_description: Atlas Stones are a classic strongman exercise that tests your full-body strength. Lift, lap, and load the stone to build power and endurance. Feel like a true strongman! 🪨💪

name: Axle Deadlift
instructions: Approach the bar so that it is centered over your feet. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, allowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typically, you would use an over/under grip.

With your feet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knees until your shins contact the bar. Look forward with your head, keep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the heels to move the weight upward.
After the bar passes the knees, aggressively pull the bar back, pulling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the floor.
subtitle: Lift with Grit!
new_instructions:
1. Approach the bar, feet hip-width apart, bar centered.
2. Bend at hips, grip bar with an over/under grip.
3. Lower hips, flex knees till shins touch bar, chest up.
4. Drive through heels to lift bar, head forward.
5. Pull bar back, drive hips forward after bar passes knees.
6. Lower bar by bending at hips, guide to floor.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful crane lifting a heavy load—keep your movements strong and steady! 🚧
short_description: The Axle Deadlift is a powerhouse move that targets your lower back and other key muscles. Perfect for building strength and grit. Ready to lift like a strongman? 💪

name: Back Flyes - With Bands
instructions: Run a band around a stationary post like that of a squat rack.
Grab the band by the handles and stand back so that the tension in the band rises.

Extend and lift the arms straight in front of you. Tip: Your arms should be straight and parallel to the floor while perpendicular to your torso. Your feet should be firmly planted on the floor spread at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, move your arms to the sides and back. Keep your arms extended and parallel to the floor. Continue the movement until the arms are extended to your sides.
After a pause, go back to the original position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Band Boosted Back Flyes
new_instructions:
1. Loop the resistance band around a sturdy post.
2. Grab the handles and step back to create tension.
3. Extend your arms straight in front at shoulder height.
4. Pull your arms out to the sides, keeping them parallel to the floor.
5. Pause, then return to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're spreading your wings like a majestic eagle 🦅. Keep your arms straight and strong!
short_description: Pump up those shoulders and middle back with Band Boosted Back Flyes! This move uses resistance bands to strengthen your upper body. Let's fly strong and feel the burn! 💪

name: Backward Drag
instructions: Load a sled with the desired weight, attaching a rope or straps to the sled that you can hold onto.
Begin the exercise by moving backwards for a given distance. Leaning back, extend through the legs for short steps to move as quickly as possible.
subtitle: Pull Back Power
new_instructions:
1. Load a sled with the weight you want to pull.
2. Attach a rope or straps to the sled. 
3. Hold onto the rope or straps firmly.
4. Start walking backward, pulling the sled with you.
5. Lean back slightly and take short, quick steps.
6. Keep moving until you reach your target distance.
tip: Imagine you're pulling a stubborn mule 🐴—keep those steps short and strong!
short_description: Strengthen your quads, glutes, and more with the Backward Drag! This beginner-friendly move will have you pulling weight like a pro in no time. 💪

name: Backward Medicine Ball Throw
instructions: This exercise is best done with a partner. If you lack a partner, the ball can be thrown and retrieved or thrown against a wall.
Begin standing a few meters in front of your partner, both facing the same direction. Begin holding the ball between your legs.
Squat down and then forcefully reverse direction, coming to full extension and you toss the ball over your head to your partner.
Your partner can then roll the ball back to you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Toss It Back!
new_instructions:
1. Stand a few meters in front of your partner, both facing the same direction. Hold the medicine ball between your legs.

2. Squat down low, feeling the burn in your legs.

3. Explode upward, tossing the ball over your head as far as you can.

4. Watch the ball soar to your partner - keep those eyes on the prize!

5. Your partner will roll the ball back to you. If solo, throw against a wall and retrieve.

6. Repeat for the number of reps you want, keeping up that energy!
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket 🚀. Push hard and aim high to get the best throw!
short_description: The Backward Medicine Ball Throw is an awesome way to work your shoulders while having fun! Toss the ball with power and feel the burn. Great for beginners and perfect for adding a playful twist to your workout! 💥

name: Balance Board
instructions: Place a balance board in front of you.
Stand up on it and try to balance yourself.
Hold the balance for as long as desired.
subtitle: Balancing Act Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Place the balance board on a flat surface.
2. Step onto the board with one foot, then the other.
3. Keep your knees slightly bent.
4. Focus on a point in front of you to help balance.
5. Adjust your weight to find your center.
6. Hold the balance for as long as you can.
tip: Imagine you're surfing on a calm wave 🌊. Keep your core tight and flow with the motion!
short_description: The Balance Board exercise is a fun way to strengthen your calves, hamstrings, and quads. It's perfect for beginners looking to improve stability and coordination. Give it a try and ride the wave of balance! 🌟

name: Ball Leg Curl
instructions: Begin on the floor laying on your back with your feet on top of the ball.
Position the ball so that when your legs are extended your ankles are on top of the ball. This will be your starting position.
Raise your hips off of the ground, keeping your weight on the shoulder blades and your feet.
Flex the knees, pulling the ball as close to you as you can, contracting the hamstrings.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Hamstring Happiness Roll
new_instructions:
1. Lay on your back with your feet on top of the exercise ball.
2. Position the ball so your ankles rest on it when your legs are straight.
3. Lift your hips off the ground, weight on your shoulder blades and feet.
4. Bend your knees and roll the ball towards you, squeezing your hamstrings.
5. Pause for a moment, then roll the ball back to the start position.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping a steady pace.
tip: Think of the ball like a rolling pin, smoothing out a dough of strong muscles! 🥖
short_description: The Ball Leg Curl is an awesome beginner move that targets your hamstrings, calves, and glutes. Roll your way to stronger legs and a happier you! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Band Assisted Pull-Up
instructions: Choke the band around the center of the pullup bar. You can use different bands to provide varying levels of assistance.
Pull the end of the band down, and place one bent knee into the loop, ensuring it won't slip out. Take a medium to wide grip on the bar. This will be your starting position.

Pull yourself upward by contracting the lats as you flex the elbow. The elbow should be driven to your side. Pull to the front, attempting to get your chin over the bar. Avoid swinging or jerking movements.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Boosted Pull-Up Fun
new_instructions:
1. Loop the band around the center of the pull-up bar securely. 
2. Pull the end of the band down and place one bent knee into the loop. 
3. Grab the bar with a medium to wide grip. This is your starting position.
4. Pull yourself up by squeezing your lats and bending your elbows. 
5. Aim to get your chin over the bar. Keep it smooth—no swinging! 
6. Pause briefly, then lower yourself back down to the start.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero, lifting off smoothly and controlled 🦸‍♂️. Keep your movements strong and steady!
short_description: The Band Assisted Pull-Up helps beginners master the pull-up by providing a boost with a resistance band. Great for building back strength and confidence! 💪

name: Band Good Morning
instructions: Using a 41 inch band, stand on one end, spreading your feet a small amount. Bend at the hips to loop the end of the band behind your neck. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your legs straight, extend through the hips to come to a near vertical position.
Ensure that you do not round your back as you go down back to the starting position.
subtitle: Morning Stretch Power-Up
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** on one end of a 41-inch resistance band, feet slightly apart. 
2. **Bend** at the hips and loop the other end of the band behind your neck. This is your starting position. 
3. **Keep** your legs straight as you extend through your hips to stand up tall. 
4. **Return** to the starting position by bending at the hips again. 
5. **Ensure** your back stays straight and doesn't round during the movement. 
6. **Repeat** these steps for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful superhero lifting off the ground! 🦸‍♂️ Keep your back straight and strong like a cape flying in the wind.
short_description: The Band Good Morning is a fantastic move to stretch and strengthen your hamstrings, glutes, and lower back. It's like a morning stretch but with superpowers! 💪 Perfect for beginners looking to add some oomph to their routine.

name: Band Good Morning (Pull Through)
instructions: Loop the band around a post. Standing a little ways away, loop the opposite end around the neck. Your hands can help hold the band in position.
Begin by bending at the hips, getting your butt back as far as possible. Keep your back flat and bend forward to about 90 degrees. Your knees should be only slightly bent.
Return to the starting position be driving through with the hips to come back to a standing position.
subtitle: Morning Stretch Magic
new_instructions:
1. Loop the band around a sturdy post and then around your neck. Use your hands to keep the band in place.
2. Step back a bit to create tension in the band. Stand tall with a slight bend in your knees.
3. Bend at the hips and push your butt back as far as you can. Keep your back flat.
4. Lower your torso until it's nearly parallel to the ground. Feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Drive through your hips to return to a standing position. Squeeze your glutes at the top.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping a controlled pace.
tip: Imagine you're a hinge on a door swinging gently. 🚪 Keep your back flat and move smoothly.
short_description: The Band Good Morning (Pull Through) is a great exercise to target your hamstrings, glutes, and lower back. It's perfect for beginners looking to strengthen their posterior chain with resistance bands. 🌟

name: Band Hip Adductions
instructions: Anchor a band around a solid post or other object.
Stand with your left side to the post, and put your right foot through the band, getting it around the ankle.
Stand up straight and hold onto the post if needed. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the knee straight, raise your right legs out to the side as far as you can.
Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired rep count.
Switch sides.
subtitle: Side Leg Squeeze
new_instructions:
1. Anchor a resistance band around something sturdy.
2. Stand with your left side facing the anchor and loop the band around your right ankle.
3. Keep your back straight and hold onto the anchor for balance.
4. Pull your right leg straight out to the side as far as you can.
5. Bring your leg back to the starting position slowly.
6. Repeat for your reps, then switch sides and do it again!
tip: Imagine you're pushing against a strong wind 🌬️ to really work those muscles.
short_description: Feel the burn in your inner thighs with Band Hip Adductions! This move uses resistance bands to target and tone your adductors. Perfect for beginners and a great addition to any strength routine! 💪

name: Band Pull Apart
instructions: Begin with your arms extended straight out in front of you, holding the band with both hands.
Initiate the movement by performing a reverse fly motion, moving your hands out laterally to your sides.
Keep your elbows extended as you perform the movement, bringing the band to your chest. Ensure that you keep your shoulders back during the exercise.
Pause as you complete the movement, returning to the starting position under control.
subtitle: Stretch and Strengthen
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a resistance band and **extend** your arms straight in front of you, holding the band with both hands.
2. **Stand** tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
3. **Pull** the band apart by moving your hands out to your sides like you're giving a big hug.
4. **Keep** your elbows straight and shoulder blades squeezed together.
5. **Bring** the band to your chest, feeling the stretch in your shoulders and upper back.
6. **Return** to the starting position with control, ready for the next rep.
tip: Imagine you're trying to pinch a pencil between your shoulder blades as you pull the band apart. ✏️
short_description: The Band Pull Apart is a fantastic move to strengthen your shoulders and upper back using a simple resistance band. It's perfect for beginners and a great way to improve posture. 💪

name: Band Skull Crusher
instructions: Secure a band to the base of a rack or the bench. Lay on the bench so that the band is lined up with your head.
Take hold of the band, raising your elbows so that the upper arm is perpendicular to the floor. With the elbow flexed, the band should be above your head. This will be your starting position.
Extend through the elbow to straighten your arm, keeping your upper arm in place. Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.
subtitle: Tricep Band Blaster
new_instructions:
1. Secure a resistance band to the base of a rack or your bench. 
2. Lay down on the bench, aligning the band with your head. 
3. Grab the band and lift your elbows so your upper arms are perpendicular to the floor, with the band above your head. This is your starting position. 
4. Extend your elbows to straighten your arms, keeping your upper arms in place. 
5. Pause at the top, feeling the burn in your triceps. 
6. Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for reps.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the band away to reveal a hidden treasure chest 🏴‍☠️. Keep those upper arms steady!
short_description: Blast those triceps with the Band Skull Crusher! This beginner-friendly move isolates your triceps using resistance bands. It's a fun and effective way to build arm strength 💪. Give it a try and feel the burn!

name: Barbell Ab Rollout
instructions: For this exercise you will need to get into a pushup position, but instead of having your hands of the floor, you will be grabbing on to an Olympic barbell (loaded with 5-10 lbs on each side) instead. This will be your starting position.

While keeping a slight arch on your back, lift your hips and roll the barbell towards your feet as you exhale. Tip: As you perform the movement, your glutes should be coming up, you should be keeping the abs tight and should maintain your back posture at all times. Also your arms should be staying perpendicular to the floor throughout the movement. If you don't, you will work out your shoulders and back more than the abs.
After a second contraction at the top, start to roll the barbell back forward to the starting position slowly as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Roll Your Way to Rock-Hard Abs
new_instructions:
1. Start in a pushup position with your hands gripping an Olympic barbell loaded with small weights.
2. Keep a slight arch in your back and lift your hips.
3. Roll the barbell towards your feet as you exhale. Keep your abs tight.
4. Ensure your arms stay perpendicular to the floor to engage your abs.
5. Hold the position for a second at the top.
6. Roll the barbell back to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat.
tip: Think of your abs as a tight coil spring, keeping tension throughout! 🌀
short_description: The Barbell Ab Rollout is a dynamic exercise targeting your abs, lower back, and shoulders. It's like giving your core a wake-up call! 🌟 Perfect for those looking to level up their ab game.

name: Barbell Ab Rollout - On Knees
instructions: Hold an Olympic barbell loaded with 5-10lbs on each side and kneel on the floor.
Now place the barbell on the floor in front of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a kneeling push up position). This will be your starting position.

Slowly roll the barbell straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the floor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a second pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and keep your abs tight at all times.
subtitle: Knee Rollout Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Grab a barbell with light weights on each side and kneel down.
2. Place the barbell on the floor in front of you, like a kneeling push-up position.
3. Slowly roll the barbell forward, stretching your body straight. Inhale as you go.
4. Roll forward as far as you can without touching the floor with your body.
5. Pause for a second in the stretched position.
6. Pull yourself back to the start as you exhale, keeping your abs tight.
tip: Imagine you're a cat stretching its body long and lean. 🐱 Keep your abs tight like a cat ready to pounce!
short_description: Roll your way to awesome abs with the Barbell Ab Rollout! This move stretches and strengthens your core, giving your abs and lower back a great workout. Feel the burn and have fun doing it! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Barbell Bench Press - Medium Grip
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
From the starting position, breathe in and begin coming down slowly until the bar touches your middle chest.

After a brief pause, push the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out. Focus on pushing the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position at the top of the motion, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: Ideally, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Bench Press Bonanza!
new_instructions:
1. Lie back on a flat bench with your feet firmly on the ground.
2. Grip the barbell with a medium width, forming a 90-degree angle at your elbows.
3. Lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with arms locked.
4. Inhale and slowly lower the bar until it touches your mid-chest.
5. Exhale and push the bar back up, locking your arms and squeezing your chest.
6. Repeat for the desired reps and carefully rack the bar when done.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the bar away from you like you’re trying to move a heavy door. 🚪 Use your chest power!
short_description: The Barbell Bench Press is a classic move to build chest, shoulder, and tricep strength. Perfect for beginners, it helps you push your limits and get stronger! 💪

name: Barbell Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at a shoulder-width grip. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and the elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boostin' Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with palms facing forward. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
2. Curl the barbell up while squeezing your biceps. Breathe out as you lift.
3. Lift until the barbell is at shoulder level. Hold and squeeze your biceps for a second.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position while breathing in.
5. Keep your upper arms still; only your forearms should move.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, feeling the burn!
tip: Imagine you're lifting a treasure chest filled with gold! 🏋️‍♂️ Keep that chest proud and elbows steady.
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Barbell Curl! This classic move targets your biceps and forearms, making your arms stronger and more defined. Feel the power with every curl! 💪

name: Barbell Curls Lying Against An Incline
instructions: Lie against an incline bench, with your arms holding a barbell and hanging down in a horizontal line. This will be your starting position.

While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weight up as high as you can while squeezing the biceps. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Do not swing the arms.
After a second contraction, slowly go back to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you go all of the way down.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boost Bonanza
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on an incline bench, holding a barbell with your arms hanging down straight.
2. **Start** with your arms in a horizontal line. This is your starting position.
3. **Curl** the barbell up while squeezing your biceps. Breathe out as you lift.
4. **Keep** your upper arms stationary; only your forearms should move.
5. **Hold** the top position for a second, then slowly lower the barbell back down as you inhale.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions, keeping your movements smooth and controlled.
tip: 🎯 Imagine your biceps as balloons inflating with each curl. Keep that squeeze tight!
short_description: Boost your biceps with this fun and effective exercise! Lying against an incline bench helps isolate your biceps, giving them a fantastic workout. Pump up those guns and enjoy the burn! 💪

name: Barbell Deadlift
instructions: Stand in front of a loaded barbell.

While keeping the back as straight as possible, bend your knees, bend forward and grasp the bar using a medium (shoulder width) overhand grip. This will be the starting position of the exercise. Tip: If it is difficult to hold on to the bar with this grip, alternate your grip or use wrist straps.

While holding the bar, start the lift by pushing with your legs while simultaneously getting your torso to the upright position as you breathe out. In the upright position, stick your chest out and contract the back by bringing the shoulder blades back. Think of how the soldiers in the military look when they are in standing in attention.

Go back to the starting position by bending at the knees while simultaneously leaning the torso forward at the waist while keeping the back straight. When the weights on the bar touch the floor you are back at the starting position and ready to perform another repetition.
Perform the amount of repetitions prescribed in the program.
subtitle: Deadlift Delight
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** in front of a loaded barbell with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Bend** your knees and lean forward, keeping your back straight. **Grab** the bar with a medium overhand grip.
3. **Lift** the bar by pushing with your legs and straightening your torso. **Breathe out** as you move up.
4. **Stand tall**, chest out and shoulders back. Imagine a proud soldier at attention.
5. **Lower** the bar by bending your knees and leaning forward from the waist. Keep your back straight.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps.
tip: 🦅 Imagine you’re a proud eagle soaring up as you lift the bar. Keep your chest out and shoulders back!
short_description: The Barbell Deadlift is a power move that targets your lower back, glutes, and legs. Feel like a champion as you lift that weight with perfect form! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Barbell Full Squat
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack just above shoulder level. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder-width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times and maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position.

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees and sitting back with your hips as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until your hamstrings are on your calves. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel or middle of your foot as you straighten the legs and extend the hips to go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat Like a Boss
new_instructions:
1. Set the bar on a rack just above shoulder level.
2. Step under the bar and place it across the back of your shoulders.
3. Grip the bar with both hands and lift it by straightening your legs and torso.
4. Step back, positioning your legs shoulder-width apart with toes slightly out.
5. Lower the bar by bending your knees and sitting back with your hips until your hamstrings touch your calves.
6. Push through your heels to stand back up and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into an invisible chair 🪑. This helps keep your form perfect!
short_description: The Barbell Full Squat is a powerhouse move that targets your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Perfect for building strength and muscle. Get ready to squat like a boss! 💪

name: Barbell Glute Bridge
instructions: Begin seated on the ground with a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lay down flat on the floor.
Begin the movement by driving through with your heels, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your upper back and the heels of your feet.
Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Booty Boost Bridge
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** with a barbell over your legs. Use a pad to make it comfy.
2. **Roll the bar** over your hips and **lay flat** on the floor.
3. **Press through** your heels and **lift your hips** up.
4. **Support your weight** with your upper back and heels.
5. **Extend your hips** as far as you can.
6. **Lower your hips** back to the start position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the floor away with your heels to lift your hips. 🚀
short_description: The Barbell Glute Bridge is fantastic for firing up your glutes and giving your booty a lift. It's a fun compound move that also works your calves and hamstrings. Perfect for getting that powerful push! 🍑

name: Barbell Guillotine Bench Press
instructions: Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, bring the bar down slowly until it is about 1 inch from your neck.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Press to Impress!
new_instructions:
1. **Grip the bar**: Use a medium-width grip to lift the bar from the rack. Hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked.
2. **Lower the bar**: Slowly bring the bar down as you breathe in, stopping about 1 inch from your neck.
3. **Press up**: Push the bar back to the starting position while breathing out, using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest at the top.
4. **Repeat**: Continue the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions.
5. **Rack it**: Carefully place the bar back on the rack when done.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the bar away from you like you're trying to launch it into space 🚀. Focus on that explosive power!
short_description: The Barbell Guillotine Bench Press targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps for a powerful upper body workout. This intermediate exercise brings serious strength gains. Get ready to press and impress! 💪

name: Barbell Hack Squat
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a barbell behind you at arms length and your feet at shoulder width. Tip: A shoulder width grip is best with the palms of your hands facing back. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for a better grip. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your head and eyes up and back straight, squat until your upper thighs are parallel to the floor. Breathe in as you slowly go down.
Pressing mainly with the heel of the foot and squeezing the thighs, go back up as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Backwards Barbell Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall:** Hold a barbell behind you at arm's length, feet shoulder-width apart, hands facing back. 
2. **Get set:** Keep your head up, eyes forward, and back straight. 
3. **Squat down:** Slowly lower your body until your upper thighs are parallel to the floor. Inhale as you go down. 
4. **Press up:** Push through your heels, squeeze your thighs, and rise back up. Exhale as you stand. 
5. **Repeat:** Do this for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your form tight. 
6. **Finish strong:** Complete your set with a smile!
tip: Imagine you're a reverse superhero lifting off! 🚀 Keep your chest proud and eyes forward.
short_description: The Barbell Hack Squat is a fun twist on leg day, focusing on your quads, calves, and hamstrings. Feel the burn and build strength like a champ! 💪

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
instructions: Begin seated on the ground with a bench directly behind you. Have a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise.
Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lean back against the bench so that your shoulder blades are near the top of it.

Begin the movement by driving through your feet, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your shoulder blades and your feet. Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Boost Your Booty
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the ground with a bench behind you and a barbell over your legs.
2. Roll the barbell so it's above your hips and lean back against the bench.
3. Drive through your feet and lift your hips up, extending them vertically through the bar.
4. Support your weight on your shoulder blades and feet.
5. Extend as far as you can, squeezing your glutes at the top.
6. Lower your hips back down to the starting position.
tip: Think of your hips as a rocket ship 🚀, blasting off to the moon. Squeeze those glutes to power your lift!
short_description: The Barbell Hip Thrust is a killer move for your glutes, giving you a strong and lifted booty. It's like sending your hips to the moon and back! 🌕

name: Barbell Incline Bench Press - Medium Grip
instructions: Lie back on an incline bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on you upper chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: it should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Pump Up Your Chest!
new_instructions:
1. Lie back on an incline bench and grab the barbell with a medium-width grip.
2. Lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with arms locked.
3. Inhale and slowly lower the bar to your upper chest.
4. Pause briefly, then exhale and push the bar back up using your chest muscles.
5. Lock your arms at the top, squeeze your chest, and hold for a second.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then carefully rack the bar.
tip: Imagine you’re pushing the barbell away from you like you're launching a rocket into space! 🚀
short_description: Boost your chest strength with the Barbell Incline Bench Press! This compound move also works your shoulders and triceps for a balanced upper body workout. Feel the burn and get ready to soar! 💥

name: Barbell Incline Shoulder Raise
instructions: Lie back on an Incline Bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms straight. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the arms straight, lift the bar by protracting your shoulder blades, raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the bar to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift to New Heights!
new_instructions:
1. Lie back on an incline bench and grab a barbell with a medium-width grip.
2. Lift the bar off the rack, holding it straight over you with arms fully extended. This is your starting position.
3. Keep your arms straight and lift the bar by moving your shoulder blades forward, raising your shoulders from the bench. Exhale as you do this.
4. Lower the bar back to the starting position as you inhale.
5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're reaching for the stars with your shoulders! 🌟 Keep your arms straight and focus on the upward motion.
short_description: The Barbell Incline Shoulder Raise is a fantastic move to build strong shoulders and chest. Perfect for beginners, this exercise will have you lifting to new heights! 💪

name: Barbell Lunge
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack just below shoulder level. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and step forward with your right leg and squat down through your hips, while keeping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Inhale as you go down. Note: Do not allow your knee to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this will put undue stress on the knee joint. li>
Using mainly the heel of your foot, push up and go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.
subtitle: Step and Strengthen!
new_instructions:
1. Set the bar on a squat rack just below shoulder height.
2. Step under the bar, resting it across your shoulders, and grip it firmly.
3. Push with your legs, straighten your torso, and lift the bar off the rack. Step back.
4. Step forward with your right leg and squat down through your hips. Inhale as you lower.
5. Push through the heel of your right foot to return to the starting position. Exhale as you lift.
6. Complete reps on the right leg, then switch to the left leg and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're stepping onto a cloud ☁️ with each lunge to keep your movements smooth and controlled.
short_description: Barbell Lunges are fantastic for working your legs and glutes. This exercise gives you a great burn while building strength and balance. Ready to feel the power? 🔥

name: Barbell Rear Delt Row
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a barbell using a wide (higher than shoulder width) and overhand (palms facing your body) grip.

Bend knees slightly and bend over as you keep the natural arch of your back. Let the arms hang in front of you as they hold the bar. Once your torso is parallel to the floor, flare the elbows out and away from your body. Tip: Your torso and your arms should resemble the letter "T". Now you are ready to begin the exercise.

While keeping the upper arms perpendicular to the torso, pull the barbell up towards your upper chest as you squeeze the rear delts and you breathe out. Tip: When performed correctly, this exercise should resemble a bench press in reverse. Also, refrain from using your biceps to do the work. Focus on targeting the rear delts; the arms should only act as hooks.
Slowly go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Sculptor
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall and grab a barbell with a wide, overhand grip.
2. Slightly bend your knees and lean forward, keeping your back naturally arched.
3. Let your arms hang in front of you, elbows flared out to form a 'T' with your torso.
4. Pull the barbell towards your upper chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Focus on your rear delts and keep your biceps relaxed.
6. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine pinching a pencil between your shoulder blades as you lift the bar. ✏️ This helps engage the right muscles.
short_description: The Barbell Rear Delt Row is a fantastic move to target your shoulders, biceps, and back. It's like a reverse bench press that sculpts your upper body. Get ready to feel strong and look amazing! 💪

name: Barbell Rollout from Bench
instructions: Place a loaded barbell on the ground, near the end of a bench. Kneel with both legs on the bench, and take a medium to narrow grip on the barbell. This will be your starting position.
To begin, extend through the hips to slowly roll the bar forward. As you roll out, flex the shoulder to roll the bar above your head. Ensure that your arms remain extended throughout the movement.
When the bar has been moved as far forward as possible, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Abs Rollout Adventure
new_instructions:
1. Kneel on the bench and grab the barbell with a medium to narrow grip. 
2. Start in this position with the barbell close to the edge of the bench. 
3. Extend your hips and slowly roll the bar forward.
4. Keep your arms straight and roll the bar above your head.
5. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control. 
6. Roll the bar back to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine your body as a straight arrow 🏹 aiming for the target – this helps keep your form in check and core engaged!
short_description: Get ready for an abs adventure! The Barbell Rollout from Bench challenges your core, glutes, and shoulders. It's a fun way to build strength and stability. 💥

name: Barbell Seated Calf Raise
instructions: Place a block about 12 inches in front of a flat bench.
Sit on the bench and place the ball of your feet on the block.
Have someone place a barbell over your upper thighs about 3 inches above your knees and hold it there. This will be your starting position.
Raise up on your toes as high as possible as you squeeze the calves and as you breathe out.
After a second contraction, slowly go back to the starting position. Tip: To get maximum benefit stretch your calves as far as you can.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Calf Pumping Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a flat bench with a block 12 inches in front. 
2. **Place** the ball of your feet on the block. 
3. **Position** the barbell over your upper thighs, 3 inches above your knees. 
4. **Raise** up on your toes as high as you can, squeezing your calves. 
5. **Hold** the position for a second, then slowly lower back down. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended repetitions, stretching calves as far as possible.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the ceiling with your head while on your toes. 🎯
short_description: Pump those calves with the Barbell Seated Calf Raise! This beginner-friendly move isolates your calves for a fantastic burn. Feel the fun and get those legs strong! 🦵🔥

name: Barbell Shoulder Press
