instructions: Sit on a bench with back support in a squat rack. Position a barbell at a height that is just above your head. Grab the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing forward).

Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip width, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the shoulders slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Push It Up!
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with back support under a barbell rack.
2. Grip the barbell with palms facing forward.
3. Lift the barbell over your head, arms locked, to start.
4. Lower the barbell to your shoulders, breathing in.
5. Push the barbell back up, breathing out.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Think of pushing the barbell like lifting a heavy box onto a high shelf. 📦
short_description: The Barbell Shoulder Press strengthens your shoulders, chest, and triceps. It's a fantastic move to build upper body power! 💪

name: Barbell Shrug
instructions: Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands in front of you using a pronated grip (palms facing the thighs). Tip: Your hands should be a little wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for a better grip. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbell by using your biceps.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Trap Tamer
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell in front of you with palms facing your thighs. 
2. Position your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width on the barbell. 
3. Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears as high as you can. 
4. Squeeze at the top for a second, feeling the burn in your traps. 
5. Lower the barbell back down slowly to the starting position. 
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping the motion controlled.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch your shoulders to your ears – lift them high and tight! 🎯
short_description: Barbell Shrugs are perfect for building and defining your trapezius muscles. Stand tall, shrug, and feel the burn. Keep it controlled and get those traps popping! 💥

name: Barbell Shrug Behind The Back
instructions: Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands behind your back using a pronated grip (palms facing back). Tip: Your hands should be a little wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for better grip. This will be your starting position.

Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbell by using your biceps. The arms should remain stretched out at all times.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shrug It Off!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell behind your back with palms facing back.
2. Grip the barbell a bit wider than shoulder-width. Tip: Use wrist wraps if you need extra grip.
3. Lift your shoulders up as high as you can while exhaling. Hold for a second.
4. Remember, don't use your biceps. Keep your arms straight.
5. Slowly lower your shoulders back down while inhaling.
6. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch your shoulders to your ears. 🦻 This helps maximize the contraction in your traps!
short_description: Get ready to strengthen and define your traps with the Barbell Shrug Behind The Back! Perfect for beginners, this move focuses on your upper back and forearms. Shrug it off and show those muscles who's boss! 💪

name: Barbell Side Bend
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck). Your feet should be shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.

While keeping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bend and Flex Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with the barbell placed on your shoulders, just below your neck. Feet should be shoulder-width apart. 
2. Keep your back straight and head up. Bend at the waist to the right as far as you can. Breathe in as you bend.
3. Hold for a second, then return to the starting position while exhaling. Keep your body still.
4. Repeat the bend, but this time to the left side. Hold for a second, then return to the starting position.
5. Continue alternating sides for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're a tall tree swaying gently in the wind 🌳. Stay rooted with your feet and let your upper body flex smoothly to each side.
short_description: Barbell Side Bend is a fantastic move to target your abs and lower back. It's like giving your torso a good stretch while building strength 💪. Stay controlled and feel the burn!

name: Barbell Side Split Squat
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck). Your feet should be placed wide apart with the foot of the lead leg angled out to the side. This will be your starting position.
Lower your body towards the side of your angled foot by bending the knee and hip of your lead leg and while keeping the opposite leg only slightly bent. Breathe in as you lower your body.
Return to the starting position by extending the hip and knee of the lead leg. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
After performing the recommended amount of reps, repeat the movement with the opposite leg.
subtitle: Side-to-Side Strength
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a barbell resting on your shoulders, just below your neck. Place your feet wide apart, and angle one foot out to the side. This is your starting position. 
2. Lower your body towards the angled foot by bending the knee and hip of that leg. Keep the other leg slightly bent. Inhale as you go down.
3. Push through the heel of your lead leg to stand back up. Exhale as you return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
5. Switch legs and repeat the movement on the opposite side.
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into a chair on one side 🪑. This helps keep your form right and prevents leaning too far forward.
short_description: Strengthen your quads, calves, hamstrings, and lower back with the Barbell Side Split Squat. It's a fun, beginner-friendly move that builds serious lower body power. 🌟

name: Barbell Squat
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack to just below shoulder level. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance described above which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees and hips as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat It Like It's Hot!
new_instructions:
1. **Set the bar**: Place the barbell on the rack just below shoulder height. Load the bar with the right weight. 
2. **Get under**: Step under the bar, position it across the back of your shoulders (just below your neck), and grip it firmly. 
3. **Lift off**: Push with your legs and straighten your torso to lift the bar off the rack. Step back with a shoulder-width stance, toes slightly out. 
4. **Squat down**: Bend your knees and hips slowly, keeping your back straight and head up. Lower until your thighs are just below parallel to the floor. Inhale as you go down. 
5. **Rise up**: Push through your heels to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. Exhale as you rise.
tip: Imagine sitting back into a chair 🪑 when you squat. This helps keep your knees aligned and your back straight!
short_description: Feel the burn with Barbell Squats! This compound move targets your quads, glutes, and more, making you stronger and more powerful. Get ready to squat it out and feel awesome! 💪

name: Barbell Squat To A Bench
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first place a flat bench or a box behind you. The flat bench is used to teach you to set your hips back and to hit depth.

Then, set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance described above which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees and sitting your hips back as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until you slightly touch the bench behind you. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot as you straighten the legs and extend the hips to go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat & Sit Challenge
new_instructions:
1. Place a flat bench behind you.
2. Adjust the bar on the rack to match your height. Step under it and place the back of your shoulders across it.
3. Grab the bar with both hands, push with your legs, and straighten your torso to lift it off the rack.
4. Step back from the rack, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, and point your toes slightly out. Keep your head up and back straight.
5. Bend your knees and push your hips back, lowering yourself until you lightly touch the bench. Inhale as you go down.
6. Exhale, push through your heels, straighten your legs, and extend your hips to return to the starting position. Repeat.
tip: 🧠 Imagine sitting back into a chair. This helps you to keep your balance and protect your knees!
short_description: Barbell Squat to a Bench is a powerful move to strengthen your quads, glutes, and more. It's like sitting on an invisible chair while carrying some serious weight. Feel the burn and boost your lower body strength! 🔥

name: Barbell Step Ups
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) and stand upright behind an elevated platform (such as the one used for spotting behind a flat bench). This is your starting position.

Place the right foot on the elevated platform. Step on the platform by extending the hip and the knee of your right leg. Use the heel mainly to lift the rest of your body up and place the foot of the left leg on the platform as well. Breathe out as you execute the force required to come up.

Step down with the left leg by flexing the hip and knee of the right leg as you inhale. Return to the original standing position by placing the right foot of to next to the left foot on the initial position.
Repeat with the right leg for the recommended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.
subtitle: Step Up to Strength!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a barbell on your shoulders.
2. Place your right foot on a platform.
3. Push through your right heel and lift your body up. Exhale.
4. Step down with your left foot and return to the start. Inhale.
5. Repeat for the desired reps with your right leg, then switch to your left.
6. Keep your movements controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine you're stepping up onto a stage to accept an award 🏆. Lead with your heel and keep your back straight for a star performance!
short_description: Barbell Step Ups are a fantastic way to build strong legs and glutes while enhancing your balance. Step up, stay strong, and feel the burn🔥! Perfect for those who want a challenging and rewarding leg workout.

name: Barbell Walking Lunge
instructions: Begin standing with your feet shoulder width apart and a barbell across your upper back.

Step forward with one leg, flexing the knees to drop your hips. Descend until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. Your posture should remain upright, and your front knee should stay above the front foot.
Drive through the heel of your lead foot and extend both knees to raise yourself back up.
Step forward with your rear foot, repeating the lunge on the opposite leg.
subtitle: Barbell Lunge March
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell across your upper back. 
2. Step forward with one leg, bending both knees as you drop your hips. 
3. Lower until your back knee nearly touches the ground, keeping your posture upright. 
4. Push through the heel of your front foot and straighten your knees to rise back up. 
5. Step forward with your rear foot, repeating the lunge on the opposite leg.
6. Continue lunging forward, alternating legs with each step.
tip: 🦵 Imagine stepping over a puddle! This helps you take bigger steps and maintain good form.
short_description: The Barbell Walking Lunge is a fantastic full-leg workout! It targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Keep moving forward and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Battling Ropes
instructions: For this exercise you will need a heavy rope anchored at its center 15-20 feet away. Standing in front of the rope, take an end in each hand with your arms extended at your side. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rapidly raising one arm to shoulder level as quickly as you can.
As you let that arm drop to the starting position, raise the opposite side.
Continue alternating your left and right arms, whipping the ropes up and down as fast as you can.
subtitle: Rope Wrangle Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a heavy rope anchored 15-20 feet in front of you.
2. Grab an end of the rope in each hand and extend your arms at your sides.
3. Quickly raise one arm to shoulder level, whipping the rope upwards.
4. Let that arm drop back while raising the opposite arm quickly.
5. Keep alternating arms, whipping the ropes up and down.
6. Move as fast as you can, like taming a wild beast!
tip: Imagine you're taming a wild stallion with those ropes! 🐎 Keep your core tight to stay in control.
short_description: Unleash your inner warrior with Battling Ropes! This fun and dynamic exercise targets your shoulders, chest, and forearms, giving you a full-body workout. Feel the burn and have a blast! 💥

name: Bear Crawl Sled Drags
instructions: Wearing either a harness or a loose weight belt, attach the chain to the back so that you will be facing away from the sled. Bend down so that your hands are on the ground. Your back should be flat and knees bent. This is your starting position.
Begin by driving with legs, alternating left and right. Use your hands to maintain balance and to help pull. Try to keep your back flat as you move over a given distance.
subtitle: Crawl and Drag Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Strap on a harness or weight belt, attaching it to the sled behind you.
2. Get down on all fours like a bear, with your back flat and knees bent.
3. Start moving by pushing off with your legs, alternating left and right.
4. Use your hands to keep balance and help with the pull.
5. Keep your back flat and stay low to the ground as you move.
6. Drag the sled over the set distance, feeling the burn in your legs and core!
tip: Imagine you're a mighty bear dragging its prey! 🐻 Keep your back flat to maintain control and power.
short_description: Bear Crawl Sled Drags are a fun, full-body exercise that targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Feel the burn and embrace your inner bear as you drag the sled across the ground. Unleash your strength and enjoy the challenge! 🐻💪

name: Behind Head Chest Stretch
instructions: Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you.
Place your hands behind your hand, and push your elbows back as far as you can. Your partner should hold your elbows. This will be your starting position.
Gently attempt to pull your elbows forward with your hands still behind your head for 10 or more seconds. Your partner should prevent your elbows from moving.

Now, relax your muscles and have your partner gently pull the elbows back as far as it comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.
subtitle: Elbow Wing Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Sit upright on the floor, with your partner behind you.
2. Place your hands behind your head and push your elbows back as far as you can. Let your partner hold your elbows.
3. Try to pull your elbows forward gently while keeping your hands behind your head for about 10 seconds. Your partner should prevent any elbow movement.
4. Relax your muscles, and have your partner gently pull your elbows back as far as is comfortable for you.
5. Communicate with your partner to ensure a safe and adequate stretch, avoiding any overstretching or injury.
tip: Imagine you’re opening up like a butterfly 🦋. This will help you visualize the stretch and keep your chest lifted.
short_description: The Behind Head Chest Stretch is an expert-level move that targets your chest and shoulders. Grab a partner for this deep stretch to improve flexibility and posture. 🦋

name: Bench Dips
instructions: For this exercise you will need to place a bench behind your back. With the bench perpendicular to your body, and while looking away from it, hold on to the bench on its edge with the hands fully extended, separated at shoulder width. The legs will be extended forward, bent at the waist and perpendicular to your torso. This will be your starting position.

Slowly lower your body as you inhale by bending at the elbows until you lower yourself far enough to where there is an angle slightly smaller than 90 degrees between the upper arm and the forearm. Tip: Keep the elbows as close as possible throughout the movement. Forearms should always be pointing down.
Using your triceps to bring your torso up again, lift yourself back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Bench Boosters
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the edge of a bench and **place** your hands next to your hips.
2. **Slide** your butt off the bench and **extend** your legs in front of you.
3. **Lower** yourself by **bending** your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
4. **Stop** when your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
5. **Push** through your palms to **raise** yourself back up to the start.
6. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps, keeping a steady pace.
tip: 🦋 Imagine your elbows are glued to your sides like butterfly wings; this helps keep your form tight and effective!
short_description: Bench Dips are an awesome way to work your triceps using just a bench. Perfect for beginners, this move also targets your chest and shoulders. Get ready to feel the burn and build some serious arm strength! 💪

name: Bench Jump
instructions: Begin with a box or bench 1-2 feet in front of you. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Perform a short squat in preparation for the jump; swing your arms behind you.
Rebound out of this position, extending through the hips, knees, and ankles to jump as high as possible. Swing your arms forward and up.
Jump over the bench, landing with the knees bent, absorbing the impact through the legs.
Turn around and face the opposite direction, then jump back over the bench.
subtitle: Bounce with Bench Jumps!
new_instructions:
1. Stand in front of a bench with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Do a mini squat and swing your arms back.
3. Explode up, swinging arms forward and jumping high.
4. Land softly on the other side with your knees bent.
5. Turn around and face the bench again.
6. Repeat the jump back to your starting point.
tip: 🦘 Imagine you're a kangaroo, aiming for a soft and controlled landing each time!
short_description: Bench Jumps are a fun way to power up your legs and boost your heart rate! Jump over a bench, landing softly to build strength in your quads, glutes, and more. 🦘

name: Bench Press - Powerlifting
instructions: Begin by lying on the bench, getting your head beyond the bar if possible. Tuck your feet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help support your weight, lift your shoulder off the bench and retract them, squeezing the shoulder blades together. Use your feet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.
However wide your grip, it should cover the ring on the bar. Pull the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. Focus on squeezing the bar and trying to pull it apart.
Lower the bar to your lower chest or upper stomach. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at all times.
Pause when the barbell touches your torso, and then drive the bar up with as much force as possible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.
subtitle: Power Push-Up Strength
new_instructions:
1. Lie on the bench and position your head beyond the bar.
2. Tuck your feet under you, arch your back, and lift your shoulders off the bench.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and drive your traps into the bench with your feet.
4. Grip the bar wide, covering the ring, and pull it out of the rack without moving shoulders forward.
5. Lower the bar to your lower chest or upper stomach, keeping bar, wrist, and elbow aligned.
6. Pause when the bar touches your torso, then drive it up powerfully, tucking your elbows until lockout.
tip: Imagine pushing the bar away like you're launching a rocket! 🚀 Keep that explosive power in mind for maximum lift.
short_description: The Bench Press - Powerlifting move is a compound exercise that hits your triceps, chest, and shoulders hard! It's perfect for building serious upper body strength. Get ready to feel powerful and unstoppable! 💪

name: Bench Press - With Bands
instructions: Using a flat bench secure a band under the leg of the bench that is nearest to your head.
Once the band is secure, grab it by both handles and lie down on the bench.
Extend your arms so that you are holding the band handles in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Bring down the handles slowly until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle. Keep full control at all times.

As you breathe out, bring the handles up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
subtitle: Chest Power with Bands!
new_instructions:
1. Secure a band under the bench leg nearest to your head.
2. Grab the band handles and lie down on the bench.
3. Extend your arms, holding the handles in front at shoulder width.
4. Rotate your wrists forward so palms face away. This is your start position.
5. Lower the handles slowly until elbows form 90-degree angles. Control the movement.
6. Exhale, press the handles up using your chest, squeeze at the top, and lower slowly. Repeat.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a big beach ball as you press up 🌊. Keep that control and squeeze!
short_description: Pump up your chest with the Bench Press using resistance bands! Great for beginners, it targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Feel the power and control with every press! 💪

name: Bench Press with Chains
instructions: Adjust the leader chain, shortening it to the desired length.Place the chains on the sleeves of the bar.

Lying on the bench, get your head beyond the bar if possible. Tuck your feet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help support your weight, lift your shoulder off the bench and retract them, squeezing the shoulder blades together. Use your feet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement. However wide your grip, it should cover the ring on the bar.

Pull the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. Focus on squeezing the bar and trying to pull it apart. Lower the bar to your lower chest or upper stomach. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at all times.
Pause when the barbell touches your torso, and then drive the bar up with as much force as possible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.
subtitle: Chain Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust the chain** to the right length and attach it to the bar.
2. **Lie on the bench** with your head beyond the bar, tuck your feet, and arch your back. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and keep this tight position.
3. **Grab the bar** with a grip covering the ring, and pull it out of the rack without moving your shoulders. Lower it to your lower chest or upper stomach.
4. **Pause** when the bar touches your torso, then push it up forcefully, keeping elbows tucked in until lockout.
tip: Imagine you're a spring, coiled tight and ready to burst! 🌀 Keep that tension throughout for maximum power.
short_description: The Bench Press with Chains is the ultimate power move for strong triceps, chest, and shoulders. Feel like a powerhouse as you push the bar with added chain resistance! 💪

name: Bench Sprint
instructions: Stand on the ground with one foot resting on a bench or box with your heel close to the edge.
Push off with your foot on top of the bench, extending through the hip and knee.
Land with the opposite foot on top of the box, returning your other foot back to the start position.
Continue alternating from one foot to another to complete the set.
subtitle: Speedy Bench Blast
new_instructions:
1. Stand with one foot on a bench or sturdy box, heel close to the edge.
2. Push off with the foot on the bench, extending your hip and knee.
3. Land with the opposite foot on the bench and bring the other foot back down.
4. Keep alternating feet quickly in a sprinting motion.
5. Swing your arms for balance and extra momentum.
6. Repeat for the set duration or number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're racing a friend 🏃‍♂️—keep those feet quick and light!
short_description: Bench Sprints are a fun way to fire up your legs and boost your cardio. It's like running up stairs but way more exciting! Get ready to feel the burn and have a blast! 🏋️‍♀️

name: Bent-Arm Barbell Pullover
instructions: Lie on a flat bench with a barbell using a shoulder grip width.
Hold the bar straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your arms in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the barbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
subtitle: Pull and Flex Fun! 💪
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a barbell, using a shoulder-width grip.
2. **Hold** the bar straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. This is your starting position.
3. **Lower** the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in. Feel the stretch in your chest.
4. **Bring back** the barbell to the starting position using the same arc, and exhale as you move.
5. **Pause** for a second at the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the prescribed number of repetitions.
tip: 🔄 Imagine you're drawing a big rainbow over your head with the barbell. Keep the arc smooth and controlled for the best stretch! 🌈
short_description: The Bent-Arm Barbell Pullover is a fantastic compound exercise targeting your lats, chest, shoulders, and triceps. It's like drawing a big rainbow with a barbell! 🌈 Perfect for building upper body strength and flexibility.

name: Bent-Arm Dumbbell Pullover
instructions: Place a dumbbell standing up on a flat bench.

Ensuring that the dumbbell stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with feet firmly on the floor. The head will be off the bench as well.

Grasp the dumbbell with both hands and hold it straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. Both palms should be pressing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbbell. This will be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the dumbbell used for this exercise is secure. Using a dumbbell with loose plates can result in the dumbbell falling apart and falling on your face.
While keeping your arms locked in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the dumbbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest & Shoulders Fiesta
new_instructions:
1. Place a dumbbell on a flat bench.
2. Lie perpendicular to the bench with shoulders on it, hips below, and feet on the floor.
3. Hold the dumbbell over your chest with bent arms, palms under it.
4. Lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head, breathing in.
5. Bring the dumbbell back to the start, exhaling as you lift.
6. Hold for a second, then repeat for the desired reps.
tip: 🧘‍♂️ Imagine you're drawing a rainbow with the dumbbell. Keep it smooth and controlled for the best stretch and lift!
short_description: The Bent-Arm Dumbbell Pullover is a fantastic chest and shoulder workout that also engages your lats and triceps. Feel the stretch and strengthen your upper body with this fun, compound move! 🌈💪

name: Bent-Knee Hip Raise
instructions: Lay flat on the floor with your arms next to your sides.
Now bend your knees at around a 75 degree angle and lift your feet off the floor by around 2 inches.

Using your lower abs, bring your knees in towards you as you maintain the 75 degree angle bend in your legs. Continue this movement until you raise your hips off of the floor by rolling your pelvis backward. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the end of the movement your knees will be over your chest.
Squeeze your abs at the top of the movement for a second and then return to the starting position slowly as you breathe in. Tip: Maintain a controlled motion at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Happy Hips Lift!
new_instructions:
1. Lay flat on your back with your arms by your sides.
2. Bend your knees at a 75-degree angle and lift your feet 2 inches off the floor.
3. Engage your lower abs and bring your knees toward your chest, lifting your hips off the floor.
4. Roll your pelvis backward as you raise your hips, exhaling with the movement.
5. Squeeze your abs at the top for a second, then slowly lower back down as you inhale.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps, keeping the motion controlled.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch your knees to the sky! 🌌 Keep your motions smooth and steady for the best results.
short_description: Bent-Knee Hip Raise is the perfect move to target your abs and give your hips a lift! Keep things controlled and imagine touching the sky with your knees. 🌟

name: Bent Over Barbell Row
instructions: Holding a barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing down), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up. The barbell should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.

Now, while keeping the torso stationary, breathe out and lift the barbell to you. Keep the elbows close to the body and only use the forearms to hold the weight. At the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a brief pause.
Then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Row Your Way Strong!
new_instructions:
1. Grab a barbell with palms down and bend your knees a bit. 
2. Lean your torso forward, keeping your back straight and head up. 
3. Let the barbell hang in front of you, arms straight. 
4. Exhale, pull the barbell to your torso, elbows close to your body. 
5. Squeeze your back muscles at the top and hold briefly. 
6. Inhale and lower the barbell back down slowly. Repeat.
tip: Think of your arms as hooks and your back doing the rowing. 🚣‍♂️ This helps target the right muscles!
short_description: The Bent Over Barbell Row is a killer move to strengthen your middle back, biceps, and lats. Feel the burn and row your way to a stronger you! 💪

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise With Head On Bench
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand and with an incline bench in front of you.

While keeping your back straight and maintaining the natural arch of your back, lean forward until your forehead touches the bench in front of you. Let the arms hang in front of you perpendicular to the ground. The palms of your hands should be facing each other and your torso should be parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position.

Keeping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows, lift the dumbbells straight to the side until both arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift the weights. Caution: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms back as opposed to the side.
After a one second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bench-Head Shoulder Lift
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, facing an incline bench.
2. Lean forward, touching your forehead to the bench, arms hanging down.
3. Keep your back straight, slight bend in elbows, and lift dumbbells to the side.
4. Raise arms until they're parallel to the floor, exhaling as you lift.
5. Hold for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings 🦅. Keep your movements controlled and steady for the best shoulder burn!
short_description: Feel the burn in your shoulders with the Bench-Head Shoulder Lift! This beginner-friendly move isolates your shoulder muscles for a focused workout. Get ready to spread those wings and soar! 🦅

name: Bent Over Low-Pulley Side Lateral
instructions: Select a weight and hold the handle of the low pulley with your right hand.

Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Your legs should be slightly bent with your left hand placed on your lower left thigh. Your right arm should be hanging from your shoulder in front of you and with a slight bend at the elbow. This will be your starting position.
Raise your right arm, elbow slightly bent, to the side until the arm is parallel to the floor and in line with your right ear. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and repeat the movement with the other arm.
subtitle: Side Lifts with a Twist!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab the handle:** Set the pulley to a low position and grab the handle with your right hand.
2. **Bend over:** Hinge at your hips until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Keep a slight bend in your knees and place your left hand on your left thigh for support.
3. **Lift to the side:** With a slight bend in your right elbow, lift your right arm out to the side until it’s in line with your ear. Exhale as you lift.
4. **Lower it slowly:** Inhale as you slowly bring your right arm back to the starting position.
5. **Switch sides:** After completing the reps with your right arm, switch to the other arm and repeat.
tip: 💡 Imagine you’re a bird spreading its wings—keep that form graceful and controlled!
short_description: This shoulder exercise is perfect for beginners! It targets your shoulders and back, helping you build strength and stability. Spread those wings and feel the burn! 🕊️

name: Bent Over One-Arm Long Bar Row
instructions: Put weight on one of the ends of an Olympic barbell. Make sure that you either place the other end of the barbell in the corner of two walls; or put a heavy object on the ground so the barbell cannot slide backward.
Bend forward until your torso is as close to parallel with the floor as you can and keep your knees slightly bent.
Now grab the bar with one arm just behind the plates on the side where the weight was placed and put your other hand on your knee. This will be your starting position.

Pull the bar straight up with your elbow in (to maximize back stimulation) until the plates touch your lower chest. Squeeze the back muscles as you lift the weight up and hold for a second at the top of the movement. Breathe out as you lift the weight. Tip: Do not allow for any swinging of the torso. Only the arm should move.

Slowly lower the bar to the starting position getting a nice stretch on the lats. Tip: Do not let the plates touch the floor. To ensure the best range of motion, I recommend using small plates (25-lb ones) as opposed to larger plates (like 35-45lb ones).
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and switch arms.
subtitle: Single-Arm Row Showdown
new_instructions:
1. Set weight on one end of a barbell and secure the other end.
2. Bend forward, keeping your knees slightly bent.
3. Grab the bar just behind the plates with one hand and place your other hand on your knee.
4. Pull the bar straight up towards your lower chest, keeping your elbow in.
5. Pause for a second at the top to maximize the squeeze.
6. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position and repeat for recommended reps, then switch arms.
tip: 🎯 Imagine pulling the bar to your hip pocket to keep your form on point!
short_description: The Bent Over One-Arm Long Bar Row targets your middle back, with a bonus burn for your biceps, lats, and lower back. This beginner-friendly move is great for building strength and stability. 🚀

name: Bent Over Two-Arm Long Bar Row
instructions: Put weight on one of the ends of an Olympic barbell. Make sure that you either place the other end of the barbell in the corner of two walls; or put a heavy object on the ground so the barbell cannot slide backward.
Bend forward until your torso is as close to parallel with the floor as you can and keep your knees slightly bent.
Now grab the bar with both arms just behind the plates on the side where the weight was placed and put your other hand on your knee. This will be your starting position.

Pull the bar straight up with your elbows in (to maximize back stimulation) until the plates touch your lower chest. Squeeze the back muscles as you lift the weight up and hold for a second at the top of the movement. Breathe out as you lift the weight. Tip: Use a stirrup or double handle cable attachment by hooking it under the end of the bar.

Slowly lower the bar to the starting position getting a nice stretch on the lats. Tip: Do not let the plates touch the floor. To ensure the best range of motion, I recommend using small plates (25-lb ones) as opposed to larger plates (like 35-45lb ones).
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Row Your Way to Strength!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up the Bar:** Place weight on one end of a barbell and secure the other end in a corner or with a heavy object.
2. **Get in Position:** Bend forward with your torso nearly parallel to the floor, knees slightly bent. Grab the bar just behind the plates.
3. **Start Rowing:** Pull the bar straight up towards your lower chest with elbows in. Squeeze your back muscles and hold for a second.
4. **Lower with Control:** Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, feeling a nice stretch in your lats.
5. **Repeat:** Do the suggested number of repetitions without letting the plates touch the floor.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades as you lift the bar. 📝 This will help engage your back muscles better.
short_description: Boost your back strength with the Bent Over Two-Arm Long Bar Row! This compound move works your middle back, biceps, and lats. Get ready to feel powerful and strong! 💪

name: Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row
instructions: With a dumbbell in each hand (palms facing your torso), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward by bending at the waist; as you bend make sure to keep your back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up. The weights should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keeping the torso stationary, lift the dumbbells to your side (as you breathe out), keeping the elbows close to the body (do not exert any force with the forearm other than holding the weights). On the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Back Builder Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Grab dumbbells**: Hold one in each hand, palms facing you.
2. **Bend forward**: Slightly bend your knees, hinge at your waist, and keep your back straight.
3. **Head up**: Look forward to maintain a straight spine.
4. **Lift weights**: Pull the dumbbells to your sides, squeezing your back muscles.
5. **Hold and squeeze**: At the top, hold for a second and feel the squeeze in your back.
6. **Lower slowly**: Gently bring the weights back to the starting position. Repeat.
tip: Imagine pinching a pencil between your shoulder blades as you lift the weights. 📝
short_description: Strengthen your middle back with this beginner-friendly exercise! The Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row also gives your biceps, lats, and shoulders a solid workout. Get ready to feel strong and powerful! 💪

name: Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row With Palms In
instructions: With a dumbbell in each hand (palms facing each other), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up. The weights should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keeping the torso stationary, lift the dumbbells to your side as you breathe out, squeezing your shoulder blades together. On the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Row Your Way to Strength!
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the waist, keeping your back straight.
3. Let the weights hang down in front of you, arms straight.
4. Lift the dumbbells to your sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Hold for a second at the top, then lower the weights back down slowly.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine pinching a pencil between your shoulder blades as you lift to engage your back muscles. ✏️
short_description: This beginner-friendly move strengthens your middle back, biceps, and lats. Grab those dumbbells, bend over, and row your way to a stronger back! 💪

name: Bent Press
instructions: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so. This will be your starting position.

Begin my leaning to the side opposite the kettlebell, continuing until you are able to touch the ground with your free hand, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell. As you do so, press the weight vertically be extending through the elbow, keeping your arm perpendicular to the ground.
Return to an upright position, with the kettlebell above your head. Return the kettlebell to the shoulder and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Bend, Press, and Impress!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a kettlebell at your shoulder. 
2. Lean away from the kettlebell until you can touch the ground with your free hand.
3. Keep your eyes on the kettlebell as you lean.
4. Press the kettlebell straight up by extending your elbow.
5. Return to standing with the kettlebell overhead.
6. Lower the kettlebell back to your shoulder and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a teapot tipping over and pouring out strength! 🫖
short_description: The Bent Press is a dynamic move that targets your abs, glutes, and shoulders. It's perfect for building strength and stability. Ready to impress with your bend and press? 💪

name: Bicycling
instructions: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.
subtitle: Pedal Power Party
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.
2. Place your feet on the pedals.
3. Grip the handlebars firmly.
4. Start pedaling at a comfortable pace.
5. Gradually increase your speed for a good workout.
6. Keep your back straight and enjoy the ride!
tip: Imagine you're racing through a beautiful park 🌳. Keep your pace steady and your posture perfect.
short_description: Bicycling is a fun cardio exercise that strengthens your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings 🚴. It's perfect for beginners and great for outdoor adventures. Hop on and feel the breeze!

name: Bicycling, Stationary
instructions: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

Select the desired option from the menu. You may have to start pedaling to turn it on. You can use the manual setting, or you can select a program to use. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. The level of resistance can be changed throughout the workout. The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an appropriate intensity.
subtitle: Pedal Power Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.
2. **Choose** a program or manual setting from the menu.
3. **Pedal** to start and turn on the bike.
4. **Enter** your age and weight if needed to estimate calories burned.
5. **Adjust** the resistance level as you ride to match your workout intensity.
6. **Hold** the handles to monitor your heart rate and stay in the zone.
tip: Imagine you're riding through your favorite park—keep that pace steady and enjoy the ride! 🚴‍♂️
short_description: Hop on the stationary bike for a fun and effective cardio workout that targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Feel the burn and enjoy the ride while you burn those calories! 🚴

name: Board Press
instructions: Begin by lying on the bench, getting your head beyond the bar if possible. One to five boards, made out of 2x6's, can be screwed together and held in place by a training partner, bands, or just tucked under your shirt.

Tuck your feet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help support your weight, lift your shoulder off the bench and retract them, squeezing the shoulder blades together. Use your feet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.

You can take a standard bench grip, or shoulder width to focus on the triceps. Pull the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at all times. Focus on squeezing the bar and trying to pull it apart.
Lower the bar to the boards, and then drive the bar up with as much force as possible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.
subtitle: Boost Your Triceps Power! 💥
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on the bench with your head beyond the bar.
2. **Place boards** (1-5) on your chest, held by a partner or tucked under your shirt.
3. **Tuck your feet** underneath and arch your back, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. **Grip the bar** at shoulder width or a standard bench grip. Lift the bar without protracting your shoulders.
5. **Lower the bar** to the boards, keeping your elbows tucked in.
6. **Drive the bar up** with full force until your arms are locked out.
tip: Imagine pushing the bar through the roof! 🚀 Keep your elbows tucked for maximum power.
short_description: The Board Press is a fantastic move to pump up your triceps and build chest strength. Get ready to power up your upper body with this dynamic exercise! 💪

name: Body-Up
instructions: Assume a plank position on the ground. You should be supporting your bodyweight on your toes and forearms, keeping your torso straight. Your forearms should be shoulder-width apart. This will be your starting position.
Pressing your palms firmly into the ground, extend through the elbows to raise your body from the ground. Keep your torso rigid as you perform the movement.
Slowly lower your forearms back to the ground by allowing the elbows to flex.
Repeat.
subtitle: Push-Up Power Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Start** in a plank position with your weight on your toes and forearms, keeping your body straight.
2. **Press** your palms into the ground and push up, extending your elbows.
3. **Lift** your body off the ground, maintaining a rigid torso.
4. **Lower** your forearms back to the ground by bending your elbows.
5. **Repeat** the push-up motion for the desired number of repetitions.
6. **Focus** on keeping your movements smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're a rocket lifting off 🚀 - power up with a strong push!
short_description: Boost your push-up game with Body-Ups! This exercise targets your triceps, abs, and forearms, making you stronger and more stable. Get ready to feel the burn and have fun doing it! 💪

name: Body Tricep Press
instructions: Position a bar in a rack at chest height.
Standing, take a shoulder width grip on the bar and step a yard or two back, feet together and arms extended so that you are leaning on the bar. This will be your starting position.
Begin by flexing the elbow, lowering yourself towards the bar.
Pause, and then reverse the motion by extending the elbows.
Progress from bodyweight by adding chains over your shoulders.
subtitle: Tricep Power Press
new_instructions:
1. Set a bar at chest height.
2. Stand back with feet together, gripping the bar shoulder-width.
3. Lean in with arms extended; this is your start.
4. Bend your elbows to lower chest towards the bar.
5. Pause briefly, then push back up by straightening elbows.
6. Add chains over shoulders for extra challenge.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero pushing away a heavy door! 🚪
short_description: Feel the burn in your triceps with the Body Tricep Press! This beginner-friendly, bodyweight move is perfect for isolating and strengthening your triceps. 💪 Get ready to push yourself and add some power to your arms!

name: Bodyweight Flyes
instructions: Position two equally loaded EZ bars on the ground next to each other. Ensure they are able to roll.
Assume a push-up position over the bars, supporting your weight on your toes and hands with your arms extended and body straight.
Place your hands on the bars. This will be your starting position.
Using a slow and controlled motion, move your hands away from the midline of your body, rolling the bars apart. Inhale during this portion of the motion.
After moving the bars as far apart as you can, return to the starting position by pulling them back together. Exhale as you perform this movement.
subtitle: Chest Glide Power
new_instructions:
1. **Position** two EZ bars on the ground side by side. Make sure they can roll.
2. **Assume** a push-up stance over the bars, balancing on your hands and toes with a straight body.
3. **Place** your hands on the bars. This is your starting spot.
4. **Roll** your hands away from your body slowly, spreading the bars apart. Inhale as you move.
5. **Pull** the bars back together to the start position. Exhale as you return.
6. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps, keeping control and form.
tip: Imagine you're gliding on ice 🧊. Smooth and controlled movements keep you steady and strong!
short_description: Bodyweight Flyes are an awesome chest move that isolates your pecs while also working your abs, shoulders, and triceps. Feel the burn and sculpt that upper body! 💪

name: Bodyweight Mid Row
instructions: Begin by taking a medium to wide grip on a pull-up apparatus with your palms facing away from you. From a hanging position, tuck your knees to your chest, leaning back and getting your legs over your side of the pull-up apparatus. This will be your starting position.
Beginning with your arms straight, flex the elbows and retract the shoulder blades to raise your body up until your legs contact the pull-up apparatus.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Backyard Swing Set Row!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a medium to wide grip on a pull-up bar with your palms facing away.
2. **Hang** from the bar and tuck your knees to your chest.
3. **Lean** back and get your legs over the bar.
4. **Pull** your body up by flexing your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
5. **Pause** briefly when your legs touch the bar.
6. **Lower** yourself back to the starting position slowly.
tip: 🦸‍♂️ Imagine you're a superhero pulling yourself up to save the day! Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together.
short_description: The Bodyweight Mid Row is a fantastic intermediate exercise that targets your middle back, biceps, and lats. Think of it as your ticket to a superhero back! 🦸‍♂️

name: Bodyweight Squat
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. You can place your hands behind your head. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your knees and hips, sitting back with your hips.
Continue down to full depth if you are able,and quickly reverse the motion until you return to the starting position. As you squat, keep your head and chest up and push your knees out.
subtitle: Squat and Shine!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hands behind your head.
2. Bend your knees and hips, lowering your body like you're sitting on an invisible chair.
3. Keep your chest lifted and eyes forward as you go down.
4. Go as low as you can comfortably, aiming for full depth.
5. Push through your heels to stand back up quickly.
6. Repeat, keeping your movements smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into a small chair and pushing the floor away as you stand up. 🪑
short_description: Bodyweight Squats are a fantastic beginner move to strengthen your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. They're great for building strong legs and a firm booty. Get ready to squat and shine! 🌟

name: Bodyweight Walking Lunge
instructions: Begin standing with your feet shoulder width apart and your hands on your hips.

Step forward with one leg, flexing the knees to drop your hips. Descend until your rear knee nearly touches the ground. Your posture should remain upright, and your front knee should stay above the front foot.
Drive through the heel of your lead foot and extend both knees to raise yourself back up.
Step forward with your rear foot, repeating the lunge on the opposite leg.
subtitle: Lunge with a Smile!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Step forward with one leg, bending both knees to lower your hips.
3. Lower until your back knee is just above the ground, keeping your torso upright.
4. Push through the heel of your front foot to rise back up.
5. Step forward with your back foot and repeat the lunge with the other leg.
6. Keep alternating legs as you move forward, staying strong and steady!
tip: Imagine you're walking on a tightrope 🎯 – stay balanced and focused!
short_description: Get ready to strengthen those legs with the Bodyweight Walking Lunge! This beginner-friendly move targets your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It's like a walking adventure for your muscles! 🚶‍♂️

name: Bosu Ball Cable Crunch With Side Bends
instructions: Connect a standard handle to each arm of a cable machine, and position them in the most downward position.
Grab a Bosu Ball and position it in front and center of the cable machine.
Lie down on the Bosu Ball with the small of your back arched around the ball. Your rear end should be close to the floor without touching it.
With both hands, reach back and grab the handle of each cable.
With your feet positioned in a wide stance, extend your arms straight out in front of you and in between your knees. Your hands should be at knee level.
Keep your arms straight and in-line with the upward angle of the cable. Elevate your torso in a crunching motion without dropping or bending your arms.
Maintain the rigid position with your arms. Slowly descend back to the starting position with your back arched around the Bosu Ball and your abs elongated.
Repeat the same series of movements to failure.
Once you reach failure, keep your abs tight and raise your torso into plank position so your back is elevated off the Bosu Ball.
Lower your arms down to your side; keep them straight. Start doing alternating side bends; reach for your heels! This finishing movement will focus on your obliques.
subtitle: Bosu Ball Crunch Party
new_instructions:
1. Connect handles to the lowest setting on a cable machine.
2. Place a Bosu Ball in front of the machine and lie back on it, arching your back.
3. Grab the cable handles with both hands, arms straight in front of you.
4. Crunch up, keeping your arms straight, then lower back down.
5. After reaching failure, lift your torso off the ball into a plank position.
6. Perform alternating side bends, reaching for your heels to work your obliques.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero pulling in your cape from the front. 🦸‍♂️ Keep those arms strong and steady!
short_description: Crunch and twist your way to killer abs with the Bosu Ball Cable Crunch with Side Bends. It's a beginner-friendly move that'll challenge your core and give you a solid burn. Get ready to feel the heat! 🔥

name: Bottoms-Up Clean From The Hang Position
instructions: Initiate the exercise by standing upright with a kettlebell in one hand.
Swing the kettlebell back forcefully and then reverse the motion forcefully. Crush the kettlebell handle as hard as possible and raise the kettlebell to your shoulder.
subtitle: Kettlebell Swing & Lift Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a kettlebell in one hand.
2. Swing the kettlebell backward between your legs.
3. Reverse the swing quickly, bringing it forward.
4. Grip the kettlebell handle tightly as you lift.
5. Raise the kettlebell up to your shoulder.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: 🧲 Imagine the kettlebell is a magnet, and your hand is attracted to it. This helps maintain a firm grip!
short_description: Tackle the Bottoms-Up Clean to build strong forearms, biceps, and shoulders. This intermediate move with a kettlebell is a fun and effective way to boost your pulling power! 💥

name: Bottoms Up
instructions: Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms at your side. This will be your starting position.

To perform the movement, tuck the knees toward your chest by flexing the hips and knees. Following this, extend your legs directly above you so that they are perpendicular to the ground. Rotate and elevate your pelvis to raise your glutes from the floor.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Abs to the Sky
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with legs straight and arms at your sides.
2. Tuck your knees towards your chest.
3. Extend your legs straight up, pointing to the sky.
4. Lift your pelvis and glutes off the floor.
5. Pause for a moment at the top.
6. Lower back down to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the ceiling with your toes! 🦶
short_description: Bottoms Up is a fun, beginner-friendly exercise that targets your abs. Feel the burn as you lift your legs high into the air! Perfect for strengthening your core and having a good time doing it. 💪

name: Box Jump (Multiple Response)
instructions: Assume a relaxed stance facing the box or platform approximately an arm's length away. Arms should be down at the sides and legs slightly bent.
Using the arms to aid in the initial burst, jump upward and forward, landing with feet simultaneously on top of the box or platform.
Immediately drop or jump back down to the original starting place; then repeat the sequence.
subtitle: Jump Up, Smile Wide!
new_instructions:
1. Stand in front of a sturdy box with your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bent.
2. Swing your arms back and bend your knees to prepare for the jump.
3. Explode upwards, using your arms to help lift you, and land softly on the box with both feet.
4. Stand up tall for a moment to regain balance.
5. Jump or step back down to your starting position.
6. Repeat with a big smile and lots of energy!
tip: Imagine you're a superhero taking off for flight! 🦸‍♂️ Focus on a soft landing to protect your knees and absorb the impact.
short_description: Box Jumps are a fun and explosive way to work your legs and glutes. Perfect for beginners, this exercise will have you feeling like a superhero in no time! 🦸‍♀️

name: Box Skip
instructions: You will need several boxes lined up about 8 feet apart.
Begin facing the first box with one leg slightly behind the other.
Drive off the back leg, attempting to gain as much height with the hips as possible.

Immediately upon landing on the box, drive the other leg forward and upward to gain height and distance, leaping from the box. Land between the first two boxes with the same leg that landed on the first box.
Then, step to the next box and repeat.
subtitle: Jump for Joy!
new_instructions:
1. **Line up** several boxes about 8 feet apart.
2. **Start** facing the first box with one leg slightly behind the other.
3. **Push off** your back leg, lifting your hips high.
4. **Land** on the box with the same leg.
5. **Drive** the other leg forward and leap off the box.
6. **Repeat** the steps for the next boxes.
tip: Imagine you're a kangaroo hopping from box to box! 🦘 Keep your jumps smooth and springy.
short_description: Box Skip is a fun plyometric exercise that targets your legs and glutes. Perfect for beginners, it helps build explosive power and coordination. Jump in and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Box Squat
instructions: The box squat allows you to squat to desired depth and develop explosive strength in the squat movement. Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Keep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce off of a box.
Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward off of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe.
subtitle: Box Squat Blast
new_instructions:
1. Set up by positioning a box behind you in a power rack. Aim for a height that brings you to a parallel squat.
2. Step under the barbell and rest it across your shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward.
3. Lift the barbell from the rack, arching your lower back. Step back into position with your feet either wider or closer together based on muscle focus.
4. Push your knees and butt out as you descend. Sit back with your hips until seated on the box.
5. Pause on the box, relax your hip flexors but don't bounce.
6. Drive upward off the box, leading with your head, and return to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.
tip: Imagine you're sitting down on a chair behind you – nice and controlled! 🪑 Keep it smooth and steady.
short_description: The Box Squat is a fantastic compound exercise targeting your quads, glutes, and more. It's perfect for building explosive strength and control. Give it a go and feel the power! 💥

name: Box Squat with Bands
instructions: Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Set up the bands on the sleeves, secured to either band pegs, the rack, or dumbbells so that there is appropriate tension. If dumbbells are used, secure them so that they don't move. Also, ensure that the dumbbells you are using are heavy enough for the bands that you are using. Additional plates can be used to hold the dumbbells down. If more tension is needed, you can either widen the base on the floor or choke the bands. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Keep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce off of a box.

Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward off of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe. Use care to return the barbell to the rack.
subtitle: Box Squat Boost
new_instructions:
1. Set up the box behind you and attach the bands securely to the barbell.
2. Step under the bar and place it across your shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift the bar off the rack.
3. Position your feet, keep your head forward, and squat down by pushing your knees and butt out.
4. Sit back onto the box, keeping your shins perpendicular to the ground. Pause and avoid bouncing.
5. Push through your heels to drive upward off the box, leading with your head.
6. Maintain tightness and carefully return the barbell to the rack.
tip: Imagine you're sitting down on a chair behind you. Keep it smooth and steady! 🪑
short_description: Box Squat with Bands fires up your quads and more! Great for powerlifting, it adds resistance for a killer workout. Get ready to squat like a champ! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Box Squat with Chains
instructions: Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

To set up the chains, begin by looping the leader chain over the sleeves of the bar. The heavy chain should be attached using a snap hook. Adjust the length of the lead chain so that a few links are still on the floor at the top of the movement.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Keep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce off of a box.
Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward off of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe.
subtitle: Chain Power Squats
new_instructions:
1. Set up a box behind you and attach chains to the barbell, making sure some links touch the ground.
2. Step under the barbell, place it on your upper back, and squeeze your shoulder blades.
3. Lift the bar, step back, and position your feet either wide or close depending on your target muscles.
4. Push your knees and butt out, sitting back until you sit on the box. Pause and relax your hip flexors.
5. Drive up from the box by pushing through your heels and leading with your head while staying tight.
tip: Imagine you're a spring, coiled and ready to explode upward! 🌀 Keep that tension for a powerful lift-off!
short_description: The Box Squat with Chains builds explosive strength in your legs and glutes. It's a dynamic move that uses chains to challenge your stability and power. Perfect for serious lifters looking to up their game! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Brachialis-SMR
instructions: Lie on your side, with your upper arm against the foam roller. The upper arm should be more or less aligned with your body, with the outside of the bicep pressed against the foam roller.
Raise your hips off of the floor, supporting your weight on your arm and on your feet. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Bicep Bliss Roll
new_instructions: 1. Lie on your side with a foam roller under your upper arm. 2. Align your upper arm with your body. 3. Press the outside of your bicep against the foam roller. 4. Lift your hips off the floor. 5. Balance on your arm and feet. 6. Hold for 10-30 seconds, then switch sides.
tip: Imagine you're flattening dough with your arm. 🎨 The more even your pressure, the better!
short_description: Release tension in your biceps with the Brachialis-SMR exercise. This stretch uses a foam roller to target your upper arms, providing relief and improving flexibility. Perfect for a post-workout treat! 🎉

name: Bradford/Rocky Presses
instructions: Sit on a Military Press Bench with a bar at shoulder level with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than shoulder width and it should create a 90-degree angle between the forearm and the upper arm as the barbell goes down. This is your starting position.
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms.
Now lower the bar down to the back of the head slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Lower the bar down to the starting position slowly as you inhale. This is one repetition.
Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Barbell Shoulder Shredder
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with a barbell at shoulder level, palms facing forward.
2. Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width, creating a 90-degree angle at your elbows.
3. Lift the bar over your head until your arms are straight.
4. Lower the bar slowly behind your head as you inhale.
5. Raise the bar back to the starting position as you exhale.
6. Lower the bar in front of you to the starting position slowly. Repeat!
tip: Imagine you're moving the bar through thick mud—it helps control the motion and works the muscles better! 💪
short_description: Crush your shoulder workout with Bradford/Rocky Presses! This move targets your shoulders and triceps, giving you a powerful upper body. Grab a barbell and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Butt-Ups
instructions: Begin a pushup position but with your elbows on the ground and resting on your forearms. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle.
Arch your back slightly out rather than keeping your back completely straight.

Raise your glutes toward the ceiling, squeezing your abs tightly to close the distance between your ribcage and hips. The end result will be that you'll end up in a high bridge position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lower back down slowly to your starting position as you breathe in. Tip: Don't let your back sag downwards.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Booty Up, Abs Tight!
new_instructions:
1. Start in a push-up position, but rest on your forearms with elbows bent at 90 degrees.
2. Arch your back just a little bit instead of keeping it perfectly straight.
3. Lift your glutes up towards the ceiling, squeeze those abs tight!
4. Aim to bring your ribcage closer to your hips, forming a high bridge.
5. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps. Keep your back from sagging!
tip: Imagine you're a cat stretching up to the sky! 🐱 Keep that form smooth and steady.
short_description: Butt-Ups are a beginner-friendly move that strengthens your abs while giving your glutes a lift. Perfect for building core stability and adding a little wiggle to your workout routine! 🍑

name: Butt Lift (Bridge)
instructions: Lie flat on the floor on your back with the hands by your side and your knees bent. Your feet should be placed around shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Pushing mainly with your heels, lift your hips off the floor while keeping your back straight. Breathe out as you perform this part of the motion and hold at the top for a second.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you breathe in.
subtitle: Booty Bridge Bliss
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with hands by your sides and knees bent.
2. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart; this is your starting position.
3. Push through your heels to lift your hips towards the sky.
4. Keep your back straight and squeeze your glutes at the top.
5. Hold the position for a second and breathe out.
6. Slowly lower your hips back down while breathing in.
tip: Imagine you're holding a pencil between your cheeks 🍑. Squeeze tight to keep it from falling!
short_description: The Butt Lift, or Bridge, is a fantastic move to fire up your glutes and hamstrings using just your body weight. It's perfect for beginners and great for building a stronger, perkier behind! 🍑

name: Butterfly
instructions: Sit on the machine with your back flat on the pad.
Take hold of the handles. Tip: Your upper arms should be positioned parallel to the floor; adjust the machine accordingly. This will be your starting position.
Push the handles together slowly as you squeeze your chest in the middle. Breathe out during this part of the motion and hold the contraction for a second.
Return back to the starting position slowly as you inhale until your chest muscles are fully stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest Squeeze Delight
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the machine with your back flat against the pad.
2. **Grab the handles** with your arms parallel to the floor; adjust the machine if needed.
3. **Push the handles** together slowly, squeezing your chest in the middle. **Exhale** and hold for a second.
4. **Slowly return** to the starting position as you **inhale** and stretch your chest muscles.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
6. **Enjoy** the burn and feel your chest muscles working!
tip: Imagine you're **hugging a big beach ball** 🏖️ as you bring the handles together. This helps you engage your chest muscles fully!
short_description: The Butterfly exercise is a fantastic way to isolate and build your chest muscles using a machine. Perfect for beginners, it guides you through a smooth, controlled movement that you'll feel right away. 🌟

name: Cable Chest Press
instructions: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together straight in front of you. Keep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
