After pausing at full extension, return to th starting position, keeping tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back off the pad, at an incline or decline, or alternate hands.
subtitle: Chest Press Power Push!
new_instructions:
1. Adjust the weight and sit down, holding the handles with your elbows bent at 90 degrees.
2. Keep your head up and chest out as you get ready to press.
3. Push the handles straight in front of you, extending your arms fully.
4. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position, keeping tension.
6. Repeat, and try variations like incline or decline presses for fun.
tip: Imagine you’re hugging a tree 🌳—keep your arms wide and press with power!
short_description: The Cable Chest Press is a great beginner move to build chest strength. With a simple push, you'll also work your shoulders and triceps. Let's get those pecs popping! 💪

name: Cable Crossover
instructions: To get yourself into the starting position, place the pulleys on a high position (above your head), select the resistance to be used and hold the pulleys in each hand.

Step forward in front of an imaginary straight line between both pulleys while pulling your arms together in front of you. Your torso should have a small forward bend from the waist. This will be your starting position.

With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon, extend your arms to the side (straight out at both sides) in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms and torso should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you breathe out. Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest Fly Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Set up the cables**: Position the pulleys above your head and choose your resistance.
2. **Step forward**: Stand in front of an imaginary line between the pulleys, arms together in front.
3. **Bend slightly**: Lean a bit forward from the waist.
4. **Stretch wide**: With elbows slightly bent, extend arms wide to feel a chest stretch.
5. **Return to start**: Bring arms back, following the same arc. Exhale as you do.
6. **Repeat**: Hold briefly at the start, then go again for the set reps.
tip: Imagine hugging a big tree 🌳 to keep your chest engaged and arms in the right position.
short_description: Cable Crossovers are fantastic for targeting your chest muscles. This isolation move focuses on giving you a great stretch and pump. Feel the burn and enjoy the results! 💥

name: Cable Crunch
instructions: Kneel below a high pulley that contains a rope attachment.
Grasp cable rope attachment and lower the rope until your hands are placed next to your face.
Flex your hips slightly and allow the weight to hyperextend the lower back. This will be your starting position.

With the hips stationary, flex the waist as you contract the abs so that the elbows travel towards the middle of the thighs. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.

Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you keep constant tension on the abs throughout the movement. Also, do not choose a weight so heavy that the lower back handles the brunt of the work.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Crunch Time with Cables!
new_instructions:
1. **Kneel down** below a high pulley and grab the rope attachment.
2. **Bring the rope** down so your hands are next to your face.
3. **Slightly flex** your hips and let the weight arch your lower back a bit. This is your starting position.
4. **Crunch down** by flexing your waist and contracting your abs, bringing your elbows towards your thighs. Exhale!
5. **Hold the crunch** for a second, feeling those abs burn.
6. **Slowly return** to start while inhaling, keeping tension in your abs. Repeat!
tip: Imagine you're a human accordion 🎹—squeeze tightly as you crunch and then slowly expand!
short_description: Cable Crunches target your abs, giving them a serious workout for a rock-solid core. Get ready to crunch down and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Cable Deadlifts
instructions: Move the cables to the bottom of the towers and select an appropriate weight. Stand directly in between the uprights.
To begin, squat down be flexing your hips and knees until you can reach the handles.
After grasping them, begin your ascent. Driving through your heels extend your hips and knees keeping your hands hanging at your side. Keep your head and chest up throughout the movement.
After reaching a full standing position, Return to the starting position and repeat.
subtitle: Lift, Smile, Repeat!
new_instructions:
1. Set the cables to the lowest position and pick a comfy weight.
2. Stand tall between the cable towers.
3. Squat down by bending your hips and knees to grab the handles.
4. Grip the handles tight and push through your heels to stand up.
5. Lift until you're standing tall, hands by your sides, chest and head up.
6. Lower back down and get ready for another rep!
tip: Imagine you're lifting shopping bags full of goodies! 🛍️ Keep your back straight and push through your heels for extra power.
short_description: Cable Deadlifts work your quads, glutes, and more! They're perfect for beginners and super satisfying. Imagine lifting bags full of goodies and get those muscles moving! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Cable Hammer Curls - Rope Attachment
instructions: Attach a rope attachment to a low pulley and stand facing the machine about 12 inches away from it.
Grasp the rope with a neutral (palms-in) grip and stand straight up keeping the natural arch of the back and your torso stationary.
Put your elbows in by your side and keep them there stationary during the entire movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move; not your upper arms. This will be your starting position.
Using your biceps, pull your arms up as you exhale until your biceps touch your forearms. Tip: Remember to keep the elbows in and your upper arms stationary.
After a 1 second contraction where you squeeze your biceps, slowly start to bring the weight back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Rope Up Those Biceps!
new_instructions:
1. Attach the rope to the low pulley and stand about 12 inches away.
2. Grip the rope with your palms facing each other and stand tall with a natural arch in your back.
3. Keep your elbows tucked in by your sides and only move your forearms.
4. Pull the rope upwards using your biceps until your forearms touch your biceps, then breathe out.
5. Squeeze your biceps for a second, then slowly lower the rope back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps, keeping your form tight and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing an orange with each curl 🍊. This helps engage your biceps fully!
short_description: Cable Hammer Curls with a rope attachment are great for targeting your biceps with precision. They're perfect for beginners and provide an isolated burn that'll make your arms pop! 💪

name: Cable Hip Adduction
instructions: Stand in front of a low pulley facing forward with one leg next to the pulley and the other one away.
Attach the ankle cuff to the cable and also to the ankle of the leg that is next to the pulley.
Now step out and away from the stack with a wide stance and grasp the bar of the pulley system.
Stand on the foot that does not have the ankle cuff (the far foot) and allow the leg with the cuff to be pulled towards the low pulley. This will be your starting position.
Now perform the movement by moving the leg with the ankle cuff in front of the far leg by using the inner thighs to abduct the hip. Breathe out during this portion of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then repeat the same movement with the opposite leg.
subtitle: Cable Leg Squeeze
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall in front of a low pulley with one leg next to it and the other leg away. 
2. Attach the ankle cuff to the cable and your nearest ankle. 
3. Step out wide and grab the pulley bar for balance. 
4. Stand firm on your far foot and let your cuffed leg get gently pulled by the cable. This is your start position. 
5. Squeeze your inner thighs to bring your cuffed leg in front of your standing leg. Exhale as you do this move. 
6. Slowly return your leg to the start position while inhaling. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.
tip: Imagine you're gracefully sweeping your leg like a dancer. 🩰 Keep it smooth and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Get those inner thighs burning with Cable Leg Squeeze! This beginner-friendly move targets your quadriceps using a cable machine. Feel the burn and enjoy the benefits! 💪

name: Cable Incline Pushdown
instructions: Lie on incline an bench facing away from a high pulley machine that has a straight bar attachment on it.

Grasp the straight bar attachment overhead with a pronated (overhand; palms down) shoulder width grip and extend your arms in front of you. The bar should be around 2 inches away from your upper thighs. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the upper arms stationary, lift your arms back in a semi circle until the bar is straight over your head. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
Slowly go back to the starting position using your lats and hold the contraction once you reach the starting position. Breathe out during the execution of this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lat Lift-Off!
new_instructions:
1. Lie on an incline bench facing away from a high pulley machine with a straight bar attachment.
2. Grab the bar overhead with an overhand grip, arms extended in front of you.
3. Keep the bar about 2 inches from your upper thighs - this is your starting position.
4. Lift your arms back in a semi-circle until the bar is over your head. Inhale as you do this.
5. Slowly return to the starting position, using your lats. Exhale as you move down.
6. Hold the contraction briefly at the start position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero lifting off! 🦸‍♂️ Focus on feeling your lats engage as you move the bar.
short_description: The Cable Incline Pushdown is perfect for beginners aiming to strengthen their lats. This exercise isolates the muscle and helps you achieve a strong, toned back. Ready to feel those wings grow? 🦋

name: Cable Incline Triceps Extension
instructions: Lie on incline an bench facing away from a high pulley machine that has a straight bar attachment on it.

Grasp the straight bar attachment overhead with a pronated (overhand; palms down) narrow grip (less than shoulder width) and keep your elbows tucked in to your sides. Your upper arms should create around a 25 degree angle when measured from the floor.
Keeping the upper arms stationary, extend the arms as you flex the triceps. Breathe out during this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Sky-High Tricep Toner
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on an incline bench facing away from the high pulley machine.
2. **Grab the bar** overhead with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
3. **Keep your arms** at a 25-degree angle from the floor, elbows tucked in.
4. **Extend your arms** fully by pushing the bar forward and flexing your triceps.
5. **Hold the squeeze** for a second at full extension.
6. **Slowly return** to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine your triceps are rockets, and you're launching them skyward with each extension! 🚀
short_description: Blast your triceps with this beginner-friendly cable exercise. Perfect for isolating those muscles and building strength. Get ready to feel the burn and flaunt those toned arms! 💪

name: Cable Internal Rotation
instructions: Sit next to a low pulley sideways (with legs stretched in front of you or crossed) and grasp the single hand cable attachment with the arm nearest to the cable. Tip: If you can adjust the pulley's height, you can use a flat bench to sit on instead.
Position the elbow against your side with the elbow bent at 90° and the arm pointing towards the pulley. This will be your starting position.

Pull the single hand cable attachment toward your body by internally rotating your shoulder until your forearm is across your abs. You will be creating an imaginary semi-circle. Tip: The forearm should be perpendicular to your torso at all times.
Slowly go back to the initial position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then repeat the movement with the next arm.
subtitle: Twist and Tone
new_instructions:
1. Sit sideways by a low pulley, legs stretched or crossed.
2. Grab the single hand cable attachment with the closest arm.
3. Keep your elbow bent at 90°, tucked against your side.
4. Pull the cable attachment across your body by rotating your shoulder internally.
5. Bring your forearm across your abs, creating a semi-circle motion.
6. Slowly return and repeat for the recommended repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
tip: Imagine you're closing a book with your arm 📚. Keep your forearm steady and move smoothly for the best results!
short_description: Crank up your shoulder strength with the Cable Internal Rotation! This beginner-friendly move tones your shoulders while keeping things smooth and controlled. Give it a twist and feel the burn! 💪

name: Cable Iron Cross
instructions: Begin by moving the pulleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.
Stand directly between both pulleys with your arms extended out to your sides. Your head and chest should be up while your arms form a "T". This will be your starting position.
Keeping the elbows extended, pull your arms straight to your sides.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a pause at the peak contraction.
Continue the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest Fly Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Move the pulleys to the high position and select your resistance. Grab a handle in each hand.
2. **Stand Tall:** Stand between the pulleys with arms out to your sides, forming a 'T'. Keep your head and chest up.
3. **Pull In:** Keep your elbows extended and pull your arms straight to your sides.
4. **Squeeze:** Pause and squeeze your chest at the peak contraction.
5. **Return:** Slowly return your arms to the starting position.
6. **Repeat:** Continue for the prescribed number of reps, keeping the motion controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a big tree 🌳. Bring your arms around it and squeeze!
short_description: The Cable Iron Cross is an awesome move to isolate your chest muscles. With each controlled pull, you'll feel stronger and more sculpted. Get ready to flex those pecs and have some fun! 💪

name: Cable Judo Flip
instructions: Connect a rope attachment to a tower, and move the cable to the lowest pulley position. Stand with your side to the cable with a wide stance, and grab the rope with both hands.
Twist your body away from the pulley as you bring the rope over your shoulder like you're performing a judo flip.
Shift your weight between your feet as you twist and crunch forward, pulling the cable downward.
Return to the starting position and repeat until failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
subtitle: Twist and Flip Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** a rope to the lowest pulley on a cable tower.
2. **Stand** sideways to the cable with a wide stance, holding the rope with both hands.
3. **Twist** your body away from the pulley, mimicking a judo flip by bringing the rope over your shoulder.
4. **Shift** your weight and crunch forward, pulling the cable downward.
5. **Return** to the start position and repeat until you feel the burn.
6. **Switch** sides and repeat the movement for a balanced workout.
tip: Imagine throwing a lasso over a wild horse 🐴. Feel the power in your twist!
short_description: The Cable Judo Flip is a fun, beginner-friendly exercise that targets your abs. Twist, shift, and crunch your way to a stronger core! 💪

name: Cable Lying Triceps Extension
instructions: Lie on a flat bench and grasp the straight bar attachment of a low pulley with a narrow overhand grip. Tip: The easiest way to do this is to have someone hand you the bar as you lay down.
With your arms extended, position the bar over your torso. Your arms and your torso should create a 90-degree angle. This will be your starting position.

Lower the bar by bending at the elbow while keeping the upper arms stationary and elbows in. Go down until the bar lightly touches your forehead. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Flex the triceps as you lift the bar back to its starting position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Toning Fun
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on a flat bench and grab the bar with a narrow overhand grip. Ask a friend to hand you the bar if needed.
2. Extend your arms and position the bar over your torso, forming a 90-degree angle with your arms and body.
3. Bend your elbows and lower the bar towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms still. Breathe in.
4. Flex your triceps and lift the bar back to the starting position. Exhale.
5. Hold the position for a second, feeling the tricep squeeze.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're lowering a drawbridge to your forehead. Keep it controlled and steady for the best burn! 🏰
short_description: The Cable Lying Triceps Extension is perfect for targeting your triceps. Lie on a bench, grab a bar, and feel the burn as you tone those arms. It's a fun and effective way to get stronger, one rep at a time! 💪

name: Cable One Arm Tricep Extension
instructions: With your right hand, grasp a single handle attached to the high-cable pulley using a supinated (underhand; palms facing up) grip. You should be standing directly in front of the weight stack.

Now pull the handle down so that your upper arm and elbow are locked in to the side of your body. Your upper arm and forearm should form an acute angle (less than 90-degrees). You can keep the other arm by the waist and you can have one leg in front of you and the other one back for better balance. This will be your starting position.

As you contract the triceps, move the single handle attachment down to your side until your arm is straight. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Your upper arms should remain stationary at all times.
Squeeze the triceps and hold for a second in this contracted position.
Slowly return the handle to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then perform the same movement with the other arm.
subtitle: Single Arm Tricep Power
new_instructions:
1. Stand in front of the cable machine and grab the handle with one hand, palm facing up.
2. Pull the handle down, keeping your elbow and upper arm close to your body.
3. Position one leg in front and the other behind for balance.
4. Push the handle down until your arm is straight, only moving your forearm.
5. Squeeze your triceps at the bottom and hold for a moment.
6. Slowly return to the start and repeat for the other arm.
tip: Imagine pushing away a heavy door with just your forearm 💪. Keep that elbow glued to your side!
short_description: Pump up those triceps with the Cable One Arm Tricep Extension! This move isolates the triceps for maximum burn and strength. Feel the power in each push! 💥

name: Cable Preacher Curl
instructions: Place a preacher bench about 2 feet in front of a pulley machine.
Attach a straight bar to the low pulley.
Sit at the preacher bench with your elbow and upper arms firmly on top of the bench pad and have someone hand you the bar from the low pulley.
Grab the bar and fully extend your arms on top of the preacher bench pad. This will be your starting position.
Now start pilling the weight up towards your shoulders and squeeze the biceps hard at the top of the movement. Exhale as you perform this motion. Also, hold for a second at the top.
Now slowly lower the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Blaster Curl
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the preacher bench and grab the straight bar attached to the low pulley.
2. Extend your arms fully, keeping your upper arms glued to the bench pad.
3. Pull the bar up towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps hard. Exhale as you lift.
4. Hold the position at the top for a second and really feel the burn.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, keeping control.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping those biceps engaged!
tip: Imagine you're curling a giant ice cream cone 🍦—keep it smooth and controlled to avoid spilling!
short_description: Get ready to blast those biceps with the Cable Preacher Curl! This exercise focuses on isolating your biceps, giving you that sweet arm pump. Great for beginners and perfect for sculpting strong, defined arms. 💪

name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Adjust the pulleys to the appropriate height and adjust the weight. The pulleys should be above your head.
Grab the left pulley with your right hand and the right pulley with your left hand, crossing them in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by moving your arms back and outward, keeping your arms straight as you execute the movement.
Pause at the end of the motion before returning the handles to the start position.
subtitle: Fly High with Cable Delts!
new_instructions:
1. Adjust the pulleys to just above your head and set your desired weight.
2. Stand tall and grab the left pulley with your right hand and the right pulley with your left hand, crossing them in front of you.
3. Start by pulling your arms back and out, keeping them straight like airplane wings.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together when your arms are fully extended.
5. Pause for a moment, feeling the burn in your shoulders.
6. Slowly return the handles to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you’re a proud eagle spreading its wings wide! 🦅 Keep that form steady for the best muscle engagement.
short_description: Feel the burn in your shoulders with the Cable Rear Delt Fly! This beginner-friendly exercise isolates your delts, helping you sculpt strong, balanced shoulders. Spread those wings and soar to new fitness heights! 💪

name: Cable Reverse Crunch
instructions: Connect an ankle strap attachment to a low pulley cable and position a mat on the floor in front of it.
Sit down with your feet toward the pulley and attach the cable to your ankles.
Lie down, elevate your legs and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle. Your legs and the cable should be aligned. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are.
With your hands behind your head, bring your knees inward to your torso and elevate your hips off the floor.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controlled manner drop your hips and bring your legs back to the starting 90-degree angle. You should still have tension on your abs in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
subtitle: Cable Leg Tuck Twist
new_instructions:
1. Connect an ankle strap to a low pulley cable and place a mat in front of it.
2. Sit with your feet toward the pulley and attach the cable to your ankles.
3. Lie down, lift your legs, and bend your knees at 90 degrees. Adjust the pulley to align with your legs.
4. Place your hands behind your head, bring your knees toward your torso, and lift your hips.
5. Pause, then slowly lower your hips and return legs to starting position.
6. Repeat until you can't do any more reps.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a tight pair of jeans as you tuck your knees in! 🧘‍♀️ This helps engage your abs more effectively.
short_description: The Cable Reverse Crunch targets your abs, helping you build a strong core. It's a fantastic move for beginners looking to tone their midsection. Give it a try and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Cable Rope Overhead Triceps Extension
instructions: Attach a rope to the bottom pulley of the pulley machine.

Grasping the rope with both hands, extend your arms with your hands directly above your head using a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Your elbows should be in close to your head and the arms should be perpendicular to the floor with the knuckles aimed at the ceiling. This will be your starting position.
Slowly lower the rope behind your head as you hold the upper arms stationary. Inhale as you perform this movement and pause when your triceps are fully stretched.
Return to the starting position by flexing your triceps as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Triceps Overhead Rope Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Attach a rope to the bottom pulley of a cable machine.
2. Grab the rope with both hands and extend your arms above your head. Keep your palms facing each other.
3. Tuck your elbows close to your head and point your knuckles to the ceiling. This is your starting position.
4. Slowly lower the rope behind your head while keeping your upper arms still. Inhale as you lower the rope.
5. Pause when you feel a good stretch in your triceps.
6. Flex your triceps to raise the rope back to the starting position while exhaling. Repeat.
tip: 🎯 Imagine you're pulling a bowstring behind your head to target your triceps more effectively!
short_description: Flex those triceps with the Cable Rope Overhead Triceps Extension! This move isolates your triceps for a fantastic stretch and strength-building session. 🎯 Perfect for sculpting those upper arms!

name: Cable Rope Rear-Delt Rows
instructions: Sit in the same position on a low pulley row station as you would if you were doing seated cable rows for the back.
Attach a rope to the pulley and grasp it with an overhand grip. Your arms should be extended and parallel to the floor with the elbows flared out.
Keep your lower back upright and slide your hips back so that your knees are slightly bent. This will be your starting position.

Pull the cable attachment towards your upper chest, just below the neck, as you keep your elbows up and out to the sides. Continue this motion as you exhale until the elbows travel slightly behind the back. Tip: Keep your upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to the torso and parallel to the floor throughout the motion.
Go back to the initial position where the arms are extended and the shoulders are stretched forward. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Sizzle Rows
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a low pulley row station, just like seated cable rows. 
2. **Attach** a rope to the pulley and grab it with an overhand grip. Extend your arms parallel to the floor, elbows flared out. 
3. **Keep** your back upright and slide your hips back, bending your knees slightly. This is your starting position. 
4. **Pull** the rope towards your upper chest, just below your neck. Keep your elbows up and out to the sides. Exhale as you pull, moving your elbows slightly behind your back. 
5. **Return** to the starting position, stretching your shoulders forward and inhaling. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping form and fun in mind!
tip: Imagine you're pulling a rope to ring a bell high above you. 🎶 Keep that rhythm and aim high!
short_description: Fire up those shoulders and back with Cable Rope Rear-Delt Rows! Perfect for beginners, this move targets those tricky rear delts while giving your biceps and back a boost. Feel the burn and have a blast! 🔥

name: Cable Russian Twists
instructions: Connect a standard handle attachment, and position the cable to a middle pulley position.
Lie on a stability ball perpendicular to the cable and grab the handle with one hand. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable.
Grab the handle with both hands and fully extend your arms above your chest. You hands should be directly in-line with the pulley. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are.
Keep your hips elevated and abs engaged. Rotate your torso away from the pulley for a full-quarter rotation. Your body should be flat from head to knees.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controlled manner reset to the starting position. You should still have side tension on the cable in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
subtitle: Twist & Shout Fun
new_instructions:
1. Connect a standard handle to the middle pulley and lie on a stability ball, perpendicular to the cable.
2. Grab the handle with one hand, place yourself arm's length from the pulley, then hold the handle with both hands above your chest.
3. Ensure your hands are in line with the pulley; adjust as needed.
4. Keep your hips up, abs tight, and rotate your torso away from the pulley.
5. Pause, then slowly return to the start, maintaining tension.
6. Continue until fatigued, then switch sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're wringing out a wet towel with every twist to squeeze those abs tight! 💦
short_description: Cable Russian Twists are an awesome ab exercise that uses a cable pulley to add resistance and engage your core. Twist your way to a stronger midsection with this fun and challenging move. Give it a try! 💪

name: Cable Seated Crunch
instructions: Seat on a flat bench with your back facing a high pulley.

Grasp the cable rope attachment with both hands (with the palms of the hands facing each other) and place your hands securely over both shoulders. Tip: Allow the weight to hyperextend the lower back slightly. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist so the elbows travel toward the hips. Breathe out as you perform this step.
As you inhale, go back to the initial position slowly.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Sit and Crunch!
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a flat bench with your back to a high pulley.
2. Grab the cable rope with both hands, palms facing each other, and place your hands over your shoulders.
3. Let the weight pull your lower back slightly for a good stretch. This is your starting position.
4. Keep your hips still and crunch forward, bringing your elbows towards your hips. Exhale as you crunch.
5. Slowly return to the starting position while inhaling.
6. Repeat for your desired number of reps, keeping the movement controlled.
tip: Imagine you're pulling your chest towards your belly button. Keep it slow and steady! 🐢
short_description: Cable Seated Crunches will fire up your abs and help you build core strength. Sit, grab, and crunch your way to a stronger midsection. Feel the burn and enjoy the ride! 🔥

name: Cable Seated Lateral Raise
instructions: Stand in the middle of two low pulleys that are opposite to each other and place a flat bench right behind you (in perpendicular fashion to you; the narrow edge of the bench should be the one behind you). Select the weight to be used on each pulley.
Now sit at the edge of the flat bench behind you with your feet placed in front of your knees.
Bend forward while keeping your back flat and rest your torso on the thighs.

Have someone give you the single handles attached to the pulleys. Grasp the left pulley with the right hand and the right pulley with the left after you select your weight. The pulleys should run under your knees and your arms will be extended with palms facing each other and a slight bend at the elbows. This will be the starting position.

While keeping the arms stationary, raise the upper arms to the sides until they are parallel to the floor and at shoulder height. Exhale during the execution of this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your arms to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Tip: Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and a fixed elbow position (10 degree to 30 degree angle) throughout exercise.
subtitle: Seated Shoulder Shapers
new_instructions: 1. Sit on a flat bench between two low pulleys. 2. Lean forward, keeping your back flat, and rest your torso on your thighs. 3. Grab the handles, crossing your hands so the left hand holds the right handle and vice versa. 4. Lift your arms to the sides until your upper arms are parallel to the floor, exhaling as you lift. 5. Hold for a second, feeling the burn in your shoulders. 6. Lower your arms slowly while inhaling, and repeat.
tip: 🦋 Imagine you're spreading your wings like a butterfly—keep those arms steady and strong!
short_description: Strengthen your shoulders with the Cable Seated Lateral Raise! This beginner-friendly move focuses on isolating the shoulder muscles for maximum burn. Get ready to feel the fire and shape those shoulders! 💪

name: Cable Shoulder Press
instructions: Move the cables to the bottom of the towers and select an appropriate weight.
Stand directly in between the uprights. Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to press the handles directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat.
subtitle: Push Up Your Power!
new_instructions:
1. Move the cables to the bottom of the towers and choose your weight.
2. Stand between the uprights and grab the cables at shoulder height, palms forward.
3. Keep your head and chest up throughout the exercise.
4. Press the handles directly overhead by extending your elbows.
5. Pause briefly at the top.
6. Lower back to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the sky away from you! ☁️
short_description: The Cable Shoulder Press is a fantastic beginner move that works your shoulders and triceps. It's like pushing the sky away, building strength and confidence! 💪

name: Cable Shrugs
instructions: Grasp a cable bar attachment that is attached to a low pulley with a shoulder width or slightly wider overhand (palms facing down) grip.
Stand erect close to the pulley with your arms extended in front of you holding the bar. This will be your starting position.

Lift the bar by elevating the shoulders as high as possible as you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at all times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the bar. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the bar back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shrug it Off!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the cable bar with an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
2. **Stand** tall and close to the pulley, arms straight in front of you.
3. **Lift** your shoulders up towards your ears, like you're saying "I don't know!"
4. **Hold** the squeeze at the top for a moment. Feel those traps working!
5. **Lower** the bar back down slowly, keeping control.
6. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps, keeping the movement smooth and steady.
tip: Imagine trying to touch your shoulders to your ears. 🧏‍♂️ Keep your arms straight and let your traps do all the work!
short_description: Cable Shrugs are a fantastic way to target your trapezius muscles with precision. Elevate your shoulders and feel the burn, helping to build strength and stability. Perfect for a strong, confident posture! 💪

name: Cable Wrist Curl
instructions: Start out by placing a flat bench in front of a low pulley cable that has a straight bar attachment.

Use your arms to grab the cable bar with a narrow to shoulder width supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the top of your thighs. Your wrists should be hanging just beyond your knees.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling. Keep the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Curl Those Wrists!
new_instructions:
1. Sit down and place a flat bench in front of a low pulley cable machine with a straight bar attachment.
2. Grab the cable bar with palms up, hands shoulder-width apart. Rest your forearms on your thighs, with wrists hanging just beyond your knees.
3. Curl your wrists upward and breathe out. Hold that squeeze for a moment.
4. Slowly lower your wrists back to the start while breathing in.
5. Keep your forearms still; only your wrists should move.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps and feel the burn!
tip: Imagine you're scooping up a delicious ice cream cone 🍦—keep that motion smooth and controlled!
short_description: Get those forearms fired up with Cable Wrist Curls! This exercise targets your forearms, helping you build strength and definition. Perfect for beginners looking to add some grip power. 💪

name: Calf-Machine Shoulder Shrug
instructions: Position yourself on the calf machine so that the shoulder pads are above your shoulders. Your torso should be straight with the arms extended normally by your side. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up towards your ears as you exhale and hold the contraction for a full second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shrug It Off!
new_instructions: 1. Stand tall with the shoulder pads above your shoulders. Let your arms hang naturally by your sides. 2. Raise your shoulders up towards your ears. Exhale as you do this. 3. Keep your shoulders raised for a full second and feel the contraction. 4. Gently bring your shoulders back down to the starting position as you inhale. 5. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions. 6. Keep your torso straight and steady throughout.
tip: Imagine you're trying to hold a pencil between your shoulders. ✏️ This will help you engage the right muscles for a better squeeze!
short_description: Give your traps some love with the Calf-Machine Shoulder Shrug! This beginner-friendly move targets your traps, helping you build strong, defined shoulders. Plus, it's super easy to master! 💪

name: Calf Press
instructions: Adjust the seat so that your legs are only slightly bent in the start position. The balls of your feet should be firmly on the platform.
Select an appropriate weight, and grasp the handles. This will be your starting position.

Straighten the legs by extending the knees, just barely lifting the weight from the stack. Your ankle should be fully flexed, toes pointing up. Execute the movement by pressing downward through the balls of your feet as far as possible.
After a brief pause, reverse the motion and repeat.
subtitle: Toe-Tapping Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the seat so your legs are slightly bent. Make sure the balls of your feet are firmly on the platform.
2. **Select** an appropriate weight and **grasp** the handles. This is your starting position.
3. **Straighten** your legs by extending your knees, just lifting the weight. Your ankle should be fully flexed, toes pointing up.
4. **Press** downward through the balls of your feet as far as possible.
5. **Pause** briefly, then **reverse** the motion.
6. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're pressing a gas pedal in a race car 🏎️. Feel that speed!
short_description: Calf Press is your ticket to strong, sculpted calves! This beginner-friendly exercise uses a machine to isolate those calf muscles. Get ready to feel the burn and walk with a pep in your step! 🦵🔥

name: Calf Press On The Leg Press Machine
instructions: Using a leg press machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a medium (shoulder width) foot stance.

Lower the safety bars holding the weighted platform in place and press the platform all the way up until your legs are fully extended in front of you without locking your knees. (Note: In some leg press units you can leave the safety bars on for increased safety. If your leg press unit allows for this, then this is the preferred method of performing the exercise.) Your torso and the legs should make perfect 90-degree angle. Now carefully place your toes and balls of your feet on the lower portion of the platform with the heels extending off. Toes should be facing forward, outwards or inwards as described at the beginning of the chapter. This will be your starting position.

Press on the platform by raising your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Calf-Boosting Leg Press Fun
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the leg press machine and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
2. Lower the safety bars and press the platform until your legs are straight but not locked.
3. Position your toes and balls of your feet on the platform edge with heels off.
4. Push the platform by raising your heels, extending your ankles, and flexing your calves.
5. Hold for a second, then slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps, keeping your knees stationary throughout.
tip: Imagine you're pressing a gas pedal to rev up a race car! 🏎️ Keep that energy to maximize calf activation.
short_description: Get ready to feel the burn in your calves with the Calf Press on the Leg Press Machine! This beginner-friendly move isolates your calves, helping you build strength and definition. Strap in, press on, and let's get those calves popping! 🚀

name: Calf Raise On A Dumbbell
instructions: Hang on to a sturdy object for balance and stand on a dumbbell handle, preferably one with round plates so that it rolls as in this manner you have to work harder to stabilize yourself; thus increasing the effectiveness of the exercise.
Now roll your foot slightly forward so that you can get a nice stretch of the calf. This will be your starting position.

Lift the calf as you roll your foot over the top of the handle so that you get a full extension. Exhale during the execution of this movement. Contract the calf hard at the top and hold for a second. Tip: As you come up, roll the dumbbell slightly backward.
Now inhale as you roll the dumbbell slightly forward as you come down to get a better stretch.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Calf Pump on a Dumbbell
new_instructions:
1. Hold onto something sturdy for balance and stand on a dumbbell handle.
2. Roll your foot slightly forward for a nice calf stretch; this is your starting position.
3. Lift your heel as you roll your foot over the handle for full extension. Exhale as you move.
4. Squeeze your calf at the top and hold for a second.
5. Inhale as you roll the dumbbell slightly forward while lowering your heel for a good stretch.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine your calf is a balloon 🎈 that you want to inflate with each lift. This helps you focus on the squeeze at the top!
short_description: Calf Raise on a Dumbbell helps isolate and strengthen your calves with a fun twist! Balancing on the dumbbell handle makes it more challenging and effective. Get ready to feel the burn! 🔥

name: Calf Raises - With Bands
instructions: Grab an exercise band and stand on it with your toes making sure that the length of the band between the foot and the arms is the same for both sides.

While holding the handles of the band, raise the arms to the side of your head as if you were getting ready to perform a shoulder press. The palms should be facing forward with the elbows bent and to the sides. This movement will create tension on the band. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the hands by your shoulder, stand up on your toes as you exhale and contract the calves hard at the top of the movement.
After a one second contraction, slowly go back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Toe Tippy Tension
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** on a resistance band, toes forward, making sure the length of the band is equal on both sides.
2. **Grab** the handles and **lift** your arms beside your head, like prepping for a shoulder press.
3. **Keep** hands by your shoulders and **rise** onto your toes, exhaling as you go. Feel your calves tighten!
4. **Hold** that tippy-toe stance for a second, squeezing those calves.
5. **Lower** your heels slowly back to start.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping the movement smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're trying to peek over a tall fence! 🏡 Stretch tall and feel that calf burn.
short_description: Calf Raises with Bands give your calves a solid burn while adding some band tension for extra fun. Perfect for beginners, this move makes your lower legs strong and sleek! 🦵

name: Calf Stretch Elbows Against Wall
instructions: Stand facing a wall from a couple feet away.
Lean against the wall, placing your weight on your forearms.
Attempt to keep your heels on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds. You may move further or closer the wall, making it more or less difficult, respectively.
subtitle: Wall-Push Calf Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Stand a couple of feet away from a wall.
2. Place your forearms against the wall and lean in.
3. Keep your heels on the ground as much as possible.
4. Hold the stretch for 10-20 seconds.
5. Adjust your distance from the wall to increase or decrease the stretch.
6. Repeat as necessary to feel the burn in your calves!
tip: Imagine your heels are glued to the floor 🦶. This will ensure a deep stretch!
short_description: The Wall-Push Calf Stretch is perfect for loosening up tight calves. It's a simple move that gets your legs ready for action! Give your calves some love and feel the difference! 🦵

name: Calf Stretch Hands Against Wall
instructions: Stand facing a wall from several feet away. Stagger your stance, placing one foot forward.
Lean forward and rest your hands on the wall, keeping your heel, hip and head in a straight line.
Attempt to keep your heel on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.
subtitle: Wall Push Calf Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Stand a few feet away from a wall.
2. Stagger your stance with one foot forward.
3. Lean forward and place your hands on the wall.
4. Keep your heel, hip, and head in a straight line.
5. Try to keep your back heel on the ground.
6. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the wall to the next street—feel that stretch! 🦵
short_description: This stretch is perfect for giving your calves some love. By leaning into the wall, you'll feel a deep stretch that helps improve flexibility and reduce tension. Give it a go and walk away with a spring in your step! 🏃

name: Calves-SMR
instructions: Begin seated on the floor. Place a foam roller underneath your lower leg. Your other leg can either be crossed over the opposite or be placed on the floor, supporting some of your weight. This will be your starting position.

Place your hands to your side or just behind you, and press down to raise your hips off of the floor, placing much of your weight against your calf muscle. Roll from below the knee to above the ankle, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat for the other leg.
subtitle: Calf Roller Fun
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor and place a foam roller under your lower leg.
2. Keep your other leg crossed over or on the floor for support.
3. Put your hands behind you and press down to lift your hips off the floor.
4. Roll from below your knee to above your ankle.
5. Pause and hold for 10-30 seconds at tight spots.
6. Repeat with the other leg.
tip: Imagine you're smoothing out a wrinkle in your favorite shirt! 🧺
short_description: Roll out tight calves with a foam roller for a nice stretch. Perfect for easing muscle tension and improving flexibility. Give those calves some love! 🦵

name: Car Deadlift
instructions: This event apparatus typically has neutral grip handles, however some have a straight bar that you can approach like a normal deadlift. The apparatus can be loaded with a vehicle or other heavy objects such as tractor tires or kegs.

Center yourself between the handles if you are a strong squatter, or back a couple inches if you are a strong deadlifter. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the handles. With your feet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knees.

Look forward with your head, keep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the heels to move the weight upward. As the weight comes up, pull your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward.
Lower the weight by bending at the hips and guiding it to the floor.
subtitle: Lift Like a Champ!
new_instructions:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, centered between the handles.
2. Bend at the hip and grab the handles firmly.
3. Lower your hips and flex your knees after taking a big breath.
4. Keep your head forward, chest up, and back arched. Drive through your heels to lift.
5. Pull your shoulder blades together and push your hips forward as you lift.
6. Bend at the hips to guide the weight back to the floor.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful crane lifting a car smoothly and steadily 🚗. Focus on driving through your heels and engaging your core for a strong, controlled lift.
short_description: Get ready to feel powerful with the Car Deadlift! This strongman move targets your quads, glutes, and more, making you strong and sturdy 💪. Perfect for those looking to lift heavy and build strength across multiple muscle groups!

name: Car Drivers
instructions: While standing upright, hold a barbell plate in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended straight out in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rotating the plate as far to one side as possible. Use the same type of movement you would use to turn a steering wheel to one side.
Reverse the motion, turning it all the way to the opposite side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Steering Wheel Spins
new_instructions: 1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell plate at 3 and 9 o'clock. Palms face each other, arms straight out front. 2. Rotate the plate as far to one side as you can, like turning a steering wheel. 3. Reverse the motion by turning the plate all the way to the opposite side. 4. Keep repeating for your desired number of reps. 5. Keep your core tight and back straight throughout. 6. Finish strong by slowly bringing the plate back to the start.
tip: Imagine you're steering a race car around tight corners 🏎️. Keep your movements smooth and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Turn those shoulders into boulders with Car Drivers! This fun exercise targets your shoulders and forearms with a simple steering wheel motion. Perfect for beginners, it's a great way to build strength and stability. 🚗💪

name: Carioca Quick Step
instructions: Begin with your feet a few inches apart and your left arm up in a relaxed, athletic position.
With your right foot, quick step behind and pull the knee up.
Fire your arms back up when you pull the right knee, being sure that your knee goes straight up and down. Avoid turning your feet as you move and continue to look forward as you move to the side.
subtitle: Quick Feet Shuffle
new_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet a few inches apart and lift your left arm up in a relaxed, athletic stance.
2. Step your right foot behind your left foot quickly.
3. Pull your right knee up while swinging your arms back up.
4. Ensure your right knee moves straight up and down without turning your feet.
5. Keep your gaze forward and continue moving to the side.
6. Repeat the steps with quick, light movements.
tip: Imagine you're dancing sideways through cones. Keep it light and nimble! 🕺
short_description: The Carioca Quick Step is a fun, beginner-friendly move that gets your adductors, abs, and leg muscles firing. It's perfect for adding some zest to your warm-up! 😊

name: Cat Stretch
instructions: Position yourself on the floor on your hands and knees.
Pull your belly in and round your spine, lower back, shoulders, and neck, letting your head drop.
Hold for 15 seconds.
subtitle: Purr-fect Back Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Get on the floor on your hands and knees.
2. Pull your belly in tight.
3. Round your spine and lower your back.
4. Drop your shoulders and neck.
5. Let your head hang down.
6. Hold this pose for 15 seconds.
tip: Think of a scaredy-cat arching its back 🐱. This helps you get the right form!
short_description: The Cat Stretch is a soothing move to stretch your lower back. Ideal for beginners, it helps release tension and feels purr-fectly relaxing! 😺

name: Catch and Overhead Throw
instructions: Begin standing while facing a wall or a partner.
Using both hands, position the ball behind your head, stretching as much as possible, and forcefully throw the ball forward.

Ensure that you follow your throw through, being prepared to receive your rebound from your throw. If you are throwing against the wall, make sure that you stand close enough to the wall to receive the rebound, and aim a little higher than you would with a partner.
subtitle: Medicine Ball Magic
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall facing a wall or a partner.
2. Grab the medicine ball with both hands.
3. Lift the ball behind your head, stretch and get ready!
4. Throw the ball forward with force, aiming high if using a wall.
5. Follow through with your throw, keeping your eyes on the ball.
6. Catch the rebound and get ready to throw again!
tip: Imagine you're a catapult launching a stone! 🏹 Keep that power and follow through!
short_description: Feel the burn and build strength with the Catch and Overhead Throw! This fun plyometric move targets your lats, abs, chest, and shoulders. Get ready to throw and catch like a pro! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Chain Handle Extension
instructions: You will need two cable handle attachments and a flat bench, as well as chains, for this exercise. Clip the middle of the chains to the handles, and position yourself on the flat bench. Your elbows should be pointing straight up.
Begin by extending through the elbow, keeping your upper arm still, with your wrists pronated.
Pause at the lockout, and reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Tricep Chain Power Push
new_instructions:
1. Gather your equipment: two cable handles, chains, and a flat bench.

2. Clip the middle of the chains to the handles and lie back on the bench.

3. Position your elbows straight up towards the ceiling.

4. Extend your elbows, pushing your hands up while keeping your upper arms still.

5. Pause at the top, feeling the squeeze in your triceps.

6. Slowly lower your hands back to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the chains to ring a big, heavy bell above you! 🔔 Keep that focus and power through each rep.
short_description: Feel the burn in your triceps with the Chain Handle Extension! This exercise isolates your triceps for maximum strength and tone. Get ready to push those chains and power up your arms! 💪

name: Chain Press
instructions: Begin by connecting the chains to the cable handle attachments. Position yourself on the flat bench in the same position as for a dumbbell press. Your wrists should be pronated and arms perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Lower the chains by flexing the elbows, unloading some of the chain onto the floor.
Continue until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle, and then reverse the motion by extending through the elbow to lockout.
subtitle: Chain Press Fun: Pump it Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Connect** the chains to the cable handle attachments.
2. **Position** yourself on the flat bench like a dumbbell press, wrists pronated and arms perpendicular to the floor.
3. **Lower** the chains by bending your elbows, letting some of the chain rest on the floor.
4. **Continue** lowering until your elbows form a 90-degree angle.
5. **Reverse** the motion by straightening your elbows to lockout.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping the movement smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're pushing a mountain! 🏔️ Keep your core tight and visualize the power flowing from your chest through your arms.
short_description: Chain Press is an exhilarating compound movement that targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Feel the power as you lift and lower the weights, building strength and muscle. Give it a go and unleash your inner powerlifter! 💥

name: Chair Leg Extended Stretch
instructions: Sit upright in a chair and grip the seat on the sides.
Raise one leg, extending the knee, flexing the ankle as you do so.
Slowly move that leg outward as far as you can, and then back to the center and down.
Repeat for your other leg.
subtitle: Sit and Stretch Bliss
new_instructions:
1. Sit tall and hold the sides of your chair.
2. Lift one leg, straighten your knee, and flex your ankle.
3. Slowly swing your leg outward to the side.
4. Bring it back to the center.
5. Lower your leg down.
6. Repeat on the other leg.
tip: Imagine you're painting a rainbow with your toes! 🌈 Keep it smooth and steady.
short_description: Get a great hamstring stretch without leaving your chair! Perfect for a quick break, this move helps keep your legs flexible and happy. 🪑

name: Chair Lower Back Stretch
instructions: Sit upright on a chair.
Bend to one side with your arm over your head. You can hold onto the chair with your free hand.
Hold for 10 seconds, and repeat for your other side.
subtitle: Sit, Stretch, Smile!
new_instructions:
1. Sit upright on a chair.
2. Raise one arm overhead and reach toward the opposite side.
3. Hold onto the chair with your free hand for balance.
4. Feel the stretch along your side and lower back.
5. Hold this position for 10 seconds.
6. Slowly return to the starting position and switch sides.
tip: 🌟 Think of reaching for a rainbow above you! Stretch with a big smile and enjoy the rainbow arc!
short_description: Sit, stretch, and smile with the Chair Lower Back Stretch! This move targets your lats and lower back, making it perfect for loosening up after a long day. 🌈

name: Chair Squat
instructions: To begin, first set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the bar is loaded, step under it and position it across the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with your hands facing forward, unlock it and lift it off the rack by extending your legs.

Move your feet forward about 18 inches in front of the bar. Position your legs using a shoulder width stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Look forward at all times and maintain a neutral or slightly arched spine. This will be your starting position.
Slowly lower the bar by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper and lower leg breaks 90 degrees.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heels of your feet, extending the knees and returning to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Sit, Squat, Shine!
new_instructions:
1. Set the bar to match your height and position it on your shoulders.
2. Grab the bar with hands forward, unlock, and lift it by extending your legs.
3. Move your feet about 18 inches ahead, stand shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out.
4. Bend your knees, keep your back straight, head up, and lower until your thighs are below 90 degrees.
5. Exhale, push through your heels, extend your knees, and come back up.
6. Do the recommended number of reps, keeping your form tight.
tip: 👀 Imagine you're sitting back into a comfy chair. Keep your chest up and push through your heels for balance!
short_description: Chair Squats work your quads, glutes, and more! Feel the burn while keeping it fun and effective. Perfect for beginners! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Chair Upper Body Stretch
instructions: Sit on the edge of a chair, gripping the back of it.
Straighten your arms, keeping your back straight, and pull your upper body forward so you feel a stretch. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
subtitle: Chair Stretch Delight
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair and grab the back of it.
2. Keep your back straight and arms extended.
3. Gently pull your upper body forward.
4. Feel the stretch in your shoulders, chest, and biceps.
5. Hold this position for 20-30 seconds.
6. Slowly return to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you’re trying to touch the wall in front of you with your chest. 🧍‍♂️✨
short_description: Feel the joy of a seated stretch that targets your shoulders, chest, and biceps. Perfect for a quick break, this move helps release upper body tension. Enjoy the stretch and keep smiling! 😊

name: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch
instructions: Start off by standing with your legs together, holding a bodybar or a broomstick.
Take a slightly wider than shoulder width grip on the pole and hold it in front of you with your palms facing down.
Carefully lift the pole up and behind your head.
subtitle: Stretch & Smile!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your legs together, holding a broomstick or bodybar.
2. Grip the stick slightly wider than your shoulders, with palms facing down.
3. Lift the stick slowly in front of you, keeping arms straight.
4. Continue lifting the stick over your head and behind you.
5. Feel the stretch in your chest and shoulders.
6. Hold for a few seconds, then return to the start position.
tip: Imagine you’re opening up like a sunflower to the sun! 🌻 Keep your movements slow and steady.
short_description: This stretch is perfect for opening up your chest and shoulders. It’s a great way to start or end your workout, leaving you feeling refreshed and relaxed. 🌞

name: Chest Push from 3 point stance
instructions: Begin in a three point stance, squatted down with your back flat and one hand on the ground. Place the medicine ball directly in front of you.
To begin, take your first step as you pull the ball to your chest, positioning both hands to prepare for the throw.
As you execute the second step, explosively release the ball forward as hard as possible.
subtitle: Power Push from the Ground
new_instructions:
1. Squat down and place one hand on the ground, keeping your back flat and the medicine ball in front of you.
2. Grab the medicine ball and pull it to your chest with both hands.
3. Take your first step forward while holding the ball close to your chest.
4. Step forward again and prepare to throw the ball.
5. Explosively push the ball forward as hard as you can.
6. Reset and repeat the steps for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket 🚀. Push with power and speed!
short_description: Get ready to boost your chest power with the Chest Push from 3 Point Stance! This beginner-friendly move targets your chest, abs, shoulders, and triceps. Explode forward and feel the burn! 💥

name: Chest Push (multiple response)
instructions: Begin in a kneeling position facing a wall or utilize a partner. Hold the ball with both hands tight into the chest.
Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the ball as hard as possible.
Follow through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
Immediately return to an upright position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Power Ball Chest Launch
new_instructions:
1. Kneel facing a wall or partner, holding the medicine ball close to your chest.
2. Explode forward with your hips, pushing the ball hard and fast.
3. Let your momentum carry you forward, catching yourself with your hands.
4. Quickly return to your starting position.
5. Repeat the process for the desired number of reps.
6. Keep your movements controlled and powerful.
tip: Think of launching a rocket 🚀. Push with force and follow through!
short_description: Launch a medicine ball from your chest with explosive power! This move targets your chest, abs, shoulders, and triceps. Get ready to feel the burn and have some fun! 💥

name: Chest Push (single response)
instructions: Begin in a kneeling position holding the medicine ball with both hands tightly into the chest.
Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the ball as far as possible.
Follow through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
subtitle: Chest Power Push
new_instructions:
1. Start kneeling with the medicine ball held tightly against your chest.
2. Explode forward using your hips and push the ball out with force.
3. Let your body follow through by falling forward.
4. Catch yourself with your hands as you land.
5. Reset and get ready for the next push.
6. Feel the power in your chest and repeat!
tip: Imagine you're blasting the ball like a superhero! 💥 It helps to engage your core and push with power.
short_description: The Chest Push is a fun and powerful move that blasts your chest, abs, and shoulders. Perfect for beginners, it combines strength and plyometrics to make you feel unstoppable! 💪

name: Chest Push with Run Release
instructions: Begin in an athletic stance with the knees bent, hips back, and back flat. Hold the medicine ball near your legs. This will be your starting position.
While taking your first step draw the medicine ball into your chest.
As you take the second step, explosively push the ball forward, immediately sprinting for 10 yards after the release. If you are really fast, you can catch your own pass!
subtitle: Push, Sprint, Repeat!
new_instructions:
1. Start in a sporty stance: knees bent, hips back, and back flat, holding the medicine ball near your legs.
2. Take your first step and bring the medicine ball to your chest.
3. On your second step, powerfully push the ball forward.
4. Immediately sprint forward for 10 yards as soon as you release the ball.
5. If you're super speedy, try to catch your own pass!
6. Reset and get ready for the next round.
tip: 💡 Imagine you're launching a rocket! Push that ball forward with all your might and blast off into your sprint!
short_description: Get ready to power up your chest and sprint like a champ! The Chest Push with Run Release works your chest, abs, shoulders, and triceps while adding a fun sprint challenge. 🚀

name: Chest Stretch on Stability Ball
instructions: Get on your hands and knees next to an exercise ball.
Place your elbows on top of the ball, keeping your arm out to your side. This will be your starting position.
Lower your torso towards the floor, keeping your elbow on top of the ball. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, and repeat with the other arm.
subtitle: Chest Stretch Bliss
new_instructions:
1. Get on your hands and knees next to an exercise ball.
2. Place your elbows on top of the ball, arms out to your sides.
3. Lower your torso towards the floor, keeping elbows on the ball.
4. Feel the stretch in your chest and hold for 20-30 seconds.
5. Slowly return to the starting position.
6. Repeat with the other arm.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a giant beach ball 🌊. Keep that round shape to get the best stretch!
short_description: Feel the tension melt away with the Chest Stretch on Stability Ball 🏐. This move opens up your chest and feels oh-so-good. Great for beginners and perfect for unwinding!

name: Child's Pose
instructions: Get on your hands and knees, walk your hands in front of you.
Lower your buttocks down to sit on your heels. Let your arms drag along the floor as you sit back to stretch your entire spine.
Once you settle onto your heels, bring your hands next to your feet and relax. "breathe" into your back. Rest your forehead on the floor. Avoid this position if you have knee problems.
subtitle: Relaxing Back Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Kneel down and place your hands on the floor in front of you.
2. Slowly lower your hips back towards your heels.
3. Allow your arms to drag along the floor, stretching your spine.
4. Settle onto your heels and place your hands beside your feet.
5. Rest your forehead on the floor and breathe deeply.
6. Relax in this position, feeling the stretch in your back and glutes.
tip: Imagine you're a cat stretching after a nap. 🐱 Feel the gentle pull along your spine and relax into it.
short_description: Child's Pose is a gentle stretch focused on relaxing and elongating the lower back and glutes. Perfect for beginners, this pose helps relieve tension and improve flexibility. 🧘‍♂️

name: Chin-Up
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing your torso and a grip closer than the shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, keep your torso as straight as possible while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position. Tip: Keeping the torso as straight as possible maximizes biceps stimulation while minimizing back involvement.

As you breathe out, pull your torso up until your head is around the level of the pull-up bar. Concentrate on using the biceps muscles in order to perform the movement. Keep the elbows close to your body. Tip: The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.

After a second of squeezing the biceps in the contracted position, slowly lower your torso back to the starting position; when your arms are fully extended. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Chin-Up Champions
new_instructions:
1. Grab the pull-up bar with your palms facing you, hands close together.
2. Hang with arms straight, keep your torso straight, and chest out.
3. Exhale and pull your body up until your chin is level with the bar.
4. Focus on using your biceps to lift you; keep elbows close.
5. Hold at the top for a moment, then slowly lower yourself down.
6. Repeat for the number of reps you prefer.
tip: Imagine pulling yourself up to peek over a fence 🏞️. Keep your moves smooth and controlled!
short_description: Chin-ups are a fantastic way to build your upper body strength, especially your lats and biceps. You’ll feel like a superhero as you lift your body weight with ease! 💪

name: Chin To Chest Stretch
instructions: Get into a seated position on the floor.
Place both hands at the rear of your head, fingers interlocked, thumbs pointing down and elbows pointing straight ahead. Slowly pull your head down to your chest. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
subtitle: Neck Relief Nod
new_instructions:
1. Sit comfortably on the floor.
2. Place both hands on the back of your head.
3. Interlock your fingers and point your thumbs down.
4. Keep your elbows pointing straight ahead.
5. Slowly pull your head down towards your chest.
6. Hold for 20-30 seconds and feel the stretch.
tip: Imagine your head is a heavy bowling ball rolling forward. 🎳 Let gravity do the work!
short_description: Feel that neck tension melt away with this simple stretch. Great for easing stress and improving flexibility. Give your neck some love! 🧘‍♂️

name: Circus Bell
instructions: The circus bell is an oversized dumbbell with a thick handle. Begin with the dumbbell between your feet, and grip the handle with both hands.
Clean the dumbbell by extending through your hips and knees to deliver the implement to the desired shoulder, letting go with the extra hand.

Ensure that you get one of the dumbbell heads behind the shoulder to keep from being thrown off balance. To raise it overhead, dip by flexing the knees, and the drive upwards as you extend the dumbbell overhead, leaning slightly away from it as you do so.
Carefully guide the bell back to the floor, keeping it under control as much as possible. It is best to perform this event on a thick rubber mat to prevent damage to the floor.
subtitle: Big Top Shoulder Press
new_instructions:
1. Stand with the circus bell between your feet and grab the handle with both hands.
2. Clean the bell by pushing through your hips and knees to lift it to one shoulder. Let go with one hand.
3. Secure one bell head behind your shoulder to maintain balance.
4. Dip by bending your knees, then push up and extend the bell overhead as you lean slightly away.
5. Carefully lower the bell back down to the floor with control.
6. Perform this on a thick rubber mat to protect the floor.
tip: Imagine you're pushing a giant balloon up to the sky 🎈—keep it steady and controlled!
short_description: The Circus Bell is all about showcasing your shoulder strength and balance. This expert move will have you feeling like a strongman superstar! 💪 Give it a go and feel the power!

name: Clean
instructions: With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand (or hook) grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.

Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.

As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom squat position, which will help in the recovery.
Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.
subtitle: Power Up with the Clean!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab the bar**: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. Bend your knees and take an overhand grip on the barbell, hands just outside your legs.
2. **Lift off**: Drive through your heels and extend your knees. Keep your back straight and arms extended as you lift the bar to knee height.
3. **Jump and shrug**: Explosively extend your hips, knees, and ankles like a jump. Shrug your shoulders and keep the bar close.
4. **Catch the bar**: Rotate your elbows under the bar and catch it on your shoulders. Drop into a front squat as you do.
5. **Stand tall**: Drive through your heels and rise to a standing position, keeping the bar on your shoulders.
tip: Imagine you’re jumping onto a box 🏋️‍♂️. This helps you use your legs and hips for power, not just your arms!
short_description: The Clean is a dynamic barbell move that hits your whole body, especially your legs and back. It’s perfect for building explosive strength and power. Give it a try and feel like an Olympian! 🏋️‍♀️

name: Clean Deadlift
instructions: Begin standing with a barbell close to your shins. Your feet should be directly under your hips with your feet turned out slightly. Grip the bar with a double overhand grip or hook grip, about shoulder width apart. Squat down to the bar. Your spine should be in full extension, with a back angle that places your shoulders in front of the bar and your back as vertical as possible.

Begin by driving through the floor through the front of your heels. As the bar travels upward, maintain a constant back angle. Flare your knees out to the side to help keep them out of the bar's path.
After the bar crosses the knees, complete the lift by driving the hips into the bar until your hips and knees are extended.
subtitle: Lift & Shine!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a barbell close to your shins, feet hip-width apart, and toes slightly out.
2. **Grip the bar** with hands shoulder-width apart, using a double overhand or hook grip.
3. **Squat down** to the bar, keeping your spine straight and shoulders in front of it.
4. **Push through your heels** to lift the bar, keeping your back angle constant.
5. **Flare your knees** out to avoid the bar's path as it rises.
6. **Hips forward** once the bar passes your knees, extending your hips and knees to complete the lift.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful crane lifting a heavy load—steady and smooth all the way up! 🏗️
short_description: The Clean Deadlift is a fantastic full-body move that targets your hamstrings, back, and more! Perfect for beginners, it's a great way to build strength and confidence. 🚀

name: Clean Pull
instructions: With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand or hook grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight and elbows out. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.

Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended. Full extension should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the extension for longer than necessary.
subtitle: Pull Strong and Clean!
new_instructions:
1. Grip the barbell close to your shins with an overhand or hook grip outside your legs.
2. Lower your hips, keep your back straight, face forward, chest up, and shoulders just in front of the bar.
3. Drive through your heels, extend your knees, and keep your back angle steady and arms straight. Move the barbell to your knees.
4. As the bar reaches mid-thigh, extend through your hips. Jump by extending hips, knees, and ankles, moving the bar upward while keeping arms and body extended.
