3. Quickly stand up and use your legs' momentum to press the kettlebells overhead.
4. Lock your arms out once the kettlebells are above your head.
5. Lower the kettlebells back to your shoulders carefully.
6. Repeat the movement.
tip: 🦵 Imagine your legs are springs! Use that spring power to push the kettlebells up fast. More bounce, more power!
short_description: Get ready to power up your shoulders and legs with the Double Kettlebell Push Press! This move blends strength and speed for a full-body boost. Plus, it's a fun way to feel like a superhero! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Double Kettlebell Snatch
instructions: Place two kettlebells behind your feet. Bend your knees and sit back to pick up the kettlebells.
Swing the kettlebells between your legs forcefully and reverse the direction.
Drive through with your hips and lock the ketttlebells overhead in one uninterrupted motion.
subtitle: Snatch Those Bells!
new_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and kettlebells behind your feet.
2. Bend your knees and sit back to grab the kettlebells with both hands.
3. Swing the kettlebells back between your legs like a pendulum.
4. Explode up by thrusting your hips forward and pulling the kettlebells upward.
5. Lock out your arms and hold the kettlebells overhead in one smooth motion.
6. Lower the kettlebells carefully and reset for the next rep.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a jacket with a powerful yank to get those kettlebells overhead! 🧥
short_description: The Double Kettlebell Snatch is a powerful and dynamic move targeting your shoulders, glutes, and legs. It's a full-body exercise that will make you feel like a superhero! 🦸‍♂️

name: Double Kettlebell Windmill
instructions: Place a kettlebell in front of your front foot and clean and press a kettlebell overhead with your opposite arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.

Keeping the kettlebell locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out kettlebell. Turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the locked out kettlebell.
Bending at the hip to one side, sticking your butt out, slowly lean until you can retrieve the kettlebell from the floor. Keep your eyes on the kettlebell that you hold over your head at all times.
Pause for a second after retrieving the kettlebell from the ground and reverse the motion back to the starting position.
subtitle: Whirlwind Kettlebell Fun
new_instructions:
1. Place a kettlebell in front of your foot. Clean and press a kettlebell overhead with your opposite arm.
2. Keep the kettlebell locked out. Push your butt out in the direction of the locked-out kettlebell. Turn your feet out at a 45-degree angle from the arm with the locked-out kettlebell.
3. Bend at the hip to one side, sticking your butt out, and slowly lean until you can grab the kettlebell from the floor. Keep your eyes on the kettlebell overhead.
4. Pause after grabbing the kettlebell and reverse the motion to the start.
tip: Pretend your body is a windmill 🌬️, with your arm as the windmill blade. Keep it steady and strong!
short_description: The Double Kettlebell Windmill is a fun and challenging move that targets your abs, glutes, hamstrings, shoulders, and triceps. Feel the burn and enjoy the twist! 🌪️

name: Double Leg Butt Kick
instructions: Begin standing with your knees slightly bent.
Quickly squat a short distance, flexing the hips and knees, and immediately extend to jump for maximum vertical height.
As you go up, tuck your heels by flexing the knees, attempting to touch the buttocks.
Finish the motion by landing with the knees only partially bent, using your legs to absorb the impact.
subtitle: Springy Heel High-Fives
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your knees slightly bent and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Squat down** a bit, then **spring up** into a jump.
3. **Tuck your heels** up to your butt as you reach the top of your jump.
4. **Land softly** on the balls of your feet with your knees slightly bent.
5. **Absorb the impact** with your legs and get ready to bounce up again!
6. Repeat this move in a rhythm to keep your heart pumping!
tip: Pretend you're trying to high-five your heels behind you! 🦶✨
short_description: Double Leg Butt Kicks are a fun way to get your heart rate up while working your quads and glutes. Jump, tuck, and land softly to keep the bounce going! Give those heels a high-five! 🦵

name: Downward Facing Balance
instructions: Lie facedown on top of an exercise ball.
While resting on your stomach on the ball, walk your hands forward along the floor and lift your legs, extending your elbows and knees.
subtitle: Balance on the Ball!
new_instructions:
1. Lie facedown on the exercise ball, keeping your body straight.
2. Place your hands on the floor in front of you.
3. Walk your hands forward, letting the ball roll under your body.
4. Lift your legs off the floor, extending your knees and elbows.
5. Keep your core tight and hold the balance.
6. Slowly walk your hands back to return to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're a seesaw balancing perfectly—keep your core tight to stay steady! 🤸
short_description: Bring on the balance challenge with the Downward Facing Balance! This move targets your glutes, abs, and hamstrings while giving your core a serious workout. Perfect for adding some fun to your strength routine! 🏋️

name: Drag Curl
instructions: Grab a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing forward) and get your elbows close to your torso and back. This will be your starting position.

As you exhale, curl the bar up while keeping the elbows to the back as you "Drag" the bar up by keeping it in contact with your torso. Tip: As you can see, you will not be keeping the elbows pinned to your sides, but instead you will be bringing them back. Also, do not lift your shoulders.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you keep the bar in contact with the torso at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Bar Magic
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** tall with a barbell in your hands, palms facing forward.
2. **Get ready** by tucking your elbows close to your body and back. This is your starting stance.
3. **Exhale** and **curl** the bar up while dragging it along your torso. Keep those elbows back!
4. **Avoid lifting** your shoulders. Keep the movement smooth and controlled.
5. **Inhale** and **lower** the bar back to the start, keeping it close to your torso.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, feeling the burn in your biceps!
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a snug jacket! 🧥 Keep the bar close to your body for the best results.
short_description: The Drag Curl is a fun, intermediate exercise that targets your biceps and forearms using a barbell. By keeping the bar close to your body, you'll feel a deep burn and build those arm muscles! 💪

name: Drop Push
instructions: Position low boxes or other platforms 2-3 feet apart.
Move to a pushup position between them, supporting yourself by placing your hands on the boxes.
With good posture, drop from the platforms by pressing up and moving your hands to shoulder width, cushioning your landing by absorbing the impact through the arm.
subtitle: Drop and Pop Pushups
new_instructions:
1. Place two low boxes or platforms about 2-3 feet apart.
2. Get into a pushup position with your hands on the boxes.
3. Keep your body straight and strong.
4. Push up hard and move your hands to shoulder width apart, landing on the floor.
5. Absorb the impact by bending your elbows slightly.
6. Repeat the movement, jumping your hands back to the boxes.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero landing from a jump. Absorb the impact softly! 🦸‍♂️
short_description: Feel the power with Drop Pushups! This chest-blasting move also works your shoulders and triceps. Perfect for adding a dynamic twist to your routine. 💥

name: Dumbbell Alternate Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand (torso upright) with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso and the palms of your hand should be facing your thighs.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight as you rotate the palm of the hands until they are facing forward. At this point continue contracting the biceps as you breathe out until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbell back to the starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Remember to twist the palms back to the starting position (facing your thighs) as you come down.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boost with Dumbbells
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a dumbbell in each hand, arms straight, elbows near your torso, and palms facing your thighs.
2. **Curl the right dumbbell up** by rotating your palm forward and contracting your biceps. Keep your upper arm still.
3. **Squeeze your biceps** at the top for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbell back, rotating your palm to the starting position.
4. **Repeat with the left hand** to complete one rep.
5. **Alternate arms** and keep going for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're lifting a delicious ice cream cone to your mouth 🍦—keep that elbow steady and savor the squeeze!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with this fun, beginner-friendly move! Dumbbell Alternate Bicep Curls isolate your biceps and forearms, making them stronger and more defined. Grab those dumbbells and get curling! 💪

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hands will be facing each other.
Then, using your thighs to help raise the dumbbells up, lift the dumbbells one at a time so that you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width.

Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. The dumbbells should be just to the sides of your chest, with your upper arm and forearm creating a 90 degree angle. Be sure to maintain full control of the dumbbells at all times. This will be your starting position.

Then, as you breathe out, use your chest to push the dumbbells up. Lock your arms at the top of the lift and squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then begin coming down slowly. Tip: Ideally, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
subtitle: Pump Up Your Chest
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
2. **Lift the dumbbells** using your thighs to help, holding them in front of you at shoulder width.
3. **Rotate your wrists** so your palms face away and the dumbbells are by your chest.
4. **Push the dumbbells up** using your chest, locking your arms at the top.
5. **Squeeze your chest** at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down.
tip: Imagine you’re hugging a big beach ball as you press up 🌴. This keeps your elbows in the right position!
short_description: Boost your chest power with the Dumbbell Bench Press! This move targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps for an all-around upper body workout 💪. Great for beginners, it’s a fun way to build strength and confidence!

name: Dumbbell Bench Press with Neutral Grip
instructions: Take a dumbbell in each hand and lay back onto a flat bench. Your feet should be flat on the floor and your shoulder blades retracted.
Maintaining a neutral grip, palms facing each other, begin with your arms extended directly above you, perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, lowering the upper arms to the side. Descend until the dumbbells are to your torso.
Pause, then extend the elbow and return to the starting position.
subtitle: Chest Pump with a Twist!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell in each hand and **lie back** on a flat bench. Keep your feet flat on the floor and your shoulder blades retracted. 
2. **Hold** the dumbbells with a neutral grip, palms facing each other, and **extend** your arms straight above you. This is your starting position.
3. **Bend** your elbows and **lower** the dumbbells to the sides of your torso. Feel the stretch in your chest!
4. **Pause** for a moment, then **push** the dumbbells back up to the starting position. That's one rep!
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping the motion controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a big tree 🌳—keep that form tight and controlled to maximize the chest workout!
short_description: Boost your chest gains with the Dumbbell Bench Press with Neutral Grip! This beginner-friendly move targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Get ready to feel the burn and build some serious strength! 💥

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position.

Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Curls for the Girls 💪
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides. 
2. **Rotate** your palms to face forward. This is your starting position.
3. **Curl** the weights up while squeezing your biceps. Keep your upper arms still. 
4. **Hold** at the top for a second, feeling the burn! 
5. **Lower** the weights slowly back to the starting position. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended reps, keeping good form.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a small ball in your biceps at the top of the curl. 🎾 Feel the muscle contraction!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with Dumbbell Bicep Curls! This move isolates your biceps, giving you a strong, defined look. Get ready to flex those guns! 💪

name: Dumbbell Clean
instructions: Begin standing with a dumbbell in each hand with your feet shoulder width apart.
Lower the weights to the floor by flexing at the hips and knees, pushing your hips back until the dumbbells reach the floor. This will be your starting position.

To initiate the movement, violently jump upward by extending the hips, knees, and ankles to acclerate the weights upward. Maintaining a neutral grip on the dumbbells, keep the arms straight until full extension is reached.
After full extension, rebend the hips and knees to receive the weight in a squat position. Allow the arms to bend, guiding the dumbbells to your shoulders.
Upon receiving the weight in the squat position, extend the hips and knees to finish in a standing position with the weights on your shoulders.
subtitle: Lift & Jump with Dumbbells!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Start with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. **Lower Down:** Bend your hips and knees to lower the weights to the floor. Push your hips back.
3. **Explosive Jump:** Jump up by extending your hips, knees, and ankles, lifting the weights. Keep your arms straight with a neutral grip.
4. **Catch in Squat:** As you reach full extension, bend your hips and knees to catch the dumbbells on your shoulders. Bend your arms to guide them.
5. **Stand Up:** Finish by standing up tall with the dumbbells resting on your shoulders.
tip: Imagine you're a spring! Coil down and then explode up to lift the weights. 🌟
short_description: Get ready to work your whole body with the Dumbbell Clean! This move combines strength and coordination, hitting your legs, back, and shoulders. It's like a full-body wake-up call! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
instructions: Lay on the floor holding dumbbells in your hands. Your knees can be bent. Begin with the weights fully extended above you.
Lower the weights until your upper arm comes in contact with the floor. You can tuck your elbows to emphasize triceps size and strength, or to focus on your chest angle your arms to the side.
Pause at the bottom, and then bring the weight together at the top by extending through the elbows.
subtitle: Push It with Dumbbell Floor Press
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand and your knees bent.
2. **Extend** the weights fully above you, forming a straight line with your arms.
3. **Lower** the weights slowly until your upper arms touch the floor. Keep elbows tucked in or angled out.
4. **Pause** briefly at the bottom to feel the stretch.
5. **Press** the weights back up by extending your elbows until your arms are straight.
6. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps, maintaining control and form.
tip: Imagine you're pushing away a heavy door that won't budge 🚪. This helps engage your triceps and chest muscles more effectively!
short_description: Feel the power with the Dumbbell Floor Press! This intermediate move targets your triceps, chest, and shoulders for a full upper-body push workout. Keep it tight, keep it right, and enjoy the muscle burn! 🔥

name: Dumbbell Flyes
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell on each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.

Then using your thighs to help raise the dumbbells, lift the dumbbells one at a time so you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width with the palms of your hands facing each other. Raise the dumbbells up like you're pressing them, but stop and hold just before you lock out. This will be your starting position.

With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon, lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest Fly Fun
new_instructions:
1. Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs. Palms face each other.
2. Use your thighs to lift the dumbbells one at a time. Hold them at shoulder width, palms facing each other. Raise without locking out. This is the start.
3. With a slight elbow bend, lower your arms out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a chest stretch. Inhale as you do this. Keep arms stationary; only shoulders move.
4. Squeeze your chest and exhale as you return to the start. Use the same arc motion.
5. Hold for a second at the top, then repeat for desired reps.
tip: Imagine hugging a big beach ball as you bring the dumbbells together. 🏖️ This keeps the motion controlled and targets your chest muscles better.
short_description: Dumbbell Flyes are an awesome chest exercise that isolates your pecs for a focused burn. Lie back, spread your wings, and squeeze for a stronger chest! 💪

name: Dumbbell Incline Row
instructions: Using a neutral grip, lean into an incline bench.
Take a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip, beginning with the arms straight. This will be your starting position.
Retract the shoulder blades and flex the elbows to row the dumbbells to your side.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then return to the starting position.
subtitle: Row to Grow!
new_instructions:
1. **Lean** into an incline bench with a neutral grip.
2. **Grab** a dumbbell in each hand, arms straight to start.
3. **Retract** your shoulder blades and **flex** your elbows to row the dumbbells to your side.
4. **Pause** at the top, feeling the squeeze in your back.
5. **Lower** the weights back to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're pulling the oars of a boat—steady and strong! 🚣‍♂️ Keep your movements controlled for the best results.
short_description: Boost your back strength with the Dumbbell Incline Row! This beginner-friendly move hits your middle back, biceps, and more. Get ready to row and grow! 💪

name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raise
instructions: Sit on an Incline Bench while holding a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs.

Lift your legs up to kick the weights to your shoulders and lean back. Position the dumbbells above your shoulders with your arms extended. The arms should be perpendicular to the floor with your palms facing forward and knuckles pointing towards the ceiling. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the arms straight and locked, lift the dumbbells by raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the dumbbells to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift and Shine!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs.
2. **Lift** your legs to kick the weights up to your shoulders and lean back. Extend your arms with dumbbells above your shoulders. Palms facing forward, knuckles up. This is your starting position.
3. **Raise** the dumbbells by lifting your shoulders from the bench while keeping your arms straight. Breathe out as you lift.
4. **Lower** the dumbbells back to the starting position while breathing in.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: 🪁 Imagine lifting your shoulders like a kite catching the wind. This helps engage the right muscles and keeps your form sharp!
short_description: Pump up your shoulder game with Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raises! This move targets your shoulders and triceps. Perfect for beginners looking to add some definition. 💪

name: Dumbbell Lunges
instructions: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. This will be your starting position.

Step forward with your right leg around 2 feet or so from the foot being left stationary behind and lower your upper body down, while keeping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Inhale as you go down. Note: As in the other exercises, do not allow your knee to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this will put undue stress on the knee joint. Make sure that you keep your front shin perpendicular to the ground.
Using mainly the heel of your foot, push up and go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.
subtitle: Step Into Strength!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** tall with a dumbbell in each hand, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. **Step forward** with your right foot, about 2 feet ahead. Keep your torso upright.
3. **Lower** your body by bending both knees. Keep your front shin vertical and your back knee hovering above the ground. Inhale.
4. **Push up** through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position. Exhale as you rise.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended reps, then switch legs.
6. **Keep moving** with a smile – you got this!
tip: Imagine you're stepping over a puddle 🌦️. Keep your steps big and steady to maintain balance!
short_description: Dumbbell Lunges work your quads, glutes, and more, making your legs strong and toned. It's a fun way to build strength and balance. Ready, set, lunge! 💪

name: Dumbbell Lying One-Arm Rear Lateral Raise
instructions: While holding a dumbbell in one hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.

Position the palm of the hand that is holding the dumbbell in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This will be your starting position.

Now raise the arm with the dumbbell to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keeping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbell to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Single-Arm Fly High
new_instructions:
1. Lay chest-down on a slightly inclined bench (about 15 degrees).
2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand, with your palm facing your torso.
3. Use your other hand to hold the bench for stability.
4. Raise the dumbbell to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height.
5. Keep your arm straight and hold for a second at the top.
6. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
7. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings! 🦅 Keep your arm straight and control the motion for the best results.
short_description: Lift your shoulders and mid-back with this fun, single-arm move! Perfect for building strength and stability. Give it a try and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation
instructions: Lie on a flat bench face down with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbbell so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm.

Now raise the upper arm so that the forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the upper arm is perpendicular to your torso. Tip: The upper arm should be parallel to the floor and also creating a 90-degree angle with your torso. This will be your starting position.

As you breathe out, externally rotate your forearm so that the dumbbell is lifted forward as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the forearm. You will continue this external rotation until the forearm is parallel to the floor. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Forearm Power Booster
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench, facing down. Rest one arm on the bench and hold a dumbbell with the other hand. 
2. **Bend your elbow** holding the dumbbell, creating a 90-degree angle between your upper arm and forearm.
3. **Lift your upper arm** so your forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the upper arm is parallel to the floor. This is your starting position.
4. **Rotate your forearm** outward, lifting the dumbbell forward while maintaining the 90-degree bend. Continue until your forearm is parallel to the floor. Hold for a second.
5. **Slowly return** to the starting position as you inhale.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're screwing in a lightbulb with your forearm. 🏋️‍♂️ Keep it slow and controlled for maximum muscle engagement!
short_description: Boost your forearm strength with the Dumbbell Lying Pronation! This move isolates the forearms, helping you build stronger grip and stability. Ready to power up those forearms? Let's do it! 💪

name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise
instructions: While holding a dumbbell in each hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench.
Position the palms of the hands in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arms extended with the elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position.

Now raise the arms to the side until your elbows are at shoulder height and your arms are roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arms perpendicular to the torso while keeping them extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
subtitle: Lift & Shape Those Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. **Lay down** on a slightly inclined bench with a dumbbell in each hand. 
2. **Position your palms** facing your torso, arms extended with a slight bend in your elbows.
3. **Raise your arms** to the side until elbows are shoulder height, exhaling as you lift.
4. **Hold the top position** for a second, feeling the squeeze in your shoulders.
5. **Slowly lower** the dumbbells back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings 🦅. Keep that form strong and steady for the best lift!
short_description: Boost those shoulders with the Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise! This exercise isolates your shoulder muscles, shaping and strengthening them. Get ready to fly high! 🦅

name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
instructions: Lie sideways on a flat bench with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbbell so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm.

Now raise the upper arm so that the forearm is parallel to the floor and perpendicular to your torso (Tip: So the forearm will be directly in front of you). The upper arm will be stationary by your torso and should be parallel to the floor (aligned with your torso at all times). This will be your starting position.

As you breathe out, externally rotate your forearm so that the dumbbell is lifted up in a semicircle motion as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the forearm. You will continue this external rotation until the forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the torso pointing towards the ceiling. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
subtitle: Forearm Power Twist
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your side on a flat bench, resting your head on your folded arm. 
2. Hold a dumbbell in your other hand with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
3. Lift your upper arm so your forearm is parallel to the floor, keeping your upper arm still.
4. Rotate your forearm, lifting the dumbbell in a semicircle until your forearm points to the ceiling. Hold for a second.
5. Slowly lower your forearm back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're turning a doorknob to open a treasure chest 🗝️. Keep that motion smooth and controlled!
short_description: Strengthen your forearms with the Dumbbell Lying Supination. This move isolates those muscles, giving you a focused and effective workout. Perfect for building grip strength! 💪

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Shoulder Press
instructions: Grab a dumbbell and either sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.
Clean the dumbbell up to bring it to shoulder height. The other hand can be kept fully extended to the side, by the waist or grabbing a fixed surface.
Rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand is facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch arms.
subtitle: Single-Arm Sky Push
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell and either sit on a bench with back support or stand up straight.
2. **Lift** the dumbbell to shoulder height with one hand. The other hand can be extended to the side, by your waist, or holding a fixed surface.
3. **Turn** your wrist so your palm faces forward. This is your starting position.
4. **Push** the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended as you exhale.
5. **Pause** for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position as you inhale.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling higher with each rep! 🚀 This helps engage your shoulder muscles even more.
short_description: Pump up those shoulders with the Dumbbell One-Arm Shoulder Press! This exercise targets your shoulders and triceps, giving you a solid upper body workout. Feel the burn and reach for the sky! 🌟

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Triceps Extension
instructions: Grab a dumbbell and either sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.

Clean the dumbbell up to bring it to shoulder height and then extend the arm over your head so that the whole arm is perpendicular to the floor and next to your head. The dumbbell should be on top of you. The other hand can be kept fully extended to the side, by the waist, supporting the upper arm that has the dumbbell or grabbing a fixed surface.
Rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand is facing forward and the pinkie is facing the ceiling. This will be your starting position.
Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head as you hold the upper arm stationary. Inhale as you perform this movement and pause when your triceps are fully stretched.
Return to the starting position by flexing your triceps as you breathe out. Tip: It is imperative that only the forearm moves. The upper arm should remain at all times stationary next to your head.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and switch arms.
subtitle: Tri to the Sky
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell and sit on a bench with back support, or stand tall and straight.
2. Lift the dumbbell to shoulder height and extend your arm over your head. Use your free hand for support.
3. Rotate your wrist so your palm faces forward and your pinkie points to the sky. This is your starting position.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly behind your head while keeping your upper arm still. Inhale as you go down and pause when your triceps are fully stretched.
5. Return to the starting position by flexing your triceps and exhale. Only your forearm should move; keep your upper arm steady.
6. Repeat the movement for the recommended reps and then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're a statue with an arm that only moves at the elbow! 🗿 Keep everything else still to target those triceps perfectly.
short_description: Strengthen your triceps with the Dumbbell One-Arm Triceps Extension! This move isolates your triceps, giving them a solid workout. Feel the burn and know you're getting stronger! 💪

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Upright Row
instructions: Grab a dumbbell and stand up straight with your arm extended in front of you with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight. This will be your starting position. Tip: The dumbbell should be resting on top of your thigh with the palm of your hands facing your thighs.
Keep the other hand can be kept fully extended to the side, by the waist or grabbing a fixed surface. This will be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbbell as you exhale. The dumbbell should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until the dumbbell is nearly in line with your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbbell, your elbow should always be higher than your forearm. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbell back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and switch arms.
subtitle: Single-Arm Shoulder Lift
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a dumbbell in one hand, arm extended down with a slight bend at the elbow and back straight. This is your starting position.
2. **Place** your other hand either at your side, by your waist, or holding a fixed surface for balance.
3. **Lift** the dumbbell using your shoulder, keeping it close to your body. Stop when the dumbbell is nearly at chin level, with your elbow higher than your forearm.
4. **Pause** for a second at the top, feeling the squeeze in your shoulder.
5. **Lower** the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position, inhaling as you go.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended reps, then switch arms and do it again!
tip: Imagine pulling up a zipper on your jacket with your elbow leading the way 🧥. This helps keep your form right!
short_description: Pump up those shoulders with the Dumbbell One-Arm Upright Row! This move targets your shoulders, biceps, and traps, giving you a balanced upper body workout. Feel the burn and get stronger, one lift at a time! 💪

name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
instructions: Grab a dumbbell on each hand and lie face down on an incline bench with your shoulders near top of the incline. Your knees can rest on the seat or your legs can be straddled to the sides (my preferred way).
Let your arms extend and hang naturally in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the floor.
Now keep your elbows in by your side and face the palms forward. This will be your starting position.

Raise the dumbbells by contracting the biceps until your arms are fully flexed. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and ensure that only the forearms move. The upper arms should remain stationary at all times.
Lower the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
subtitle: Bicep Bliss on the Bench
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell in each hand and **lie** face down on an incline bench. Your shoulders should be near the top of the incline. 
2. **Rest** your knees on the seat or **straddle** your legs to the sides. 
3. **Let** your arms hang naturally in front of you, perpendicular to the floor. 
4. **Keep** your elbows by your side and **face** your palms forward. This is your starting position. 
5. **Raise** the dumbbells by contracting your biceps until your arms are fully flexed. **Exhale** as you do this. Keep your upper arms stationary. 
6. **Lower** the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended. 
7. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps.
tip: 🎯 Imagine you're squeezing an orange with your bicep at the top of each curl. Feel the juice! 🍊
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl! This move zones in on your biceps while you lie comfortably on an incline bench. Let's get those arms flexing and muscles popping! 💪

name: Dumbbell Raise
instructions: Grab a dumbbell in each arm and stand up straight with your arms extended by your sides with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight. This will be your starting position. Tip: The dumbbell should be next to your thighs with the palm of your hands facing back.

Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbbells as you exhale. The dumbbells should be to the side of the body as you move them up. Continue to lift it until the dumbbells are nearly in line with your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbbell, your elbow should always be higher than your forearm. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift Those Dumbbells!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell in each hand and **stand** tall with arms by your sides, elbows slightly bent. **Keep** your back straight.
2. **Lift** the dumbbells to the sides using your shoulder muscles. **Exhale** as you do this. **Raise** until the dumbbells are almost in line with your chin. 
3. **Ensure** your elbows drive the motion, staying higher than your forearms. **Keep** your torso steady and **pause** at the top for a second.
4. **Lower** the dumbbells back down slowly to the start position. **Inhale** during this part.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, **keeping** your form sharp!
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings wide 🦅. This helps you engage the right muscles and keep your form spot-on.
short_description: Get ready to work those shoulders and biceps with Dumbbell Raises! This beginner-friendly move will have you feeling strong and powerful. Let's lift, smile, and repeat! 💪

name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
instructions: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. This will be your starting position.

Step backward with your right leg around two feet or so from the left foot and lower your upper body down, while keeping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Inhale as you go down. Tip: As in the other exercises, do not allow your knee to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this will put undue stress on the knee joint. Make sure that you keep your front shin perpendicular to the ground. Keep the torso upright during the lunge; flexible hip flexors are important. A long lunge emphasizes the Gluteus Maximus; a short lunge emphasizes Quadriceps.
Push up and go back to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Use the ball of your feet to push in order to accentuate the quadriceps. To focus on the glutes, press with your heels.
Now repeat with the opposite leg.
subtitle: Step Back with Strength
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** tall with a dumbbell in each hand, arms by your sides. This is your starting position.
2. **Step back** with your right leg about two feet, lowering your body while keeping your balance. **Inhale** as you go down.
3. **Keep** your front shin perpendicular to the ground and your torso upright. **Don't let** your knee go past your toes.
4. **Push up** through the ball of your foot to return to the starting position. **Exhale** as you rise.
5. **Repeat** the movement with your left leg.
tip: Imagine you're stepping back into a warrior stance 🦸‍♂️. This will help you stay balanced and strong throughout the move.
short_description: The Dumbbell Rear Lunge is an awesome move for firing up your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It's a perfect way to build leg strength and stability. Plus, who doesn't want to feel like a warrior? 🦵😄

name: Dumbbell Scaption
instructions: This corrective exercise strengthens the muscles that stabilize your shoulder blade. Hold a light weight in each hand, hanging at your sides. Your thumbs should pointing up.
Begin the movement raising your arms out in front of you, about 30 degrees off center. Your arms should be fully extended as you perform the movement.
Continue until your arms are parallel to the ground, and then return to the starting position.
subtitle: Lift and Shine
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a light dumbbell in each hand, letting them hang at your sides with your thumbs pointing up.
2. **Stand** tall with your chest up and shoulders back.
3. **Raise** your arms in front of you at a slight angle, about 30 degrees off the centerline.
4. **Keep** your arms straight as you lift them to shoulder height, parallel to the floor.
5. **Lower** your arms back down slowly to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping a steady and controlled motion.
tip: Imagine you're holding a tray of drinks at a party 🍹—keep it steady and level!
short_description: Feel the burn in your shoulders with the Dumbbell Scaption! 💪 This move helps stabilize your shoulder blades, giving you strength and support where you need it most. Perfect for beginners aiming for those sculpted shoulders!

name: Dumbbell Seated Box Jump
instructions: Position a box a couple feet to the side of a bench. Hold a dumbbell to your chest with both hands and seat yourself on the bench facing the box. This will be your starting position.
Plant your feet firmly on the ground as you lean forward, extending through the hips and knees to jump up and forward.
Land on the box with both feet, absorbing the impact by allowing the hips and knees to bend.
Step down and return to the starting position.
subtitle: Jump to It!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a bench with a dumbbell held at your chest and a box a couple feet in front of you.
2. **Plant** your feet firmly on the ground and lean slightly forward.
3. **Extend** through your hips and knees to jump up and onto the box.
4. **Land** softly on the box with both feet, bending your knees and hips to absorb the impact.
5. **Step down** carefully and return to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your movements controlled and explosive.
tip: 💡 Imagine you're a rocket launching into space! Push off with power and land softly like you're on the moon.
short_description: Boost your leg power with the Dumbbell Seated Box Jump! This fun, explosive move targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Get ready to jump for joy! 🚀

name: Dumbbell Seated One-Leg Calf Raise
instructions: Place a block on the floor about 12 inches from a flat bench.
Sit on a flat bench and place a dumbbell on your upper left thigh about 3 inches above your knee.
Now place the ball of your left foot on the block. This will be your starting position.
Raise your toes up as high as possible as you exhale and you contract your calf muscle. Hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position, stretching as far down as possible.
Repeat for your prescribed number of repetitions and then repeat with the right leg.
subtitle: Calf Power Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a flat bench and place a block about 12 inches in front of you.
2. **Position** a dumbbell on your upper left thigh, 3 inches above your knee.
3. **Place** the ball of your left foot on the block. This is your starting position.
4. **Lift** your toes as high as you can while exhaling. Feel that calf muscle contract!
5. **Hold** the top position for a second, then **slowly lower** back down, stretching your calf.
6. **Repeat** for the desired reps, then switch to your right leg and do it all over again.
tip: Imagine you're pushing through the floor to reach for the stars 🌟. Keep that mental image to maximize your calf raise height!
short_description: Boost your calves with seated one-leg calf raises! This fun move isolates your calf muscles using a dumbbell. Perfect for beginners looking to add some kick to their workout! 🦵💥

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: While holding a dumbbell in each hand, sit on a military press bench or utility bench that has back support. Place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs.
Now raise the dumbbells to shoulder height one at a time using your thighs to help propel them up into position.
Make sure to rotate your wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position.
Now, exhale and push the dumbbells upward until they touch at the top.
Then, after a brief pause at the top contracted position, slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Push Up Those Dumbbells!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit**: Sit on a bench with back support and hold a dumbbell in each hand, resting them on your thighs.
2. **Lift**: Raise the dumbbells to shoulder height one at a time, using your thighs to help.
3. **Rotate**: Rotate your wrists so your palms face forward. This is your starting position.
4. **Press**: Exhale and push the dumbbells upward until they touch above your head.
5. **Pause**: Briefly pause at the top, then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. **Repeat**: Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling higher with each press! 🏋️‍♂️
short_description: Strengthen your shoulders and triceps with the Dumbbell Shoulder Press! This exercise is great for building upper body strength and stability. Let's lift and feel the burn! 💪

name: Dumbbell Shrug
instructions: Stand erect with a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing your torso), arms extended on the sides.

Lift the dumbbells by elevating the shoulders as high as possible while you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at all times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the dumbbells. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the dumbbells back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Lift Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso.
2. **Lift** your shoulders towards your ears like you're saying, "I don't know!" and exhale.
3. **Hold** the top position for a second, feeling the squeeze in your shoulders.
4. **Lower** the weights back to your sides slowly.
5. **Repeat** for the number of reps you’re aiming for.
tip: Think of your shoulders as elevators going up and down, not forward and backward. 🛗 Keep the movement straight!
short_description: Dumbbell Shrugs are fantastic for building those shoulder and upper back muscles. It's like giving your traps a playful lift! Ready to shrug it out? 🤷‍♂️

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on the left hand (palms facing the torso) as you have the right hand holding your waist. Your feet should be placed at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.

While keeping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then change hands.
subtitle: Abs Sizzle with Side Bends!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall**: Hold a dumbbell in your left hand. Place your right hand on your waist. Feet shoulder-width apart. Start here.
2. **Bend right**: Keep your back straight. Bend at your waist to the right. Inhale as you go down.
3. **Hold and rise**: Hold for a second, then return to start as you exhale. Keep your body still.
4. **Switch sides**: Bend to the left. Hold for a second. Return to start.
5. **Repeat**: Do the recommended reps. Switch hands and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a teapot tipping over to pour tea, and keep your body straight! 🫖 It'll help you target those abs better.
short_description: Spice up your ab workouts with Dumbbell Side Bends! This beginner-friendly move isolates your abs and gives you a solid core burn. Perfect for adding a twist to your routine! 🔥

name: Dumbbell Squat
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

Position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance described above which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section.

Begin to slowly lower your torso by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise your torso as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat and Shine!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Grab a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your legs. Keep your back straight and head up. 
2. **Set Your Feet**: Position your feet shoulder-width apart, with toes slightly pointing out.
3. **Lower Down**: Slowly bend your knees and lower your torso, keeping your back straight. Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
4. **Check Form**: Make sure your knees don’t go past your toes.
5. **Push Up**: Push through your heels and straighten your legs to come back up.
6. **Repeat**: Do it again for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you’re sitting back into an invisible chair 🪑. This helps keep your knees behind your toes and your form on point!
short_description: Dumbbell Squats are fantastic for strengthening your quads, glutes, and more! 🌟 With just a couple of dumbbells, you can get a powerful lower-body workout that's great for beginners. Let's squat and shine!

name: Dumbbell Squat To A Bench
instructions: Stand up straight with a flat bench behind you while holding a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

Position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance described above which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section.

Begin to slowly lower your torso by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until you slightly touch the bench behind you. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bench Buddy Squats
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Stand straight with a bench behind you, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your legs. 
2. **Position Your Feet:** Place your feet shoulder-width apart with toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up and back straight. This is your starting position. 
3. **Lower Down:** Slowly bend your knees and lower your torso while keeping your posture straight. Inhale as you go down and touch the bench lightly with your glutes.
4. **Push Up:** Push through your heels to straighten your legs and return to the starting position. Exhale as you rise.
5. **Repeat:** Do the exercise for your desired number of reps, keeping form in check!
tip: Imagine you're sitting down on an invisible chair behind you. 🎭 Keep it slow and controlled to hit those muscles right!
short_description: Bench Buddy Squats are a fun way to work your quads, glutes, and more! It's like sitting on an invisible chair while holding dumbbells. Perfect for building strength and stability! 💪

name: Dumbbell Step Ups
instructions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

Place the right foot on the elevated platform. Step on the platform by extending the hip and the knee of your right leg. Use the heel mainly to lift the rest of your body up and place the foot of the left leg on the platform as well. Breathe out as you execute the force required to come up.

Step down with the left leg by flexing the hip and knee of the right leg as you inhale. Return to the original standing position by placing the right foot of to next to the left foot on the initial position.
Repeat with the right leg for the recommended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.
subtitle: Step Up for Stronger Legs!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell in each hand, stand tall with your arms at your sides.
2. **Step** your right foot onto a sturdy platform or bench.
3. **Push** through your right heel to lift your body up.
4. **Bring** your left foot up to meet your right on the platform.
5. **Step** down with your left foot first, then your right, returning to the start.
6. **Repeat** all steps for the set reps, then switch legs!
tip: 👟 Imagine you're squashing a bug with your heel as you step up. This helps activate your glutes and quads more effectively!
short_description: Boost your leg power and balance with Dumbbell Step Ups! This fun move targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings for a complete lower body workout. Ready to step up your game? Let's do it! 💪

name: Dumbbell Tricep Extension -Pronated Grip
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench holding two dumbbells directly above your shoulders. Your arms should be fully extended and form a 90 degree angle from your torso and the floor.
The palms of your hands should be facing forward, and your elbows should be tucked in. This will be your starting position.
Now, inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells until they are near your ears. Be sure to keep your upper arms stationary and your elbows tucked in.
Then, exhale and use your triceps to return the weight to the starting position.
subtitle: Tricep Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your shoulders.
2. **Face forward** with your palms and keep your elbows tucked in close to your body.
3. **Inhale** and slowly lower the dumbbells towards your ears, keeping upper arms steady.
4. **Exhale** and push the dumbbells back to the starting position using your triceps.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, maintaining control and form.
tip: Imagine you're lowering the dumbbells through thick honey 🍯; this will help you control the movement and engage your triceps fully.
short_description: Get ready to sculpt those triceps! The Dumbbell Tricep Extension is a beginner-friendly isolation exercise that uses a pronated grip. Perfect for building strength and definition in your triceps. 💪

name: Dynamic Back Stretch
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, swing them straight up in front of you 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion each time until your arms are above your head.
subtitle: Swing and Stretch!
new_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. This is your starting position.
2. Keep your arms straight and relaxed at your sides.
3. Swing your arms up in front of you in a controlled motion.
4. Gradually increase the range of motion with each swing.
5. Continue until your arms are swinging above your head.
6. Repeat this motion 5-10 times.
tip: Imagine you're drawing a rainbow with your hands 🌈. It helps make your movements fluid and controlled.
short_description: Loosen up those lats with this dynamic stretch! Perfect for beginners, this move will get your back ready for action. 🌟

name: Dynamic Chest Stretch
instructions: Stand with your hands together, arms extended directly in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, quickly move your arms back as far as possible and back in again, similar to an exaggerated clapping motion. Repeat 5-10 times, increasing speed as you do so.
subtitle: Clap & Stretch Your Chest
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart. Reach your hands out in front of you at chest height. 
2. **Extend your arms** straight out, bringing your hands together, palms facing each other. This is your starting position. 
3. **Swing your arms** out to your sides quickly, feeling a stretch in your chest. 
4. **Clap your hands** back together in front of you, like an exaggerated clap. 
5. **Repeat** this motion 5-10 times, getting faster each time. 
6. **Breathe** steadily as you move, keeping your core engaged.
tip: Imagine you're trying to hug a big beach ball 🏖️—this helps keep your arms rounded and engaged!
short_description: The Dynamic Chest Stretch is a fast and fun way to open up your chest muscles. Perfect for beginners, this move will have you feeling more flexible in no time! 🌟

name: EZ-Bar Curl
instructions: Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle. The palms of your hands should be facing forward and slightly tilted inward due to the shape of the bar. Keep your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps. Focus on only moving your forearms.
Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the top contracted position for a moment and squeeze the biceps.
Then inhale and slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Power Curl
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall and hold an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle, palms facing forward and tilted in. Keep your elbows close to your torso. This is your start position.
2. Exhale and curl the bar up, focusing on only moving your forearms. Contract those biceps!
3. Raise the bar until your biceps are fully flexed and the bar is at shoulder level. Give your biceps a squeeze at the top!
4. Inhale and slowly lower the bar back to your starting position.
5. Repeat for the suggested number of reps. Feel the burn and enjoy the pump!
tip: Imagine you're lifting a treasure chest with each curl. 🏋️‍♂️ Keep your movements controlled and steady, like you're guarding the treasure from falling!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the EZ-Bar Curl! This beginner-friendly move isolates your biceps for maximum growth. Grab that bar, curl it up, and feel the strength surge! 💪

name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
instructions: Using a close grip, lift the EZ bar and hold it with your elbows in as you lie on the bench. Your arms should be perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the upper arms stationary, lower the bar by allowing the elbows to flex. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Pause once the bar is directly above the forehead.
Lift the bar back to the starting position by extending the elbow and exhaling.
Repeat.
subtitle: Tricep Trimmer
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the EZ bar with a close grip and **lie** on a bench. Hold the bar above you, with elbows tucked in and arms straight up—you're ready to start!
2. **Lower** the bar slowly by bending your elbows. **Inhale** as it comes down, aiming just above your forehead. Feel that stretch!
3. **Pause** for a moment when the bar is right above your noggin. No rush, control is key.
4. **Push** the bar back up by straightening your elbows. **Exhale** as you lift. Nice and steady!
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps. Each lift is one step closer to stronger triceps!
tip: Imagine you're lowering the bar to crack an invisible egg right above your forehead—nice and gentle 🥚. Keep it controlled for best results!
short_description: The EZ-Bar Skullcrusher is a killer move for targeting your triceps. Using an EZ bar makes it easier on your wrists while you blast those upper arms! 💪 Perfect for beginners looking to tone up and build strength.

name: Elbow Circles
instructions: Sit or stand with your feet slightly apart.
Place your hands on your shoulders with your elbows at shoulder level and pointing out.
Slowly make a circle with your elbows. Breathe out as you start the circle and breathe in as you complete the circle.
subtitle: Circle Those Elbows!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit or Stand**: Get comfy in a sitting or standing position with your feet slightly apart.
2. **Hands on Shoulders**: Place your hands on your shoulders. Your elbows should be at shoulder level and pointing out.
3. **Start the Circle**: Slowly make a circle with your elbows, starting from the front. Breathe out as you begin the circle.
4. **Complete the Circle**: Continue the circle motion until you return to the start position. Breathe in as you complete the circle.
5. **Repeat**: Keep going with the circles for the desired number of repetitions. Feel the stretch!
tip: 🌀 Imagine drawing a big circle with your elbows like you're tracing a giant hula hoop in the air. It helps with smooth and controlled movement!
short_description: Warm up those shoulders with Elbow Circles! This beginner-friendly move loosens up your shoulder and trap muscles. Perfect for getting ready to rock your workout! 💪

name: Elbow to Knee
instructions: Lie on the floor, crossing your right leg across your bent left knee. Clasp your hands behind your head, beginning with your shoulder blades on the ground. This will be your starting position.
Perform the motion by flexing the spine and rotating your torso to bring the left elbow to the right knee.
Return to the starting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.
subtitle: Crunchy Knee Twist
new_instructions:
1. Lie on the floor with your right leg crossed over your bent left knee. 
2. Place your hands behind your head with your shoulder blades touching the ground. This is your starting position.
3. Flex your abs and rotate your torso to bring your left elbow towards your right knee.
4. Lower back to the starting position.
5. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
6. Switch sides and repeat for the other side.
tip: Imagine you're a sponge being squeezed, twisting out all the water from your middle. 💦 This will help you engage your abs more!
short_description: Twist and crunch your way to stronger abs with the Elbow to Knee exercise. It's fun, effective, and perfect for beginners. Get ready to feel the burn! 🔥

name: Elbows Back
instructions: Stand up straight.
Place both hands on your lower back, fingers pointing downward and elbows out.
Then gently pull your elbows back aiming to touch them together.
subtitle: Elbows Back Stretch: Open Up!
new_instructions:
1. Stand up straight with confidence.
2. Place both hands on your lower back, fingers pointing downward and elbows out.
3. Gently pull your elbows back, aiming to touch them together.
4. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, feeling the chest and shoulder muscles engage.
5. Slowly release and return to the starting position.
6. Repeat a few times to feel loose and relaxed.
tip: Imagine you're trying to squeeze a pencil between your shoulder blades. 🎯 This helps you engage the right muscles!
short_description: The Elbows Back stretch is perfect for opening up your chest and shoulders. It’s a simple yet effective way to improve flexibility and posture. Give it a try and feel the tension melt away! 🧘‍♂️

name: Elevated Back Lunge
instructions: Position a bar onto a rack at shoulder height loaded to an appropriate weight. Place a short, raised platform behind you.
Rack the bar onto your upper back, keeping your back arched and tight. Step onto your raised platform with both feet. This will be your starting position.
Begin by stepping backwards with one leg. Descend by flexing your hips and knees until your knee touches the floor.
Pause, and extend through the hips and knees to rise up, returning all the way to the starting position before alternating.
subtitle: Step Back with Strength!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Load a barbell on a rack at shoulder height. Place a short platform behind you.
2. **Position**: Rack the barbell on your upper back, keep your back arched. Step onto the platform.
3. **Step Back**: Step backward with one leg until your knee touches the floor.
4. **Pause**: Hold briefly, feeling the stretch.
5. **Rise Up**: Push through your hips and knees to return to the starting position.
6. **Alternate**: Switch legs and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're stepping back into a portal to another dimension 🌌—keep your movements smooth and controlled for balance.
short_description: Add some variety to your leg day with the Elevated Back Lunge! This move targets your quads, glutes, and hamstrings, making you stronger and more balanced. Step back, and let’s get those legs fired up! 🔥

name: Elevated Cable Rows
instructions: Get a platform of some sort (it can be an aerobics or calf raise platform) that is around 4-6 inches in height.
Place it on the seat of the cable row machine.
Sit down on the machine and place your feet on the front platform or crossbar provided making sure that your knees are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your back and grab the V-bar handles.

With your arms extended pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feeling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in front of you. This is the starting position of the exercise.

Keeping the torso stationary, pull the handles back towards your torso while keeping the arms close to it until you touch the abs. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squeezing your back muscles hard. Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift and Pull with Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up the Platform:** Place a 4-6 inch platform on the seat of the cable row machine.
2. **Sit and Position:** Sit on the machine with feet on the front platform or crossbar, keeping knees slightly bent.
3. **Grab the Handles:** Lean forward, keeping your back aligned, and grab the V-bar handles.
4. **Starting Position:** Extend your arms and pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle with your legs.
5. **Row the Handles:** Pull the handles towards your torso while keeping arms close, squeezing your back muscles.
6. **Return Slowly:** Slowly return to the original position, feeling a stretch in your lats. Repeat.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a beach ball between your shoulder blades! 🏖️ This helps engage your back muscles better.
short_description: Elevated Cable Rows are a fantastic exercise to strengthen your lats, middle back, and traps. Feel the power as you pull and build a strong, sculpted back! 💪

name: Elliptical Trainer
instructions: To begin, step onto the elliptical and select the desired option from the menu. Most ellipticals have a manual setting, or you can select a program to run. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.
The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an appropriate intensity.
subtitle: Glide to Fitness Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Step onto the elliptical and choose a program or manual setting from the menu. 
2. Input your age and weight to get an accurate calorie burn estimate. 
3. Adjust the elevation to set your workout intensity level. 
4. Grip the handles to monitor your heart rate and stay within your target zone. 
5. Start gliding smoothly, keeping a steady pace. 
6. Cool down by gradually reducing your speed before stopping.
tip: Imagine you're skiing down a snowy hill – keep your movements smooth and rhythmic ⛷️.
short_description: Hop on the elliptical trainer for a low-impact, full-body cardio workout. It's like gliding on air, working your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. 🚴‍♂️ Keep it steady and have fun!

name: Exercise Ball Crunch
instructions: Lie on an exercise ball with your lower back curvature pressed against the spherical surface of the ball. Your feet should be bent at the knee and pressed firmly against the floor. The upper torso should be hanging off the top of the ball. The arms should either be kept alongside the body or crossed on top of your chest as these positions avoid neck strains (as opposed to the hands behind the back of the head position).
Lower your torso into a stretch position keeping the neck stationary at all times. This will be your starting position.

With the hips stationary, flex the waist by contracting the abs and curl the shoulders and trunk upward until you feel a nice contraction on your abs. The arms should simply slide up the side of your legs if you have them at the side or just stay on top of your chest if you have them crossed. The lower back should always stay in contact with the ball. Exhale as you perform this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bounce and Crunch!
new_instructions:
1. Lie on an exercise ball with your lower back pressed against it. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor. 
2. Keep your arms either alongside your body or crossed on your chest. Avoid putting hands behind the head to prevent neck strain. 
3. Lower your torso into a stretch position, keeping your neck steady. This is your starting position.
4. Flex your waist by contracting your abs and curl your shoulders and trunk upwards. Keep your lower back in contact with the ball. Exhale and hold the contraction for a second.
5. Inhale and go back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're a turtle peeking out of its shell 🐢. Keep your neck steady and move smoothly.
short_description: Exercise Ball Crunches are a fun way to work your abs! This beginner move uses a ball to add an extra challenge, making your core work harder. Let's get those abs burning! 🔥

name: Exercise Ball Pull-In
instructions: Place an exercise ball nearby and lay on the floor in front of it with your hands on the floor shoulder width apart in a push-up position.

Now place your lower shins on top of an exercise ball. Tip: At this point your legs should be fully extended with the shins on top of the ball and the upper body should be in a push-up type of position being supported by your two extended arms in front of you. This will be your starting position.

While keeping your back completely straight and the upper body stationary, pull your knees in towards your chest as you exhale, allowing the ball to roll forward under your ankles. Squeeze your abs and hold that position for a second.
Now slowly straighten your legs, rolling the ball back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Core Crunch Ball Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready:** Place an exercise ball nearby and lay on the floor in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. 
2. **Position:** Rest your lower shins on top of the exercise ball. Your legs should be straight, and your body in a push-up position.
3. **Pull In:** Keep your back straight and pull your knees towards your chest. Let the ball roll forward under your ankles. Squeeze your abs!
4. **Hold Tight:** Hold the position for a second and feel the burn in your abs.
5. **Roll Back:** Slowly straighten your legs, rolling the ball back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat:** Do the recommended number of repetitions and enjoy the core workout!
tip: Imagine you're a cat curling up into a cozy ball 🐱. Keep your movements smooth and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Rock those abs with the Exercise Ball Pull-In! This move uses an exercise ball to roll your way to a stronger core. It's fun, effective, and perfect for beginners! 🎉

name: Extended Range One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
instructions: Lie on the floor and position a kettlebell for one arm to press. The kettlebell should be held by the handle. The leg on the same side that you are pressing should be bent, with the knee crossing over the midline of the body.
Press the kettlebell by extending the elbow and adducting the arm, pressing it above your body. Return to the starting position.
subtitle: One-Arm Kettlebell Power Press
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on the floor and grab your kettlebell by the handle.
2. **Bend your leg** on the same side you're pressing, with the knee crossing your body's midline.
3. **Press up** by extending your elbow and lifting the kettlebell above your body.
4. **Lower back** to the starting position with control.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the kettlebell up to the sky like a rocket launch 🚀. Keep your movement smooth and controlled for the best lift.
short_description: Get ready to work your chest, shoulders, and triceps with this powerful one-arm press! Lying on the floor, you'll push a kettlebell up like a champ. Perfect for building strength and stability 💪.

name: External Rotation
instructions: Lie sideways on a flat bench with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbbell so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm. Tip: Keep the arm parallel to your torso.

Now bend the elbow while keeping the upper arm stationary. In this manner, the forearm will be parallel to the floor and perpendicular to your torso (Tip: So the forearm will be directly in front of you). The upper arm will be stationary by your torso and should be parallel to the floor (aligned with your torso at all times). This will be your starting position.

As you breathe out, externally rotate your forearm so that the dumbbell is lifted up in a semicircle motion as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the forearm. You will continue this external rotation until the forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the torso pointing towards the ceiling. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
subtitle: Shoulder Spin Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lie Down**: Lie sideways on a flat bench. Hold a dumbbell in one hand and rest your head on your other arm.
2. **Bend Elbow**: Bend the elbow of the arm with the dumbbell to a 90-degree angle. Keep your arm parallel to your torso.
3. **Start Position**: Bend your elbow, keeping your upper arm still. Your forearm should be parallel to the floor.
4. **Lift Dumbbell**: Exhale and rotate your forearm, lifting the dumbbell in a semicircle until your forearm points to the ceiling. Hold for a second.
5. **Lower Dumbbell**: Inhale and slowly return to the starting position.
6. **Repeat**: Do the recommended number of reps, then switch arms and repeat.
tip: 🌀 Imagine you're painting a rainbow with the dumbbell. Keep the motion smooth and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Get those shoulders strong with External Rotations! This fun move targets your shoulder muscles, giving you better stability and strength. Perfect for beginners and easy to do with just a dumbbell! 🌟

name: External Rotation with Band
