Step forward, gaining tension in the pulleys. Your palms should be facing forward, hands below the waist, and your arms straight. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend in your arms, draw your hands upward and toward the midline of your body. Your hands should come together in front of your chest, palms facing up.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a brief pause.
subtitle: Chest Fly Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Place the pulleys low and choose your weights. Grab a handle in each hand.
2. **Step Forward**: Move forward until you feel tension. Keep your palms facing forward and hands below your waist.
3. **Lift and Squeeze**: With a slight arm bend, lift your hands upward and together in front of your chest. Palms should face up.
4. **Pause and Lower**: Briefly pause, then slowly lower your arms back to the start. Repeat!
tip: Think of hugging a big beach ball 🏀 while lifting your hands. This keeps your form tight and targets your chest muscles better.
short_description: Boost your chest game with the Low Cable Crossover! This move isolates your chest and gives your shoulders some love too. Feel the squeeze and enjoy the burn! 💥

name: Low Cable Triceps Extension
instructions: Select the desired weight and lay down face up on the bench of a seated row machine that has a rope attached to it. Your head should be pointing towards the attachment.
Grab the outside of the rope ends with your palms facing each other (neutral grip).

Position your elbows so that they are bent at a 90 degree angle and your upper arms are perpendicular (90 degree angle) to your torso. Tip: Keep the elbows in and make sure that the upper arms point to the ceiling while your forearms point towards the pulley above your head. This will be your starting position.

As you breathe out, extend your lower arms until they are straight and vertical. The upper arms and elbows remain stationary throughout the movement. Only the forearms should move. Contract the triceps hard for a second.
As you breathe in slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Cable Triceps Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Select** your weight and lay face-up on the bench of a seated row machine.
2. **Grab** the rope ends with your palms facing each other.
3. **Position** your elbows at 90 degrees, with upper arms pointing to the ceiling.
4. **Exhale** and extend your lower arms until they are straight and vertical.
5. **Inhale** and return slowly to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're pushing away the ceiling with your hands. 🚀 Keep those elbows still!
short_description: Feel the burn in your triceps with the Low Cable Triceps Extension. This move isolates your triceps, giving them a great workout! Perfect for beginners. 💪

name: Low Pulley Row To Neck
instructions: Sit on a low pulley row machine with a rope attachment.

Grab the ends of the rope using a palms-down grip and sit with your back straight and your knees slightly bent. Tip: Keep your back almost completely vertical and your arms fully extended in front of you. This will be your starting position.

While keeping your torso stationary, lift your elbows and start bending them as you pull the rope towards your neck while exhaling. Throughout the movement your upper arms should remain parallel to the floor. Tip: Continue this motion until your hands are almost next to your ears (the forearms will not be parallel to the floor at the end of the movement as they will be angled a bit upwards) and your elbows are out away from your sides.
After holding for a second or so at the contracted position, come back slowly to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Again, during no part of the movement should the torso move.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Neck and Shoulder Row Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a low pulley row machine with a rope attachment.
2. **Grab** the ends of the rope with your palms facing down and **sit up** straight with your knees slightly bent. This is your starting position.
3. **Pull** the rope towards your neck by lifting your elbows and bending them, keeping your upper arms parallel to the floor. Exhale as you pull.
4. **Hold** for a second when your hands are near your ears, then **slowly release** back to the starting position while inhaling.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping your torso stationary throughout the exercise.
tip: Imagine you're trying to make your elbows touch the walls on either side of you. 🎯 Keep that target in mind to maintain proper form!
short_description: The Low Pulley Row To Neck targets your shoulders, biceps, back, and traps all in one move. It's like giving your upper body a group hug! 🤗 Perfect for beginners looking to strengthen multiple muscles at once.

name: Lower Back-SMR
instructions: In a seated position, place a foam roll under your lower back. Cross your arms in front of you and protract your shoulders. This will be your starting position.

Raise your hips off of the floor and lean back, keeping your weight on your lower back. Now shift your weight slightly to one side, keeping your weight off of the spine and on the muscles to the side of it. Roll over your lower back, holding points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat on the other side.
subtitle: Roll Out the Tension!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** and place a foam roller under your lower back.
2. **Cross your arms** over your chest and push your shoulders forward.
3. **Lift your hips** off the floor, leaning back onto the roller.
4. **Shift your weight** to one side, avoiding your spine, and roll over the muscles.
5. **Hold for 10-30 seconds** on any tight spots.
6. **Repeat** on the other side.
tip: Imagine you're smoothing out dough with a rolling pin. 🍞 Keep the pressure even and gentle!
short_description: Say goodbye to lower back tension with this foam roller exercise! 🎉 Roll out those tight muscles and feel the relief. Perfect for beginners looking to stretch and soothe. Give it a try and feel amazing! 😊

name: Lower Back Curl
instructions: Lie on your stomach with your arms out to your sides. This will be your starting position.
Using your lower back muscles, extend your spine lifting your chest off of the ground. Do not use your arms to push yourself up. Keep your head up during the movement. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions.
subtitle: Chill and Lift
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your stomach with your arms out to your sides. This is your starting position.
2. **Extend** your spine by lifting your chest off the ground using your lower back muscles. 
3. **Keep** your arms relaxed and avoid using them to push yourself up.
4. **Look up** slightly to keep your head in a neutral position.
5. **Lower** your chest back down to the ground slowly and repeat for 10-20 reps.
tip: Imagine you're a super-slow superhero lifting off the ground—steady and strong! 🦸‍♂️
short_description: Lower Back Curl strengthens your lower back while giving a gentle stretch to your abs. It's a great move to improve posture and reduce back pain. 🧘‍♂️

name: Lunge Pass Through
instructions: Stand with your torso upright holding a kettlebell in your right hand. This will be your starting position.
Step forward with your left foot and lower your upper body down by flexing the hip and the knee, keeping the torso upright. Lower your back knee until it nearly touches the ground.
As you lunge, pass the kettlebell under your front leg to your opposite hand.
Pressing through the heel of your foot, return to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions, alternating legs.
subtitle: Smooth Move Lunges
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a kettlebell in your right hand.
2. **Step forward** with your left foot and lower your body by bending at the hip and knee.
3. **Pass the kettlebell** under your front leg to your opposite hand as you lunge.
4. **Press through your heel** to return to the starting position.
5. **Switch legs** and repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're gliding smoothly like a dancer passing the kettlebell under your leg gracefully 🩰.
short_description: This move combines lunges and a kettlebell pass for a killer leg workout! Strengthen your hamstrings, glutes, and more while feeling like a fitness pro. 💪

name: Lunge Sprint
instructions: Adjust a bar in a Smith machine to an appropriate height. Position yourself under the bar, racking it across the back of your shoulders. Unrack the bar, and then split your feet, moving one foot forward and one foot back. This will be your starting position.
Lower your back knee nearly to the ground, flexing the knees and lowering your hips as you do so.

At the bottom of the descent, immediately reverse direction. Explosively drive through the heel of your front foot with light pressure from your back foot. Jump up and reverse the position of your legs.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Speedy Leg Blaster
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the bar in a Smith machine to a comfortable height. **Position** yourself under the bar, letting it rest across the back of your shoulders.
2. **Unrack** the bar carefully and **split** your feet—one foot forward and one foot back. This is your starting spot.
3. **Lower** your back knee close to the ground by bending your knees and dropping your hips.
4. **Reverse** direction quickly at the bottom. **Push off** the heel of your front foot and lightly from your back foot to **jump** up, switching the position of your legs.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping your movements smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're springing off the ground like a kangaroo 🦘. This will help you get that explosive power!
short_description: Lunge Sprints are a dynamo for your legs! They work your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings all at once. It's like giving your lower body a power boost! ⚡

name: Lying Bent Leg Groin
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the soles of the feet pressed together. Have your partner hold your knees. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to squeeze your knees together, while your partner prevents any movement from occurring.
After 10-20 seconds, relax your muscles as your partner gently pushes your knees towards the floor. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.
subtitle: Happy Hips Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your back with knees bent and soles of your feet pressed together.
2. **Have a buddy** hold your knees gently to keep them steady.
3. **Try to squeeze** your knees together while your buddy resists the movement.
4. **Hold the squeeze** for 10-20 seconds to feel the tension.
5. **Relax your muscles** and let your buddy gently push your knees toward the floor.
6. **Communicate** with your buddy to avoid overstretching.
tip: Imagine your knees are magnets 🧲 trying to touch, but your buddy is the force field keeping them apart!
short_description: Get those hips happy with the Lying Bent Leg Groin stretch! It targets your inner thighs and helps increase flexibility. Grab a buddy and give your hips some love! 🧘‍♂️

name: Lying Cable Curl
instructions: Grab a straight bar or E-Z bar attachment that is attached to the low pulley with both hands, using an underhand (palms facing up) shoulder-width grip.
Lie flat on your back on top of an exercise mat in front of the weight stack with your feet flat against the frame of the pulley machine and your legs straight.
With your arms extended and your elbows close to your body slightly bend your arms. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary and the elbows close to your body, curl the bar up slowly toward your chest as you breathe out and you squeeze the biceps.
After a second squeeze at the top of the movement, slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Cable Magic
new_instructions:
1. Grab a straight or E-Z bar attached to the low pulley with an underhand grip.
2. Lie flat on your back in front of the weight stack with feet against the pulley frame and legs straight.
3. Start with arms extended, elbows close, and a slight bend in your arms.
4. Curl the bar up slowly toward your chest, keeping upper arms stationary, and squeeze your biceps.
5. Hold the squeeze for a second, then slowly return to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps and feel the burn!
tip: Imagine you're lifting a heavy treasure chest lid with each curl. 💪🏴‍☠️
short_description: Lying Cable Curls work your biceps while you're on your back. It's a fun way to isolate those muscles and get a good pump. Plus, it feels like a magical workout move! 🪄

name: Lying Cambered Barbell Row
instructions: Place a cambered bar underneath an exercise bench.
Lie face down on the exercise bench and grab the bar using a palms down (pronated grip) that is wider than shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale row the bar up as you keep the elbows close to your body to either your chest, in order to target the upper mid back, or to your stomach if targeting the lats is your goal.
After a second hold at the top, lower back down to the starting position slowly as you inhale.
subtitle: Face-Down Barbell Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Place a cambered bar underneath an exercise bench.
2. **Position Yourself**: Lie face down on the exercise bench and grab the bar with a palms-down grip, wider than shoulder width. This is your starting position.
3. **Row Up**: Exhale and row the bar up, keeping your elbows close to your body. Aim for your chest to target the upper mid-back, or your stomach for the lats.
4. **Hold and Lower**: Hold for a second at the top, then slowly lower the bar back to the starting position as you inhale.
tip: Imagine squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades as you row up 📝. This helps engage your back muscles better!
short_description: Row, row, row your barbell! This move targets your mid-back, lats, and biceps while you lie face down on a bench. Perfect for beginners looking to build strength and confidence! 💪

name: Lying Close-Grip Bar Curl On High Pulley
instructions: Place a flat bench in front of a high pulley or lat pulldown machine.
Hold the straight bar attachment using an underhand grip (palms up) that is about shoulder width.
Lie on your back with your head over the end of the bench.
Now extend your arms straight above your shoulders. Your torso and your arms should make a 90-degree angle and the elbows should be in. This will be your starting position.

As you breathe out, curl the bar down in a semicircular motion until it touches your chin. Squeeze the biceps for a second at the top contracted position. Tip: As you execute this motion only the forearms should move. At no time should the upper arms be moving at all. They are to remain perpendicular throughout the movement.
Return to starting position slowly.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lying Bicep Bliss
new_instructions:
1. **Place** a flat bench in front of a high pulley or lat pulldown machine.
2. **Grab** the straight bar attachment with an underhand grip, about shoulder width apart.
3. **Lie down** on your back with your head over the end of the bench.
4. **Extend** your arms straight above your shoulders. Keep your elbows in and form a 90-degree angle with your body.
5. **Curl** the bar down in a semicircular motion until it touches your chin. Squeeze your biceps and remember, only your forearms should move!
6. **Return** to the starting position slowly and repeat for the recommended amount of reps.
tip: 🧠 Imagine you're pulling a rope to ring a bell above your head. Keep that focus and control!
short_description: Get ready to curl those biceps while lying down! The Lying Close-Grip Bar Curl on High Pulley isolates your biceps for a stronger, more focused workout. Perfect for beginners looking to tone those arms! 💪

name: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Extension Behind The Head
instructions: While holding a barbell or EZ Curl bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward), lie on your back on a flat bench with your head close to the end of the bench. Tip: If you are holding a barbell grab it using a shoulder-width grip and if you are using an E-Z Bar grab it on the inner handles.

Extend your arms in front of you and slowly bring the bar back in a semi circular motion (while keeping the arms extended) to a position over your head. At the end of this step your arms should be overhead and parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position. Tip: Keep your elbows in at all times.
As you inhale, lower the bar by bending at the elbows and while keeping the upper arm stationary. Keep lowering the bar until your forearms are perpendicular to the floor.

As you exhale bring the bar back up to the starting position by pushing the bar up in a semi-circular motion until the lower arms are also parallel to the floor. Contract the triceps hard at the top of the movement for a second. Tip: Again, only the forearms should move. The upper arms should remain stationary at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Tamer
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a barbell or EZ Curl bar and lie on your back on a flat bench near the end.
2. **Extend** your arms and slowly arc the bar back over your head. Your arms should end up parallel to the floor. This is your starting position.
3. **Inhale** and lower the bar by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms still. Lower until your forearms are perpendicular to the floor.
4. **Exhale** and push the bar back to the starting position in a semi-circular motion. Squeeze your triceps at the top for a second. Only your forearms should move.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're drawing a rainbow with the bar 🌈. Keep your elbows steady to paint a perfect arc!
short_description: Tame those triceps with the Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Extension! This move isolates your triceps for maximum burn and growth. Feel the power and sculpt those arms! 💪

name: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Press To Chin
instructions: While holding a barbell or EZ Curl bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward), lie on your back on a flat bench with your head off the end of the bench. Tip: If you are holding a barbell grab it using a shoulder-width grip and if you are using an E-Z Bar grab it on the inner handles.
Extend your arms in front of you as you hold the barbell over your chest. The arms should be perpendicular to your torso (90-degree angle). This will be your starting position.
As you inhale, lower the bar in a semi-circular motion by bending at the elbows and while keeping the upper arm stationary and elbows in. Keep lowering the bar until it lightly touches your chin.

As you exhale bring the bar back up to the starting position by pushing the bar up in a semi-circular motion. Contract the triceps hard at the top of the movement for a second. Tip: Again, only the forearms should move. The upper arms should remain stationary at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Chin Press Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with an EZ bar in hand. Grab it with a close grip.
2. **Extend** your arms straight up, bar above your chest. This is your starting spot!
3. **Bend** your elbows and lower the bar towards your chin. Keep those upper arms still.
4. **Push** the bar back up to the start. Feel your triceps work hard!
5. **Squeeze** at the top for a second, then repeat the moves for the set number of reps.
tip: 🧠 Think of your arms like hinges on a door, only your elbows move to let the bar down and up!
short_description: Get ready to blast those triceps with the Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Press to Chin! This move isolates your triceps for an intense workout. Feel the burn and have fun with it! 🔥

name: Lying Crossover
instructions: Lie on your back with your legs extended.

Cross one leg over your body with the knee bent, attempting to touch the knee to the ground. Your partner should kneel beside you, holding your shoulder down with one hand and controlling the crossed leg with the other. this will be your starting position.
Attempt to raise the bent knee off of the ground as your partner prevents any actual movement.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the leg as your partner gently presses the knee towards the floor. Repeat with the other side.
subtitle: Cross It Over!
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with your legs straight.
2. Cross one leg over your body, bending the knee and trying to touch it to the ground.
3. Have a buddy kneel beside you, holding your shoulder down and controlling your crossed leg.
4. Try to lift the bent knee off the ground, while your buddy holds it in place.
5. Hold the position for 10-20 seconds, then relax.
6. Let your buddy gently press your knee towards the floor. Switch sides and repeat.
tip: Picture your leg like a slow-moving windshield wiper, gently crossing over your body. 🚗
short_description: The Lying Crossover is a fantastic stretch for your abductors and helps improve flexibility. Get a buddy to help you out and make it fun! 🤸‍♂️

name: Lying Dumbbell Tricep Extension
instructions: Lie on a flat bench while holding two dumbbells directly in front of you. Your arms should be fully extended at a 90-degree angle from your torso and the floor. The palms should be facing in and the elbows should be tucked in. This is the starting position.
As you breathe in and you keep the upper arms stationary with the elbows in, slowly lower the weight until the dumbbells are near your ears.
At that point, while keeping the elbows in and the upper arms stationary, use the triceps to bring the weight back up to the starting position as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tri-Toning Extensions
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench, holding two dumbbells above you with arms fully extended. Palms face each other. 
2. **Keep elbows tucked in** and slowly **lower the weights** towards your ears. Breathe in as you do this. 
3. **Stop** when the dumbbells are near your ears. 
4. **Push the weights back up** to the starting position using your triceps while you breathe out. 
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your form tight and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're lowering the weights like drawing a rainbow above your head 🌈. It helps keep your movement smooth and controlled!
short_description: Blast those triceps with Lying Dumbbell Tricep Extensions! This move isolates and tones your triceps, giving your arms that defined look. Get ready to feel the burn and love the results! 💪

name: Lying Face Down Plate Neck Resistance
instructions: Lie face down with your whole body straight on a flat bench while holding a weight plate behind your head. Tip: You will need to position yourself so that your shoulders are slightly above the end of a flat bench in order for the upper chest, neck and face to be off the bench. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the plate secure on the back of your head slowly lower your head (as in saying "yes") as you breathe in.
Raise your head back up to the starting position in a semi-circular motion as you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Neck Power Move
new_instructions:
1. Lie face down on a flat bench, keeping your body straight and holding a weight plate behind your head. Position yourself so your shoulders, neck, and face are off the bench.
2. Secure the plate on the back of your head and slowly lower your head, like you're nodding 'yes,' while breathing in.
3. Raise your head back to the starting position in a semi-circular motion while breathing out. Hold the contraction for a second.
4. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine your head is a lever lifting a treasure chest. Keep the motion controlled and steady. 🏋️
short_description: Strengthen your neck with this targeted exercise. Perfect for building neck muscles and enhancing posture. Get ready to nod with power! 💪

name: Lying Face Up Plate Neck Resistance
instructions: Lie face up with your whole body straight on a flat bench while holding a weight plate on top of your forehead. Tip: You will need to position yourself so that your shoulders are slightly above the end of a flat bench in order for the traps, neck and head to be off the bench. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the plate secure on your forehead slowly lower your head back in a semi-circular motion as you breathe in.
Raise your head back up to the starting position in a semi-circular motion as you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Neck Power Up
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** flat on a bench with your whole body straight and shoulders slightly above the bench end.
2. **Hold** a weight plate securely on your forehead.
3. **Lower** your head back slowly in a semi-circular motion. Breathe in as you go.
4. **Raise** your head back to the starting position in a semi-circular motion. Breathe out as you move up.
5. **Hold** the contraction at the top for a second.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine your head is a drawbridge moving slowly and smoothly. 🏰 Keep it controlled and steady!
short_description: Strengthen your neck muscles with the Lying Face Up Plate Neck Resistance exercise. Perfect for building neck power and stability. Give your neck some love! 💪

name: Lying Glute
instructions: Lie on your back with your partner kneeling beside you.

Flex the hip of one leg, raising it off of the floor. Rotate the leg so the foot is over the opposite hip, the lower leg perpendicular to your body. Your partner should hold the knee and ankle in place. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your leg towards your partner, who should be preventing any actual movement of the leg.

After 10-20 seconds, completely relax as your partner gently pushes the ankle and knee towards your chest. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.
subtitle: Glute Stretch Magic
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with your partner kneeling beside you.
2. Raise one leg off the floor and rotate it so your foot is over the opposite hip, forming an 'L' shape with your lower leg. Have your partner hold your knee and ankle in place.
3. Push your leg towards your partner, who should stop any movement. Hold this position for 10-20 seconds.
4. Relax completely as your partner gently pushes your ankle and knee towards your chest. Communicate with your partner to avoid overstretching.
tip: Imagine you're gently pressing against a wall with your leg, but the wall isn't moving. 🚧
short_description: The Lying Glute stretch is a fantastic way to target those glutes and hip abductors. This move requires teamwork, making it fun and interactive. 👫

name: Lying Hamstring
instructions: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Your partner should be kneeling beside you. Raise one leg up towards the ceiling and have your partner hold the ankle. Your partner can use their shoulder to brace your leg if necessary. This will be your starting position.
With your partner holding your leg in place, attempt to flex the knee, contracting the hamstrings for 10-20 seconds.

Then relax your leg, allowing your partner to gently push the leg towards your head. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching. Switch sides once complete.
subtitle: Stretch Those Hammies!
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back with your legs straight out.
2. Have a buddy kneel next to you and lift one leg up.
3. Keep your leg straight and let your friend hold your ankle.
4. Try to bend your knee, tightening your hamstring for 10-20 seconds.
5. Relax your leg and let your buddy gently push it towards your head.
6. Switch legs and repeat!
tip: Imagine you're trying to push your foot through thick mud. This will help you really engage those hamstrings! 🦵
short_description: The Lying Hamstring stretch is perfect for targeting those tricky hamstrings and calves. Grab a friend to help you get a deeper stretch and feel those muscles loosen up! 🤗

name: Lying High Bench Barbell Curl
instructions: Lie face forward on a tall flat bench while holding a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing up). Tip: If you are holding a barbell grab it using a shoulder-width grip and if you are using an E-Z Bar grab it on the inner handles. Your upper body should be positioned in a way that the upper chest is over the end of the bench and the barbell is hanging in front of you with the arms extended and perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the elbows in and the upper arms stationary, curl the weight up in a semi-circular motion as you contract the biceps and exhale. Hold at the top of the movement for a second.
As you inhale, slowly go back to the starting position. Tip: Maintain full control of the weight at all times and avoid any swinging. Remember, only the forearms should move throughout the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Bliss on a Bench
new_instructions:
1. Lie down face forward on a tall bench, holding a barbell with palms up. Use a shoulder-width grip for a barbell or inner handles for an E-Z Bar.
2. Position yourself so your upper chest is over the end of the bench and the barbell hangs in front of you.
3. Curl the weight up, contracting your biceps and exhaling. Keep elbows in and upper arms stationary.
4. Hold at the top for a second.
5. Lower the weight back to the starting position while inhaling. Control the weight and avoid swinging.
6. Repeat for the recommended amount of reps.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing an orange in your elbow pit 🍊. This helps you focus on keeping your elbows stationary and your biceps engaged.
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Lying High Bench Barbell Curl! This exercise isolates your biceps for maximum growth. Get ready to feel the burn and rock those sleeveless shirts! 💪

name: Lying Leg Curls
instructions: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie face down on the leg curl machine with the pad of the lever on the back of your legs (just a few inches under the calves). Tip: Preferably use a leg curl machine that is angled as opposed to flat since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment.

Keeping the torso flat on the bench, ensure your legs are fully stretched and grab the side handles of the machine. Position your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances described on the foot positioning section). This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl your legs up as far as possible without lifting the upper legs from the pad. Once you hit the fully contracted position, hold it for a second.
As you inhale, bring the legs back to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Hamstring Hero
new_instructions:
1. Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie face down on the leg curl machine.
2. Position the pad just a few inches below your calves and grab the side handles.
3. Keep your torso flat, stretch your legs fully, and point your toes straight.
4. Exhale and curl your legs up as far as you can without lifting your thighs.
5. Hold the curl for a second, then inhale and slowly lower back to start.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to kick your own butt! 🍑 This helps you engage your hamstrings fully.
short_description: Lying Leg Curls are a fantastic exercise to isolate and strengthen your hamstrings. Lie face down on a machine, curl those legs, and feel the burn. It's great for building strong, toned legs! 🦵

name: Lying Machine Squat
instructions: Adjust the leg machine to a height that will allow you to get inside it with your knees bent and the thighs slightly below parallel.

Once you select the weight, position yourself inside the machine face up with the knees bent and thighs slightly below parallel to the platform. Make sure that the knees do not go past the toes. The angle created between the hamstrings and the calves should be one that is slightly less than 90 degrees (since your starting position requires you to start slightly below parallel). Your back and your head should be resting on the machine while your shoulders are pressed under the shoulder pads.
Place your hands by the handles and position your feet slightly pointing out at a shoulder width position. This will be your starting position.

While pressing with the balls of the feet as you breathe out, make your whole body erect as you squeeze the quads. Hold the contracted position for a second. Tip: Since you are starting below parallel, you can opt to use your hands to help you up by pressing on your thighs only on the first repetition.

Slowly squat down as you inhale but instead of going all the way down to the starting position, just stop once your thighs are parallel to the platform. The angle between your hamstrings and calves should be a 90-degree angle.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat Machine Fun
new_instructions:
1. Adjust the leg machine to a height that keeps your thighs slightly below parallel.
2. Select your weight and position yourself face-up in the machine. Bend your knees so they're just below parallel. Keep your back and head resting on the seat.
3. Grab the handles and keep your feet shoulder-width apart, pointing slightly outwards. This is your starting position.
4. Push up with the balls of your feet as you breathe out, straightening your body and squeezing your quads. Hold for a second.
5. Lower down slowly as you inhale until your thighs are parallel to the platform. Keep a 90-degree angle between your hamstrings and calves.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the floor away from you, like a superhero taking off! 🦸‍♂️
short_description: Lying Machine Squats target your quadriceps, glutes, and calves, giving you a powerful leg workout. It's a fun and effective way to build strength and stability. Ready to feel the burn? 🔥

name: Lying One-Arm Lateral Raise
instructions: While holding a dumbbell in one hand, lay with your chest down on a flat bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.

Position the palm of the hand that is holding the dumbbell in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This will be your starting position.

Now raise the arm with the dumbbell to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keeping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbell to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: One-Arm Side Stretch Out
new_instructions:
1. **Lay down** on your chest on a flat bench, holding a dumbbell in one hand and gripping the leg of the bench with the other for stability.
2. **Position your palm** facing your torso, arm extended with a slight bend in the elbow. This is your starting point.
3. **Lift the dumbbell** to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift.
4. **Hold the position** at the top for a second, enjoying the shoulder squeeze.
5. **Lower the dumbbell** slowly back to the starting point while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for your desired number of repetitions, feeling that shoulder burn!
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading one wing 🦅. Keep your arm straight and strong!
short_description: This move targets your shoulders, making them stronger and more defined. Feel like a superhero as you stretch that arm out! 💪

name: Lying Prone Quadriceps
instructions: Lay face down on the floor with your partner kneeling beside you. Flex one knee and raise that leg off the ground, attempting to touch your glutes with your foot. Your partner should hold the knee and ankle. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to extend your knee while your partner prevents any actual movement.
After 10-20 seconds, relax your muscles as your partner gently pushes the foot towards your glutes, further stretching the quadriceps and hip flexors.
After 10-20 seconds, switch sides.
subtitle: Quad Stretching Fun
new_instructions:
1. Lay face down on the floor with your partner kneeling beside you.
2. Flex one knee and lift that leg, trying to touch your glutes with your foot. Your partner holds your knee and ankle. This is your starting position.
3. Try to straighten your knee while your partner stops any movement. Hold for 10-20 seconds.
4. Relax your muscles as your partner gently pushes your foot towards your glutes, stretching your quads and hip flexors. Hold for another 10-20 seconds.
5. Switch sides and repeat the steps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to push your foot through thick mud 🦵. It'll help you engage your muscles better!
short_description: Get ready to stretch those quads! This partner exercise helps improve flexibility in your quadriceps and hip flexors. Plus, it's a great way to bond! 🤸‍♂️

name: Lying Rear Delt Raise
instructions: While holding a dumbbell in each hand, lay with your chest down on a flat bench.
Position the palms of the hands in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arms extended with the elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position.

Now raise the arms to the side until your elbows are at shoulder height and your arms are roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arms perpendicular to the torso while keeping them extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
subtitle: Shoulder Fly Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
2. **Position palms** facing your torso and keep your arms straight with elbows slightly bent.
3. **Raise your arms** to the side until elbows are at shoulder height. Keep arms parallel to the floor.
4. **Hold the top** position for a second, feeling the squeeze in your shoulders.
5. **Slowly lower** the dumbbells back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a graceful bird spreading its wings 🕊️. Keep your arms steady and controlled for smooth movements.
short_description: The Lying Rear Delt Raise is a fantastic move to target your shoulders. Feel the burn and build strength in your upper body with this fun and effective exercise! 🏋️‍♀️

name: Lying Supine Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench face up while holding a dumbbell in each arm on top of your thighs.
Bring the dumbbells to the sides with the arms extended and the palms of the hands facing your thighs (neutral grip).

While keeping the arms close to your torso and elbows in, slowly lower your arms (as you keep them extended with a slight bend at the elbows) as far down towards the floor as you can go. Once you cannot go down any further, lock your upper arms in that position and that will be your starting position.

As you breathe out, slowly begin to curl the weights up as you simultaneously rotate your wrists so that the palms of the hands face up. Continue curling the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and squeeze hard at the top position for a second. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Upper arms should remain stationary and elbows should stay in throughout the movement.
Return back to the starting position very slowly.
subtitle: Bicep Boost Bonanza
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs.
2. **Lower your arms** to your sides, keeping them extended with a slight bend at the elbows. Palms should face your thighs.
3. **Slowly lower** your arms towards the floor while keeping them close to your torso. Stop when you can't go further. This is your starting position.
4. **Curl the weights up** while rotating your wrists so your palms face up. Squeeze your biceps at the top.
5. **Lower the weights slowly** back to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're trying to lift a small, friendly puppy with just your forearms 🐶. Keep the movement controlled and your upper arms still.
short_description: Boost your biceps with the Lying Supine Dumbbell Curl! This beginner-friendly move isolates your biceps for maximum strength gains. Give it a try and feel the burn! 💪

name: Lying T-Bar Row
instructions: Load up the T-bar Row Machine with the desired weight and adjust the leg height so that your upper chest is at the top of the pad. Tip: In some machines all you can do is stand on the appropriate step that allows you to be at a height that has the upper chest at the top of the pad.
Lay face down on the pad and grab the handles. You can either use a palms down, palms up, or palms in position depending on what part of your back you want to emphasize.
Lift the bar off the rack and extend your arms in front of you. This will be your starting position.

As you exhale slowly pull the weight up and squeeze your back at the top of the movement. Tip: Keep the upper arms as close to the torso as possible throughout the movement in order to better engage the back muscles. Also, do not lift your body off of the pad at any time and refrain from using the biceps to lift the weight.
After a second contraction at the top of the movement, as you inhale, slowly go back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Back Attack Machine
new_instructions:
1. Load the machine with your desired weight and adjust the leg height so your upper chest touches the pad.
2. Lie face down on the pad and grab the handles with your preferred grip.
3. Lift the bar off the rack and extend your arms in front of you. This is your starting position.
4. Exhale and pull the weight up slowly, squeezing your back muscles at the top.
5. Inhale and return to the starting position slowly.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades at the top of each row to really engage your back muscles. ✏️
short_description: The Lying T-Bar Row machine is perfect for targeting your middle back while also giving your biceps and lats some love. Get ready to feel strong and powerful! 💪

name: Lying Triceps Press
instructions: Lie on a flat bench with either an e-z bar (my preference) or a straight bar placed on the floor behind your head and your feet on the floor.

Grab the bar behind you, using a medium overhand (pronated) grip, and raise the bar in front of you at arms length. Tip: The arms should be perpendicular to the torso and the floor. The elbows should be tucked in. This is the starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the weight until the bar lightly touches your forehead while keeping the upper arms and elbows stationary.
At that point, use the triceps to bring the weight back up to the starting position as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Tamer
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with your feet on the floor and an EZ bar behind your head.
2. **Grab the bar** with a medium overhand grip and **raise it** to arm's length in front of you, keeping your arms perpendicular to your torso.
3. **Inhale** and **lower the bar** slowly until it lightly touches your forehead. Keep your upper arms and elbows still.
4. **Exhale** and **press the bar** back up to the starting position using your triceps.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're lowering and lifting a golden crown 👑 without letting it touch your head. Keep it smooth and controlled for the best tricep workout!
short_description: The Lying Triceps Press, also known as the Skull Crusher, is a fantastic move to build those triceps! 💪 This exercise isolates the triceps, giving them a serious workout. Perfect for leveling up your arm game!

name: Machine Bench Press
instructions: Sit down on the Chest Press Machine and select the weight.
Step on the lever provided by the machine since it will help you to bring the handles forward so that you can grab the handles and fully extend the arms.

Grab the handles with a palms-down grip and lift your elbows so that your upper arms are parallel to the floor to the sides of your torso. Tip: Your forearms will be pointing forward since you are grabbing the handles. Once you bring the handles forward and extend the arms you will be at the starting position.
Now bring the handles back towards you as you breathe in.
Push the handles away from you as you flex your pecs and you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second before going back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of reps.
When finished step on the lever again and slowly get the handles back to their original place.
subtitle: Chest Press Power-Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the machine and pick your weight. 
2. **Step** on the lever to bring the handles forward. 
3. **Grab** the handles with a palms-down grip and lift your elbows parallel to the floor. 
4. **Pull** the handles towards you as you inhale. 
5. **Push** the handles away as you flex your chest and exhale. Hold for a second. 
6. **Repeat** for the desired reps, then step on the lever to return the handles slowly.
tip: Imagine you're pushing a door closed against a strong wind. 💨 Use controlled movements for the best results!
short_description: Pump up your chest with the Machine Bench Press! This beginner-friendly move targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps using a machine for extra support. 💪 Get ready to flex those pecs and feel powerful!

name: Machine Bicep Curl
instructions: Adjust the seat to the appropriate height and make your weight selection. Place your upper arms against the pads and grasp the handles. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by flexing the elbow, pulling your lower arm towards your upper arm.
Pause at the top of the movement, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position.
Avoid returning the weight all the way to the stops until the set is complete to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
subtitle: Bicep Curl Bliss
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the seat to the right height and pick your weight.
2. **Place** your upper arms on the pads and grab the handles. This is your start!
3. **Flex** your elbows to pull your lower arms towards your upper arms.
4. **Pause** at the top, feeling that sweet bicep squeeze.
5. **Slowly Return** the weight to the start, but keep tension by not letting it rest completely.
6. **Repeat** until your set is done, keeping those muscles engaged!
tip: Imagine you're curling a big, happy rainbow 🌈. Keep that arc smooth for the best results!
short_description: Get those biceps popping with the Machine Bicep Curl! This beginner-friendly move targets your biceps, giving them a solid workout. Feel the burn and enjoy the ride! 💪

name: Machine Preacher Curls
instructions: Sit down on the Preacher Curl Machine and select the weight.

Place the back of your upper arms (your triceps) on the preacher pad provided and grab the handles using an underhand grip (palms facing up). Tip: Make sure that when you place the arms on the pad you keep the elbows in. This will be your starting position.

Now lift the handles as you exhale and you contract the biceps. At the top of the position make sure that you hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Only the forearms should move. The upper arms should remain stationary and on the pad at all times.
Lower the handles slowly back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Pump Up!
new_instructions:
1. Sit down on the Preacher Curl Machine and select your weight.
2. Place your arms on the pad, keeping your elbows in, and grab the handles with palms up.
3. Lift the handles, contracting your biceps as you exhale. Hold the squeeze at the top for a second.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to the start as you inhale.
5. Repeat for the recommended number of reps, feeling the burn!
tip: 🧠 Imagine squeezing a sponge at the top of the curl to get every drop out. This helps maximize the contraction!
short_description: Get those biceps popping with Machine Preacher Curls! This isolation exercise focuses directly on your biceps, giving you that awesome pump. Perfect for beginners looking to build strength and size. 💪

name: Machine Shoulder (Military) Press
instructions: Sit down on the Shoulder Press Machine and select the weight.
Grab the handles to your sides as you keep the elbows bent and in line with your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now lift the handles as you exhale and you extend the arms fully. At the top of the position make sure that you hold the contraction for a second.
Lower the handles slowly back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Press Up and Power On!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the Shoulder Press Machine and **choose** your weight.
2. **Grab** the handles with elbows bent, keeping them in line with your torso. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift** the handles as you **exhale** and **extend** your arms fully. **Hold** the squeeze for a second at the top.
4. **Lower** the handles slowly back to the starting position as you **inhale**.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps.
6. **Smile** and feel that shoulder burn!
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling higher with each press! 🚀
short_description: Strengthen your shoulders and triceps with the Machine Shoulder Press. This beginner-friendly exercise helps build upper body strength using a machine for stability. Feel the power in every press! 💪

name: Machine Triceps Extension
instructions: Adjust the seat to the appropriate height and make your weight selection. Place your upper arms against the pads and grasp the handles. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by extending the elbow, pulling your lower arm away from your upper arm.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position.
Avoid returning the weight all the way to the stops until the set is complete to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
subtitle: Push for Stronger Arms!
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the seat height and pick your weight. 
2. **Place** your upper arms on the pads and grab the handles. 
3. **Extend** your elbows, pushing the handles away. 
4. **Pause** for a moment when fully extended. 
5. **Return** slowly to the start, but keep a bit of tension until you finish the set.
tip: Imagine you're pushing away a heavy door to build strength. 🚪
short_description: Get ready to sculpt those triceps! This beginner-friendly machine isolates your triceps for maximum strength. Let’s push those handles and get those muscles popping! 💪

name: Medicine Ball Chest Pass
instructions: You will need a partner for this exercise. Lacking one, this movement can be performed against a wall.
Begin facing your partner holding the medicine ball at your torso with both hands.
Pull the ball to your chest, and reverse the motion by extending through the elbows. For sports applications, you can take a step as you throw.
Your partner should catch the ball, and throw it back to you.
Receive the throw with both hands at chest height.
subtitle: Power Pass Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Grab a medicine ball and stand facing your partner. 
2. Hold the ball at your chest with both hands. 
3. Pull the ball to your chest, then push it out by extending your elbows. 
4. Throw the ball toward your partner. 
5. Catch the ball when your partner throws it back. 
6. Keep passing back and forth!
tip: Imagine you're a superhero passing a power orb to your teammate! ⚡
short_description: Turn up the fun with a Medicine Ball Chest Pass! This exercise works your chest, shoulders, and triceps, making it a powerful and playful workout. Grab a buddy and get throwing! 🤗

name: Medicine Ball Full Twist
instructions: For this exercise you will need a medicine ball and a partner. Stand back to back with your partner, spaced 2-3 feet apart. This will be your starting position.
Hold the ball in front of the trunk. Open the hips and turn the shoulders at the same time as your partner.
For full rotation, you and your partner should twist in the same direction, i.e. counter-clockwise.
Pass the ball to your partner, and both of you can now twist in the opposite direction to repeat the procedure.
subtitle: Twist and Pass Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand back-to-back with your partner, 2-3 feet apart, holding a medicine ball in front of your chest.
2. Twist your hips and shoulders to one side, while your partner mirrors you in the same direction.
3. Pass the ball to your partner at the end of your twist.
4. Now, both twist in the opposite direction to receive and pass the ball back.
5. Keep repeating the twist and pass motion, maintaining a smooth rhythm.
tip: Imagine you're passing a secret treasure to your partner 🏴‍☠️. Keep your movements smooth and coordinated!
short_description: Get ready to twist and shout with the Medicine Ball Full Twist! This fun partner exercise targets your abs and shoulders, making it a great addition to any workout. Grab a buddy and give it a whirl! 🔄

name: Medicine Ball Scoop Throw
instructions: Assume a semisquat stance with a medicine ball in your hands. Your arms should hang so the ball is near your feet.
Begin by thrusting the hips forward as you extend through the legs, jumping up.
As you do, swing your arms up and over your head, keeping them extended, releasing the ball at the peak of your movement. The goal is to throw the ball the greatest distance behind you.
subtitle: Throw That Ball!
new_instructions:
1. Start in a semi-squat stance holding a medicine ball near your feet.
2. Thrust your hips forward and jump up, extending your legs.
3. Swing your arms up over your head as you rise.
4. Release the ball at the peak of your jump, sending it behind you.
5. Land softly and get ready for the next throw!
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket 🚀. The more powerful your thrust, the further it flies!
short_description: Blast off with the Medicine Ball Scoop Throw! This move powers up your shoulders, abs, and legs, making you feel like a superhero 🦸‍♂️. Perfect for beginners looking to add a fun, explosive twist to their workout!

name: Middle Back Shrug
instructions: Lie facedown on an incline bench while holding a dumbbell in each hand. Your arms should be fully extended hanging down and pointing towards the floor. The palms of your hands should be facing each other. This will be your starting position.

As you exhale, squeeze your shoulder blades together and hold the contraction for a full second. Tip: This movement is just like the reverse action of a hug, or trying to perform rear laterals as if you had no arms.
As you inhale go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Back Hug Squeeze
new_instructions:
1. Lie facedown on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended down toward the floor. Palms facing each other.
2. Exhale and squeeze your shoulder blades together, like you're 'un-hugging' someone. Hold for one second.
3. Inhale and return to the start position, letting your arms hang naturally.
4. Repeat for the recommended amount of reps, keeping your motion smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you’re trying to pinch a pencil between your shoulder blades. 🖉 It helps get the right squeeze!
short_description: Middle Back Shrugs give your middle back some love by focusing on those muscles. Squeeze and release to build strength and improve posture. Perfect for a strong, straight back! 💪

name: Middle Back Stretch
instructions: Stand so your feet are shoulder width apart and your hands are on your hips.
Twist at your waist until you feel a stretch. Hold for 10 to 15 seconds, then twist to the other side.
subtitle: Twist & Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** with your feet shoulder-width apart and place your hands on your hips.
2. **Twist** your torso to one side until you feel a gentle stretch in your middle back.
3. **Hold** the stretch for 10 to 15 seconds, breathing deeply.
4. **Return** to the starting position slowly.
5. **Repeat** the twist to the other side and hold for another 10 to 15 seconds.
6. **Relax** and enjoy the stretch, feeling the tension melt away.
tip: Imagine wringing out a wet towel - that's your back! Twist gently to get the best stretch. 🧺
short_description: Loosen up your middle back with this beginner-friendly twist! Perfect for stretching out tension and feeling refreshed. Give your back some love! 💖

name: Mixed Grip Chin
instructions: Using a spacing that is just about 1 inch wider than shoulder width, grab a pull-up bar with the palms of one hand facing forward and the palms of the other hand facing towards you. This will be your starting position.

Now start to pull yourself up as you exhale. Tip: With the arm that has the palms facing up concentrate on using the back muscles in order to perform the movement. The elbow of that arm should remain close to the torso. With the other arm that has the palms facing forward, the elbows will be away but in line with the torso. You will concentrate on using the lats to pull your body up.
After a second contraction at the top, start to slowly come down as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

On the following set, switch grips; so if you had the right hand with the palms facing you and the left one with the palms facing forward, on the next set you will have the palms facing forward for the right hand and facing you for the left.
subtitle: Mix It Up Chin-Ups
new_instructions:
1. Grab a pull-up bar with one palm facing forward and the other palm facing towards you, just an inch wider than shoulder-width.
2. Pull yourself up as you exhale. Focus on using your back muscles with the arm having the palm facing up. Keep that elbow close to your torso.
3. With the other arm (palm facing forward), keep your elbow in line but away from the torso and use your lats to pull your body up.
4. Hold for a second at the top, then slowly lower yourself down as you inhale.
5. Switch grips in the next set: swap the hand positions and repeat.
6. Continue for the recommended reps, having fun with each switch!
tip: Imagine you're climbing a wall like a ninja 🥷. Focus on the pull and feel your muscles engage!
short_description: Level up your pull-ups with Mixed Grip Chin-Ups! This exercise works your middle back, biceps, and lats. Feel like a ninja as you mix up your grips for a balanced workout! 💪

name: Monster Walk
instructions: Place a band around both ankles and another around both knees. There should be enough tension that they are tight when your feet are shoulder width apart.
To begin, take short steps forward alternating your left and right foot.
After several steps, do just the opposite and walk backward to where you started.
subtitle: Walk Like a Monster!
new_instructions:
1. **Wrap** a resistance band around both ankles and another around your knees. Feet should be shoulder-width apart to start.
2. **Stand** tall and engage your core.
3. **Step** forward with your left foot, then your right, like a sneaky monster.
4. **Continue** taking small, alternating steps forward for several paces.
5. **Reverse** your steps and walk backward to your starting point.
6. **Repeat** as desired, maintaining tension in the bands.
tip: Imagine you're sneaking up on someone like a monster in a movie. Keep your steps small and controlled for the best results. 👻
short_description: The Monster Walk is a beginner-friendly exercise that targets your abductors using resistance bands. It's a fun way to strengthen your hips and glutes. Get ready to walk like a sneaky monster! 👟

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Begin in a pushup position, with your weight supported by your hands and toes. Flexing the knee and hip, bring one leg until the knee is approximately under the hip. This will be your starting position.

Explosively reverse the positions of your legs, extending the bent leg until the leg is straight and supported by the toe, and bringing the other foot up with the hip and knee flexed. Repeat in an alternating fashion for 20-30 seconds.
subtitle: Climb Every Mountain
new_instructions:
1. **Start** in a push-up position, with your hands under your shoulders and toes on the ground.
2. **Bring** one knee up towards your chest, keeping your core tight.
3. **Switch** legs quickly, extending the bent leg back and bringing the other knee up.
4. **Keep** alternating legs as if you're running in place, but stay in the push-up position.
5. **Continue** this movement for 20-30 seconds, maintaining a steady pace.
6. **Finish** strong and return to the starting position when you're done.
tip: 🏔️ Imagine you're racing up a steep hill! Keep your core engaged and move quickly like a mountain goat to get the most out of this exercise.
short_description: Mountain Climbers are a fun, dynamic exercise that gets your whole body moving. They target your quads, chest, and shoulders, while also giving you a great cardio workout. Get ready to climb and conquer! 🏃‍♂️💨

name: Moving Claw Series
instructions: This move helps prepare your running form to help you excel at sprinting. As you run, be sure to flex the knee, aiming to kick your glutes as the hip extends.
Reload the quad as the leg moves back forward, attacking the ground on the next step.
Ensure that as you run, you block with the arms, punching through in a rapid 1-2 motion.
subtitle: Run Like a Ninja!
new_instructions:
1. **Flex** your knee as you run, aiming to kick your glutes as your hip extends.
2. **Reload** your quad as your leg moves forward, getting ready to attack the ground.
3. **Punch** through with your arms in a rapid 1-2 motion to block and drive forward.
4. **Repeat** these steps in a smooth, continuous motion to build speed and precision.
tip: Imagine you're a ninja running through the night, silent and swift. 🥷 Keep your movements sharp and focused.
short_description: Get ready to sprint like a pro! This exercise preps your running form, working your hamstrings, calves, and quads. Feel the power and speed with every step! 🏃‍♂️

name: Muscle Snatch
instructions: Begin with a loaded barbell held at the mid thigh position with a wide grip. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.

Begin the pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar. Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body.
Continue raising the bar to the overhead position, without rebending the knees.
subtitle: Snatch and Lift Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Grip the barbell with a wide grip at mid-thigh. Keep feet under hips and toes slightly out.
2. **Lower Down**: Drop your hips, keep your chest up, and look forward. Shoulders should be in front of the bar.
3. **Pull Up**: Drive through your heels and lift the bar, transitioning to a quick pull by extending hips, knees, and ankles.
4. **Lift Overhead**: Keep the bar close to your body and raise it overhead in one smooth motion without bending your knees again.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a giant jacket 🌟 – keep the bar close to your body for a smooth lift.
short_description: The Muscle Snatch is an awesome compound move that works your hamstrings, glutes, back, shoulders, and more. Perfect for building strength and power! 🚀

name: Muscle Up
instructions: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Initiate a pull up by pulling the elbows down to your side, flexing the elbows.

As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your shoulders forward, allowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.
subtitle: Lift and Dip Magic
new_instructions:
1. **Grip** the rings with a false grip, palms on top.

2. **Pull** yourself up by pulling your elbows down to your sides.

3. **Tuck** the rings into your armpits as you roll your shoulders forward.

4. **Extend** through your elbows to push up into a dip.

5. **Lower** yourself down with control and care.
tip: Imagine you're a majestic bird taking flight—graceful and powerful! 🦅
short_description: The Muscle Up is a dynamic move that works your lats, abs, biceps, and more. It's like a pull-up and dip combo, giving you a full upper body workout. Fly high and get strong! 💪

name: Narrow Stance Hack Squats
instructions: Place the back of your torso against the back pad of the machine and hook your shoulders under the shoulder pads provided.

Position your legs in the platform using a less than shoulder width narrow stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your feet should be around 3 inches or less apart. Tip: Keep your head up at all times and also maintain the back on the pad at all times.
Place your arms on the side handles of the machine and disengage the safety bars (which on most designs is done by moving the side handles from a facing front position to a diagonal position).
Now straighten your legs without locking the knees. This will be your starting position.

Begin to slowly lower the unit by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up (back on the pad at all times). Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Begin to raise the unit as you exhale by pushing the floor with mainly with the heels of your feet as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Close Squat Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Place your back against the machine pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads.
2. **Feet Together:** Position your feet close together, about 3 inches apart, toes slightly out. Head up and back straight!
3. **Hold On Tight:** Grab the side handles and unlock the safety bars by moving the handles diagonally.
4. **Start Strong:** Straighten your legs, but don't lock your knees. This is your starting position.
5. **Squat Down:** Bend your knees and lower the platform until your thighs are just below parallel to the floor.
6. **Push Up:** Push through your heels to straighten your legs and lift the platform back to start. Repeat for the recommended reps.
tip: Think of pushing the floor away with your heels like you're trying to squash a bug 🐞. It'll help keep your weight balanced!
short_description: Narrow Stance Hack Squats target your quads, glutes, and more with a machine setup. This close-stance variation packs a punch for leg day, giving you that powerful push! 💪

name: Narrow Stance Leg Press
instructions: Using a leg press machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a less-than-shoulder-width narrow stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your feet should be around 3 inches or less apart. Tip: Keep your head up at all times and also maintain the back on the pad at all times.

Lower the safety bars holding the weighted platform in place and press the platform all the way up until your legs are fully extended in front of you. Tip: Make sure that you do not lock your knees. Your torso and the legs should make a perfect 90-degree angle. This will be your starting position.
As you inhale, slowly lower the platform until your upper and lower legs make a 90-degree angle.
Pushing mainly with the heels of your feet and using the quadriceps go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and ensure to lock the safety pins properly once you are done. You do not want that platform falling on you fully loaded.
subtitle: Push Those Limits!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the leg press machine and place your feet on the platform, closer than shoulder-width apart, about 3 inches from each other. Toes should point slightly outward. Keep your head up and your back firmly against the pad.
2. **Lower the safety bars** and press the platform upwards until your legs are fully extended, but don’t lock your knees. Your body should form a 90-degree angle.
3. **Inhale** and slowly lower the platform until your knees form a 90-degree angle with your thighs.
4. **Exhale and push** through your heels to press the platform back up to the starting position.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps and make sure to lock the safety pins when done.
tip: 👠 Imagine you're pressing the weight away with your heels like you're squishing a bug. Keep that mental image and push with power!
short_description: The Narrow Stance Leg Press targets your quads while also giving your glutes, hamstrings, and calves some love! It's a fantastic compound movement that'll help you build strength and stability. Get ready to feel the burn and love the results! 🔥

name: Narrow Stance Squats
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a less-than-shoulder-width narrow stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Feet should be around 3-6 inches apart. Keep your head up at all times (looking down will get you off balance) and maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance described above which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat It Narrow!
new_instructions:
1. Set the bar on a rack that matches your height inside a squat rack.
2. Step under the bar, placing it on your shoulders, just below your neck. Hold the bar with both hands.
3. Lift the bar off the rack by pushing with your legs and straightening your torso.
4. Step away from the rack and position your feet 3-6 inches apart, toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up and back straight.
5. Lower the bar by bending your knees until your upper legs are just below parallel to the floor. Inhale while lowering.
6. Push through your heels to raise the bar back to the starting position while exhaling. Repeat for the desired reps.
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into a tiny chair 🪑. This helps keep your knees in line with your toes, protecting your knees!
short_description: Narrow Stance Squats target your quads while also working your calves, glutes, and lower back. It's a fantastic all-around leg exercise that'll have you feeling strong and powerful! 💪

name: Natural Glute Ham Raise
instructions: Using the leg pad of a lat pulldown machine or a preacher bench, position yourself so that your ankles are under the pads, knees on the seat, and you are facing away from the machine. You should be upright and maintaining good posture.
This will be your starting position. Lower yourself under control until your knees are almost completely straight.
Remaining in control, raise yourself back up to the starting position.
If you are unable to complete a rep, use a band, a partner, or push off of a box to aid in completing a repetition.
subtitle: Boost Your Hamstrings!
new_instructions:
1. **Position Yourself:** Kneel on a padded surface and secure your ankles under a sturdy support.
2. **Get Ready:** Keep your body upright and maintain good posture. This is your starting position.
3. **Lower Down:** Slowly lower your body forward, keeping your core tight, until your knees are nearly straight.
4. **Rise Up:** Controlled and steady, lift yourself back to the starting position.
5. **Need Help?:** If it's too tough, use a band, partner, or push off a box for assistance.
tip: 👯‍♂️ Think of your hamstrings as the brakes on a car—control your descent to avoid a crash! Keep it smooth for maximum effect.
short_description: Strengthen your hamstrings and glutes with this intermediate move! The Natural Glute Ham Raise is perfect for targeting your lower body and improving muscle control. 🚀

name: Neck-SMR
instructions: Using a muscle roller or a rolling pin, place the roller behind your head and against your neck. Make sure that you do not place the roller directly against the spine, but turned slightly so that the roller is pressed against the muscles to either side of the spine. This will be your starting position.
Starting at the top of your neck, slowly roll down the muscles of your neck, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds.
subtitle: Roll Away Neck Tension!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a muscle roller or rolling pin.
2. **Place** the roller behind your head, against your neck, but not on your spine.
3. **Turn** the roller slightly so it's pressed against the muscles beside your spine.
4. **Start** at the top of your neck and slowly roll down the muscles.
5. **Pause** at tight spots for 10-30 seconds.
tip: Imagine you're ironing out wrinkles in a shirt—smooth and steady! 🧺
short_description: Ease neck tension with this simple rolling exercise. Perfect for stretching out those tight neck muscles and feeling refreshed! 🌟

name: Neck Press
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your neck.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up).
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Pump Up Your Neck Press
new_instructions:
1. **Lie Down:** Lie back on a flat bench and grab the barbell with a medium-width grip.
2. **Lift Bar:** Lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This is your starting position.
3. **Lower Slowly:** Inhale and lower the bar slowly until it touches your neck.
4. **Push Up:** Exhale and push the bar back up to the starting position, using your chest muscles. Squeeze your chest when your arms are locked.
5. **Repeat:** Lower the bar slowly again and repeat for the desired number of reps.
6. **Rack It:** Once done, place the bar back in the rack carefully.
tip: Imagine you're pressing up a heavy box to a high shelf. Stay steady and use your chest muscles! 📦
short_description: The Neck Press is a chest and triceps builder that'll have you feeling powerful. It's a compound exercise that's perfect for those looking to add some serious strength. 💪

name: Oblique Crunches
instructions: Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. For this exercise, you will need to put one hand beside your head and the other to the side against the floor.
Make sure your feet are elevated and resting on a flat surface.
Now lift the shoulder in which your hand is touching your head.

Simply elevate your shoulder and body upward until you touch your knee. For example, if you have your right hand besides your head, then you want to elevate your body upwards until your right elbow touches your left knee. The same variation can be applied doing the inverse and using your left elbow to touch your right knee.
After your knee touches your elbow, lower your body until you have reached the starting position.
Remember to breathe in during the eccentric (lowering) part of the exercise and to breathe out during the concentric (upward) part of the exercise.
Continue alternating in this manner until all of the recommended repetitions for each side have been completed.
subtitle: Twist and Crunch Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down**: Start flat on your back with your lower back pressed to the ground. One hand goes by your head, the other on the floor.
2. **Lift your feet**: Elevate them and rest them on a flat surface.
3. **Crunch up**: Lift the shoulder with the hand by your head. Bring your elbow towards the opposite knee.
4. **Touch your knee**: Try to get your elbow to touch your knee, then lower back down.
5. **Breathe**: Inhale as you lower, exhale as you crunch up.
6. **Alternate and repeat**: Switch sides and keep going until you finish all reps.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a sponge with your abs every time you crunch up. 🧽 This helps you engage the right muscles!
short_description: Oblique Crunches are a fantastic ab exercise that targets those side muscles. They're beginner-friendly and need no equipment. Get ready to twist and tone! 🌀

name: Oblique Crunches - On The Floor
instructions: Start out by lying on your right side with your legs lying on top of each other. Make sure your knees are bent a little bit.
Place your left hand behind your head.
