Once you are in this set position, begin by moving your left elbow up as you would perform a normal crunch except this time the main emphasis is on your obliques.
Crunch as high as you can, hold the contraction for a second and then slowly drop back down into the starting position.
Remember to breathe in during the eccentric (lowering) part of the exercise and to breathe out during the concentric (elevation) part of the exercise.
subtitle: Twist and Crunch Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your right side with your legs stacked and knees slightly bent.
2. **Place** your left hand behind your head.
3. **Lift** your left elbow up as if doing a normal crunch, focusing on your obliques.
4. **Crunch** as high as possible, hold for a second, then slowly lower back.
5. **Breathe** in while lowering and breathe out while lifting. Repeat!
tip: Imagine you're squeezing an orange with your side as you crunch! 🍊
short_description: Oblique crunches fire up your side abs for a toned waist. Easy to do on the floor, it's a no-equipment move that's great for beginners. Ready to twist? Let's go! 💪

name: Olympic Squat
instructions: Begin with a barbell supported on top of the traps. The chest should be up, and the head facing forward. Adopt a hip width stance with the feet turned out as needed.

Descend by flexing the knees, refraining from moving the hips back as much as possible. This requires that the knees travel forward; ensure that they stay aligned with the feet. The goal is to keep the torso as upright as possible. Continue all the way down, keeping the weight on the front of the heel.
At the moment the upper legs contact the lower, reverse the motion, driving the weight upward.
subtitle: Squat Like a Champ!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Place the barbell on top of your traps. Keep your chest up and face forward. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. **Squat Down:** Bend your knees and lower your body. Keep your hips still and let your knees move forward, staying aligned with your feet. Aim to keep your torso upright.
3. **Go Deep:** Continue lowering until your upper legs touch your lower legs. Focus on keeping the weight on your heels.
4. **Drive Up:** Push through your heels and straighten your legs to return to the starting position. Keep your movements controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine sitting back into a tiny chair behind you 🪑. This helps keep your balance and form in check!
short_description: The Olympic Squat is a powerhouse move for your legs and glutes! Perfect for intermediate lifters, this compound exercise targets your quads while also working your calves, hamstrings, and glutes. Get ready to squat like a champ! 🏋️

name: On-Your-Back Quad Stretch
instructions: Lie on a flat bench or step, and hang one leg and arm over the side.
Bend the knee and hold the top of the foot. As you do this, be careful not to arch your lower back.
Pull the belly button to the spine to stay in neutral. Press your foot down and into your hand. To add the hip stretch, lift the hip of the leg you're holding up toward the ceiling.
Switch sides.
subtitle: Quad Stretch Magic
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on a flat bench or step, letting one leg and arm hang over the side.
2. Bend your knee and grab the top of your foot. Keep your lower back from arching.
3. Pull your belly button towards your spine to maintain a neutral position.
4. Press your foot into your hand. To get a hip stretch, lift your hip towards the ceiling.
5. Switch sides and repeat the steps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the ceiling with your hip! 🌟 This will help you get the best stretch.
short_description: Stretch those quads and feel fantastic! This exercise is perfect for beginners looking to improve flexibility. Give it a go and enjoy the stretch! 🤸‍♂️

name: On Your Side Quad Stretch
instructions: Start off by lying on your right side, with your right knee bent at a 90-degree angle resting on the floor in front of you (this stabilizes the torso).
Bend your left knee behind you and hold your left foot with your left hand. To stretch your hip flexor, press your left hip forward as you push your left foot back into your hand. Switch sides.
subtitle: Happy Side Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your right side, bending your right knee at a 90-degree angle in front of you.
2. Bend your left knee and reach back to grab your left foot with your left hand.
3. Push your left hip forward gently while pulling your left foot back into your hand.
4. Hold the stretch, feeling it in your quadriceps, and breathe deeply.
5. Slowly release and switch to the other side to stretch the right quadriceps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the back of your head with your foot – but gently! 🦶💆‍♂️
short_description: Stretch out your quads with this relaxing side stretch. Lie on your side, grab your foot, and gently pull. Perfect for loosening up tight muscles! 🧘‍♀️

name: One-Arm Dumbbell Row
instructions: Choose a flat bench and place a dumbbell on each side of it.

Place the right leg on top of the end of the bench, bend your torso forward from the waist until your upper body is parallel to the floor, and place your right hand on the other end of the bench for support.

Use the left hand to pick up the dumbbell on the floor and hold the weight while keeping your lower back straight. The palm of the hand should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position.

Pull the resistance straight up to the side of your chest, keeping your upper arm close to your side and keeping the torso stationary. Breathe out as you perform this step. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. Also, make sure that the force is performed with the back muscles and not the arms. Finally, the upper torso should remain stationary and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work except for holding the dumbbell; therefore do not try to pull the dumbbell up using the forearms.
Lower the resistance straight down to the starting position. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Repeat the movement for the specified amount of repetitions.
Switch sides and repeat again with the other arm.
subtitle: Row, Row, Row Your Dumbbell!
new_instructions:
1. Grab a bench and place a dumbbell on each side.
2. Put your right leg on the end of the bench, lean forward until your upper body is parallel to the floor, and support yourself with your right hand on the bench.
3. Use your left hand to grab the dumbbell. Keep your lower back straight and your palm facing your torso. This is your starting position.
4. Pull the dumbbell straight up to the side of your chest. Keep your upper arm close to your side, and make sure your torso stays still. Exhale as you pull.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. Do the specified repetitions, then switch sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're starting a lawnmower 🏡. Pull with your back muscles, not your arms, for a smoother motion!
short_description: One-Arm Dumbbell Rows give your back, biceps, and shoulders a solid workout. Perfect for beginners, this move helps build strength and stability. Ready to row? 🚣‍♂️

name: One-Arm Flat Bench Dumbbell Flye
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand resting on top of your thigh. The palm of your hand with the dumbbell in it should be at a neutral grip.

By using your thighs to help you get the dumbbell up, clean the dumbbell so that you can hold it in front of you with your lifting arm being fully extended. Remember to maintain a neutral grip with this exercise. Your non lifting hand should be to the side holding the flat bench for better support. This will be your starting position.

Your arm with the weight should have a slight bend on your elbow in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon. Begin by lowering your arm with the weight in it out in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, your lifting arm should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your lifting arm back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Single-Arm Chest Fly Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand, palm in a neutral grip.
2. **Lift the dumbbell** using your thigh for support, fully extend your arm. Place the other hand on the bench for balance.
3. **Lower your arm** with a slight elbow bend, creating a wide arc until you feel a chest stretch. Inhale as you lower.
4. **Squeeze your chest** and return to the start position, exhaling as you lift. Use the same arc motion.
5. **Hold briefly** at the top, then repeat for the set reps.
6. **Switch arms** and repeat the steps on the other side.
tip: 🦅 Imagine you're a bird spreading its wing - keep the motion smooth and controlled!
short_description: Pump up your chest with the One-Arm Flat Bench Dumbbell Fly! This beginner-friendly move isolates your chest muscles for a focused workout. Spread those wings and feel the burn! 💪

name: One-Arm High-Pulley Cable Side Bends
instructions: Connect a standard handle to a tower. Move cable to highest pulley position.
Stand with side to cable. With one hand, reach up and grab handle with underhand grip.
Pull down cable until elbow touches your side and the handle is by your shoulder.
Position feet hip-width apart. Place free hand on hip to help gauge pivot point.
Keep arm in static position. Contract oblique to bring the weight down in a side crunch.
Once you reach maximum contraction, slowly release the weight to the starting position. The weight stack should never be unloaded in a resting position. The aim is constant tension during the set.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
subtitle: Side Crunch with a Twist!
new_instructions:
1. **Connect** the handle to the highest pulley on the tower.
2. **Stand** side-on to the cable and **grab** the handle with an underhand grip.
3. **Pull** the cable down until your elbow touches your side and the handle is at your shoulder.
4. **Position** your feet hip-width apart, and **place** your free hand on your hip.
5. **Contract** your oblique to **bring** the weight down in a side crunch.
6. **Release** slowly back to the start, keeping constant tension on the cable. **Repeat** until failure and then **switch** sides.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a sponge with your side muscles every time you crunch! 🧽
short_description: Work those abs with this fun twist on a side crunch! With the cable adding resistance, you'll feel the burn and build strength in no time. Give your core some love! 🔥

name: One-Arm Incline Lateral Raise
instructions: Lie down sideways on an incline bench press with a dumbbell in the hand. Make sure the shoulder is pressing against the incline bench and the arm is lying across your body with the palm around your navel.
Hold a dumbbell in your uppermost arm while keeping it extended in front of you parallel to the floor. This is your starting position.

While keeping the dumbbell parallel to the floor at all times, perform a lateral raise. Your arm should travel straight up until it is pointing at the ceiling. Tip: Exhale as you perform this movement. Hold the dumbbell in the position and feel the contraction in the shoulders for a second.
While inhaling lower the weight across your body back into the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Lift and Shine!
new_instructions:
1. Lie sideways on an incline bench with a dumbbell in your hand. Press your shoulder against the bench, and rest your arm across your body, palm near your navel.
2. Extend your uppermost arm with the dumbbell parallel to the floor. This is your starting spot.
3. Lift the dumbbell straight up towards the ceiling while keeping it parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift and feel the shoulder magic!
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the start position while inhaling. Keep it controlled and steady.
5. Repeat for the set number of reps.
6. Switch arms and do it all over again!
tip: Imagine you're painting a rainbow 🌈 with your dumbbell. Keep that arc smooth and controlled for the best shoulder workout!
short_description: Boost your shoulder strength with the One-Arm Incline Lateral Raise! This beginner-friendly move isolates your shoulder muscles for a targeted workout. Ready to lift and shine? 🌟

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Clean
instructions: Place a kettlebell between your feet. As you bend down to grab the kettlebell, push your butt back and keep your eyes looking forward.
Clean the kettlebell to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so.
Return the weight to the starting position.
subtitle: Kettlebell Power Pop!
new_instructions:
1. **Place** the kettlebell between your feet. **Push** your butt back and **look** forward as you bend down to grab it.
2. **Clean** the kettlebell to your shoulder by **extending** your legs and hips. **Raise** the kettlebell towards your shoulder while your wrist **rotates**.
3. **Return** the kettlebell to the starting position by **reversing** the movement.
4. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, **focusing** on form and control.
tip: Think of the kettlebell like it's a weighty balloon 🎈. Control it smoothly as it 'floats' to your shoulder.
short_description: Get ready to boost your strength with the One-Arm Kettlebell Clean! This move powers up your hamstrings, glutes, and shoulders, making you feel like a true champ. Let's get lifting! 💥

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Clean and Jerk
instructions: Hold a kettlebell by the handle.
Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.
Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.

Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, press the kettlebell overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight.
Receive the weight overhead by returning to a squat position underneath the weight.
Keeping the weight overhead, return to a standing position. Lower the weight to the floor to perform the next repetition.
subtitle: Rock That Kettlebell!
new_instructions:
1. Hold the kettlebell by its handle with one hand.
2. Clean it to your shoulder by extending your legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell up, rotating your wrist until your palm faces forward.
3. Bend your knees slightly, keeping your torso straight.
4. Jump and drive through your heels, using momentum to press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is straight.
5. Catch the weight overhead by squatting down slightly.
6. Stand up straight with the kettlebell overhead and then lower it back to the floor for the next rep.
tip: 💡 Imagine you're zipping up a big, heavy jacket as you clean the kettlebell to your shoulder. This helps you get the motion right!
short_description: Get ready to power up with the One-Arm Kettlebell Clean and Jerk! This move targets your shoulders and gets your whole body involved. It's a fun way to build strength and coordination! 🏋️

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
instructions: Lie on the floor holding a kettlebell with one hand, with your upper arm supported by the floor. The palm should be facing in.
Press the kettlebell straight up toward the ceiling, rotating your wrist.
Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position and repeat.
subtitle: Press Up with Style!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie Down**: Lie on your back with a kettlebell in one hand, palm facing in, and upper arm on the floor.
2. **Get Ready**: Position your legs comfortably and engage your core.
3. **Press Up**: Push the kettlebell straight up towards the ceiling while rotating your wrist.
4. **Feel the Burn**: Squeeze your chest and triceps at the top.
5. **Lower Down**: Slowly bring the kettlebell back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat**: Continue for the desired number of reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling away from you, like Superman flying up! 🦸‍♂️
short_description: The One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press is a challenging move that targets your chest and triceps. This exercise will make you feel strong and powerful, just like a superhero! 🦸‍♀️

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Jerk
instructions: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.

Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, press the kettlebell overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight. Receive the weight overhead by returning to a squat position underneath the weight. Keeping the weight overhead, return to a standing position.
Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.
subtitle: Kettlebell Power Pop
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the kettlebell by its handle and **clean** it to your shoulder. **Extend** your legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell up, rotating your wrist so your palm faces forward. Now you're ready!
2. **Dip** by bending your knees slightly, keeping your torso upright. Feel the energy build!
3. **Drive** through your heels, almost like you're jumping. Use the momentum to press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is fully extended.
4. **Catch** the kettlebell overhead by returning to a squat position, then **stand** back up with the kettlebell still raised.
5. **Lower** the kettlebell back to your shoulder with control. Get ready for the next rep!
tip: Think of the kettlebell as a rocket 🚀—your legs are the launch pad. Blast off with power and control!
short_description: Blast your shoulders, legs, and triceps with the One-Arm Kettlebell Jerk! This explosive move combines strength and coordination for a full-body workout. Ready to feel powerful? 💥

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Military Press To The Side
instructions: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces inward. This will be your starting position.
Look at the kettlebell and press it up and out until it is locked out overhead.
Lower the kettlebell back to your shoulder under control and repeat. Make sure to contract your lat, butt, and stomach forcefully for added stability and strength.
subtitle: Side Kettlebell Press Power
new_instructions:
1. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through your legs and hips. Rotate your wrist so your palm faces inward.
2. Start with the kettlebell at your shoulder, looking at it.
3. Press the kettlebell up and out until it's locked overhead.
4. Lower the kettlebell back to your shoulder with control.
5. Engage your lat, butt, and stomach for added stability and strength.
6. Repeat and feel the burn!
tip: Imagine you're pushing the kettlebell up to touch the stars! 🌟 Engaging your core will keep you balanced and powerful.
short_description: Power up your shoulders and triceps with the One-Arm Kettlebell Military Press To The Side! This compound move is great for building strength and stability. 💪

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Para Press
instructions: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.
Hold the kettlebell with the elbow out to the side, and press it up and out until it is locked out overhead.
Lower the kettlebell back to your shoulder under control and repeat. Make sure to contract your lat, butt, and stomach forcefully for added stability and strength.
subtitle: Kettlebell Sky High
new_instructions:
1. **Clean the kettlebell:** Extend your legs and hips, pulling the kettlebell to your shoulder. Rotate your wrist so your palm faces forward.
2. **Get ready:** Elbow out to the side, hold the kettlebell firmly at shoulder level. This is your starting position.
3. **Press up:** Push the kettlebell up and out until your arm is locked overhead.
4. **Lower down:** Bring the kettlebell back to your shoulder with control.
5. **Stay strong:** Squeeze your lat, butt, and stomach for stability. Repeat!
tip: Imagine you're pushing the kettlebell through the roof! 🚀 Keep your core tight to balance like a statue.
short_description: Push your shoulders to new heights with the One-Arm Kettlebell Para Press! This move strengthens your shoulders and triceps while giving you a full-body challenge. Ready to reach for the sky? 🌟

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Push Press
instructions: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.

Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, press the kettlebell overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight. Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.
subtitle: Push It Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Hold**: Grab the kettlebell by the handle and bring it to your shoulder, rotating your wrist so your palm faces forward. 
2. **Dip**: Bend your knees slightly, keeping your torso straight. 
3. **Drive**: Push through your heels and jump slightly, using the momentum to press the kettlebell overhead. 
4. **Extend**: Fully extend your arm until the kettlebell is overhead and your arm is locked out. 
5. **Lower**: Carefully bring the kettlebell back to your shoulder to start the next rep.
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket 🚀—use that explosive energy from your legs to power the kettlebell upwards!
short_description: This move is a blast for your shoulders, legs, and arms! 💪 Feel the power as you push the kettlebell overhead with a burst of energy. Ideal for those looking to combine strength and cardio!

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Row
instructions: Place a kettlebell in front of your feet. Bend your knees slightly and then push your butt out as much as possible as you bend over to get in the starting position. Grab the kettlebell and pull it to your stomach, retracting your shoulder blade and flexing the elbow. Keep your back straight. Lower and repeat.
subtitle: Single Arm Power Pull
new_instructions:
1. Place a kettlebell in front of your feet. 
2. Bend your knees slightly and push your butt out while bending over to get into the starting position. 
3. Grab the kettlebell and pull it towards your stomach while retracting your shoulder blade and flexing your elbow. 
4. Keep your back straight throughout the movement. 
5. Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position. 
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're starting a lawnmower! 🔥 This will help you engage the right muscles and keep your form solid.
short_description: Fire up those back muscles with the One-Arm Kettlebell Row! This move targets your middle back, biceps, and lats. It's like starting a lawnmower but way more fun! 💪

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Snatch
instructions: Place a kettlebell between your feet. Bend your knees and push your butt back to get in the proper starting position.
Look straight ahead and swing the kettlebell back between your legs.

Immediately reverse the direction and drive through with your hips and knees, accelerating the kettlebell upward. As the kettlebell rises to your shoulder rotate your hand and punch straight up, using momentum to receive the weight locked out overhead.
subtitle: Snatch That Bell!
new_instructions:
1. Place a kettlebell between your feet and stand with your knees bent, butt pushed back. 
2. Keep your eyes straight ahead and swing the kettlebell back between your legs. 
3. Quickly reverse the direction, driving through your hips and knees. 
4. As the kettlebell rises, rotate your hand and punch straight up. 
5. Use the momentum to lock the kettlebell overhead. 
6. Lower the kettlebell back down with control and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a jacket with one swift motion 🧥. Keep it smooth and strong!
short_description: Amp up your shoulder game with the One-Arm Kettlebell Snatch! This move is perfect for building power and strength in your shoulders and lower body. 🚀 Ready to feel unstoppable?

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Split Jerk
instructions: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.

Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, press the kettlebell overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight.
Receive the weight overhead by returning to a squat position underneath the weight, positioning one leg in front of you and one leg behind you.
Keeping the weight overhead, return to a standing position and bring your feet together. Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.
subtitle: Split, Jerk, and Lift!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a kettlebell by the handle and **clean** it to your shoulder by extending your legs and hips. **Rotate** your wrist so your palm faces forward. This is your starting position.
2. **Dip** your body by bending your knees while keeping your torso upright.
3. **Explode** upwards by driving through your heels, and as you **jump**, press the kettlebell overhead using your body's momentum.
4. **Catch** the kettlebell overhead by dropping into a squat position with one leg in front and the other behind you.
5. **Stand** up straight while keeping the kettlebell overhead, then **bring** your feet together and **lower** the weight to go for the next rep.
tip: Imagine you're a rocket blasting off! 🚀 Use that explosive power to push the kettlebell up!
short_description: The One-Arm Kettlebell Split Jerk is a dynamic move that targets your shoulders while also engaging your legs and core. Feel powerful and explosive as you lift that kettlebell overhead! 💥

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Split Snatch
instructions: Hold a kettlebell in one hand by the handle.
Squat towards the floor, and then reverse the motion, extending the hips, knees, and finally the ankles, to raise the kettlebell overhead.

After fully extending the body, descend into a lunge position to receive the weights overhead, one leg forward and one leg back. Ensure you drive through with your hips and lock the ketttlebells overhead in one uninterrupted motion.
Return to a standing position, holding the weight overhead, and bring the feet together. Lower the weight to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Single-Arm Skyrocket
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a kettlebell in one hand, holding it by the handle.
2. **Squat** down low, then **explode** upwards, extending your hips, knees, and ankles to lift the kettlebell overhead.
3. **Lunge** forward as you catch the kettlebell overhead, with one leg in front and the other behind you. **Drive** through your hips for a smooth motion.
4. **Stand** tall, bringing your feet together with the kettlebell still held overhead, feeling the power!
5. **Lower** the kettlebell back to the starting position, ready for your next rep.
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket 🚀—use your legs and hips to generate lift-off power!
short_description: Blast off with the Single-Arm Skyrocket! This expert move powers up your shoulders and legs, giving you a full-body workout in one explosive lift. Ready to reach new heights? 💥

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Swings
subtitle: Swing High and Fly!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** with feet shoulder-width apart and kettlebell in one hand.
2. **Hinge** at your hips, bend knees slightly, and let the kettlebell swing between your legs.
3. **Drive** your hips forward, straighten your back, and swing the kettlebell up to chest height.
4. **Control** the swing back down between your legs, keeping your back neutral.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're trying to launch the kettlebell to the moon on every swing! 🌕 Keep that momentum steady and strong.
short_description: Blast off with One-Arm Kettlebell Swings! This move fires up your hamstrings, glutes, and shoulders. Feel the power and get ready to fly high with every swing! 🚀

name: One-Arm Long Bar Row
instructions: Position a bar into a landmine or in a corner to keep it from moving. Load an appropriate weight onto your end.
Stand next to the bar, and take a grip with one hand close to the collar. Using your hips and legs, rise to a standing position.
Assume a bent-knee stance with your hips back and your chest up. Your arm should be extended. This will be your starting position.
Pull the weight to your side by retracting the shoulder and flexing the elbow. Do not jerk the weight or cheat during the movement.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Row with One Powerful Arm
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up the Bar:** Secure one end of the barbell in a landmine or corner, and load the other end with weight.
2. **Grip the Bar:** Stand beside the bar and grab it close to the collar with one hand. Use your hips and legs to stand up.
3. **Get Into Position:** Bend your knees, push your hips back, and keep your chest up. Fully extend your arm to start.
4. **Row the Weight:** Pull the weight towards your side by retracting your shoulder and bending your elbow. Keep the movement smooth—no jerking!
5. **Pause and Return:** Hold briefly at the top, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're starting a lawnmower—pull smoothly and with control! 🚜
short_description: Get ready to power up your back with the One-Arm Long Bar Row! This compound move hits your middle back, biceps, and lats. Let's get rowing and feel that burn! 💪

name: One-Arm Medicine Ball Slam
instructions: Start in a standing position with a staggered, athletic stance. Hold a medicine ball in one hand, on the same side as your back leg. This will be your starting position.
Begin by winding the arm, raising the medicine ball above your head. As you do so, extend through the hips, knees, and ankles to load up for the slam.
At peak extension, flex the shoulders, spine, and hips to throw the ball hard into the ground directly in front of you.
Catch the ball on the bounce and continue for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Slam Dunk Abs Workout
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready**: Stand with one foot forward, holding a medicine ball in one hand on the same side as your back leg.
2. **Wind Up**: Lift the ball above your head, extending through your hips, knees, and ankles.
3. **Slam It Down**: Flex your shoulders, spine, and hips to throw the ball hard into the ground in front of you.
4. **Catch and Repeat**: Catch the ball as it bounces back and get ready for the next slam.
tip: Imagine you're spiking a volleyball 🏐 for a powerful slam! Focus on using your whole body to get the most out of each rep.
short_description: Unleash your inner athlete with the One-Arm Medicine Ball Slam! This beginner-friendly move targets your abs while working your lats and shoulders. Get ready to slam your way to a stronger core! 💥

name: One-Arm Open Palm Kettlebell Clean
instructions: Place one kettlebell between your feet.
Grab the handle with one hand and raise the kettlebell rapidly, let it flip so that the ball of the kettlebell lands in the palm of your hand.
Throw the kettlebell out in front of you and catch the handle with one hand.
Take the kettlebell to the floor and repeat. Make sure to work both arms.
subtitle: Kettlebell Power Flip
new_instructions:
1. Place a kettlebell between your feet.
2. Grab the handle with one hand and quickly lift it, letting it flip so the ball lands in your palm.
3. Toss the kettlebell forward and catch the handle with one hand.
4. Lower the kettlebell back to the floor.
5. Repeat the move, making sure to switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're catching a raw egg 🥚—be gentle and let it land softly in your palm.
short_description: Get ready to power up with the One-Arm Open Palm Kettlebell Clean! This move targets your hamstrings, forearms, glutes, and more. Feel the burn and have fun flipping that kettlebell! 💥

name: One-Arm Overhead Kettlebell Squats
instructions: Clean and press a kettlebell with one arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so. Press the weight overhead by extending through the elbow.This will be your starting position.
Looking straight ahead and keeping a kettlebell locked out above you, flex the knees and hips and lower your torso between your legs, keeping your head and chest up.
Pause at the bottom position for a second before rising back to the top, driving through the heels of your feet.
subtitle: Single Arm Kettlebell Power Squat
new_instructions:
1. **Clean and Press**: Lift the kettlebell to shoulder height by pulling it up and rotating your wrist.
2. **Press Overhead**: Extend your elbow to push the kettlebell above your head.
3. **Stay Focused**: Keep your eyes straight ahead and the kettlebell locked above you.
4. **Lower Down**: Bend your knees and hips to squat down, keeping your chest up.
5. **Pause and Push**: Hold for a second at the bottom, then push through your heels to stand back up.
tip: Visualize sitting back into a chair to keep your balance and form spot on! 🪑
short_description: Take on the Single Arm Kettlebell Power Squat for a full-body challenge! This expert move targets quads, glutes, and shoulders, making you feel like a powerhouse. 💥

name: One-Arm Side Deadlift
instructions: Stand to the side of a barbell next to its center. Bend your knees and lower your body until you are able to reach the barbell.

Grasp the bar as if you were grabbing a briefcase (palms facing you since the bar is sideways). You may need a wrist wrap if you are using a significant amount of weight. This is your starting position.
Use your legs to help lift the barbell up while exhaling. Your arms should extend fully as bring the barbell up until you are in a standing position.
Slowly bring the barbell back down while inhaling. Tip: Make sure to bend your knees while lowering the weight to avoid any injury from occurring.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: One-Arm Side Lift Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** next to the barbell, right in the center.
2. **Bend** your knees and lower your body to reach the barbell.
3. **Grab** the bar like a briefcase (palm facing you). Use a wrist wrap if needed.
4. **Lift** the barbell with your legs while exhaling until you're standing tall.
5. **Lower** the barbell back down slowly while inhaling, bending your knees.
6. **Switch** arms and repeat for the recommended reps.
tip: Imagine you're lifting a suitcase full of treasures – keep it close and lift with your legs! 💼
short_description: Amp up your leg day with the One-Arm Side Deadlift! This expert move targets your quads and works your core, calves, and more. Feel powerful and steady as you lift that barbell! 💪

name: One-Arm Side Laterals
instructions: Pick a dumbbell and place it in one of your hands. Your non lifting hand should be used to grab something steady such as an incline bench press. Lean towards your lifting arm and away from the hand that is gripping the incline bench as this will allow you to keep your balance.
Stand with a straight torso and have the dumbbell by your side at arm's length with the palm of the hand facing you. This will be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbbell to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and your hand slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arm is parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbell back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Single Arm Shoulder Lift
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell and hold it in one hand. Use your other hand to steady yourself on an incline bench.
2. Lean slightly towards your lifting arm, keeping your balance with the other hand.
3. Stand tall with the dumbbell by your side, palm facing in. This is your start.
4. Lift the dumbbell to your side with a slight elbow bend, like you're pouring water. Stop when your arm is parallel to the floor. Exhale and hold for a second.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down as you inhale.
6. Repeat for the set number of reps, then switch arms and go again.
tip: Imagine you're a teapot, tipping ever so slightly to pour out water. Keep that form steady! 🫖
short_description: Single Arm Side Laterals target your shoulder muscles, making them stronger and more defined. It's a simple move with a dumbbell that'll have your shoulders feeling the burn in no time! Give it a go and feel the lift! 💪

name: One-Legged Cable Kickback
instructions: Hook a leather ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and then attach the cuff to your ankle.
Face the weight stack from a distance of about two feet, grasping the steel frame for support.

While keeping your knees and hips bent slightly and your abs tight, contract your glutes to slowly "kick" the working leg back in a semicircular arc as high as it will comfortably go as you breathe out. Tip: At full extension, squeeze your glutes for a second in order to achieve a peak contraction.
Now slowly bring your working leg forward, resisting the pull of the cable until you reach the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement for the other side.
subtitle: Glute Boosting Kickbacks
new_instructions:
1. Attach a leather ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and fasten it around your ankle. 
2. Stand about two feet from the weight stack and grab the steel frame for support.
3. Keep your knees and hips slightly bent, engage your abs, and slowly kick your working leg back in a semicircular arc while exhaling. 
4. Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement for a second to maximize the contraction.
5. Slowly return your leg to the starting position, resisting the pull of the cable.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps, then switch legs and do the same on the other side.
tip: Picture your leg moving like a graceful pendulum! 🕰️ Keep it slow and controlled to really feel the burn in your glutes.
short_description: One-Legged Cable Kickbacks are an awesome way to fire up those glutes and hamstrings! This move isolates your glutes for a serious burn. Let's kick it! 🍑

name: One Arm Against Wall
instructions: From a standing position, place a bent arm against a wall or doorway.
Slowly lean toward your arm until you feel a stretch in your lats.
subtitle: Lean and Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall next to a wall or doorway. 
2. Bend your arm and press your forearm against the wall. 
3. Gently lean your body towards the wall. 
4. Feel the stretch in your side muscles (lats). 
5. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds. 
6. Repeat on the opposite side.
tip: Imagine you're a cat stretching after a nap 🐱. Keep it gentle and smooth for the best stretch.
short_description: An easy move to stretch your side muscles and improve flexibility. Perfect for beginners! Feel the stretch and get limber! 🧘‍♀️

name: One Arm Chin-Up
instructions: For this exercise, start out by placing a towel around a chin up bar.
Grab the chin-up bar with your palm facing you. One hand will be grabbing the chin-up bar and the other will be grabbing the towel.
Bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.v

Pull your torso up until the bar touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: One Arm Chin-Up Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Wrap** a towel around a chin-up bar.
2. **Grab** the chin-up bar with one hand (palm facing you) and the towel with the other hand.
3. **Arch** your lower back slightly and stick your chest out. This is your starting position.
4. **Pull** your torso up until your upper chest touches the bar. Exhale as you do this. Focus on squeezing your back muscles.
5. **Pause** for a second at the top, then inhale and slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps. Switch arms and repeat.
tip: Imagine pulling yourself up like a superhero scaling a wall 🦸‍♂️. Keep your core tight and focus on using your back muscles!
short_description: Master the challenging One Arm Chin-Up to build incredible upper body strength and impress your friends 💪. This move targets your middle back, biceps, and forearms, making you feel like a true fitness hero!

name: One Arm Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand on top of your thigh.

By using your thigh to help you get the dumbbell up, clean the dumbbell up so that you can hold it in front of you at shoulder width. Use the hand you are not lifting with to help position the dumbbell over you properly.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrist forward so that the palm of your hand is facing away from you. This will be your starting position.

Bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe in. Keep full control of the dumbbell at all times. Tip: Use the hand that you are not lifting with to help keep the dumbbell balance as you may struggle a bit at first. Only use your non-lifting hand if it is needed. Otherwise, keep it resting to the side.

As you breathe out, push the dumbbells up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Single Arm Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand, resting it on your thigh.
2. **Lift the dumbbell** using your thigh to help and position it at shoulder width. Use your other hand to assist if needed.
3. **Rotate your wrist** so your palm faces away from you. This is your starting position.
4. **Lower the dumbbell** slowly to your side while breathing in. Keep control and balance with your non-lifting hand if necessary.
5. **Push up** the dumbbell using your chest muscles while breathing out. Lock your arm at the top, squeeze your chest, hold for a second, and then lower it slowly.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms and perform the same steps.
tip: Imagine you're pushing away a heavy door with your chest. 💪 Keep your movements smooth and controlled for the best results.
short_description: Crush your chest workout with the One Arm Dumbbell Bench Press! This move targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps, giving you a powerful upper body boost. Get ready to feel the burn and see the gains! 🔥

name: One Arm Dumbbell Preacher Curl
instructions: Grab a dumbbell with the right arm and place the upper arm on top of the preacher bench or the incline bench. The dumbbell should be held at shoulder length. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbbell until your upper arm is extended and the biceps is fully stretched.

As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder height. Again, remember that to ensure full contraction you need to bring that small finger higher than the thumb.
Squeeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Solo Bicep Blast
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell with your right hand and **place** your upper arm on a preacher or incline bench. The dumbbell should be at shoulder length. This is your starting position.
2. **Inhale** as you **lower** the dumbbell slowly until your arm is fully extended and your bicep is fully stretched.
3. **Exhale** and **curl** the weight up using your biceps until the dumbbell is at shoulder height and your biceps is fully contracted. Ensure your pinky is higher than your thumb for full contraction.
4. **Squeeze** your biceps hard for a second at the top.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended reps.
6. **Switch** arms and **repeat** the movement.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a sponge with your bicep as you curl up 🧽. This helps to engage the muscle fully.
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the One Arm Dumbbell Preacher Curl! This fun, beginner-friendly move isolates your biceps for a super-focused workout. 💪 Get ready to flex!

name: One Arm Floor Press
instructions: Lie down on a flat surface with your back pressing against the floor or an exercise mat. Make sure your knees are bent.

Have a partner hand you the bar on one hand. When starting, your arm should be just about fully extended, similar to the starting position of a barbell bench press. However, this time your grip will be neutral (palms facing your torso).
Make sure the hand you are not using to lift the weight is placed by your side.
Begin the exercise by lowering the barbell until your elbow touches the ground. Make sure to breathe in as this is the eccentric (lowering part of the exercise).
Then start lifting the barbell back up to the original starting position. Remember to breathe out during the concentric (lifting part of the exercise).
Repeat until you have performed your recommended repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Single-Arm Power Press
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. **Grab the barbell** with one hand, keeping your palm facing inwards.
3. **Lower the barbell** slowly until your elbow touches the floor. Breathe in as you go down.
4. **Push the barbell** back up to the starting position as you breathe out.
5. **Complete your reps** on one side, then switch arms and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're pushing a door closed with one hand. 🚪 This helps you engage your chest and triceps better!
short_description: The One Arm Floor Press is a fantastic move to target your triceps, chest, and shoulders. Perfect for building strength and stability with a single arm. 💪

name: One Arm Lat Pulldown
instructions: Select an appropriate weight and adjust the knee pad to help keep you down. Grasp the handle with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position.
Pull the handle down, squeezing your elbow to your side as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then slowly return the handle to the starting position.
For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
subtitle: Pull Down Power!
new_instructions:
1. Select a weight and adjust the knee pad to keep you stable.
2. Grab the handle with your palm facing down.
3. Pull the handle down, squeezing your elbow to your side.
4. Pause when the handle reaches your chest.
5. Slowly let the handle go back up but don't let the weight rest.
6. Repeat for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero pulling down a heavy shield. 🛡️ Keep that focus and feel the power!
short_description: Crank up your back strength with the One Arm Lat Pulldown! This move targets your lats, biceps, and middle back. Get ready to feel strong and unstoppable! 💪

name: One Arm Pronated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: Lie flat on a bench while holding a dumbbell at arms length. Your arm should be perpendicular to your body. The palm of your hand should be facing towards your feet as a pronated grip is required to perform this exercise.
Place your non lifting hand on your bicep for support.
Slowly begin to lower the dumbbell down as you breathe in.
Then, begin lifting the dumbbell upward as you contract the triceps. Remember to breathe out during the concentric (lifting part of the exercise).
Repeat until you have performed your set repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Single Arm Tricep Tune-Up
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a bench, holding a dumbbell straight up with your arm perpendicular to your body. Your palm should face your feet. 
2. **Place** your other hand on your bicep for support. 
3. **Lower** the dumbbell slowly while breathing in. Feel that stretch! 
4. **Lift** the dumbbell back up, squeezing your triceps. Breathe out as you lift. 
5. **Repeat** the move for your set reps, then switch arms and do it again. 
6. **Feel** the burn and enjoy the pump!
tip: Imagine you're a crane, lifting the dumbbell with precision and control. 🏗️ Keep it slow and steady for best results!
short_description: Boost those triceps with the Single Arm Tricep Tune-Up! This beginner-friendly move targets the triceps and gives your arms a nice pump. Grab a dumbbell and feel the burn! 💪

name: One Arm Supinated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: Lie flat on a bench while holding a dumbbell at arms length. Your arm should be perpendicular to your body. The palm of your hand should be facing towards your face as a supinated grip is required to perform this exercise.
Place your non lifting hand on your bicep for support.
Slowly begin to lower the dumbbell down as you breathe in.
Then, begin lifting the dumbbell upward as you contract the triceps. Remember to breathe out during the concentric (lifting part of the exercise).
Repeat until you have performed your set repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
Switch arms again and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Single Arm Tricep Power
new_instructions:
1. Lie flat on a bench, holding a dumbbell with your arm straight up. Keep your palm facing you.
2. Place your other hand on your bicep for support.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbell down while breathing in.
4. Lift the dumbbell back up, squeezing your triceps and breathing out.
5. Repeat for your set reps, then switch arms.
6. Finish all reps on the other arm.
tip: Imagine you're a crane lifting a heavy weight – slow and steady wins the race! 🏗️
short_description: Boost your arm strength with the One Arm Supinated Dumbbell Triceps Extension! Perfect for beginners, this move isolates the triceps for targeted toning. Get ready to flex those muscles and make your arms pop! 💪

name: One Half Locust
instructions: Lie facedown on the floor.
Put your left hand under your left hipbone to pad your hip and pubic bone.
Bend your right knee so you can hold the foot in your right hand.

Lift the foot in the air and simultaneously lift your shoulders off the floor. This also stretches the right hip flexor and the chest and shoulders. Switch sides. If it doesn't bother your back, you can try it with both arms and legs at the same time.
subtitle: Lift Your Way to Flexibility!
new_instructions:
1. Lie facedown on the floor.
2. Place your left hand under your left hipbone.
3. Bend your right knee and grab your foot with your right hand.
4. Lift your foot while raising your shoulders off the floor.
5. Feel the stretch in your hip, chest, and shoulders.
6. Switch sides and repeat!
tip: Imagine you're a superhero taking off! 🦸‍♂️ Keep your core engaged to protect your back.
short_description: Boost your flexibility and strength with the One Half Locust! This stretch targets your quads, abs, and chest, giving you a superhero-worthy posture. 🦸‍♂️

name: One Handed Hang
instructions: Grab onto a chinup bar with one hand, using a pronated grip. Keep your feet on the floor or a step. Allow the majority of your weight to hang from that hand, while keeping your feet on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.
subtitle: Hang Tight, One Hand Delight!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a chin-up bar with one hand using an overhand grip.
2. **Keep** your feet on the floor or a step to aid balance.
3. **Let** most of your weight hang from the gripping hand.
4. **Hold** this position for 10-20 seconds, feeling the stretch.
5. **Switch** sides and repeat with the other hand.
tip: Imagine you're a monkey hanging from a tree branch 🍌. Keep your core tight for better balance!
short_description: Feel the stretch and build strength with the One Handed Hang. This move targets your lats and biceps, helping you build grip strength and stability. 🐵 Hang in there, you got this!

name: One Knee To Chest
instructions: Start off by lying on the floor.
Extend one leg straight and pull the other knee to your chest. Hold under the knee joint to protect the kneecap.
Gently tug that knee toward your nose.
Switch sides. This stretches the buttocks and lower back of the bent leg and the hip flexor of the straight leg.
subtitle: Knee Hug Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back on a comfortable surface.
2. Extend one leg straight out on the floor.
3. Bend the other knee and gently pull it towards your chest.
4. Hold beneath your knee to avoid any pressure on the kneecap.
5. Tug your knee slightly towards your nose and feel the stretch.
6. Switch legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.
tip: Imagine giving your knee a gentle hug 🤗. This helps deepen the stretch and keeps it cozy!
short_description: The One Knee To Chest stretch is a soothing move to loosen up your glutes and lower back. Perfect for beginners, it feels like giving your knee a gentle hug! 🤗

name: One Leg Barbell Squat
instructions: Start by standing about 2 to 3 feet in front of a flat bench with your back facing the bench. Have a barbell in front of you on the floor. Tip: Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other.
Bend the knees and use a pronated grip with your hands being wider than shoulder width apart from each other to lift the barbell up until you can rest it on your chest.

Then lift the barbell over your head and rest it on the base of your neck. Move one foot back so that your toe is resting on the flat bench. Your other foot should be stationary in front of you. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. Tip: Make sure your back is straight and chest is out while performing this exercise.
As you inhale, slowly lower your leg until your thigh is parallel to the floor. At this point, your knee should be over your toes. Your chest should be directly above the middle of your thigh.
Leading with the chest and hips and contracting the quadriceps, elevate your leg back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Squat on One Leg, Lift with Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Stand 2-3 feet in front of a bench with a barbell at your feet, shoulder-width apart.
2. Lift the barbell with a pronated grip and rest it on your chest. Then, lift it over your head and rest it on your neck.
3. Step one foot back, placing your toe on the bench, and keep your other foot stationary. Keep your head up and back straight.
4. Lower your leg slowly until your thigh is parallel to the floor. Your knee should be over your toes, and your chest above your thigh.
5. Elevate your leg back to the starting position by contracting your quadriceps, leading with your chest and hips.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps on one leg, then switch legs.
tip: Imagine you're balancing a glass of water on your head—stay steady and keep your back straight! 💧
short_description: The One Leg Barbell Squat is a challenging move that targets your quads, glutes, hamstrings, and calves. It's perfect for building strength and balance. Ready to impress with some serious leg power? Let's go! 🦵💪

name: Open Palm Kettlebell Clean
instructions: Place one kettlebell between your feet. Clean the kettlebell by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulders.
Release the kettlebell as it comes up, and let it flip so that the ball of the kettlebell lands in the palms of your hands.
Release the kettlebell out in front of you and catch the handle with both hands. Lower the kettlebell to the starting position and repeat.
subtitle: Kettlebell Flip Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Place** the kettlebell between your feet. 
2. **Clean** the kettlebell by extending through your legs and hips, raising it towards your shoulders. 
3. **Release** the kettlebell as it comes up and let it flip, catching the ball in your palms. 
4. **Catch** the handle with both hands as it comes down in front of you. 
5. **Lower** the kettlebell back to the starting position. 
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're flipping pancakes 🥞; catch the kettlebell smoothly to keep the motion fluid.
short_description: Flip and catch your way to strength! The Open Palm Kettlebell Clean is a dynamic move that targets your hamstrings, glutes, and shoulders. Get ready to feel powerful and agile! 💪

name: Otis-Up
instructions: Secure your feet and lay back on the floor. Your knees should be bent. Hold a weight with both hands to your chest. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing the hips and spine to raise your torso up from the ground.
As you move up, press the weight up so that it is above your head at the top of the movement.
Return the weight to your chest as you reverse the sit-up motion, ensuring not to go all the way down to the floor.
subtitle: Lift and Twist Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready**: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet secured. Hold a weight to your chest.
2. **Lift Up**: Flex your hips and spine to lift your torso from the ground.
3. **Press High**: As you lift, press the weight above your head.
4. **Lower Down**: Bring the weight back to your chest and slowly lower your torso, but don't touch the floor.
5. **Repeat**: Continue the motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control.
tip: Imagine you're reaching for the stars with the weight! 🌟 Keep your movements smooth and controlled for the best results.
short_description: Otis-Up is an awesome compound move that targets your abs, chest, shoulders, and triceps. It’s like a sit-up with a bonus weight lift! Perfect for building strength and having fun. 💪

name: Overhead Cable Curl
instructions: To begin, set a weight that is comfortable on each side of the pulley machine. Note: Make sure that the amount of weight selected is the same on each side.
Now adjust the height of the pulleys on each side and make sure that they are positioned at a height higher than that of your shoulders.

Stand in the middle of both sides and use an underhand grip (palms facing towards the ceiling) to grab each handle. Your arms should be fully extended and parallel to the floor with your feet positioned shoulder width apart from each other. Your body should be evenly aligned the handles. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, slowly squeeze the biceps on each side until your forearms and biceps touch.
While inhaling, move your forearms back to the starting position. Note: Your entire body is stationary during this exercise except for the forearms.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.
subtitle: Bicep Boost from Above!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Choose the same weight on each pulley. Adjust them to be above shoulder height.
2. **Grab Handles:** Stand in the middle, feet shoulder-width apart. Hold handles with palms up, arms extended.
3. **Curl Up:** Exhale and curl your arms until your forearms touch your biceps. Feel the squeeze!
4. **Lower Down:** Inhale and slowly return to starting position. Keep your body still, only your forearms move.
5. **Repeat:** Continue for the recommended number of reps. Keep that form tight!
tip: Imagine you're trying to make your biceps kiss your forearms. Squeeze tight! 💪
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Overhead Cable Curl! This move isolates the biceps, giving them an awesome burn. Feel the power and watch those muscles grow! 💥

name: Overhead Lat
instructions: Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your tricep and wrist. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to pull your upper arm to your side as your partner prevents you from doing actually doing so.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and allow your partner to further stretch the lat by applying gentle pressure to the tricep. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Reach for the Sky Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Sit up** tall on the floor with your partner behind you.
2. **Lift** one arm straight up and bend your elbow to try and touch your back.
3. **Have** your partner hold your tricep and wrist to keep your arm in place.
4. **Try** to pull your upper arm to your side while your partner resists.
5. **Relax** after 10-20 seconds, letting your partner gently push your tricep to stretch your lat.
6. **Switch** sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're trying to scratch an itch in the middle of your back! 🐒 This helps you get the right motion.
short_description: The Overhead Lat stretch is a fantastic way to target your lats and triceps. With the help of a partner, you'll get a deep, satisfying stretch that feels amazing. Perfect for expert stretchers! 🤸‍♀️

name: Overhead Slam
instructions: Hold a medine ball with both hands and stand with your feet at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the countermovement by raising the ball above your head and fully extending your body.
Reverse the motion, slamming the ball into the ground directly in front of you as hard as you can.
Receive the ball with both hands on the bounce and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Medicine Ball Power Smash
new_instructions:
1. Hold a medicine ball with both hands and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. This is your starting position.
2. Stretch tall and raise the ball above your head, reaching for the sky.
3. Slam the ball into the ground in front of you as hard as you can. Feel the power!
4. Catch the ball on the bounce with both hands and get ready to go again.
5. Repeat the movement, keeping your energy high and your form tight.
tip: Imagine you're trying to break the ground with the ball 🌟. The harder you slam, the better the workout!
short_description: Feel the power with the Overhead Slam! This dynamic move uses a medicine ball to work your lats and get your heart pumping. Perfect for beginners, it's a full-body exercise that's as fun as it is effective! 💥

name: Overhead Squat
instructions: Start out by having a barbell in front of you on the floor. Your feet should be wider than shoulder width apart from each other.

Bend the knees and use a pronated grip (palms facing you) to grab the barbell. Your hands should be at a wider than shoulder width apart from each other before lifting. Once you are positioned, lift the barbell up until you can rest it on your chest.

Move the barbell over and slightly behind your head and make sure your arms are fully extended. Keep your head up at all times and also maintain a straight back. Retract your shoulder blades. This is your starting position.

Slowly lower the weight by bending your knees until your thighs are parallel to the ground while inhaling. Tip: Keep your back straight while performing this exercise to avoid any injuries and your arms should remain extended and over your head at all times.
Now use your feet and legs to help bring the weight back up to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Reach High, Squat Low!
new_instructions:
1. Position the Barbell: Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width and place the barbell in front of you.
2. Grip and Lift: Bend your knees, grip the barbell with palms facing you, and lift it to rest on your chest.
3. Raise Overhead: Push the barbell over and slightly behind your head with fully extended arms. Keep your head up and back straight.
4. Lower into Squat: Bend your knees and lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Keep your arms extended overhead.
5. Rise Up: Push through your feet and legs to stand back up, keeping the barbell steady overhead.
6. Repeat: Continue for the recommended repetitions, maintaining good form.
tip: Imagine balancing a book on your head 📚 to keep your posture perfect and back straight!
short_description: The Overhead Squat is a powerhouse move that blasts your quads, abs, and more! It’s a total body workout that tests your strength and stability. Ready to feel the burn? 🔥

name: Overhead Stretch
instructions: Standing straight up, lace your fingers together and open your palms to the ceiling. Keep your shoulders down as you extend your arms up.
To create a full torso stretch, pull your tailbone down and stabilize your torso as you do this. Stretch the muscles on both the front and the back of the torso.
subtitle: Sky-High Reach
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall**: Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Lace fingers**: Interlace your fingers and turn your palms upward towards the sky.
3. **Stretch up**: Reach your arms up as high as you can, feeling the stretch along your torso.
4. **Keep shoulders down**: Make sure to keep your shoulders relaxed and down.
5. **Engage core**: Pull your tailbone down and stabilize your torso to deepen the stretch.
6. **Hold and breathe**: Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds while taking deep breaths.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the clouds with your fingertips ☁️. It helps you reach higher and stretch deeper!
short_description: The Overhead Stretch is a fantastic beginner-friendly move that opens up your torso and stretches multiple muscles. It's perfect for starting or ending your workout, leaving you feeling refreshed and taller! 🌟

name: Overhead Triceps
instructions: Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your elbow and wrist. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to extend the arm straight into the air as your partner prevents you from doing actually doing so.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and allow your partner to further stretch the tricep by applying gentle pressure to the wrist. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Tricep Stretch Party
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your back straight and your partner behind you. 
2. Raise one arm straight up, then bend at the elbow to touch your hand to your back. 
3. Have your partner hold your elbow and wrist, keeping your arm in place. 
4. Try to straighten your arm up while your partner gently resists. Hold for 10-20 seconds.
5. Relax your arm and let your partner gently push your wrist to deepen the stretch. Hold for another 10-20 seconds.
6. Switch arms and repeat the process.
tip: Imagine your arm is a bow and arrow 🎯; feel the stretch as you pull back and release.
short_description: Get ready to stretch those triceps with a partner! This move is perfect for loosening up your arms and improving flexibility. Grab a buddy and feel the awesome stretch! 🤗

name: Pallof Press
instructions: Connect a standard handle to a tower, and—if possible—position the cable to shoulder height. If not, a low pulley will suffice.
With your side to the cable, grab the handle with both hands and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable.
With your feet positioned hip-width apart and knees slightly bent, hold the cable to the middle of your chest. This will be your starting position.
Press the cable away from your chest, fully extending both arms. You core should be tight and engaged.
Hold the repetition for several seconds before returning to the starting position.
At the conclusion of the set, repeat facing the other direction.
subtitle: Core Squeeze Delight
new_instructions:
1. **Connect** the handle to the tower at shoulder height (or use a low pulley).
2. **Grab** the handle with both hands, step away until your arm is fully extended, and feel the tension.
3. **Stand** with feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold the handle at your chest.
4. **Press** the handle straight out from your chest, extending your arms fully while keeping your core tight.
5. **Hold** for a few seconds, embracing that core burn.
6. **Return** to the start, and repeat facing the other direction for the next set.
tip: Imagine you're a statue holding a tray of drinks; keep everything steady and balanced! 🏋️
short_description: The Pallof Press is a fantastic way to fire up your core! This move uses a cable to challenge your stability and strengthen your abs, chest, shoulders, and triceps. It's like giving your core a big, warm hug! 🤗

name: Pallof Press With Rotation
instructions: Connect a standard handle to a tower, and position the cable to shoulder height.

With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Align outstretched arm with cable.
With your feet positioned hip-width apart, pull the cable into your chest and grab the handle with your other hand. Both hands should be on the handle at this time.
Facing forward, press the cable away from your chest. You core should be tight and engaged.
Keeping your hips straight, twist your torso away from the pulley until you get a full quarter rotation.
Maintain your rigid stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner. Your arms should be extended in front of you.
With the side tension still engaging your core, bring your hands to your chest and immediately press outward to a fully extended position. This constitutes one rep.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
subtitle: Twist and Press Fun
new_instructions:
1. Connect a handle to a cable tower at shoulder height.
2. Stand sideways to the cable, grab the handle with one hand, and step away until your arm is extended and the cable is taut.
3. With feet hip-width apart, pull the handle to your chest and grab it with both hands.
4. Press the handle straight out, engaging your core.
5. Twist your torso away from the cable, keeping your hips steady.
6. Slowly return to the center, then repeat. Switch sides after completing your reps.
tip: Imagine you're a robot twisting to clean your space station. Maintain that rigid form! 🤖
short_description: The Pallof Press with Rotation is a fun and effective core exercise. It helps strengthen your abs, chest, and shoulders while adding a twist. Get ready to feel strong and steady! 💪

name: Palms-Down Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
instructions: Start out by placing two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.
Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.

Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells with a pronated grip (palms facing down) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Fun
new_instructions:
1. Place two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.
2. Kneel facing the bench, grabbing the dumbbells with palms facing down.
3. Rest your forearms on the bench with wrists hanging off the edge.
4. Curl your wrists upwards, then slowly lower them back down.
5. Keep your forearms still; only your wrists should move.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps and feel the burn!
tip: Imagine you're revving a motorcycle handle! 🏍️ Keep that engine purring with smooth wrist movements.
short_description: Strengthen your forearms with Wrist Curl Fun! This beginner-friendly move isolates your forearms using dumbbells. Perfect for building grip strength and giving your arms a solid burn! 💪

name: Palms-Down Wrist Curl Over A Bench
instructions: Start out by placing a barbell on one side of a flat bench.
Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab the barbell with a pronated grip (palms down) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Fun
new_instructions:
1. Place a barbell on one side of a flat bench.
2. Kneel on both knees facing the bench.
3. Grab the barbell with palms down and rest forearms on the bench.
4. Curl your wrists up while exhaling.
5. Slowly lower wrists back down while inhaling.
6. Keep forearms still and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're revving a motorcycle 🏍️. Feel the vroom in your wrists!
short_description: Feel the burn in your forearms with this fun wrist curl exercise! Grab a barbell, kneel by a bench, and flex those wrists. Perfect for building wrist strength and muscle definition! 💪

name: Palms-Up Barbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
instructions: Start out by placing a barbell on one side of a flat bench.
Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab the barbell with a supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Curl Those Wrists!
new_instructions:
1. **Place** a barbell on one side of a flat bench. 
2. **Kneel** on both knees facing the bench. 
3. **Grab** the barbell with palms facing up and rest your forearms on the bench, letting your wrists hang over the edge. 
4. **Curl** your wrists upward while exhaling. 
5. **Lower** your wrists back down slowly while inhaling. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended reps.
tip: Imagine you're scooping ice cream with your wrists - smooth and steady! 🍦
short_description: Give your forearms some love with this wrist curl move! Perfect for beginners, it strengthens your grip and forearms. Feel the burn and get stronger! 💪

name: Palms-Up Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
instructions: Start out by placing two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.
Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells with a supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Fun Time
new_instructions:
1. Place two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.
2. Kneel on both knees facing the bench.
3. Grab the dumbbells with palms up and rest your forearms on the bench.
4. Curl your wrists upwards and exhale.
5. Lower your wrists back down slowly while inhaling.
6. Keep your forearms still, only move your wrists. Repeat.
tip: Imagine you're revving a tiny motorcycle 🏍️. Keep the motion controlled and steady for the best results.
short_description: Strengthen your forearms with this beginner-friendly wrist curl. Just grab a dumbbell, kneel by a bench, and get curling. Feel the burn and have some fun! 💪

name: Parallel Bar Dip
instructions: Stand between a set of parallel bars. Place a hand on each bar, and then take a small jump to help you get into the starting position with your arms locked out.
Begin by flexing the elbow, lowering your body until your arms break 90 degrees. Avoid swinging, and maintain good posture throughout the descent.
Reverse the motion by extending the elbow, pushing yourself back up into the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Dip it to Rip it!
new_instructions:
1. **Jump Up**: Stand between the bars, place your hands on them, and take a small jump to get into the starting position with straight arms.
2. **Lower Down**: Bend your elbows slowly and lower your body until your arms form a 90-degree angle. Keep your posture strong.
3. **Push Up**: Straighten your elbows and push yourself back up to the starting position.
4. **Repeat**: Do this for your set number of repetitions, keeping the motion smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're a human elevator, going straight up and down! 🏢
short_description: Parallel Bar Dips are an awesome way to work your triceps, chest, and shoulders. They're great for building upper body strength with just your body weight. Plus, they're super satisfying! 💪

name: Pelvic Tilt Into Bridge
instructions: Lie down with your feet on the floor, heels directly under your knees.
Lift only your tailbone to the ceiling to stretch your lower back. (Don't lift the entire spine yet.) Pull in your stomach.
To go into a bridge, lift the entire spine except the neck.
