subtitle: Tilt & Lift Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with feet flat on the floor, heels right under your knees. 
2. Tilt your tailbone upwards towards the ceiling, feeling a gentle stretch in your lower back. Keep your spine grounded. 
3. Pull your stomach in like you're zipping up a tight pair of jeans. 
4. Now, lift your entire spine off the floor, one vertebra at a time, until only your shoulders and feet are grounded. 
5. Hold the bridge position for a few seconds, squeezing your glutes. 
6. Slowly lower your spine back down to the mat, from top to bottom.
tip: Imagine your spine is a string of pearls. Lift each pearl one by one, slowly and gently. 🧵
short_description: Get ready to tilt and lift with the Pelvic Tilt Into Bridge! This move will stretch your lower back and work your glutes. Perfect for adding a bit of flexibility and strength to your routine. 🌟

name: Peroneals-SMR
instructions: Lay on your side, supporting your weight on your forearm and on a foam roller placed on the outside of your lower leg. Your upper leg can either be on top of your lower leg, or you can cross it in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Raise your hips off of the ground and begin to roll from below the knee to above the ankle on the side of your leg, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat on the other leg.
subtitle: Calf Roller Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lay down** on your side, prop yourself up with your forearm, and place a foam roller under the outside of your lower leg.
2. **Position your legs**: Your top leg can either rest on your bottom leg or cross in front for balance.
3. **Lift your hips** off the ground to start the roll; keep your core engaged.
4. **Roll gently** from below your knee to above your ankle. Pause for 10-30 seconds at any tight spots.
5. **Switch sides** and repeat on the other leg for even muscle love.
tip: Imagine you're icing a cake 🎂—smooth and gentle motions will hit all the right spots!
short_description: Say goodbye to calf tightness with this foam rolling move! Roll out those muscles, pause at the tight spots, and feel the relief. It's like a mini-massage for your calves! 🦵😊

name: Peroneals Stretch
instructions: In a seated position, loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. This will be your starting position.

With the leg extended and the heel off of the ground, pull on the belt so that the foot is inverted, with the inside of the foot being pulled towards you. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Calf Cozy-Up Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** and loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot.
2. **Extend your leg** with the heel off the ground.
3. **Pull the belt** to invert your foot, bringing the inside towards you.
4. **Hold** for 10-20 seconds and feel that stretch.
5. **Switch sides** and repeat the move.
6. **Relax** and enjoy the stretch!
tip: Imagine you're gently pulling a bowstring 🎯—steady and controlled for the best stretch.
short_description: Give your calves some love with the Peroneals Stretch! This move helps improve flexibility and relieve tension. Perfect for after a long walk or run! 🐾

name: Physioball Hip Bridge
instructions: Lay on a ball so that your upper back is on the ball with your hips unsupported. Both feet should be flat on the floor, hip width apart or wider. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips using your glutes and hamstrings, raising your hips upward as you bridge.
Pause at the top of the motion and return to the starting position.
subtitle: Bounce Up Those Hips!
new_instructions:
1. Lay on the ball with your upper back resting on it, while your hips hang unsupported. Keep your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart or more.
2. Push through your feet and engage your glutes to start lifting your hips upwards.
3. Continue to lift until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
4. Hold the position at the top and really squeeze those glutes.
5. Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting point.
6. Repeat the move, keeping your form in check and those glutes working hard.
tip: Imagine you're trying to push the ball into the ground with your back – this helps you lift those hips higher! 🏋️‍♂️
short_description: Boost your glutes and hamstrings with the Physioball Hip Bridge! This beginner-friendly exercise uses an exercise ball to target your lower body. Get ready to lift and tone while having a ball! 🎉

name: Pin Presses
instructions: Pin presses remove the eccentric phase of the bench press, developing starting strength. They also allow you to train a desired range of motion.

The bench should be set up in a power rack. Set the pins to the desired point in your range of motion, whether it just be lockout or an inch off of your chest. The bar should be moved to the pins and prepared for lifting.

Begin by lying on the bench, with the bar directly above the contact point during your regular bench. Tuck your feet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help support your weight, lift your shoulder off the bench and retract them, squeezing the shoulder blades together. Use your feet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.
You can take a standard bench grip, or shoulder width to focus on the triceps. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at all times. Focus on squeezing the bar and trying to pull it apart.
Drive the bar up with as much force as possible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.
Return the bar to the pins, pausing before beginning the next repetition.
subtitle: Powerful Pin Press Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Adjust the bench in a power rack and set the pins to your desired range of motion.
2. **Get Positioned**: Lie on the bench with the bar above you. Tuck your feet under and arch your back.
3. **Tighten Up**: Use the bar to lift and retract your shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together.
4. **Grip and Align**: Take a standard or shoulder-width grip. Keep bar, wrist, and elbow aligned.
5. **Press with Power**: Drive the bar up forcefully, keeping elbows tucked in until lockout.
6. **Pause and Repeat**: Return the bar to the pins, pause, and get ready for the next rep.
tip: 🧠 Imagine you're a spring! Coil up tight and then explode with power to press the bar up.
short_description: Pin Presses help build starting strength by removing the eccentric phase. Great for working on triceps and more! Ready to press like a pro? Give it a try! 💥

name: Piriformis-SMR
instructions: Sit with your buttocks on top of a foam roll. Bend your knees, and then cross one leg so that the ankle is over the knee. This will be your starting position.

Shift your weight to the side of the crossed leg, rolling over the buttocks until you feel tension in your upper glute. You may assist the stretch by using one hand to pull the bent knee towards your chest. Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Glute Roll and Relax
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a foam roller with your buttocks positioned on top.
2. **Bend** your knees and cross one leg over the other, placing the ankle on the opposite knee.
3. **Shift** your weight onto the side of the crossed leg, rolling over your upper glute.
4. **Feel** the tension in your glute and use one hand to pull the bent knee towards your chest for a deeper stretch.
5. **Hold** the stretch for 10-30 seconds, feeling the muscles relax.
6. **Switch** sides and repeat the steps for the other glute.
tip: Imagine you're massaging dough with a rolling pin – smooth and steady! 🍞
short_description: Piriformis-SMR is a fantastic stretch to relieve tension in your glutes using a foam roller. It's like giving your muscles a gentle massage – perfect for a quick relaxation session! 🍑

name: Plank
instructions: Get into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.
Keep your body straight at all times, and hold this position as long as possible. To increase difficulty, an arm or leg can be raised.
subtitle: Hold It Tight!
new_instructions:
1. **Get Down**: Lie face down on the floor, then lift your body onto your toes and forearms.
2. **Align**: Make sure your elbows are directly under your shoulders and your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. **Engage**: Tighten your abs and glutes to keep your body straight and rigid.
4. **Hold**: Stay in this position for as long as you can. If you want a challenge, try lifting one arm or leg off the ground.
5. **Breathe**: Don't forget to breathe steadily while holding the plank.
6. **Finish**: Lower your body gently back to the ground when you're done.
tip: 🧘 Imagine you're a sturdy, unyielding bridge. Keep everything tight and steady!
short_description: Plank is all about holding your body in a straight line to work those abs! It's a simple but powerful move that strengthens your core. 🏋️‍♂️

name: Plate Pinch
instructions: Grab two wide-rimmed plates and put them together with the smooth sides facing outward
Use your fingers to grip the outside part of the plate and your thumb for the other side thus holding both plates together. This is the starting position.
Squeeze the plate with your fingers and thumb. Hold this position for as long as you can.
Repeat for the recommended amount of sets prescribed in your program.
Switch arms and repeat the movements.
subtitle: Pumped-Up Pinch
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** two wide-rimmed plates and place them together, smooth sides out.
2. **Grip** the outside of the plates with your fingers, thumb on the other side.
3. **Squeeze** the plates tightly with your fingers and thumb.
4. **Hold** this position for as long as you can.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended sets in your program.
6. **Switch** arms and repeat the movements.
tip: Imagine you're holding a giant sandwich 🥪. Keep your grip tight and steady, just like you wouldn't want your tasty lunch to fall apart!
short_description: Strengthen your forearms with the Plate Pinch! This intermediate move isolates the forearm muscles for a grip-tastic challenge. Get ready to feel the burn and enjoy the gains! 💪

name: Plate Twist
instructions: Lie down on the floor or an exercise mat with your legs fully extended and your upper body upright. Grab the plate by its sides with both hands out in front of your abs with your arms slightly bent.

Slowly cross your legs near your ankles and lift them up off the ground. Your knees should also be bent slightly. Note: Move your upper body back slightly to help keep you balanced turning this exercise. This is the starting position.
Move the plate to the left side and touch the floor with it. Breathe out as you perform that movement.

Come back to the starting position as you breathe in and then repeat the movement but this time to the right side of the body. Tip: Use a slow controlled movement at all times. Jerking motions can injure the back.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Twist and Shout!
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with legs extended and upper body upright. Hold a plate with both hands in front of your abs, arms slightly bent.
2. Cross your legs at the ankles and lift them off the ground, keeping knees slightly bent. Lean back slightly to balance. This is your starting position.
3. Move the plate to the left and touch the floor. Exhale as you twist.
4. Return to the start position as you inhale.
5. Repeat the twist movement to the right side. Keep motions slow and controlled.
6. Continue alternating sides for the recommended repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're steering a ship through stormy seas—keep your movements smooth and steady for the best balance! 🚢
short_description: Get ready to sculpt those abs with the Plate Twist! This fun move targets your core, helping you build strength and stability. Twist it up and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Platform Hamstring Slides
instructions: For this movement a wooden floor or similar is needed. Lay on your back with your legs extended. Place a gym towel or a light weight underneath your heel. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the knee, keeping your other leg straight.
Continue bringing the heel closer to you, sliding it on the floor.
At full knee flexion, reverse the movement to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Hamstring Slide Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your back on a wooden floor with legs extended and place a gym towel or light weight under your heel. This is your starting position.
2. **Flex your knee** to start the movement while keeping your other leg straight.
3. **Slide your heel** closer to you along the floor, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings.
4. **Reach full knee flexion** and then reverse the movement to return to the starting position.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on smooth, controlled movements.
tip: Imagine pulling your heel back like you're trying to reel in a big fish 🐟. This helps engage your hamstrings more effectively!
short_description: Platform Hamstring Slides are a fun way to target your hamstrings and glutes. All you need is a smooth floor and a towel. Get ready to feel the burn and slide your way to stronger legs! 🦵🔥

name: Plie Dumbbell Squat
instructions: Hold a dumbbell at the base with both hands and stand straight up. Move your legs so that they are wider than shoulder width apart from each other with your knees slightly bent.
Your toes should be facing out. Note: Your arms should be stationary while performing the exercise. This is the starting position.
Slowly bend the knees and lower your legs until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Make sure to inhale as this is the eccentric part of the exercise.
Press mainly with the heel of the foot to bring the body back to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Wide-Leg Dumbbell Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell with both hands and **stand** tall. **Spread** your legs wider than shoulder-width and **bend** your knees slightly.
2. **Point** your toes outwards. Keep your arms steady – that’s your starting pose! 🌟
3. **Slowly bend** your knees and **lower** yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground. **Inhale** as you do this – feel the stretch!
4. **Push** through your heels to **rise** back up to the starting position. **Exhale** as you go!
5. **Repeat** for the suggested number of reps. You’ve got this! 💪
tip: Imagine you’re a sumo wrestler gracefully squatting to greet their opponent. Stay balanced and strong! 🤼‍♂️
short_description: Get ready to work those quads, glutes, and more with the Plie Dumbbell Squat! It’s perfect for beginners and adds a fun twist to your routine. Grab a dumbbell and let’s get squatting! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Plyo Kettlebell Pushups
instructions: Place a kettlebell on the floor. Place yourself in a pushup position, on your toes with one hand on the ground and one hand holding the kettlebell, with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.
Begin by lowering yourself as low as you can, keeping your back straight.

Quickly and forcefully reverse direction, pushing yourself up to the other side of the kettlebell, switching hands as you do so. Continue the movement by descending and repeating the movement back and forth.
subtitle: Kettlebell Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Place a kettlebell on the floor and get into a pushup position. One hand should be on the kettlebell and the other on the ground, arms extended.
2. **Lower:** Keep your back straight and lower yourself down as far as you can go.
3. **Explode Up:** Push up quickly and powerfully, switching hands so the opposite hand is now on the kettlebell.
4. **Repeat:** Continue lowering and pushing up, switching hands each time, like a powerful, explosive dance.
tip: Imagine you're a spring-loaded superhero! 🤸‍♂️ Explode up with energy and control to switch hands smoothly.
short_description: Plyo Kettlebell Pushups are a powerhouse move that targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps. They're intense but super rewarding, giving you strength and explosive power! 💥

name: Plyo Push-up
instructions: Move into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around shoulder width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest towards the ground.
At the bottom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as possible. Attempt to push your upper body up until your hands leave the ground.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise.
For added difficulty, add claps into the movement while you are air borne.
subtitle: Push-Up Pop!
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready:** Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and body straight as a board. 
2. **Lower Down:** Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the ground.
3. **Explode Up:** Push off the ground with force, lifting your hands off the floor.
4. **Catch Yourself:** Land softly back into the starting plank position.
5. **Repeat:** Keep going with a steady rhythm, aiming for height with each push-up.
6. **Add a Clap (Optional):** For extra fun, try clapping your hands while airborne!
tip: Imagine you're a rocket blasting off! 🚀 The higher you push, the lighter you'll feel!
short_description: Plyo Push-ups are a fun twist on the classic push-up that adds a jump for explosive power. They work your chest, shoulders, and triceps, giving you a great upper body workout. Get ready to pop and soar! 💥

name: Posterior Tibialis Stretch
instructions: In a seated position, loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. This will be your starting position.

With the leg extended and the heel off of the ground, pull on the belt so that the foot is everted, with the outside of the foot being pulled towards you. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Happy Calf Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the floor and extend one leg out. 
2. **Loop** a belt, rope, or band around the foot of your extended leg. 
3. **Lift** your heel slightly off the ground while keeping the leg extended. 
4. **Pull** the belt towards you so the outside of your foot moves closer to you. 
5. **Hold** this position for 10-20 seconds, feeling a good stretch in your calf. 
6. **Switch** sides and repeat the stretch on the other leg.
tip: Imagine you're a puppeteer gently pulling your foot like a string puppet. 🎭
short_description: Stretch out those calves with the Posterior Tibialis Stretch! It's perfect for loosening up tight muscles. Give your legs some love! 🦵💓

name: Power Clean
instructions: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart and toes pointing out slightly.
Squat down and grasp bar with a closed, pronated grip. Your hands should be slightly wider than shoulder width apart outside knees with elbows fully extended.
Place the bar about 1 inch in front of your shins and over the balls of your feet.
Your back should be flat or slightly arched, your chest held up and out and your shoulder blades should be retracted.
Keep your head in a neutral position (in line with vertebral column and not tilted or rotated) with your eyes focused straight ahead. Inhale during this phase.

Lift the bar from the floor by forcefully extending the hips and the knees as you exhale. Tip: The upper torso should maintain the same angle. Do not bend at the waist yet and do not let the hips rise before the shoulders (this would have the effect of pushing the glutes in the air and stretching the hamstrings.
Keep elbows fully extended with the head in a neutral position and the shoulders over the bar.
As the bar raises keep it as close to the shins as possible.
As the bar passes the knees, thrust your hips forward and slightly bend the knees to avoid locking them. Tip: At this point your thighs should be against the bar.
Keep the back flat or slightly arched, elbows fully extended and your head neutral. Tip: You will hold your breath until the next phase.
Inhale and then forcefully and quickly extend your hips and knees and stand on your toes.

Keep the bar as close to your body as possible. Tip: Your back should be flat with the elbows pointed out to the sides and your head in a neutral position. Also, keep your shoulders over the bar and arms straight as long as possible.
When your lower body joints are fully extended, shrug the shoulders upward rapidly without letting the elbows flex yet. Exhale during this portion of the movement.
As the shoulders reach their highest elevation flex your elbows to begin pulling your body under the bar.

Continue to pull the arms as high and as long as possible. Tip: Due to the explosive nature of this phase, your torso will be erect or with an arched back, your head will be tilted back slightly and your feet may lose contact with the floor.
After the lower body has fully extended and the bar reaches near maximal height, pull your body under the bar and rotate the arms around and under the bar.
Simultaneously, flex the hips and knees into a quarter squat position.
Once the arms are under the bar, inhale and then lift your elbows to position the upper arms parallel to the floor. Rack the bar across the front of your collar bones and front shoulder muscles.
Catch the bar with an erect and tight torso, a neutral head position and flat feet. Exhale during this movement.
Stand up by extending the hips and knees to a fully erect position.
Lower the bar by gradually reducing the muscular tension of the arms to allow a controlled descent of the bar to the thighs. Inhale during this movement.
Simultaneously flex the hips and knees to cushion the impact of the bar on the thighs.
Squat down with the elbows fully extended until the bar touches the floor.
Start over at Phase 1 and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Clean Sweep
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready**: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly pointed out. Squat down, grab the barbell with an overhand grip, and keep your arms just outside your knees.
2. **Lift Off**: With a flat back and chest out, inhale and lift the bar by extending your hips and knees. Keep the bar close to your shins.
3. **Power Up**: As the bar passes your knees, thrust your hips forward. Stand on your toes and shrug your shoulders while keeping the bar close.
4. **Catch It**: Pull yourself under the bar, rotate your arms, and catch the bar on your shoulders in a squat. Keep your torso tight and eyes forward.
5. **Stand Tall**: Stand up straight by extending your hips and knees.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a jacket really fast 🧥—keep the bar close to your body as you lift it!
short_description: Power Clean is your go-to move for building explosive strength and full-body power! Get ready to feel like an athlete as you lift that barbell with style and precision. 🌟

name: Power Clean from Blocks
instructions: With a barbell on boxes of the desired height, take a grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips.

In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight. At the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.

As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, pull yourself under the bar far enough that it can be racked onto the shoulders, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed.

Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position, and complete the repetition by returning the weight to the boxes.
subtitle: Clean Power Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Grip the Bar**: Stand with the barbell on boxes. Grip it just outside your legs. Keep your hips low, weight on heels, back straight, and chest up.
2. **First Pull**: Drive through your heels, extend your knees. Keep your back angle the same and arms straight.
3. **Jump and Extend**: When the bar hits mid-thigh, jump! Extend your hips, knees, and ankles to move the bar up.
4. **Third Pull**: Shrug and flex your arms, pulling yourself under the bar. Rotate elbows under to rack the bar on your shoulders.
5. **Stand Tall**: Drive through your heels to stand up straight, keeping your torso upright and elbows up. Lower the bar back to the boxes.
tip: Imagine you're exploding like a rocket 🚀! This helps you put maximum power into your jump and extension.
short_description: Power Clean from Blocks is a dynamic move to boost strength in your hamstrings and quads. Feel like a superhero as you lift and rack that barbell! 🦸‍♂️

name: Power Jerk
instructions: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible.
Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.

At this moment as the feet leave the floor, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible. In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should be moved to a slightly wider stance, with the knees partially bent.
Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead.
Return to a standing position.
subtitle: Power Up with the Jerk!
new_instructions:
1. **Start**: Stand tall with the barbell on your front shoulders, feet under hips. Slightly dip by bending your knees.
2. **Drive**: Push through your heels powerfully. Move your head back as the barbell leaves your shoulders.
3. **Jump**: As your feet leave the floor, quickly move them to a wider stance with knees bent.
4. **Catch**: Lock your arms overhead to catch the barbell.
5. **Stand**: Return to a standing position, keeping the barbell overhead.
tip: Imagine you're a rocket blasting off! 🚀 Push through your heels to generate maximum power.
short_description: Blast off into fitness with the Power Jerk! This explosive move targets your quads, shoulders, and more. Perfect for those looking to add some serious strength to their routine. 💥

name: Power Partials
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. Your feet should be about shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight and the torso stationary, lift the weights out to your sides until they are about shoulder level height while exhaling.

Feel the contraction for a second and begin to lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling. Tip: Keep the palms facing down with the little finger slightly higher while lifting and lowering the weights as it will concentrate the stress on your shoulders mainly.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Power Pops
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a dumbbell in each hand, arms straight down. 
2. **Set your feet** shoulder-width apart and keep elbows close to your torso. 
3. **Lift the weights** straight out to the sides until shoulder height. 
4. **Hold for a second**, then slowly lower them back down. 
5. **Keep palms down** with pinkies slightly higher for extra shoulder focus. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings 🕊️. Keep the motion controlled and graceful for the best shoulder burn.
short_description: Pump up those shoulders with Power Partials! This beginner-friendly move isolates your shoulder muscles for a focused burn. Grab some dumbbells and let's get those shoulders popping! 💪

name: Power Snatch
instructions: Begin with a loaded barbell on the floor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar from the ground. The back angle should stay the same until the bar passes the knees.

Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and allow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your feet into the receiving position, a slightly wider position, pull yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The bar should be received in a partial squat. Continue raising the bar to the overhead position, receiving the bar locked out overhead.
Return to a standing position with the weight over head.
subtitle: Snatch It with Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Position**: Stand with feet under hips. Grip the bar wide and lower hips, keeping chest up and head forward.
2. **First Pull**: Drive through your heels to lift the bar, keeping your back angle steady until the bar passes your knees.
3. **Second Pull**: Extend through your hips, knees, and ankles, driving the bar up. Keep it close to your body. Shrug your shoulders and flex elbows to the side at peak extension.
4. **Receive**: Move your feet wider and pull yourself under the bar. Catch it in a partial squat with arms overhead.
5. **Finish**: Stand up straight, holding the bar overhead with arms locked.
tip: 🧲 Imagine you’re a magnet pulling the bar close to your body. The closer it is, the more control you have!
short_description: Power Snatch is a dynamic move that works your entire body, from legs to shoulders. It's like giving your muscles a wake-up call with each lift! 💥

name: Power Snatch from Blocks
instructions: Begin with a loaded barbell on boxes or stands of the desired height. A wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar, with the elbows pointed out. This will be the starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar from the boxes.

Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and allow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your feet into the receiving position, forcefully pull yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The feet should move to just outside the hips, turned out as necessary. Receive the bar above a full squat and with the arms fully extended overhead.
Keeping the bar aligned over the front of the heels, your head and chest up, drive through heels of the feet to move to a standing position. Carefully return the weight to the boxes.
subtitle: Lift and Snatch!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab the Bar:** Stand with your feet under your hips, toes turned out. Grab the bar with a wide grip.
2. **Settle In:** Lower your hips, lift your chest, and keep your head forward. Align shoulders just in front of the bar.
3. **First Pull:** Push through your heels and lift the bar from the blocks.
4. **Second Pull:** Extend your hips, knees, and ankles. Shrug your shoulders and keep the bar close.
5. **Catch It:** As the bar rises, jump your feet out and pull yourself under the bar, catching it overhead in a squat.
6. **Stand Tall:** Drive through your heels to stand up, holding the bar overhead. Lower it back to the blocks carefully.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a jacket really fast! Keep the bar close to your body for more power and control. 🧥
short_description: The Power Snatch from Blocks is a dynamic move that builds explosive strength and coordination. Feel the power as you lift the bar overhead in a smooth, controlled motion. Perfect for those looking to level up their lifting game! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Power Stairs
instructions: In the power stairs, implements are moved up a staircase. For training purposes, these can be performed with a tire or box.

Begin by taking the implement with both hands. Set your feet wide, with your head and chest up. Drive through the ground with your heels, extending your knees and hips to raise the weight from the ground.
As you lean back, attempt to swing the weight onto the stairs, which are usually around 16-18" high. You can use your legs to help push the weight onto the stair.
Repeat for 3-5 repetitions, and continue with a heavier weight, moving as fast as possible.
subtitle: Step Up Your Strength!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the implement with both hands, keeping your feet wide apart.
2. **Stand** tall with your head and chest up, and drive through your heels to lift the weight.
3. **Lean** back slightly as you swing the weight onto the first stair, using your legs to help push it up.
4. **Repeat** the lift and swing motion for 3-5 reps.
5. **Increase** the weight and **move** as quickly as possible for added challenge.
tip: 👀 Imagine you're Hercules lifting a giant tire up Mount Olympus! Use your legs and back to power through each step.
short_description: Power Stairs will boost your strength and endurance by lifting heavy weights onto stairs. It's a fun way to target your hamstrings, glutes, and more. Feel like a strongman and power up those stairs! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Preacher Curl
instructions: To perform this movement you will need a preacher bench and an E-Z bar. Grab the E-Z curl bar at the close inner handle (either have someone hand you the bar which is preferable or grab the bar from the front bar rest provided by most preacher benches). The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar.
With the upper arms positioned against the preacher bench pad and the chest against it, hold the E-Z Curl Bar at shoulder length. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the bar until your upper arm is extended and the biceps is fully stretched.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps is fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder height. Squeeze the biceps hard and hold this position for a second.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boost Bliss
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** an E-Z curl bar using the close inner handle. Your palms should face forward, slightly tilted inward. 
2. **Position** your upper arms against the preacher bench pad and rest your chest on it. This is your starting position. 
3. **Inhale** and **lower** the bar slowly until your upper arms are extended and your biceps are fully stretched. 
4. **Exhale** and **curl** the weight up using your biceps until the bar is at shoulder height. Squeeze your biceps and hold for a second. 
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps. Keep your movements controlled and steady!
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a sponge to get the last drop of water out when you contract your biceps. 💧
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Preacher Curl! This move isolates your biceps for maximum engagement, making your arms stronger and more defined. 🚀

name: Preacher Hammer Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Place the upper part of both arms on top of the preacher bench as you hold a dumbbell in each hand with the palms facing each other (neutral grip).
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbbells until your upper arm is extended and the biceps is fully stretched.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder height.
Squeeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Builder Bonanza
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the preacher bench and **rest** your upper arms on the pad, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other.
2. **Inhale** and **lower** the dumbbells slowly until your arms are fully extended and your biceps are stretched.
3. **Exhale** and **curl** the dumbbells up using your biceps until they reach shoulder height.
4. **Squeeze** your biceps hard at the top for a second.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions, keeping the movement slow and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing an orange with your biceps at the top of the curl 🍊. This helps you really contract the muscle!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Preacher Hammer Dumbbell Curl! This move isolates your biceps and forearms, making them work hard. It's simple, effective, and perfect for beginners. 💪

name: Press Sit-Up
instructions: To begin, lie down on a bench with a barbell resting on your chest. Position your legs so they are secure on the extension of the abdominal bench. This is the starting position.

While inhaling, tighten your abs and glutes. Simultaneously curl your torso as you do when performing a sit-up and press the barbell to an overhead position while exhaling. Tip: Use your arms to push the barbell out as you perform this exercise while still focusing on the abdominal muscles.
Lower your upper body back down to the starting position while bringing the barbell back down to your torso. Remember to breathe in while lowering the body.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift and Curl Magic
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a bench with a barbell on your chest and legs secure on the bench extension.
2. **Inhale**, tighten your abs and glutes, and **curl up** like a sit-up while **pressing the barbell** overhead. **Exhale** as you do this.
3. **Lower yourself** back down and bring the barbell to your chest. Remember to **inhale** as you go down.
4. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping your core tight and movements controlled.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero lifting a giant barbell above your head every time you press up! 🦸‍♂️
short_description: The Press Sit-Up is a powerhouse move that targets your abs, chest, shoulders, and triceps. Feel like a superhero as you lift the barbell overhead while curling up. Get ready to feel the burn and build some serious strength! 💪

name: Prone Manual Hamstring
instructions: You will need a partner for this exercise. Lay face down with your legs straight. Your assistant will place their hand on your heel.

To begin, flex the knee to curl your leg up. Your partner should provide resistance, starting light and increasing the pressure as the movement is completed. Communicate with your partner to monitor appropriate resistance levels.
Pause at the top, returning the leg to the starting position as your partner provides resistance going the other direction.
subtitle: Hamstring Helper
new_instructions:
1. **Lay down**: Get a buddy and lay face down with your legs straight. 
2. **Partner ready**: Your partner places their hand on your heel. 
3. **Curl up**: Flex your knee to curl your leg up while your partner gives light resistance. 
4. **Feel the burn**: As you curl, your partner should gradually increase the resistance. 
5. **Hold it**: Pause when you reach the top of the curl. 
6. **Lower down**: Slowly return your leg to the starting position as your partner resists the motion.
tip: Think of your leg as a drawbridge 🏰—slowly lift and lower it with control to really engage those hamstrings.
short_description: Grab a partner and target those hamstrings with the Prone Manual Hamstring exercise! It's perfect for beginners looking to strengthen their legs. 💪

name: Prowler Sprint
instructions: Place your sled on an appropriate surface, loaded to a suitable weight. The sled should provide enough resistance to require effort, but not so heavy that you are significantly slowed down.
You may use the upright or the low handles for this exercise. Place your hands on the handles with your arms extended, leaning into the implement.
With good posture, drive through the ground with alternating, short steps. Move as fast as you can for a short distance.
subtitle: Sprint with a Sled
new_instructions:
1. **Place** your sled on a flat surface and load it with a moderate weight.
2. **Choose** either the upright handles or low handles, and grip them firmly.
3. **Lean** into the sled with your arms extended, maintaining good posture.
4. **Drive** through the ground with short, quick steps.
5. **Move** as fast as you can for a short distance, giving it your all!
tip: Think of yourself as a race car! 🏎️ Keep your body low and drive forward with power, just like you're zooming down the track.
short_description: Prowler Sprints are an exciting way to boost your cardio and strengthen your legs and core. Feel the burn and sprint like a champ! 🏋️

name: Pull Through
instructions: Begin standing a few feet in front of a low pulley with a rope or handle attached. Face away from the machine, straddling the cable, with your feet set wide apart.

Begin the movement by reaching through your legs as far as possible, bending at the hips. Keep your knees slightly bent. Keeping your arms straight, extend through the hip to stand straight up. Avoid pulling upward through the shoulders; all of the motion should originate through the hips.
subtitle: Glute Power Pull
new_instructions:
1. Stand a few feet in front of a low pulley with a rope attached, facing away from the machine.
2. Straddle the cable with your feet wide apart.
3. Bend at the hips and reach through your legs as far as you can. Keep those knees slightly bent!
4. Keep your arms straight and extend through your hips to stand up tall.
5. Focus on using your hips, not your shoulders, throughout the movement.
tip: Imagine you're a catapult, launching yourself forward with your hips! 🏹
short_description: Feel the burn in your glutes and hamstrings with the Pull Through! This beginner-friendly move uses a cable machine to power up your lower body. Get ready to feel strong and steady! 🍑

name: Pullups
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

Pull your torso up until the bar touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Pull-Up Party Time
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the pull-up bar with your palms facing forward. Choose your grip: wide, medium, or close. 
2. **Hang** with your arms extended and lean back slightly, puffing out your chest. This is your starting position.
3. **Pull** your torso up until the bar touches your upper chest. Exhale as you go up, and squeeze those back muscles!
4. **Hold** for a second at the top, feeling the burn in your lats and biceps.
5. **Lower** yourself back down slowly to the starting position with arms fully extended.
6. **Repeat** for the number of reps you want, keeping that form tight!
tip: 🦸‍♂️ Imagine you're lifting yourself over a tall building like a superhero. Focus on using your back and biceps to soar up!
short_description: Pull-ups are a fantastic bodyweight exercise that targets your lats, biceps and middle back. They make you feel strong and confident as you lift yourself up. Get ready to flex those muscles! 💪

name: Push-Up Wide
instructions: With your hands wide apart, support your body on your toes and hands in a plank position. Your elbows should be extended and your body straight. Do not allow your hips to sag. This will be your starting position.
To begin, allow the elbows to flex, lowering your chest to the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position by extending the elbows. Exhale as you perform this step.
After pausing at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Widen Your Chest Push-Up
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready:** Spread your hands wider than shoulder-width. Form a plank on your toes and hands. Keep your body straight, no sagging!
2. **Lower Down:** Bend your elbows and slowly lower your chest to the floor while inhaling.
3. **Push Up:** Use your chest muscles to push back up by straightening your elbows. Exhale as you go up.
4. **Pause and Repeat:** Pause at the top, then go again. Keep it up for the number of reps you want!
tip: Imagine you're hugging a big beach ball 🌊. Keep your hands wide and control your movements for a better chest workout.
short_description: Craving a stronger chest and shoulders? Wide push-ups are here for you! They're great for beginners and work your chest, abs, shoulders, and triceps. 💪

name: Push-Ups - Close Triceps Position
instructions: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure that you are holding your torso up at arms' length.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Using your triceps and some of your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Triceps Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** face down and place your hands close together, right under your chest.
2. **Lift up** your body, keeping it straight from head to toes.
3. **Lower down** slowly until your chest almost touches the ground. Breathe in.
4. **Push up** using your triceps and chest muscles. Breathe out as you go up.
5. **Pause** for a second when you're at the top, feeling the squeeze in your triceps.
6. **Repeat** for the number of repetitions you want. Keep it steady and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a ball with your triceps as you push up! 🎾 This helps engage the triceps more effectively.
short_description: Feel the burn in your triceps with Close Triceps Push-Ups! This intermediate move strengthens your triceps, chest, and shoulders. 💪 Get ready to power up those arms!

name: Push-Ups With Feet Elevated
instructions: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.
Place your toes on top of a flat bench. This will allow your body to be elevated. Note: The higher the elevation of the flat bench, the higher the resistance of the exercise is.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Sky-High Push-Ups
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your stomach and place your hands about 36 inches apart. 
2. **Put your toes** on a flat bench to elevate your body. The higher the bench, the tougher the push-up!
3. **Lower your chest** towards the floor, almost touching it. Inhale as you go down.
4. **Push up** using your chest muscles, returning to the starting position. Exhale as you push.
5. **Squeeze your chest** at the top, pause for a second, then repeat for your desired reps.
tip: Imagine you’re pushing the floor away from you! 🚀 This will help you engage your chest and core muscles more effectively.
short_description: Elevate your push-up game with this move! Great for working your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Power up and feel the burn! 💥

name: Push-Ups With Feet On An Exercise Ball
instructions: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.
Place your toes on top of an exercise ball. This will allow your body to be elevated.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Push-Up on the Ball Magic!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** face down and **place your hands** on the floor, about 36 inches apart. Keep your arms straight.
2. **Balance your toes** on top of an exercise ball to elevate your body.
3. **Lower your chest** towards the floor, keeping your back straight, and **inhale**.
4. **Press up** using your chest muscles until your arms are straight again. **Exhale** as you do this.
5. **Pause briefly** at the top, then **repeat** for the number of reps you want.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero pushing the floor away from you! 🦸‍♂️ This keeps your form strong and your movements powerful.
short_description: Pump up your chest, shoulders, and triceps with this fun, intermediate move! Put your feet on an exercise ball for an added challenge. Feel the burn and channel your inner superhero! 🦸‍♂️

name: Push Press
subtitle: Press and Power Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Grip** the barbell with hands shoulder-width apart. 
2. **Position** the bar on your upper chest with elbows slightly in front. 
3. **Dip** your knees slightly to gain momentum. 
4. **Press** the bar overhead by extending your arms and legs simultaneously. 
5. **Lock** your arms at the top and hold for a second. 
6. **Lower** the bar back to the starting position gently.
tip: Pretend you're pushing a rocket into space! 🚀 Engage your core for extra stability.
short_description: Push Press is a powerful move that hits your shoulders, quads, and triceps. It's like sending a rocket into space with your own strength! Get ready to feel the burn and power up your workout! 💥

name: Push Press - Behind the Neck
instructions: Standing with the weight racked on the back of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible. Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, moving the bar in a vertical path.
Using the momentum generated, finish pressing the weight overhead be extending through the arms.
Return to the starting position, using your legs to absorb the impact.
subtitle: Power Up from Behind!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with the barbell on the back of your shoulders and feet under your hips.
2. **Dip slightly** by bending your knees, but keep your hips steady.
3. **Explode upwards** by pushing through your heels, driving the barbell straight up.
4. **Press overhead** using the momentum and extend your arms fully.
5. **Lower the bar** back to your shoulders, using your legs to absorb the impact.
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket! 🚀 Use your legs to generate all the power.
short_description: Get ready to ignite your shoulders with the Push Press - Behind the Neck! This move combines leg power and shoulder strength for an explosive lift. Perfect for building strength and stability. 💥

name: Push Up to Side Plank
instructions: Get into pushup position on the toes with your hands just outside of shoulder width.
Perform a pushup by allowing the elbows to flex. As you descend, keep your body straight.
Do one pushup and as you come up, shift your weight on the left side of the body, twist to the side while bringing the right arm up towards the ceiling in a side plank.
Lower the arm back to the floor for another pushup and then twist to the other side.
Repeat the series, alternating each side, for 10 or more reps.
subtitle: Push-Up Twist
new_instructions:
1. Get into a push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and on your toes.
2. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your body straight as a plank.
3. Push back up and shift your weight to your left side, raising your right arm to the ceiling, twisting into a side plank.
4. Lower your right arm back to the floor and perform another push-up.
5. This time, shift your weight to your right side, raising your left arm to the ceiling in a side plank.
6. Repeat the sequence, alternating sides, for 10 or more reps.
tip: Imagine you're a twisting superhero, reaching for the stars with each side plank! 🌟
short_description: Push-Up to Side Plank is a fun combo move that targets your chest, abs, shoulders, and triceps. It's a great way to spice up your routine and build strength with a twist! 💪

name: Pushups
instructions: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length.
Next, lower yourself downward until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Now breathe out and press your upper body back up to the starting position while squeezing your chest.
After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.
subtitle: Chest-Boosting Pushups
new_instructions:
1. **Start**: Lie face down with hands flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. **Lower**: Bend your elbows to slowly lower your chest towards the floor. Keep your body straight and don't let your hips sag.
3. **Breathe In**: As you lower yourself, take a deep breath in. Aim to get your chest as close to the floor as you can.
4. **Push**: Exhale and push through your hands to straighten your arms, lifting your body back to the start position.
5. **Repeat**: Pause briefly at the top, then repeat for the desired number of reps. Keep your movements smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're a rocket ship 🚀 pushing off the ground. Keep your core tight to lift-off smoothly!
short_description: Pushups are a fantastic bodyweight exercise that work your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Great for building strength and muscle, they can be done anywhere, anytime! 💪

name: Pushups (Close and Wide Hand Positions)
instructions: Lie on the floor face down and body straight with your toes on the floor and the hands wider than shoulder width for a wide hand position and closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure you are holding your torso up at arms length.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Pushup Palooza
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your belly with your body straight and toes on the floor. **Place your hands** wider than shoulder-width for wide pushups or closer than shoulder-width for close pushups.
2. **Lower yourself** down slowly until your chest is just above the floor. **Inhale** as you go down.
3. **Push up** using your chest muscles to lift your body back to the starting position. **Exhale** as you push up.
4. **Pause** at the top for a second, then repeat. **Keep going** for the number of reps you want.
tip: 👐 **Imagine you're hugging a big beach ball** as you push up and down. This keeps your form tight and controlled!
short_description: Pushups are an awesome bodyweight exercise that works your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Mix it up with close and wide hand positions for a fun challenge! 💪

name: Pyramid
instructions: Start off by rolling your torso forward onto the ball so your hips rest on top of the ball and become the highest point of your body.

Rest your hands and feet on the floor. Your arms and legs can be slightly bent or straight, depending on the size of the ball, your flexibility, and the length of your limbs. This also helps develop stabilizing strength in your torso and shoulders.
subtitle: Roll and Stretch Pyramid
new_instructions:
1. **Roll onto the ball**: Lie face down and roll your torso onto the exercise ball until your hips rest on top.
2. **Place hands and feet**: Position your hands and feet on the floor. Adjust your arms and legs as needed.
3. **Find stability**: Keep your arms and legs slightly bent or straight, depending on comfort and flexibility.
4. **Hold position**: Ensure your hips are the highest point of your body, stabilizing with your torso and shoulders.
5. **Breathe and relax**: Take deep breaths, relaxing into the stretch while maintaining balance.
tip: Imagine you're a pyramid, strong and stable. 💪 Keep your core tight to stay balanced!
short_description: The Pyramid stretch on an exercise ball targets your lower back and shoulders. It's a great way to build stabilizing strength while stretching. Think of yourself as a mighty pyramid! 🏜️

name: Quad Stretch
instructions: Lay on your side. Loop a belt, rope, or band around your top foot. Flex the knee and extend your hip, attempting to touch your glutes with your foot, and holding the belt with your hands. This will be your starting position.
With the belt being held over the shoulder or overhead, gently pull to increase the stretch in the quadriceps. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Happy Quads Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Lay on your side comfortably.
2. Loop a belt, rope, or band around your top foot.
3. Flex your knee and extend your hip, aiming to touch your glutes with your foot.
4. Hold the belt with your hands securely.
5. Gently pull the belt over your shoulder or overhead to feel a nice stretch in your quadriceps.
6. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides and repeat.
tip:
Imagine you're trying to bring your heel to your butt like a friendly game of tag 🏃
Keep it gentle and steady!
short_description: Give your quads some love with this Happy Quads Stretch! It lengthens and loosens your quadriceps, making you feel fabulous. Perfect for when you need a quick, feel-good stretch! 🦵😊

name: Quadriceps-SMR
instructions: Lay facedown on the floor with your weight supported by your hands or forearms. Place a foam roll underneath one leg on the quadriceps, and keep the foot off of the ground. Make sure to relax the leg as much as possible. This will be your starting position.
Shifting as much weight onto the leg to be stretched as is tolerable, roll over the foam from above the knee to below the hip, holding points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Switch sides.
subtitle: Roll Your Quads Happy
new_instructions:
1. Lay facedown on the floor, supporting your weight with your hands or forearms. 
2. Place a foam roller under one leg on the quadriceps, and keep your foot off the ground. 
3. Relax your leg as much as possible; this is your starting position. 
4. Shift as much weight onto the leg as you can tolerate. 
5. Roll over the foam from above the knee to below the hip. 
6. Hold any points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Switch sides.
tip: Imagine you're ironing out the wrinkles in your muscles. 🎯 Focus on those tight spots!
short_description: Give those quads some love! This move uses a foam roller to massage and stretch your quadriceps. It's fantastic for muscle recovery and flexibility. 🏋️‍♂️

name: Quick Leap
instructions: You will need a box for this exerise.
Begin facing the box standing 1-2 feet from its edge.
By utilizing your hips, hop onto the box, landing on both legs. Ensure that you land with your legs bent and your feet flat.
Immediately upon landing, fully extend through the entire body and swing your arms overhead to explode off of the box. Use your legs to absorb the impact of landing.
subtitle: Jump to the Top!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Face a sturdy box and stand 1-2 feet away from it.
2. **Get Set**: Bend your knees slightly and swing your arms back.
3. **Leap Up**: Use your hips and jump onto the box, landing with bent knees and flat feet.
4. **Stand Strong**: Immediately stand up tall, extending your body and swinging your arms overhead.
5. **Step Down**: Step back down carefully and get ready for the next jump!
tip: 🎯 **Visualize a Target**: Imagine you're aiming for a spot just above the box. This helps you jump higher and land with control!
short_description: Quick Leap is a fun plyometric exercise that boosts your leg strength and explosive power. Perfect for beginners, it's like jumping onto a platform with a superhero landing! 🦸‍♂️

name: Rack Delivery
instructions: This drill teaches the delivery of the barbell to the rack position on the shoulders. Begin holding a bar in the scarecrow position, with the upper arms parallel to the floor, and the forearms hanging down. Use a hook grip, with your fingers wrapped over your thumbs.

Begin by rotating the elbows around the bar, delivering the bar to the shoulders. As your elbows come forward, relax your grip. The shoulders should be protracted, providing a shelf for the bar, which should lightly contact the throat.

It is important that the bar stay close to the body at all times, as with a heavier load any distance will result in an unwanted collision. As the movement becomes smoother, speed and load can be increased before progressing further.
subtitle: Rack 'n' Roll!
new_instructions:
1. Hold the barbell in a scarecrow position: arms out, upper arms parallel to the floor, and forearms hanging down.
2. Use a hook grip with fingers wrapped over your thumbs.
3. Rotate your elbows around the bar to bring it to your shoulders.
4. Relax your grip as your elbows come forward and let the bar rest on your shoulders.
5. Make sure the bar stays close to your body to avoid any collisions.
6. As you get better, increase speed and load for more challenge!
tip: Think of your elbows like windshield wipers, smoothly moving around the bar to clean the view! 🧽
short_description: Rack Delivery is a compound lift that targets your shoulders, forearms, and traps. It's all about smoothly bringing the barbell to your shoulders. Perfect for getting stronger and mastering control! 💪

name: Rack Pull with Bands
instructions: Set up in a power rack with the bar on the pins. The pins should be set to the desired point; just below the knees, just above, or in the mid thigh position. Attach bands to the base of the rack, or secure them with dumbbells. Attach the other end to the bar. You may need to choke the bands to provide tension.

Position yourself against the bar in proper deadlifting position. Your feet should be under your hips, your grip shoulder width, back arched, and hips back to engage the hamstrings. Since the weight is typically heavy, you may use a mixed grip, a hook grip, or use straps to aid in holding the weight.

With your head looking forward, extend through the hips and knees, pulling the weight up and back until lockout. Be sure to pull your shoulders back as you complete the movement. Return the weight to the pins and repeat.
subtitle: Band-Powered Rack Pull
new_instructions:
1. Set a barbell on power rack pins, adjust height to your knees or mid-thigh. Attach resistance bands to the rack base or dumbbells, then to the barbell.
2. Stand with feet under hips, grip bar shoulder-width. Arch back, push hips back, engage hamstrings. Use mixed grip or straps if needed.
3. Keep head forward, extend hips and knees to lift the bar until upright.
4. Pull shoulders back at the top, then lower bar to pins. Repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero using bands to power up your lift! 🦸‍♂️ It helps you engage your muscles and gives you that extra boost!
short_description: Rack Pull with Bands supercharges your lower back, glutes, and legs by adding resistance bands to the classic rack pull. It's like leveling up your powerlifting game! 💪

name: Rack Pulls
instructions: Set up in a power rack with the bar on the pins. The pins should be set to the desired point; just below the knees, just above, or in the mid thigh position. Position yourself against the bar in proper deadlifting position. Your feet should be under your hips, your grip shoulder width, back arched, and hips back to engage the hamstrings. Since the weight is typically heavy, you may use a mixed grip, a hook grip, or use straps to aid in holding the weight.
With your head looking forward, extend through the hips and knees, pulling the weight up and back until lockout. Be sure to pull your shoulders back as you complete the movement.
Return the weight to the pins and repeat.
subtitle: Rack 'n' Roll!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Place the barbell on the pins of a power rack, just below or above your knees, or at mid-thigh. Stand with your feet under your hips and grip the bar shoulder-width apart. Keep your back arched and push your hips back.
2. **Grip It**: Use a mixed grip, hook grip, or straps to hold the heavy weight. Look straight ahead.
3. **Lift Off**: Extend your hips and knees to pull the weight up and back. Stand tall and pull your shoulders back at the top.
4. **Return**: Lower the bar back to the pins with control.
5. **Repeat**: Keep going for the desired number of reps.
tip: Think of your hips as a hinge, swinging the weight up - like a door opening! 🚪
short_description: Rack Pulls are an awesome lower back strengthener, hitting your glutes, hamstrings, and more! Perfect for powerlifters. Get ready to feel strong and powerful! 🔥

name: Rear Leg Raises
instructions: Place yourself on your hands knees on an exercise mat. Your head should be looking forward and the bend of the knees should create a 90-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves. This will be your starting position.
Extend one leg up and behind you. The knee and hip should both extend. Repeat for 5-10 repetitions, and then switch sides.
subtitle: Lift and Stretch Those Legs!
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready:** Start on your hands and knees on an exercise mat. Keep your head up and look forward.
2. **Set Position:** Ensure your knees are bent at 90 degrees, forming a right angle between your thighs and calves. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift One Leg:** Extend one leg straight up and back. Make sure both your knee and hip extend fully.
4. **Repeat:** Lower your leg back to the starting position. Do 5-10 repetitions on this leg.
5. **Switch Sides:** Now, switch to the other leg and repeat the lifts for 5-10 reps.
6. **Finish Strong:** Keep your movements controlled and steady throughout the exercise.
tip: Imagine you're gently kicking something behind you with your foot 🦶. This helps maintain a good form and balance.
short_description: Rear Leg Raises are a beginner-friendly exercise that stretches and strengthens your quadriceps. Perfect for warming up or cooling down, this move helps improve your flexibility and balance. Give it a try and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Recumbent Bike
instructions: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

Select the desired option from the menu. You may have to start pedaling to turn it on. You can use the manual setting, or you can select a program to use. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. The level of resistance can be changed throughout the workout. The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an appropriate intensity.

Recumbent bikes offer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and have less impact than other activities. A 150 lb person will burn about 230 calories cycling at a moderate rate for 30 minutes, compared to 450 calories or more running.
subtitle: Pedal Power Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Sit and Adjust**: Sit on the bike and adjust the seat to fit your height. Make sure you're comfortable.
2. **Start Pedaling**: Begin to pedal slowly to turn on the bike's display screen.
3. **Choose Your Program**: Select a manual setting or a pre-set program. Enter your age and weight for accurate calorie tracking.
4. **Set Resistance**: Adjust the resistance level to match your fitness goal. You can change it anytime during your workout.
5. **Hold Handles**: Grip the handles to monitor your heart rate and ensure you're in the right intensity zone.
6. **Pedal and Enjoy**: Keep pedaling, enjoy the ride, and feel the burn in your legs!
tip: Imagine you're cycling through a beautiful park 🚴‍♂️. It keeps your mind engaged and makes the workout more enjoyable.
short_description: Hop on the recumbent bike and pedal your way to fitness! 🚲 It's perfect for a low-impact cardio workout that targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Ready to pedal? Let's go!

name: Return Push from Stance
instructions: You will need a partner for this drill.
Begin in an athletic 2 or 3 point stance.
At the signal, move into a position to receive the pass from your partner.
Catch the medicine ball with both hands and immediately throw it back to your partner.
You can modify this drill by running different routes.
subtitle: Bounce & Pass Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Get Ready**: Stand in an athletic stance, either 2 or 3 points. Have your partner ready with the medicine ball.
2. **Signal Time**: At the signal, move quickly into a position to receive the pass.
3. **Catch**: Grab the medicine ball with both hands as your partner throws it to you.
4. **Throw Back**: Immediately throw the ball back to your partner.
5. **Route Variation**: Spice it up by running different routes before catching the ball.
tip: 🧠 Imagine you're a superhero catching and throwing a power orb. Stay light on your feet and react quickly!
short_description: Bounce & Pass Fun works your shoulders, chest, and triceps. Perfect for beginners, this exercise turns teamwork into a high-energy game! 💪

name: Reverse Band Bench Press
instructions: Position a bench inside a power rack, with the bar set to the correct height. Begin by anchoring bands either to band pegs or to the top of the rack. Ensure that you will be position properly under the bands. Attach the other end to the barbell.

Lie on the bench, tuck your feet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help support your weight, lift your shoulder off the bench and retract them, squeezing the shoulder blades together. Use your feet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement. However wide your grip, it should cover the ring on the bar.

Pull the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. Focus on squeezing the bar and trying to pull it apart. Lower the bar to your lower chest or upper stomach. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at all times.
Pause when the barbell touches your torso, and then drive the bar up with as much force as possible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.
subtitle: Push It with Bands!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Position your bench inside a power rack and secure the bands to the top. Attach the other ends to the barbell.
2. **Get Ready:** Lie on the bench, tuck your feet, and arch your back. Squeeze your shoulder blades together by lifting your shoulders off the bench.
3. **Grip and Lift:** Grab the bar, pull it out of the rack, and keep your shoulders squeezed. Lower it to your lower chest or upper stomach.
4. **Press Up:** Pause when the bar touches your torso, then push it up with all your might. Keep your elbows tucked until you lock out.
tip: Imagine you're trying to bend the bar into a rainbow as you press up 🌈. This helps engage your muscles better!
short_description: Want to feel powerful? The Reverse Band Bench Press is your go-to! It targets your triceps and chest, giving you that strong upper body vibe 💪. Plus, it's fun with bands!

name: Reverse Band Box Squat
instructions: Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Set up the bands either on band pegs or attached to the top of the rack, ensuring they will be directly above the bar during the squat. Attach the other end to the bar.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Keep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce off of a box.

Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward off of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe. Use care to return the barbell to the rack.
subtitle: Boost Your Squat Game
new_instructions:
1. Set up the box and bands behind you in the power rack.
2. Step under the bar, place it on your shoulders, and lift it off the rack.
3. Position your feet, keeping your head straight.
4. Lower yourself until seated on the box.
5. Press through your heels to rise back up and return the bar to the rack.
tip: Imagine sitting down on a chair behind you—this helps you keep the right form! 🪑
short_description: The Reverse Band Box Squat is a powerful move to level up your leg day! It targets your quads, glutes, and hamstrings while building strength and stability. Let's squat to greatness! 💥

name: Reverse Band Deadlift
instructions: Set the bar up in a power rack. Attach bands to the top of the rack, using either bands pegs or the frame itself. Attach the other end of the bands to the bar.

Approach the bar so that it is centered over your feet. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, allowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typically, you would use an overhand grip or an over/under grip on heavier sets.

With your feet, and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and bend the knees until your shins contact the bar. Look forward with your head, keep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the heels to move the weight upward.
After the bar passes the knees, aggressively pull the bar back, pulling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the floor.
subtitle: Reverse Band Lift-Off
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Attach bands to the top of a power rack and the other ends to a barbell. Ensure the bar is centered over your feet, which should be hip-width apart.
2. **Grip It:** Bend at the hips and grip the bar at shoulder width. Use an overhand or over/under grip for heavier sets.
3. **Get Ready:** Take a big breath, lower your hips, bend your knees until your shins touch the bar. Keep your chest up and back arched.
4. **Lift Off:** Look forward and drive through your heels to lift the bar. As the bar passes your knees, pull it back and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
5. **Finish:** Drive your hips forward into the bar. Lower it by bending at the hips and guiding it to the floor.
tip: Imagine you're trying to push the ground away with your feet, like a superhero preparing for lift-off! 🚀
short_description: The Reverse Band Deadlift targets your lower back, legs, and core. It's a powerhouse move that'll make you feel like a superhero. Get ready to lift off with this challenging yet rewarding exercise! 💪

name: Reverse Band Power Squat
instructions: Begin in a power rack with the pins and bar set at the appropriate height. After loading the bar, attach bands to the top of the rack, using either pegs or the frame itself. Attach the other end of the bands to the bar.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wide for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings.

Keep your head facing forward. With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips as much as possible. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Lower bar position necessitates a greater torso lean to keep the bar over the heels. Continue until you break parallel, which is defined as the crease of the hip being in line with the top of the knee.

Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe, until you have returned to the starting position.
subtitle: Boosted Squat Power
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Attach bands to the top of the power rack and connect to the barbell. Load the bar and set it at the right height. 
2. **Position:** Step under the bar, place it on your shoulders, squeeze your shoulder blades, and rotate your elbows forward. Lift the bar and step back into position with feet wide. 
3. **Descent:** Keep your head forward, back tight, and core engaged. Push your knees and butt out, sit back with your hips, and lower until your hips break parallel with knees. 
4. **Ascent:** Drive upward from your heels, pushing feet and knees out, and lead with your head. Maintain full-body tightness until standing tall again.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ground away from you as you rise back up. 🌍 This helps you maintain proper form and power through the movement!
short_description: The Reverse Band Power Squat is a powerlifting move that boosts your squat strength using resistance bands. It targets your quads, glutes, hamstrings, and more. Get ready to feel powerful and strong! 💥

name: Reverse Band Sumo Deadlift
