instructions: Begin with a bar loaded on the floor inside of a power rack. Attach bands to the top of the rack, using either pegs or the frame itself. Attach the other end to the barbell.

Approach the bar so that the bar intersects the middle of the feet. The feet should be set very wide, near the collars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hook grip. Relax the shoulders, which in effect lengthens your arms.

Take a breath, and then lower your hips, looking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the floor, spreading your feet apart, with your weight on the back half of your feet. Extend through the hips and knees.
As the bar passes through the knees, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, pulling your shoulder blades together.
Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controlling the weight on the way down.
subtitle: Sumo Power Lift
new_instructions:
1. Place a barbell on the floor and attach bands to the top of the rack.
2. Stand with your feet wide, near the collars of the bar. Bend at the hips to grip the bar with your arms inside your legs.
3. Take a deep breath, lower your hips, and keep your chest up. Look forward and relax your shoulders.
4. Drive through your feet, spreading them apart as you lift. Extend your hips and knees.
5. As the bar passes your knees, lean back and push your hips into the bar. Squeeze your shoulder blades together.
6. Control the weight back down by bending at the hips, returning the bar to the ground.
tip: Imagine you're spreading the floor apart with your feet as you lift. 🦵 This helps engage your glutes and maintain balance.
short_description: Crank up the power with the Reverse Band Sumo Deadlift! This move blitzes your hamstrings, glutes, and more. Feel the burn and own that lift! 💥

name: Reverse Barbell Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at shoulder width with the elbows close to the torso. The palm of your hands should be facing down (pronated grip). This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Upside-Down Curl Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Up:** Keep your torso upright and hold a barbell at shoulder width with your palms facing down.
2. **Curl Up:** Curl the barbell up by contracting your biceps. Only move your forearms.
3. **Hold and Squeeze:** When the bar reaches shoulder level, hold and squeeze your biceps for a second.
4. **Lower Down:** Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position as you breathe in.
5. **Repeat:** Do the recommended number of reps and enjoy the burn!
tip: Imagine you're scooping ice cream with the barbell. 🍦 Keep it smooth and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Reverse Barbell Curls are a fun way to isolate your biceps and forearms. Feel the burn as you curl that barbell with an upside-down grip! 💪

name: Reverse Barbell Preacher Curls
instructions: Grab an EZ-bar using a shoulder width and palms down (pronated) grip.
Now place the upper part of both arms on top of the preacher bench and have your arms extended. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder height. Squeeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the barbell until your upper arms are extended and the biceps is fully stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Pump Up Those Guns!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** an EZ-bar with a shoulder-width, palms-down grip. 
2. **Place** your upper arms on the preacher bench, keeping them extended. This is your starting position. 
3. **Curl** the weight up using your biceps until the barbell is at shoulder height. Squeeze your biceps for a second. 
4. **Lower** the barbell slowly back to the starting position, fully stretching your biceps. 
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions. 
6. **Smile** because you're doing awesome!
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a stress ball at the top of the curl. It helps activate the biceps more! 💪
short_description: Reverse Barbell Preacher Curls are a great way to isolate your biceps and forearms for maximum growth. This intermediate move will have your arms feeling the burn in no time! Keep it up, you’re doing fantastic! 🔥

name: Reverse Cable Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a bar attachment that is attached to a low pulley using a pronated (palms down) and shoulder width grip. Make sure also that you keep the elbows close to the torso. This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Curl Up and Flex! 💪
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Stand up straight with your torso upright and hold the bar attachment using an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
2. **Keep Elbows Tight**: Make sure your elbows stay close to your torso. This is your starting position.
3. **Curl Up**: While keeping your upper arms still, curl the bar up by contracting your biceps. Breathe out as you lift.
4. **Squeeze**: When the bar reaches shoulder level, hold the position for a second and squeeze your biceps tight.
5. **Lower Slowly**: Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position while breathing in.
6. **Repeat**: Continue for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a small sponge with your biceps as you lift the bar. This helps you focus on the muscle contraction. 🧽
short_description: The Reverse Cable Curl is a fun way to work your biceps and forearms using a cable machine. It's a beginner-friendly move that'll have your arms feeling strong and flex-ready! 💪

name: Reverse Crunch
instructions: Lie down on the floor with your legs fully extended and arms to the side of your torso with the palms on the floor. Your arms should be stationary for the entire exercise.
Move your legs up so that your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and feet are together and parallel to the floor. This is the starting position.
While inhaling, move your legs towards the torso as you roll your pelvis backwards and you raise your hips off the floor. At the end of this movement your knees will be touching your chest.
Hold the contraction for a second and move your legs back to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Roll with It!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides, palms on the floor.
2. **Lift your legs** so your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and feet are parallel. This is your starting position.
3. **Roll your pelvis** backwards, bringing your knees towards your chest as you lift your hips off the floor. Inhale as you do this.
4. **Hold for a second**, feeling the squeeze in your abs.
5. **Lower your legs** back to the starting position while exhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the set number of reps. You've got this!
tip: Imagine you're rolling your hips like a wave 🌊. Smooth and controlled movements help target your abs better!
short_description: Reverse Crunches are awesome for targeting your lower abs! 🌟 Lie on your back, lift your legs, and roll those hips up. It's a fun and effective move to strengthen your core. Give it a try!

name: Reverse Flyes
instructions: To begin, lie down on an incline bench with the chest and stomach pressing against the incline. Have the dumbbells in each hand with the palms facing each other (neutral grip).

Extend the arms in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the angle of the bench. The legs should be stationary while applying pressure with the ball of your toes. This is the starting position.

Maintaining the slight bend of the elbows, move the weights out and away from each other (to the side) in an arc motion while exhaling. Tip: Try to squeeze your shoulder blades together to get the best results from this exercise.
The arms should be elevated until they are parallel to the floor.
Feel the contraction and slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Fly Like a Butterfly
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on an incline bench with your chest and stomach against the bench. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other.
2. **Extend your arms** in front of you, making them perpendicular to the bench. Keep your legs still and press with the balls of your feet. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift the weights** out to the side in an arc, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Exhale as you do this.
4. **Raise your arms** until they are parallel to the floor. Feel the burn in your shoulders!
5. **Slowly lower** the weights back to the starting position while inhaling. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions. Keep smiling and flying!
tip: 🦋 Imagine you're a butterfly spreading your wings. Squeeze those shoulder blades like you're trying to pinch a pencil between them!
short_description: Reverse Flyes make your shoulders strong and toned! Perfect for beginners, this exercise helps you spread your wings and fly. Grab some dumbbells and let’s get those shoulders soaring! 🦋

name: Reverse Flyes With External Rotation
instructions: To begin, lie down on an incline bench set at a 30-degree angle with the chest and stomach pressing against the incline.

Have the dumbbells in each hand with the palms facing down to the floor. Your arms should be in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the angle of the bench. Tip: Your elbows should have a slight bend. The legs should be stationary while applying pressure with the ball of your toes (your heels should not be touching the floor). This is the starting position.
Maintaining the slight bend of the elbows, move the weights out and away from each other in an arc motion while exhaling.

As you lift the weight, your wrist should externally rotate by 90-degrees so that you go from a palms down (pronated) grip to a palms facing each other (neutral) grip. Tip: Try to squeeze your shoulder blades together to get the best results from this exercise.
The arms should be elevated until they are level with the head.
Feel the contraction and slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Fly High with Dumbbells
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on an incline bench set at a 30-degree angle, keeping your chest and stomach pressed against it.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing down, arms in front, and a slight bend in your elbows. Keep your legs stationary and apply pressure with the balls of your toes.
3. Exhale and move the weights out and away from each other in an arc motion, rotating your wrists by 90 degrees so palms face each other.
4. Lift your arms until they're level with your head, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
5. Inhale and slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings! 🦅 Squeeze your shoulder blades together to get the best results.
short_description: Reverse Flyes with External Rotation targets your shoulders and helps build strength and stability. Feel like a bird spreading its wings and enjoy the shoulder burn! 🦅

name: Reverse Grip Bent-Over Rows
instructions: Stand erect while holding a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing up).

Bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up. The barbell should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keeping the torso stationary, lift the barbell as you breathe out, keeping the elbows close to the body and not doing any force with the forearm other than holding the weights. On the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Row Your Way Strong!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall:** Grab the barbell with palms facing up.
2. **Bend slightly:** Keep knees soft and bend from your waist.
3. **Keep straight:** Make sure your back is flat and head is up.
4. **Row the bar:** Pull it towards your belly, elbows close in.
5. **Squeeze:** Hold and feel your back muscles work.
6. **Lower slowly:** Return the barbell to start and repeat.
tip: 🧠 Imagine squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades with every row!
short_description: Reverse Grip Bent-Over Rows are fantastic for sculpting your middle back and boosting bicep strength. Feel powerful and tall as you row your way to a stronger you! 💪

name: Reverse Grip Triceps Pushdown
instructions: Start by setting a bar attachment (straight or e-z) on a high pulley machine.

Facing the bar attachment, grab it with the palms facing up (supinated grip) at shoulder width. Lower the bar by using your lats until your arms are fully extended by your sides. Tip: Elbows should be in by your sides and your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
Slowly elevate the bar attachment up as you inhale so it is aligned with your chest. Only the forearms should move and the elbows/upper arms should be stationary by your side at all times.
Then begin to lower the cable bar back down to the original staring position while exhaling and contracting the triceps hard.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Tamer
new_instructions:
1. Set up a bar attachment on a high pulley machine. 
2. Face the bar and grab it with your palms facing up at shoulder width. Lower the bar using your lats until your arms are fully extended by your sides. Keep your elbows by your sides and feet shoulder-width apart. 
3. Slowly lift the bar up to your chest level while inhaling. Keep your elbows and upper arms stationary by your side. 
4. Lower the bar back to the starting position while exhaling and squeezing your triceps. 
5. Repeat for the recommended amount of reps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to squeeze a lemon between your triceps to get the most juice out! 🍋
short_description: The Reverse Grip Triceps Pushdown targets your triceps using a cable machine with an underhand grip. It's perfect for beginners looking to build those upper arm muscles. Get ready to feel the burn and show off your strong, toned arms! 💪

name: Reverse Hyperextension
instructions: Place your feet between the pads after loading an appropriate weight. Lay on the top pad, allowing your hips to hang off the back, while grasping the handles to hold your position.
To begin the movement, flex the hips, pulling the legs forward.
Reverse the motion by extending the hips, kicking the leg back. It is very important not to over-extend the hip on this movement, stopping short of your full range of motion.
Return by again flexing the hip, pulling the carriage forward as far as you can.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Happy Hamstring Helpers
new_instructions:
1. **Lie Down**: Place your feet between the pads and lay your belly on the top pad, with your hips hanging off the back. Hold the handles tight. 
2. **Flex**: Pull your legs forward by flexing your hips. 
3. **Kick Back**: Extend your hips to kick your legs back. Don't overdo it—stop before you over-extend. 
4. **Return**: Flex your hips again to pull the carriage forward as far as you can. 
5. **Repeat**: Go through these steps for your desired number of reps. 
6. **Relax**: Take a moment to rest before your next set.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero flying through the sky 🦸‍♂️. Keep your movements controlled and steady for a smooth flight!
short_description: Strengthen your hamstrings, calves, and glutes with Reverse Hyperextensions. This intermediate machine exercise is your ticket to powerful legs and a strong back. 🌟

name: Reverse Machine Flyes
instructions: Adjust the handles so that they are fully to the rear. Make an appropriate weight selection and adjust the seat height so the handles are at shoulder level. Grasp the handles with your hands facing inwards. This will be your starting position.
In a semicircular motion, pull your hands out to your side and back, contracting your rear delts.
Keep your arms slightly bent throughout the movement, with all of the motion occurring at the shoulder joint.
Pause at the rear of the movement, and slowly return the weight to the starting position.
subtitle: Fly High, Feel the Burn!
new_instructions:
1. Adjust the machine handles to the rear and select your weight. Sit down and set the seat height so handles are at shoulder level. 
2. Grab the handles with your palms facing inwards. This is your starting position. 
3. Pull your hands out to your sides in a semicircle, feeling your shoulder muscles engage. 
4. Keep your arms slightly bent, moving only at the shoulders. 
5. Pause when your arms are fully extended, then slowly bring the handles back to start. 
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your movements smooth and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're spreading your wings like a majestic bird 🦅. This helps to focus on using your shoulder muscles.
short_description: Reverse Machine Flyes are a beginner-friendly shoulder exercise. They zero in on your rear delts, helping to build strength and stability. Give this a try and fly high! 🦅

name: Reverse Plate Curls
instructions: Start by standing straight with a weighted plate held by both hands and arms fully extended. Use a pronated grip (palms facing down) and make sure your fingers grab the rough side of the plate while your thumb grabs the smooth side. Note: For the best results, grab the weighted plate at an 11:00 and 1:00 o'clock position.
Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other and the weighted plate should be near the groin area. This is the starting position.

Slowly lift the plate up while keeping the elbows in and the upper arms stationary until your biceps and forearms touch while exhaling. The plate should be evenly aligned with your torso at this point.
Feel the contraction for a second and begin to lower the weight back down to the starting position while inhaling
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boost Curl
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart and grab a weighted plate with both hands, palms facing down.
2. **Hold the plate** near your groin area, keeping your arms fully extended. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift the plate** slowly, keeping your elbows in and upper arms still, until your biceps and forearms touch. Exhale as you do this.
4. **Squeeze your biceps** at the top and hold for a second for maximum contraction.
5. **Lower the plate** back down to the starting position slowly while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping the movement controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine you're lifting a golden trophy 🏆 to celebrate your hard work. Keep your elbows close to your body to make sure your biceps do all the lifting!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Reverse Plate Curl! This move isolates your biceps and forearms, giving you a solid arm workout. Stay steady and feel that awesome burn! 💪

name: Reverse Triceps Bench Press
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a close, supinated grip (around shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked extended in front of you and perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.

As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your middle chest. Tip: Make sure that as opposed to a regular bench press, you keep the elbows close to the torso at all times in order to maximize triceps involvement.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your triceps muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Push Up Your Triceps!
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with a barbell, palms up, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it straight over you, arms locked out and perpendicular to the floor.
3. Inhale and slowly lower the bar to your middle chest, keeping elbows close to your torso.
4. Exhale and push the bar back up using your triceps, locking your arms at the top.
5. Lower the bar slowly again, taking twice as long to come down as to lift it, and repeat for desired reps.
6. Carefully place the bar back in the rack when finished.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the bar away from you like you're in a tricep high-five contest! 🤚
short_description: The Reverse Triceps Bench Press is a fantastic move to target your triceps, chest, and shoulders. It's like a bench press with a twist! Get ready to push your limits and feel the burn. 💪

name: Rhomboids-SMR
instructions: Lay down with your back on the floor. Place a foam roll underneath your upper back, and cross your arms in front of you, protracting your shoulders. This will be your starting position.

Raise your hips off of the ground, placing your weight onto the foam roll. Shift your weight to one side at a time, rolling over your middle and upper back. Pause at points of tension for 10-30 seconds.
subtitle: Roll Away Back Tension
new_instructions:
1. **Lay down** with your back on the floor and place a foam roller under your upper back.
2. **Cross your arms** in front of you and **protract your shoulders**. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift your hips** off the ground to put your weight onto the foam roller.
4. **Shift your weight** to one side and then the other, rolling over your middle and upper back.
5. **Pause** at any points of tension for 10-30 seconds before continuing the roll.
tip: 🌀 Imagine you're a rolling pin smoothing out dough—slow and steady wins the race!
short_description: Roll away tension in your middle back with this foam roller move. It's like a mini-massage for your back muscles, especially those rhomboids! Perfect for some relaxation and relief. 🌀

name: Rickshaw Carry
instructions: Position the frame at the starting point, and load with the appropriate weight. Standing in the center of the frame, begin by gripping the handles and driving through your heels to lift the frame. Ensure your chest and head are up and your back is straight.

Immediately begin walking briskly with quick, controlled steps. Keep your chest up and head forward, and make sure you continue breathing. Bring the frame to the ground after you have reached the end point.
subtitle: Strongman Stride
new_instructions:
1. **Load Up**: Position the frame and load it with weights. Stand in the center and grip the handles.
2. **Lift Off**: Drive through your heels to lift the frame. Keep your chest and head up, and back straight.
3. **March Forward**: Walk briskly with quick, controlled steps. Keep your chest up and head forward.
4. **Breathe**: Continue breathing steadily as you move.
5. **Set Down**: Lower the frame to the ground when you reach the end point.
tip: Imagine you're a human forklift 🏗️—keep everything steady and balanced!
short_description: The Rickshaw Carry is a powerhouse move that targets your forearms, abs, and more! 🚀 Lift, walk, and conquer, feeling strong with every step.

name: Rickshaw Deadlift
instructions: Load the frame with the desired weight. Center yourself between the handles. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hips to grip the handles, allowing your shoulder blades to protract.

With your feet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knees. Look forward with your head, keep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the heels to move the weight upward. As the weight comes up, pull your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward.
Lower the weight by bending at the hips and guiding it to the ground.
subtitle: Lift Like a Pro with the Rickshaw
new_instructions:
1. **Load the Frame**: Add weights to the frame. Stand between the handles with feet hip-width apart. 
2. **Grip and Bend**: Bend at your hips and grab the handles. Let your shoulder blades stretch forward. 
3. **Get Set and Breathe**: With feet and grip ready, take a big breath. Lower your hips, bend your knees, keep your chest up, and back arched. Look ahead. 
4. **Drive Up**: Push through your heels to lift the weight. Pull your shoulder blades together and thrust your hips forward. 
5. **Lower the Weight**: Bend at your hips to guide the weight back down to the ground.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful robot lifting a heavy load. Keep your movements smooth and controlled, just like a well-oiled machine 🤖
short_description: The Rickshaw Deadlift is a powerhouse move targeting your quads, glutes, and more. It's a compound lift that'll make you feel strong and unstoppable! 💪

name: Ring Dips
instructions: Grip a ring in each hand, and then take a small jump to help you get into the starting position with your arms locked out.
Begin by flexing the elbow, lowering your body until your arms break 90 degrees. Avoid swinging, and maintain good posture throughout the descent.
Reverse the motion by extending the elbow, pushing yourself back up into the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Dip to Get Fit
new_instructions:
1. **Grip** the rings firmly in each hand and take a small jump to get into position with your arms straight. 
2. **Lower** your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at a 90-degree angle. Keep your body steady and avoid swinging. 
3. **Push** yourself back up by straightening your elbows to return to the starting position. 
4. **Repeat** the dip for your desired number of reps, keeping a steady pace.
tip: Imagine you're lowering yourself into a pool of jello - move smoothly and don't rush! 🏊
short_description: Ring Dips are a fantastic upper body workout that targets your triceps, chest, and shoulders. You'll feel like a gymnast as you dip and rise! 💪

name: Rocket Jump
instructions: Begin in a relaxed stance with your feet shoulder width apart and hold your arms close to the body.
To initiate the move, squat down halfway and explode back up as high as possible.
Fully extend your entire body, reaching overhead as far as possible. As you land, absorb your impact through the legs.
subtitle: Blast Off with Rocket Jumps!
new_instructions:
1. Stand relaxed with feet shoulder-width apart and arms close to your body.
2. Squat halfway down, then explode upwards as high as you can.
3. Fully extend your body and reach overhead while jumping.
4. Land gently and absorb the impact with your legs.
5. Repeat the jump, maintaining a steady rhythm.
tip: Imagine you're launching like a rocket 🚀. Reach for the stars, but remember to land softly like you're on the moon!
short_description: Get ready to launch with Rocket Jumps! This fun and energetic move targets your quads, calves, and hamstrings, giving you a full lower-body workout. Perfect for beginners looking to add some plyometric power to their routine! 🌟

name: Rocking Standing Calf Raise
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place it on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck).
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance. Also maintain a straight back and keep the knees with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position.

Raise your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending (other than the slight initial bend we created during positioning) at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Now lift your toes by contracting the tibia muscles in the front of the calves as you breathe out.
Hold for a second and bring them back down as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Calf Rockin' Fun
new_instructions:
1. Set up the bar at shoulder height on a squat rack. Step under it, placing it on your shoulders just below the neck.
2. Step away from the rack with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Keep your head up, back straight, and knees slightly bent.
3. Raise your heels by extending your ankles as high as possible. Flex your calves and hold for a second.
4. Lower your heels back to the start, stretching your calves. Breathe in as you do this.
5. Lift your toes by contracting the muscles in front of your calves. Hold for a second, then bring them back down.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps.
tip: Imagine you're reaching for the stars on your tiptoes! 🌟 This keeps your movements tall and strong.
short_description: Rock those calves with this fun, beginner-friendly move! Strengthen and flex your calves, all while feeling like you're reaching for the stars. 🌟

name: Rocky Pull-Ups/Pulldowns
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing forward using a wide grip.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

Pull your torso up until the bar touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched.

Now repeat the same movements as described above except this time your torso will remain straight as you go up and the bar will touch the back of the neck instead of the upper chest. Tip: Use the head to lean forward slightly as it will help you properly execute this portion of the exercise.
Once you have lowered yourself back down to the starting position, repeat the exercise for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.
subtitle: Rocky Pull-Up Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the pull-up bar with your palms facing forward and use a wide grip.
2. **Lean** your torso back about 30 degrees, arching your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.
3. **Pull** your torso up until the bar touches your upper chest, squeezing your back muscles. Exhale as you pull.
4. **Lower** yourself slowly back to the starting position, fully extending your arms and stretching your lats. Inhale as you lower.
5. **Repeat** the pull, but this time keep your torso straight and touch the bar to the back of your neck. Lean your head forward slightly.
6. **Lower** yourself again and repeat for the number of reps in your program.
tip: Think of pulling yourself up like you're climbing over a wall to escape a zombie! 🧟‍♂️ It keeps you motivated and focused.
short_description: Rocky Pull-Ups/Pulldowns are a fantastic combo move that targets your lats, biceps, back, and shoulders. Perfect for those looking to build serious upper body strength while feeling like a champ! 🏆

name: Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Put a barbell in front of you on the ground and grab it using a pronated (palms facing down) grip that a little wider than shoulder width. Tip: Depending on the weight used, you may need wrist wraps to perform the exercise and also a raised platform in order to allow for better range of motion.
Bend the knees slightly and keep the shins vertical, hips back and back straight. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your back and arms completely straight at all times, use your hips to lift the bar as you exhale. Tip: The movement should not be fast but steady and under control.

Once you are standing completely straight up, lower the bar by pushing the hips back, only slightly bending the knees, unlike when squatting. Tip: Take a deep breath at the start of the movement and keep your chest up. Hold your breath as you lower and exhale as you complete the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift and Lower with Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a barbell in front of you, gripping it palms down, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. **Bend knees** just a bit, keep shins vertical, push hips back, and keep your back straight.
3. **Lift the bar** using your hips, keeping back and arms straight. Exhale as you lift.
4. **Straighten up** fully, then push your hips back to lower the bar, bending knees slightly.
5. **Breathe deeply** at the start, holding your chest up, exhale as you finish the move.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping your movements controlled.
tip: Imagine your hips are a hinge! 🔄 Keep the motion smooth and controlled like a well-oiled machine.
short_description: The Romanian Deadlift is a fantastic move for your hamstrings, glutes, and lower back. Feel the power as you lift and lower the barbell, building strength and stability. 🔥

name: Romanian Deadlift from Deficit
instructions: Begin standing while holding a bar at arm's length in front of you. You can stand on a raised platform to increase the range of motion.

Begin by flexing the knees slightly, and then flex at the hip, moving your butt back as far as possible, lowering the torso as far as flexibility allows. The back should remain in absolute extension at all times, and the bar should remain in contact with the legs. If done properly, there should be heavy tension felt in the hamstrings.
Reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Lift and Lower with Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** on a raised platform with a barbell in front of you, arms straight.
2. **Bend your knees slightly** and push your hips back, lowering your torso.
3. **Keep the bar close** to your legs and maintain a straight back as you lower.
4. **Feel the stretch** in your hamstrings as you go down.
5. **Lift back up** by reversing the motion until you're standing tall again.
tip: Imagine you're closing a car door with your butt 🚗🍑. Push your hips back as far as you can!
short_description: Boost your hamstrings with the Romanian Deadlift from Deficit! This move strengthens your legs, glutes, and back, giving you a powerful stance. Get ready to lift and feel awesome! 💪

name: Rope Climb
instructions: Grab the rope with both hands above your head. Pull down on the rope as you take a small jump.
Wrap the rope around one leg, using your feet to pinch the rope. Reach up as high as possible with your arms, gripping the rope tightly.
Release the rope from your feet as you pull yourself up with your arms, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Resecure your feet on the rope, and then stand up to take another high hold on the rope. Continue until you reach the top of the rope.
To lower yourself, loosen the grip of your feet on the rope as you slide down using a hand over hand motion.
subtitle: Climb the Rope, Conquer the Day!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the rope with both hands above your head and **jump** slightly while **pulling** down on the rope.
2. **Wrap** the rope around one leg and **pinch** it with your feet. **Reach** up high with your arms and **grip** the rope tightly.
3. **Release** the rope from your feet and **pull** yourself up with your arms, **bringing** your knees towards your chest.
4. **Secure** your feet back on the rope and **stand** up to **take** another high hold on the rope. **Continue** climbing until you reach the top.
5. To **descend**, **loosen** the grip of your feet on the rope and **slide** down using a hand-over-hand motion.
tip: Imagine you're a ninja scaling a fortress wall 🥷. Keep your movements smooth and controlled for a safer climb!
short_description: Rope Climb is the ultimate test of upper body strength and coordination. Feel like a hero as you scale your way up! 💪 Perfect for building strong lats, biceps, and forearms.

name: Rope Crunch
instructions: Kneel 1-2 feet in front of a cable system with a rope attached.
After selecting an appropriate weight, grasp the rope with both hands reaching overhead. Your torso should be upright in the starting position.
To begin, flex at the spine, attempting to bring your rib cage to your legs as you pull the cable down.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then slowly return to the starting position.
These can be done with twists or to the side to hit the obliques.
subtitle: Crunch those Abs with a Cable!
new_instructions:
1. **Kneel** 1-2 feet in front of a cable system with a rope attached.
2. **Grab** the rope with both hands reaching overhead, keeping your torso upright.
3. **Flex** at your spine, pulling the rope down and bringing your rib cage towards your legs.
4. **Pause** at the bottom of the motion, feeling the squeeze in your abs.
5. **Slowly return** to the starting position to complete the rep.
6. **Optional:** Add a twist to hit the obliques!
tip: Imagine you're a shrimp curling up into its shell 🦐. This helps you focus on crunching effectively.
short_description: Get ready to crunch those abs with the Rope Crunch! This move isolates your core, making it a fantastic exercise for beginners. Grab a rope, kneel down, and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Rope Jumping
instructions: Hold an end of the rope in each hand. Position the rope behind you on the ground. Raise your arms up and turn the rope over your head bringing it down in front of you. When it reaches the ground, jump over it. Find a good turning pace that can be maintained. Different speeds and techniques can be used to introduce variation.
Rope jumping is exciting, challenges your coordination, and requires a lot of energy. A 150 lb person will burn about 350 calories jumping rope for 30 minutes, compared to over 450 calories running.
subtitle: Jump to Joy!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** each end of the rope in your hands. 
2. **Place** the rope behind you on the ground. 
3. **Swing** your arms up and over your head, bringing the rope down in front of you. 
4. **Jump** over the rope as it hits the ground. 
5. **Find** a steady rhythm and stick to it. 
6. **Mix** it up with different speeds and techniques to keep it fun!
tip: Imagine you're hopping over tiny rainbows 🌈. Keep your jumps light and quick to stay efficient and save energy!
short_description: Rope jumping is a high-energy cardio workout that boosts coordination and burns calories fast! It's like dancing with a rope—fun, challenging, and super effective! 🔥

name: Rope Straight-Arm Pulldown
instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley and make your weight selection. Stand a couple feet back from the pulley with your feet staggered and take the rope with both hands. Lean forward from the hip, keeping your back straight, with your arms extended up in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, extend the shoulder to pull the rope down to your thighs.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, squeezing your lats.
Return to the starting position without allowing the weight to fully rest on the stack.
subtitle: Rope Down, Muscle Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** a rope to a high pulley and choose your weight.
2. **Stand** a few feet back, with feet staggered, holding the rope with both hands.
3. **Lean** forward from your hips, back straight, arms extended up in front.
4. **Pull** the rope down to your thighs by extending your shoulders, keeping arms straight.
5. **Pause** and squeeze your lats at the bottom.
6. **Return** to the start without letting the weight rest on the stack.
tip: Think of pulling a giant bell rope to ring a victory bell 🎐. Keep those arms straight for maximum lat engagement!
short_description: Get ready to engage your lats with the Rope Straight-Arm Pulldown! This beginner-friendly move is great for isolating your back muscles and building strength. Plus, you'll feel like a total champ ringing that victory bell! 💪

name: Round The World Shoulder Stretch
instructions: Stand up straight with your legs together, holding a bodybar or broomstick.
Hold the pole behind your hips with a wider than shoulder width grip. Your palms should be down and your thumbs facing out.
Slowly lift your arms up behind your head. Don't force it if it gets hard to lift further.
subtitle: Round and Relax
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your legs together, holding a bodybar or broomstick behind your hips.
2. Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width, palms facing down, thumbs out.
3. Slowly lift the bar up behind your head, feeling the stretch in your shoulders.
4. Stop lifting if it gets tough; don't force it.
5. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then gently lower the bar back down.
6. Repeat a few times, enjoying the shoulder relief.
tip: Imagine you're painting a big rainbow behind you with the bar 🌈. This helps you visualize a smooth, controlled movement.
short_description: The Round The World Shoulder Stretch loosens up your shoulders, chest, and biceps. Perfect for beginners, this move feels awesome and helps ease tight muscles. 🌟

name: Rowing, Stationary
instructions: To begin, seat yourself on the rower. Make sure that your heels are resting comfortably against the base of the foot pedals and that the straps are secured. Select the program that you wish to use, if applicable. Sit up straight and bend forward at the hips.

There are three phases of movement when using a rower. The first phase is when you come forward on the rower. Your knees are bent and against your chest. Your upper body is leaning slightly forward while still maintaining good posture. Next, push against the foot pedals and extend your legs while bringing your hands to your upper abdominal area, squeezing your shoulders back as you do so. To avoid straining your back, use primarily your leg and hip muscles.
The recovery phase simply involves straightening your arms, bending the knees, and bringing your body forward again as you transition back into the first phase.
subtitle: Row, Row, Row Your Workout!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit Down**: Find the seat on the rowing machine and sit down. Secure your feet in the foot straps and grab the handle with both hands.
2. **Start Position**: Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest. Lean slightly forward while keeping your back straight.
3. **Drive Phase**: Push off with your legs, extending them fully. As you do this, pull the handle towards your upper abs. Keep your shoulders back.
4. **Finish Phase**: Lean back slightly as you pull, and make sure your legs are straight and your hands are close to your body.
5. **Recovery Phase**: Extend your arms first, then bend your knees to slide the seat forward, and return to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're rowing a boat on a calm lake. 🛶 Keep your movements fluid and strong, like you're gliding across the water. Visualize the smooth, continuous motion!
short_description: Stationary rowing is a fantastic full-body workout that targets your legs, core, and arms. 🚣‍♂️ It's like taking a boat trip without leaving the gym. Get ready to build strength and endurance with every stroke!

name: Runner's Stretch
instructions: It's easiest to get into this stretch if you start standing up, put one leg behind you, and slowly lower your torso down to the floor.
Keep the front heel on the floor (if it lifts up, scoot your other leg further back).

Place your hands on either side of your front leg. To get more out of this stretch, push your butt up toward the ceiling, and then gradually lower it back toward the floor. You'll Stretch the hip flexor of the back leg and the hamstring and buttocks of the front.
subtitle: Stretch it like a runner!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall**: Start by standing up straight.
2. **Step back**: Put one leg behind you.
3. **Lower down**: Slowly lower your torso towards the floor.
4. **Heel down**: Keep the front heel on the floor; if it lifts, move the other leg back.
5. **Hands down**: Place your hands on either side of your front leg.
6. **Butt up**: Push your butt up towards the ceiling, then slowly lower it back down.
tip: Imagine you're a cat stretching after a nap. 🐱 Stretch long and slow for the best results!
short_description: The Runner's Stretch is perfect for stretching those hamstrings and calves. Great for beginners, it'll make you feel ready to sprint! 🏃‍♂️

name: Running, Treadmill
instructions: To begin, step onto the treadmill and select the desired option from the menu. Most treadmills have a manual setting, or you can select a program to run. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.

Treadmills offer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usually have less impact than running outside. A 150 lb person will burn over 450 calories running 8 miles per hour for 30 minutes. Maintain proper posture as you run, and only hold onto the handles when necessary, such as when dismounting or checking your heart rate.
subtitle: Treadmill Dash Delight
new_instructions:
1. **Step** onto the treadmill and **choose** a workout setting from the menu. 
2. **Enter** your age and weight to get an estimate of calories burned. 
3. **Adjust** the elevation to make your run easier or harder. 
4. **Start** running at a comfortable pace, keeping good posture. 
5. **Grab** the handles only if you need to check your heart rate or dismount. 
6. **Enjoy** the run and let the treadmill do the work!
tip: 🏃‍♂️ Imagine you're a superhero on a mission! Keep your posture upright, and pretend the treadmill is your personal runway. It'll help you stay motivated and keep your form in check.
short_description: Hop on the treadmill and get ready to run! This exercise boosts your cardio, burns calories, and tones your legs. Plus, it's easy on your joints. 🏃‍♀️

name: Russian Twist
instructions: Lie down on the floor placing your feet either under something that will not move or by having a partner hold them. Your legs should be bent at the knees.

Elevate your upper body so that it creates an imaginary V-shape with your thighs. Your arms should be fully extended in front of you perpendicular to your torso and with the hands clasped. This is the starting position.
Twist your torso to the right side until your arms are parallel with the floor while breathing out.
Hold the contraction for a second and move back to the starting position while breathing out. Now move to the opposite side performing the same techniques you applied to the right side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Twist and Shout
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat, or tuck them under something sturdy.
2. **Lean back** slightly to create a V-shape with your torso and thighs, keeping your back straight.
3. **Extend** your arms in front of you, clasping your hands together.
4. **Twist** your torso to the right, moving your arms parallel to the floor. **Exhale** as you twist.
5. **Pause** for a moment, then **return** to the center. Now, **twist** to the left and repeat.
6. **Continue** alternating sides for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're ringing out a wet towel with your abs as you twist! 🌀
short_description: Get ready to carve those abs with the Russian Twist! This move will fire up your core and even engage your lower back. Feel the burn and twist your way to a stronger middle! 🔥

name: Sandbag Load
instructions: To load sandbags or other objects, begin with the implements placed a distance from the loading platform, typically 50 feet.

Begin by lifting the sandbag. Sandbags are extremely awkward, and the manner of lifting them can vary depending on the particular sandbag used. Reach as far around it as possible, extending through the hips and knees to pull it up high. Shouldering is usually not allowed.
Move as quickly as possible to the platform, and load it, extending through your hips, knees, and ankles to get it as high as possible. Place it onto the platform, ensuring it doesn't fall off.
Return to the starting position to retrieve the next sandbag, and repeat until the event is completed.
subtitle: Lift, Carry, Load - Repeat!
new_instructions:
1. **Lift**: Grab the sandbag with both hands, hugging it close to your body. 
2. **Pull Up**: Use your legs and hips to lift the sandbag off the ground. 
3. **Carry**: Move quickly towards the loading platform while holding the sandbag tight. 
4. **Load**: Extend your hips, knees, and ankles to lift the sandbag onto the platform. 
5. **Secure**: Make sure the sandbag is stable and won't fall off. 
6. **Repeat**: Go back and grab another sandbag, and do it all over again!
tip: Think of the sandbag as a big, squishy teddy bear 🧸! Hug it tight and lift with your legs, not your back.
short_description: The Sandbag Load is a fun and effective way to build strength and endurance. Hug, lift, carry, and load to work multiple muscles and feel like a powerhouse! 💪

name: Scapular Pull-Up
instructions: Take a pronated grip on a pull-up bar.
From a hanging position, raise yourself a few inches without using your arms. Do this by depressing your shoulder girdle in a reverse shrugging motion.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position before performing more repetitions.
subtitle: Shrug it off!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the pull-up bar with an overhand grip.
2. **Hang** from the bar, letting your body relax.
3. **Lift** your body a few inches by pulling your shoulder blades down and back without bending your arms.
4. **Pause** and feel the squeeze in your upper back.
5. **Lower** yourself back to the starting position slowly.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to squeeze a pencil between your shoulder blades! 🪄
short_description: The Scapular Pull-Up is perfect for beginners looking to strengthen their traps and mid-back. It’s a simple but effective move that focuses on isolating these muscles. Give it a try and feel the magic! ✨

name: Scissor Kick
instructions: To begin, lie down with your back pressed against the floor or on an exercise mat (optional). Your arms should be fully extended to the sides with your palms facing down. Note: The arms should be stationary the entire time.
With a slight bend at the knees, lift your legs up so that your heels are about 6 inches off the ground. This is the starting position.
Now lift your left leg up to about a 45 degree angle while your right leg is lowered until the heel is about 2-3 inches from the ground.
Switch movements by raising your right leg up and lowering your left leg. Remember to breathe while performing this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Snappy Scissor Kicks
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with arms by your sides, palms down. Keep them still! 
2. Bend your knees slightly and lift your legs so heels hover 6 inches off the ground. This is your starting spot.
3. Lift your left leg to a 45-degree angle while lowering your right leg close to the ground.
4. Swap legs! Lift your right leg up and lower your left leg down.
5. Keep switching legs and remember to breathe as you go.
6. Continue the scissor motion for your set number of reps.
tip: Imagine slicing through water with your legs like a pair of scissors ✂️. This helps keep your movements smooth and controlled!
short_description: Feel the burn in your abs with Snappy Scissor Kicks! This beginner-friendly move is perfect for toning your core. Get ready to slice through your workout routine! ✨

name: Scissors Jump
instructions: Assume a lunge stance position with one foot forward with the knee bent, and the rear knee nearly touching the ground.
Ensure that the front knee is over the midline of the foot. Extending through both legs, jump as high as possible, swinging your arms to gain lift.
As you jump as high as you can, switch the position of your legs, moving your front leg to the back and the rear leg to the front.
As you land, absorb the impact through the legs by adopting the lunge position, and repeat.
subtitle: Jump and Switch!
new_instructions:
1. **Start**: Get into a lunge position with one foot forward and the other foot back. Keep your front knee above your foot and your back knee close to the ground.
2. **Jump**: Push through both legs and jump up as high as you can. Swing your arms up to help lift off the ground.
3. **Switch**: In mid-air, switch your legs so that your front leg goes back and your back leg comes forward.
4. **Land**: Come down softly, landing back into a lunge position. Absorb the impact with your legs.
5. **Repeat**: Keep jumping and switching legs with each jump.
tip: Imagine you're a ninja quickly switching places! 🥷 This will help you move swiftly and land gently.
short_description: Scissors Jumps are a fun way to get your heart pumping and legs burning! 🦵 Perfect for beginners, this exercise works your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Jump high and switch it up!

name: Seated Band Hamstring Curl
instructions: Secure a band close to the ground and place a bench a couple feet away from it.
Seat yourself on the bench and secure the band behind your ankles, beginning with your legs straight. This will be your starting position.
Flex the knees, bringing your feet towards the bench. You may need to lean back slightly to keep your feet from striking the floor.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position.
subtitle: Hamstring Happy Curls
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a bench with a resistance band secured near the ground behind you.
2. **Hook** the band around your ankles with your legs extended straight out.
3. **Bend** your knees, pulling your feet towards the bench. Lean back a little if needed.
4. **Pause** when your feet are close to the bench, feeling the squeeze in your hamstrings.
5. **Slowly** extend your legs back to the starting position. Repeat and enjoy the burn!
tip: Pretend you're curling your feet to scoop up an imaginary ball from the ground! 🎾 Keep that image in your mind to control the movement.
short_description: Get those hamstrings happy with Seated Band Hamstring Curls! This beginner-friendly move isolates your hamstrings, making them stronger and more flexible. Perfect for a quick, effective workout session. 🏋️

name: Seated Barbell Military Press
instructions: Sit on a Military Press Bench with a bar behind your head and either have a spotter give you the bar (better on the rotator cuff this way) or pick it up yourself carefully with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than shoulder width and it should create a 90-degree angle between the forearm and the upper arm as the barbell goes down.

Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the collarbone slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Power Up Your Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a Military Press Bench with a bar behind your head. Use a spotter to help you lift the bar or pick it up yourself with palms facing forward. Your grip should be wider than your shoulders. 
2. **Lift** the bar over your head by locking your arms. Hold it at shoulder level, slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position. 
3. **Lower** the bar down to your collarbone slowly as you inhale. 
4. **Push** the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine pushing the ceiling up with the barbell! 🚀 Keep your core tight to stay balanced.
short_description: Boost your shoulder strength with the Seated Barbell Military Press! It's great for building those deltoids and triceps. Get ready to feel the burn and power up! 💪

name: Seated Barbell Twist
instructions: Start out by sitting at the end of a flat bench with a barbell placed on top of your thighs. Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other.
Grip the bar with your palms facing down and make sure your hands are wider than shoulder width apart from each other. Begin to lift the barbell up over your head until your arms are fully extended.
Now lower the barbell behind your head until it is resting along the base of your neck. This is the starting position.

While keeping your feet and head stationary, move your waist from side to side so that your oblique muscles feel the contraction. Only move from side to side as far as your waist will allow you to go. Stretching or moving too far can cause an injury to occur. Tip: Use a slow and controlled motion.
Remember to breathe out while twisting your body to the side and in when moving back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Twist and Shout!
new_instructions:
1. Sit at the end of a flat bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell on your thighs.
2. Grip the barbell with palms facing down, hands wider than shoulder-width. Lift it over your head until arms are straight.
3. Lower the barbell behind your head to rest at the base of your neck. This is your starting position.
4. Twist your waist from side to side, keeping your feet and head still. Feel the obliques working!
5. Breathe out as you twist, and in as you return to the start.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're wringing out a wet towel. Twist slowly and with control to really engage those obliques! 🌀
short_description: Seated Barbell Twists fire up your abs while you sit! It's a fun way to sculpt your core, perfect for beginners. Feel those obliques burn and twist your way to a stronger midsection! 🔥

name: Seated Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: Sit down at the end of a flat bench with a dumbbell in one arm using a neutral grip (palms of the hand facing you).
Bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Make sure that you keep the head up.

The upper arm with the dumbbell should be close to the torso and aligned with it (lifted up until it is parallel to the floor while the forearms are pointing towards the floor as the hands hold the weights). Tip: There should be a 90-degree angle between the forearms and the upper arm. This is your starting position.

Keeping the upper arm stationary, use the triceps to lift the weight as you exhale until the forearm is parallel to the floor and the whole arm is extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Single Arm Tricep Power Push
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a bench and grab a dumbbell with one hand, palm facing your body.
2. **Bend** your knees slightly and lean forward, keeping your back straight and head up.
3. **Align** your upper arm with your torso, holding the dumbbell at a 90-degree angle. This is your start.
4. **Extend** your arm, lifting the dumbbell until it's straight and your forearm is parallel to the floor. Only your forearm should move!
5. **Pause** for a second, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the start.
6. **Repeat** for your set reps, then switch arms and go again!
tip: 🧘‍♂️ Imagine your arm as a strong, steady lever - keep it controlled and smooth for the best results!
short_description: Pump up your triceps with this seated, one-arm dumbbell extension. It's perfect for beginners and focuses on isolating those tricep muscles. Power through and feel the burn! 💪

name: Seated Bent-Over Rear Delt Raise
instructions: Place a couple of dumbbells looking forward in front of a flat bench.
Sit on the end of the bench with your legs together and the dumbbells behind your calves.
Bend at the waist while keeping the back straight in order to pick up the dumbbells. The palms of your hands should be facing each other as you pick them. This will be your starting position.

Keeping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms slightly bent at the elbows, lift the dumbbells straight to the side until both arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift the weights. (Note: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms back as opposed to the side.)
After a one second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift and Smile!
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the end of a flat bench with dumbbells behind your calves.
2. Bend at the waist, keeping your back straight, and pick up the dumbbells with palms facing each other.
3. Keep your torso still and lift the dumbbells straight to the side until your arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift.
4. Hold for one second at the top.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you’re a bird spreading its wings 🦅. Keep that back straight and soar!
short_description: Ready to make those shoulders pop? The Seated Bent-Over Rear Delt Raise is a fab move to isolate and strengthen your rear delts. Let’s get lifting and feel those wings take flight! 🦅

name: Seated Bent-Over Two-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: Sit down at the end of a flat bench with a dumbbell in both arms using a neutral grip (palms of the hand facing you).
Bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Make sure that you keep the head up.

The upper arms with the dumbbells should be close to the torso and aligned with it (lifted up until they are parallel to the floor while the forearms are pointing towards the floor as the hands hold the weights). Tip: There should be a 90-degree angle between the forearms and the upper arm. This is your starting position.

Keeping the upper arms stationary, use the triceps to lift the weight as you exhale until the forearms are parallel to the floor and the whole arm is extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Triceps Triumph: Dumbbell Style
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** at the end of a flat bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing you. 
2. **Bend** your knees slightly and lean your torso forward from the waist, keeping your back straight and head up, until your torso is almost parallel to the floor.
3. **Lift** your upper arms so they are in line with your torso, keeping a 90-degree angle at your elbows. This is your starting position.
4. **Extend** your arms by using your triceps to lift the weights until your forearms are parallel to the floor.
5. **Pause** for a second at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, feeling the triceps burn!
tip: Think of your arms like a hinge on a door—only your forearms should move! 🔄
short_description: Ready to give those triceps some love? This exercise targets the triceps by using dumbbells while you're seated on a bench. It's perfect for sculpting strong, defined arms! 💪

name: Seated Biceps
instructions: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and your partner standing behind you. Extend your arms straight behind you with your palms facing each other. Your partner will hold your wrists for you. This will be the starting position.
Attempt to flex your elbows, while your partner prevents any actual movement.

After 10-20 seconds, relax your arms while your partner gently pulls your wrists up to stretch your biceps. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is appropriate to prevent injury or overstretching.
subtitle: Biceps Stretch Buddy
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the floor with knees bent, your partner standing behind you.
2. **Extend** arms straight behind, palms facing each other. Partner holds your wrists.
3. **Flex** those elbows, but let your partner keep them in place. Feel the tension!
4. **Hold** for 10-20 seconds. Keep breathing!
5. **Relax** your arms. Partner gently lifts your wrists to stretch biceps. Communicate to prevent overstretching.
tip: Imagine your biceps are like taffy being gently stretched. 🍬 Communicate with your partner to get the perfect stretch!
short_description: Feel the stretch in your biceps with this partner-assisted move. Perfect for a good biceps stretch while engaging your chest and shoulders too. Grab a buddy and let's stretch those muscles! 💪

name: Seated Cable Rows
instructions: For this exercise you will need access to a low pulley row machine with a V-bar. Note: The V-bar will enable you to have a neutral grip where the palms of your hands face each other. To get into the starting position, first sit down on the machine and place your feet on the front platform or crossbar provided making sure that your knees are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your back and grab the V-bar handles.

With your arms extended pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feeling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in front of you. This is the starting position of the exercise.

Keeping the torso stationary, pull the handles back towards your torso while keeping the arms close to it until you touch the abs. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squeezing your back muscles hard. Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Row Your Way to a Strong Back
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the low pulley row machine and **place your feet** on the platform, knees slightly bent.
2. **Lean over** and **grab the V-bar handles** with your palms facing each other.
3. **Pull back** until your torso is at a 90-degree angle to your legs, back slightly arched, and chest out. This is your starting position.
4. **Pull the handles** towards your torso, keeping your arms close, until they touch your abs. **Breathe out** as you pull.
5. **Squeeze your back muscles** and **hold for a second**. Then **slowly return** to the starting position while breathing in.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended amount of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades when you pull back. 📝 It'll help you engage the right muscles!
short_description: Strengthen your middle back with Seated Cable Rows! This beginner-friendly exercise uses a cable machine to work your back, biceps, and shoulders. Get ready to row your way to better posture and a stronger back! 💪

name: Seated Cable Shoulder Press
instructions: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 90 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should also be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together above your head.
After pausing at the top, return the handles to the starting position. Ensure that you maintain tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back off the pad and alternate hands.
subtitle: Push to the Top!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** and grasp the cable handles, with your arms at 90 degrees and chest up.
2. **Press up** by straightening your elbows, bringing the handles above your head.
3. **Pause** briefly at the top of the movement.
4. **Lower** the handles back to the starting position, keeping tension on the cables.
5. **Optional:** You can lift with your back off the pad and alternate hands for a variation.
tip: Imagine you're pushing two heavy doors open above you. 🚪🚪 Keep steady and strong!
short_description: The Seated Cable Shoulder Press is a fantastic beginner-friendly move to pump up your shoulders and triceps. Sit, press, and feel the burn! 💪 Perfect for building upper body strength with ease.

name: Seated Calf Raise
instructions: Sit on the machine and place your toes on the lower portion of the platform provided with the heels extending off. Choose the toe positioning of your choice (forward, in, or out) as per the beginning of this chapter.

Place your lower thighs under the lever pad, which will need to be adjusted according to the height of your thighs. Now place your hands on top of the lever pad in order to prevent it from slipping forward.
Lift the lever slightly by pushing your heels up and release the safety bar. This will be your starting position.
Slowly lower your heels by bending at the ankles until the calves are fully stretched. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Raise the heels by extending the ankles as high as possible as you contract the calves and breathe out. Hold the top contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Happy Calf Lifts
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the machine and place your toes on the platform, letting your heels hang off.
2. **Adjust** the lever pad to fit snugly over your lower thighs and place your hands on top to keep it steady.
3. **Lift** the lever by pushing your heels up and release the safety bar. This is your starting position.
4. **Lower** your heels slowly, bending at the ankles, and feel that calf stretch. Breathe in as you go down.
5. **Raise** your heels by extending your ankles as high as you can, squeezing your calves. Breathe out and hold for a second at the top.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions. Keep smiling!
tip: Think of your calves like springs! 🌱 Imagine them bouncing you up and down with each lift. Stay light and springy!
short_description: Get ready to feel the burn in your calves with Seated Calf Raises! This machine exercise is perfect for beginners looking to build strong, defined calves. It’s simple, effective, and a great way to add some pep to your step. 🚶‍♂️

name: Seated Calf Stretch
instructions: Sit up straight on an exercise mat.
Bend one knee and put that foot on the floor to stabilize the torso.
Straighten your other leg and flex your ankle.
Using a band, towel, or your hand if you can reach, pull the toes toward you. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.
subtitle: Happy Calves Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** up straight on a comfy mat.
2. **Bend** one knee and place that foot on the floor for balance.
3. **Straighten** your other leg and flex your ankle upwards.
4. **Pull** your toes towards you using a band, towel, or your hand if you can reach.
5. **Hold** the stretch for 10 to 20 seconds, feeling the happy stretch in your calf. 
6. **Switch** sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch your toes to the sky, like a ballerina pointing during a dance! 🩰
short_description: Give those calves some love with the Seated Calf Stretch! Perfect for stretching out tight muscles, especially after a long day. Feel the happiness in your calves and get ready to dance! 💃

name: Seated Close-Grip Concentration Barbell Curl
instructions: Sit down on a flat bench with a barbell or E-Z Bar in front of you in between your legs. Your legs should be spread with the knees bent and the feet on the floor.

Use your arms to pick the barbell up and place the back of your upper arms on top of your inner thighs (around three and a half inches away from the front of the knee). A supinated grip closer than shoulder width is needed to perform this exercise. Tip: Your arm should be extended at arms length and the barbell should be above the floor. This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the barbell back to starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Avoid swinging motions at any time.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Bliss Curl
new_instructions:
1. Sit down on a flat bench with a barbell between your legs. Place your feet firmly on the ground and spread your knees apart. 
2. Grab the barbell using a supinated grip (palms up) closer than shoulder-width apart.
3. Rest the back of your upper arms on your inner thighs, with arms fully extended and the barbell hovering above the floor.
4. Curl the barbell up by bending your elbows and squeezing your biceps. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms.
5. Hold the top position for a second, really squeezing those biceps.
6. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine your biceps are super-powered springs. 🌀 The tighter you squeeze at the top, the more power you unleash!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Seated Close-Grip Concentration Barbell Curl! This exercise targets your biceps for maximum growth, making your arms pop. 💪 Get ready to feel the burn and love the results!

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
Rotate the palms of the hands so that they are facing your torso. This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the weights and start twisting the wrists once the dumbbells pass your thighs so that the palms of your hands face forward at the end of the movement. Make sure that you contract the biceps as you breathe out and make sure that only the forearms move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position as your breathe in and as you rotate the wrists back to a neutral grip.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Power Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a flat bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
2. **Rotate** your palms so they're facing your torso. This is your starting position.
3. **Curl** the weights up while twisting your wrists until your palms face forward. Squeeze your biceps at the top and breathe out.
4. **Hold** the position for a second, feeling the bicep burn. Only your forearms should move.
5. **Slowly lower** the dumbbells back to the starting position while rotating your wrists back to neutral. Breathe in.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a sponge with each curl 🧽. This helps you focus on contracting the biceps fully and maximizing each rep!
short_description: Get ready to build those bicep peaks with the Seated Dumbbell Curl! 🏋️‍♀️ This beginner-friendly move isolates your biceps, making them pop with every rep. Perfect for sculpting strong, defined arms!

name: Seated Dumbbell Inner Biceps Curl
instructions: Sit on the end of a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
Rotate the palms of the hands so that they are facing inward in a neutral position. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the dumbbells out and up, turning the palms out as you lift and keeping your forearms in line with your outer deltoids. Tips:

Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position as your breathe in. Remember to rotate your arms as you lower the dumbbells so that you can switch back to a neutral grip.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Curl with a Twist
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the end of a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Keep your arms straight and elbows close to your body.
2. **Turn your palms** so they face inward. This is your starting position.
3. **Curl the dumbbells** up and out while rotating your palms outwards. Keep your upper arms still.
4. **Squeeze your biceps** at the top of the movement and hold for a second.
5. **Lower the dumbbells** back to the starting position slowly, rotating your palms back in.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're holding a tray of drinks 🥤—keep it steady as you move to avoid spills!
short_description: Give your biceps a fun twist with the Seated Dumbbell Inner Biceps Curl! This beginner-friendly move isolates your biceps for a focused workout. Get ready to feel the burn and flex those muscles! 💪

name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl
instructions: Start out by placing two dumbbells on the floor in front of a flat bench.
