Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your legs at about shoulder width apart. Make sure to keep your feet on the floor.

Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against your thighs with the palms of the hands facing down. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge of your thighs.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.

Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, simply lower the dumbbells to the floor.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Whirl!
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the edge of a flat bench with your legs shoulder-width apart and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place two dumbbells on the floor in front of you.
3. Pick up the dumbbells and rest your forearms on your thighs, letting your wrists hang over the edge, palms facing down.
4. Curl your wrists upwards, exhaling as you lift the weights.
5. Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Keep your forearms still.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps, then place the dumbbells back on the floor.
tip: Imagine you're revving a motorcycle throttle 🏍️. Keep those movements smooth and controlled!
short_description: Feel the burn in your forearms with the Seated Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl. This beginner-friendly exercise isolates the forearm muscles to build strength and endurance. Get ready to rev up those wrists! 💪

name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl
instructions: Start out by placing two dumbbells on the floor in front of a flat bench.
Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your legs at about shoulder width apart. Make sure to keep your feet on the floor.

Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against your thighs with the palms of the hands facing up. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge of your thighs.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.

Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, simply lower the dumbbells to the floor.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Fun
new_instructions:
1. Place two dumbbells on the floor in front of a flat bench.
2. Sit on the edge of the bench with legs shoulder-width apart and feet on the floor.
3. Grab the dumbbells and rest your forearms on your thighs, palms up, wrists hanging over the edge.
4. Curl your wrists upwards while exhaling.
5. Slowly lower your wrists back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. Repeat for the recommended repetitions, then lower the dumbbells to the floor.
tip: Imagine you're lifting a tray of cookies with just your wrists—keep it controlled and steady! 🍪
short_description: Get those forearms burning with Seated Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curls! Perfect for beginners, this exercise isolates your forearm muscles. Feel the burn and embrace the pump! 💪

name: Seated Dumbbell Press
instructions: Grab a couple of dumbbells and sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs.
Clean the dumbbells up one at a time by using your thighs to bring the dumbbells up to shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbbells up until they touch at the top.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Press to Impress!
new_instructions:
1. Grab your dumbbells and sit on a bench with back support.
2. Lift the dumbbells to shoulder height using your thighs.
3. Rotate your wrists so palms face forward—you're ready!
4. Exhale and push the dumbbells up until they touch above you.
5. Pause for a second, then inhale as you lower them back down.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps with a smile!
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling up! 🏋️‍♂️ This helps activate your shoulders better.
short_description: Pump up those shoulders with the Seated Dumbbell Press! This move is perfect for beginners and targets your shoulders and triceps. Grab your dumbbells, take a seat, and let's press to impress! 💪

name: Seated Flat Bench Leg Pull-In
instructions: Sit on a bench with the legs stretched out in front of you slightly below parallel and your arms holding on to the sides of the bench. Your torso should be leaning backwards around a 45-degree angle from the bench. This will be your starting position.
Bring the knees in toward you as you move your torso closer to them at the same time. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
After a second pause, go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Sit and Crunch Those Abs!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a bench with your legs stretched out in front of you, just below parallel. Hold the sides of the bench with your hands. Lean your torso back at a 45-degree angle. This is your starting position.
2. **Pull** your knees in toward your chest while moving your torso closer to your knees. Exhale as you do this.
3. **Pause** for a second, feeling the squeeze in your abs.
4. **Return** to the starting position as you inhale.
5. **Repeat** for your desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're trying to hug your knees with your chest. It'll help you crunch better! 🤗
short_description: Sit on a bench and pull your knees to your chest to work your abs. It's a great move for beginners to build core strength. Get ready to feel the burn! 🔥

name: Seated Floor Hamstring Stretch
instructions: Sit on a mat with your right leg extended in front of you and your left leg bent with your foot against your right inner thigh.
Lean forward from your hips and reach for your ankle until you feel a stretch in your hamstring. Hold for 15 seconds, then repeat for your other side.
subtitle: Stretch Those Hammies!
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a mat with your right leg straight out in front.
2. Bend your left leg, placing your foot against your right inner thigh.
3. Lean forward from your hips, reaching for your right ankle.
4. Feel the stretch in your hamstring and hold for 15 seconds.
5. Switch sides and repeat the stretch.
tip: Imagine you're a ballerina gracefully reaching for your toes 🩰. It helps to keep your back straight!
short_description: Sit, reach, and stretch those hamstrings with this simple move! Perfect for beginners, it helps loosen up your legs and improves flexibility. 🧘‍♀️

name: Seated Front Deltoid
instructions: Sit upright on the floor with your legs bent, your partner standing behind you. Stick your arms straight out to your sides, with your palms facing the ground. Attempt to move them as far behind you as possible, as your assistant holds your wrists. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your elbows straight, attempt to move your arms to the front, with your partner gently restraining you to prevent any actual movement for 10-20 seconds.
Now, relax your muscles and allow your partner to gently increase the stretch on the shoulders and chest. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
subtitle: Sit and Stretch those Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with legs bent and your friend behind you.
2. Stick your arms out to the sides, palms down.
3. Try to move your arms back as far as you can while your friend holds your wrists. This is your start.
4. Keep your elbows straight and try moving your arms to the front. Your friend gently stops you from moving for 10-20 seconds.
5. Relax and let your friend gently stretch your shoulders and chest more. Hold for another 10-20 seconds.
tip: Imagine you're trying to give someone a big hug from behind 🫂. Keep that hug feeling in your mind to stay relaxed and focused.
short_description: Stretch and strengthen your shoulders with this partner-assisted move. Perfect for opening up your chest and getting those deltoids working. Grab a friend and give it a try! 🤗

name: Seated Glute
instructions: In a seated position with your knees bent, cross one ankle over the opposite knee. Your partner will stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.
subtitle: Sit, Stretch, Smile!
new_instructions:
1. Sit down with your knees bent and cross one ankle over the opposite knee. 
2. Have your partner stand behind you and lean forward slightly. 
3. Your partner should place their hands on your shoulders.
4. Try to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds while your partner holds you in place.
5. Relax and let your partner gently push your torso forward for 10-20 seconds to deepen the stretch.
tip: Imagine you're a puppet and your partner is gently pulling your strings to help you stretch! 🎭
short_description: Stretch those glutes in a seated position with a partner's help! Perfect for deepening your stretch and increasing flexibility. Grab a buddy and get ready to feel the burn! 🔥

name: Seated Good Mornings
instructions: Set up a box in a power rack. The pins should be set at an appropriate height. Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders, not on top of your traps. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders.

Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back. Keep your head facing forward. With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the bar tight, bend forward at the hips as much as possible. If you set the pins to what would be parallel, you not only have a safety if you fail, but know when to stop.
Pause just above the pins and reverse the motion until your torso it upright.
subtitle: Sit, Bend, and Power Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Place a box in the power rack, setting the pins at the right height. Step under the bar and position it across your shoulders, not on your traps.
2. **Lift Off:** Create a tight arch in your lower back and keep your head facing forward. Tighten your back, shoulders, and core.
3. **Sit Back:** Push your knees and butt out as you begin your descent until you're seated on the box.
4. **Bend Forward:** Keeping the bar tight, bend forward at the hips as much as possible, stopping just above the pins.
5. **Rise Up:** Reverse the motion until your torso is upright again.
tip: Imagine you're a hinge! Keep your back straight and bend at the hips like a door swinging open. 🚪
short_description: Seated Good Mornings strengthen your lower back and glutes by bending forward while seated. It's a powerful move for a stronger back and better posture. Get ready to sit, bend, and power up! 💪

name: Seated Hamstring
instructions: In a seated position with your legs extended, have your partner stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.
subtitle: Stretch and Reach
new_instructions:
1. Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. 
2. Have your partner stand behind you with their hands on your shoulders. 
3. Lean forward slowly; this is your starting position. 
4. Try to push your torso back while your partner gently resists for 10-20 seconds. 
5. Relax, and let your partner slowly push your torso forward for a deeper stretch, holding for another 10-20 seconds. 
6. Repeat as needed, keeping movements slow and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're a cat stretching after a nap 🐱—slow and steady wins the stretch!
short_description: The Seated Hamstring stretch targets your hamstrings and calves. It's perfect for increasing flexibility and relieving tension. Get a buddy to help you out and turn it into a fun, team stretch session! 🤸‍♂️

name: Seated Hamstring and Calf Stretch
instructions: Loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. Sit down with both legs extended . This will be your starting position.
Leaning forward slightly, pull on the belt to draw the toes of your foot back. Hold this position for 10-20 seconds and then repeat with the other leg.
subtitle: Stretch Those Legs!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** with your legs straight out in front of you.
2. **Loop** a belt, rope, or band around the ball of one foot.
3. **Lean forward** slightly, gently pulling on the belt to draw your toes back.
4. **Hold** the stretch for 10-20 seconds, feeling the stretch in your hamstrings and calves.
5. **Switch** legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the sky with your toes 🌞! This will help you get a deeper stretch.
short_description: Sit down, loop a band around your foot, and stretch those hamstrings and calves! This move is perfect for keeping your legs flexible and strong. 🧘‍♀️

name: Seated Head Harness Neck Resistance
instructions: Place a neck strap on the floor at the end of a flat bench. Once you have selected the weights, sit at the end of the flat bench with your feet wider than shoulder width apart from each other. Your toes should be pointed out.

Slowly move your torso forward until it is almost parallel with the floor. Using both hands, securely position the neck strap around your head. Tip: Make sure the weights are still lying on the floor to prevent any strain on the neck. Now grab the weight with both hands while elevating your torso back until it is almost perpendicular to the floor. Note: Your head and torso needs to be slightly tilted forward to perform this exercise.
Now place both hands on top of your knees. This is the starting position.
Slowly lower your neck down until your chin touches the upper part of your chest while breathing in.
While exhaling, bring your neck back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Neck Power Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the end of a flat bench with feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointing out. 
2. **Lean** forward until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. 
3. **Secure** the neck strap around your head and grab the weights, then sit back up until your torso is nearly upright. 
4. **Place** your hands on top of your knees; this is your starting position. 
5. **Lower** your neck slowly, bringing your chin to your chest while inhaling. 
6. **Lift** your neck back to the starting position while exhaling. Repeat for the desired reps.
tip: Imagine your neck is a crane lifting and lowering with control. 🏗️ Keep your movements smooth and steady!
short_description: Strengthen your neck muscles with the Seated Head Harness Neck Resistance. Great for building a strong, sturdy neck! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Seated Leg Curl
instructions: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and sit on the machine with your back against the back support pad.

Place the back of lower leg on top of padded lever (just a few inches under the calves) and secure the lap pad against your thighs, just above the knees. Then grasp the side handles on the machine as you point your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances) and ensure that the legs are fully straight right in front of you. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, pull the machine lever as far as possible to the back of your thighs by flexing at the knees. Keep your torso stationary at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Hamstring Happiness
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the machine lever to fit your height and sit with your back against the pad.
2. **Place** the back of your lower legs on the padded lever, secure the lap pad above your knees, and point your toes straight. Grab the side handles.
3. **Pull** the lever back towards your thighs by bending your knees. Keep your torso still.
4. **Hold** the position for a second and **squeeze** those hamstrings.
5. **Slowly return** to the starting position as you breathe in.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're trying to squeeze a sponge behind your knees. Feel that hamstring burn! 🔥
short_description: Seated Leg Curl is a beginner-friendly move that targets your hamstrings. Perfect for isolating those muscles and adding strength. Get ready for some hamstring happiness! 😄

name: Seated Leg Tucks
instructions: Sit on a bench with the legs stretched out in front of you slightly below parallel and your arms holding on to the sides of the bench. Your torso should be leaning backwards around a 45-degree angle from the bench. This will be your starting position.
Bring the knees in toward you as you move your torso closer to them at the same time. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
After a second pause, go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tummy Tuck Time
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on a bench with your legs stretched out in front of you, just below parallel. Hold the sides of the bench. Lean your torso back at a 45-degree angle. This is your starting position. 
2. **Pull** your knees in toward your chest while moving your torso closer to your knees. Exhale as you do this. 
3. **Pause** for a second when your knees and torso are close together. 
4. **Return** to the starting position while inhaling. 
5. **Repeat** for the recommended amount of repetitions. 
6. **Smile** because you're working those abs!
tip: Imagine you're a clam closing its shell! 🐚 Bring your knees and chest together smoothly like a clam gently closing.
short_description: Seated Leg Tucks give your abs a fantastic workout by pulling your knees towards your chest. This move is great for beginners and helps to build a strong core. Give it a go and feel the burn! 💥

name: Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in your right hand.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.

Lean forward and place your right forearm on top of your upper right thigh with your palm down. Tip: Make sure that the back of the wrist lies on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the dumbbell as far as possible as you keep a tight grip on the dumbbell. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Now curl the dumbbell as high as possible as you contract the forearms and as you exhale. Keep the contraction for a second before you lower again. Tip: The only movement should happen at the wrist.
Perform for the recommended amount of repetitions, switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Fun
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a bench with feet flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing down.
3. Place your right forearm on top of your right thigh, with the back of your wrist on your knee.
4. Lower the dumbbell while inhaling, keeping a tight grip.
5. Curl the dumbbell up by moving only your wrist, exhaling as you lift.
6. Hold for a second, then lower. Switch arms after completing the set.
tip: Picture your wrist as a hinge on a door. 🦾 Keep it smooth and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Get those forearms strong and defined with this fun wrist curl! Perfect for building grip strength and adding some serious power to your pull. 💪

name: Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in your right hand.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.

Lean forward and place your right forearm on top of your upper right thigh with your palm up. Tip: Make sure that the front of the wrist lies on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the dumbbell as far as possible as you keep a tight grip on the dumbbell. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Now curl the dumbbell as high as possible as you contract the forearms and as you exhale. Keep the contraction for a second before you lower again. Tip: The only movement should happen at the wrist.
Perform for the recommended amount of repetitions, switch arms and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Wrist Power Curl
new_instructions:
1. Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in your right hand.
2. Place your feet flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
3. Lean forward and rest your right forearm on your upper right thigh, palm facing up. Ensure your wrist is over your knee.
4. Lower the dumbbell as much as you can while gripping it tightly. Inhale during this motion.
5. Curl the dumbbell up as high as you can by flexing your forearm. Exhale while doing this. Hold for a second.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps, switch arms, and do it again.
tip: Imagine you're scooping up water with your hand and don't want to spill any 💧. Keep that controlled motion!
short_description: Boost your forearm strength with the Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl! 🎉 This beginner-friendly move isolates your forearms, giving you better grip strength and wrist power. Let's pump up those muscles!

name: Seated One-arm Cable Pulley Rows
instructions: To get into the starting position, first sit down on the machine and place your feet on the front platform or crossbar provided making sure that your knees are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your back and grab the single handle attachment with your left arm using a palms-down grip.

With your arm extended pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feeling a nice stretch on your lat as you hold the bar in front of you. The right arm can be kept by the waist. This is the starting position of the exercise.

Keeping the torso stationary, pull the handles back towards your torso while keeping the arms close to it as you rotate the wrist, so that by the time your hand is by your abs it is in a neutral position (palms facing the torso). Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squeezing your back muscles hard.

Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in. Tip: Remember to rotate the wrist as you go back to the starting position so that the palms are facing down again.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then perform the same movement with the right hand.
subtitle: Single-Arm Cable Rows: Back in Action!
new_instructions:
1. Sit down on the machine and place your feet on the platform, keeping your knees slightly bent.
2. Lean in and grab the handle with your left hand, using a palms-down grip.
3. Pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle to your legs, with your chest out and back slightly arched.
4. Pull the handle towards your torso, rotating your wrist so your palm faces your body. Squeeze your back muscles.
5. Hold for a second, then slowly return to the start, rotating your wrist back to palms-down.
6. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch to your right hand.
tip: Imagine you're starting a lawnmower - pull with power and control! 🌱
short_description: Get ready to row your way to a stronger back with Single-Arm Cable Rows! This move targets your middle back, biceps, and traps. Perfect for creating that V-shape! 💪

name: Seated Overhead Stretch
instructions: Sit up straight on an exercise mat.
Touch the soles of your feet together with your feet six to eight inches in front of your hips.
Place one hand on the floor beside you and your other hand behind your head.
Lift your elbow to the ceiling as you incline your torso to the other side. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.
subtitle: Reach for the Sky Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Sit tall on an exercise mat, keeping your back straight.
2. Press the soles of your feet together, positioning them six to eight inches in front of your hips.
3. Place one hand on the floor beside you for support.
4. Position your other hand behind your head, resting gently.
5. Lift your elbow towards the ceiling, leaning your torso to the opposite side.
6. Hold the stretch for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're growing taller with each stretch 🌱. This helps you elongate your spine and get a deeper stretch.
short_description: The Seated Overhead Stretch is a beginner-friendly move that targets your abs. It's a great way to elongate your spine and work on your flexibility. Give it a try and feel the stretch! 🧘‍♂️

name: Seated Palm-Up Barbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your forearms on top of your upper thighs with your palms up. Tip: Make sure that the front of the wrists lay on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible while inhaling and keeping a tight grip.
Now curl bar up as high as possible while flexing the forearms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the wrist should move.
subtitle: Forearm Flex Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a barbell with both hands, palms up, and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. **Sit** with your feet flat on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
3. **Lean** forward and rest your forearms on your upper thighs, with your wrists on your knees. This is your starting position.
4. **Lower** the bar as far as you can while inhaling, keeping a firm grip.
5. **Curl** the bar up as high as possible, flexing your forearms and exhaling. Hold for a second at the top.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, moving only your wrists.
tip: 📏 Imagine your wrists are like hinges on a door – only they should move, not your whole arm!
short_description: Get ready to pump up those forearms with the Seated Palm-Up Barbell Wrist Curl! This beginner-friendly move focuses on isolating your forearm muscles for maximum strength and definition. 💪

name: Seated Palms-Down Barbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your forearms on top of your upper thighs with your palms down. Tip: Make sure that the back of the wrists lay on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible while inhaling and keeping a tight grip.
Now curl bar up as high as possible while flexing the forearms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the wrist should move.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Wonders
new_instructions:
1. Grab a barbell with both hands, palms facing down, shoulder-width apart.
2. Sit down and place your feet flat on the floor, a bit wider than shoulder-width.
3. Lean forward and rest your forearms on your upper thighs, wrists over your knees. This is your starting position.
4. Lower the bar down while inhaling, keeping a tight grip.
5. Curl the bar up as high as you can, flexing your forearms and exhaling. Hold for a second.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, moving only your wrists.
tip: 🧑‍🎨 Imagine painting a masterpiece with your wrists. Keep the movement smooth and controlled, like delicate brush strokes on a canvas.
short_description: Strengthen your forearms with the Seated Palms-Down Barbell Wrist Curl! This beginner-friendly move targets the forearms by isolating the wrist muscles. 🏋️‍♂️ Feel the burn with every curl!

name: Seated Side Lateral Raise
instructions: Pick a couple of dumbbells and sit at the end of a flat bench with your feet firmly on the floor. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing in and your arms straight down at your sides at arms' length. This will be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Lift Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the edge of a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms straight down. 
2. **Keep** your torso still and **raise** the weights to your sides with a slight elbow bend. Picture pouring water from a jug! 🌊
3. **Lift** until your arms are parallel to the floor. **Pause** for a second.
4. **Lower** the dumbbells slowly back to the start.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps. **Smile** and feel that burn!
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings! 🦅 Keep your movements controlled and feel your shoulders working.
short_description: Boost those shoulders with the Seated Side Lateral Raise! Perfect for beginners, this move will get your shoulders popping. Grab your dumbbells and let's lift! 💪

name: Seated Triceps Press
instructions: Sit down on a bench with back support and grasp a dumbbell with both hands and hold it overhead at arm's length. Tip: a better way is to have somebody hand it to you especially if it is very heavy. The resistance should be resting in the palms of your hands with your thumbs around it. The palm of the hand should be facing inward. This will be your starting position.

Keeping your upper arms close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the floor, lower the resistance in a semi-circular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The upper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the dumbbell. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Seated Triceps Press: Arm Power Time!
new_instructions:
1. Sit down on a bench with back support and grab a dumbbell with both hands. Hold it overhead at arm's length. 
2. Position your hands so the resistance rests in your palms with your thumbs around it. Palms should face inward. 
3. Lower the dumbbell in a semi-circular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Keep your upper arms close to your head and stationary. Breathe in as you do this.
4. Raise the dumbbell back to the starting position using your triceps. Breathe out as you perform this step.
5. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions, keeping your movements controlled and steady.
tip: Picture your upper arms as tree trunks 🌳—strong and unmoving. Only your forearms should sway like branches in the wind!
short_description: Pump up those triceps with the Seated Triceps Press! 🏋️‍♂️ Sit down, grab a dumbbell, and get ready to sculpt those arms. It’s perfect for beginners and will make your triceps pop! 💪

name: Seated Two-Arm Palms-Up Low-Pulley Wrist Curl
instructions: Put a bench in front of a low pulley machine that has a barbell or EZ Curl attachment on it.
Move the bench far enough away so that when you bring the handle to the top of your thighs tension is created on the cable due to the weight stack being moved up.
Now hold the handle with both hands, palms up, using a shoulder-width grip.
Step back and sit on the bench with your feet about shoulder width apart, firmly on the floor.
Lean forward and place the forearms on your thighs with the back of your wrists over your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible, while inhaling and keeping a tight grip.
Now curl the bar up as high as possible while contracting the forearms. Tip: Only the wrist should move; not the forearms.
After a second contraction at the top go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Whirl
new_instructions:
1. **Place** a bench in front of a low pulley machine with a barbell or EZ Curl attachment.
2. **Sit** on the bench, ensuring there's enough distance so the cable has tension when the handle is at thigh level.
3. **Grip** the handle with both hands, palms up, and shoulder-width apart.
4. **Lean** forward, placing your forearms on your thighs and wrists over your knees.
5. **Lower** the bar as far as possible while inhaling and keeping your grip tight.
6. **Curl** the bar up as high as possible solely with your wrists, then return to the start position. Repeat.
tip: 🎯 Imagine you're revving a motorcycle's throttle to get the perfect wrist movement. Keep those forearms still!
short_description: Pump up those forearms with the Seated Two-Arm Palms-Up Low-Pulley Wrist Curl! This isolation move targets your forearm muscles for a stronger grip. Feel the burn and get ready to flex! 💪

name: See-Saw Press (Alternating Side Press)
instructions: Grab a dumbbell with each hand and stand up erect.

Clean (lift) the dumbbells to the chest/shoulder level and then rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards you as if you were getting ready to perform an Arnold Press. This will be your starting position.

Now start extending your left arm overhead as you rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand faces forward as you go up. Your elbows should come out also as you lift the weight. Simultaneously, you will also be bending from your hip to your opposite side. Tip: If you perform the exercise correctly, is should look as if you are trying to reach for something overhead on the right hand side of your body, but with your left arm. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Once you reach the top position breathe in. Then, with the weight fully extended overhead and you bent over to your right hand side, begin the movement to the left side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: See-Saw Shoulder Shred
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Grab a dumbbell in each hand and stand up straight. 
2. **Get Ready:** Lift the dumbbells to your shoulders, palms facing you like an Arnold Press start. 
3. **Press and Tilt:** Push your left arm up, turning your wrist so your palm faces forward. Lean to your right as you press. 
4. **Reach High:** Imagine reaching for the sky with your left hand while tilting. Exhale as you lift. 
5. **Switch Sides:** Once fully extended, lower the left dumbbell while pressing the right one up, leaning to your left. 
6. **Repeat:** Continue alternating sides for the recommended reps.
tip: 🧘‍♂️ **Balance is Key:** Think of your body as a perfectly balanced see-saw! Keep your core engaged and move smoothly. This helps maintain stability and control. 🤹‍♀️
short_description: Get ready to feel the burn in your shoulders! The See-Saw Press alternates arms, engaging your shoulders, triceps, and abs for a full upper-body workout. It's like a fun balancing act that'll leave you feeling strong and accomplished! 💪

name: Shotgun Row
instructions: Attach a single handle to a low cable.
After selecting the correct weight, stand a couple feet back with a wide-split stance. Your arm should be extended and your shoulder forward. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by retracting the shoulder and flexing the elbow. As you pull, supinate the wrist, turning the palm upward as you go.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
subtitle: Cable Pull Party
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** a single handle to a low cable machine.
2. **Stand** a few feet back with a wide-split stance, arm extended, shoulder forward. This is your starting position.
3. **Pull** by retracting your shoulder and bending your elbow. Turn your palm upward as you pull.
4. **Pause** briefly at the top.
5. **Return** to the starting position slowly.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're starting a lawnmower – give it a gentle but firm pull! 🚜
short_description: The Shotgun Row is an awesome cable exercise that targets your lats, biceps, and middle back. It's like starting a lawnmower, but way more fun and great for building strength! 💪

name: Shoulder Circles
instructions: With shoulders relaxed and arms resting loosely at your sides (or in your lap if you're seated), gently roll your shoulders forward, up, back, and down.
Reverse direction. You can do this exercise alternating shoulders or both at the same time.
subtitle: Smooth Shoulder Rolls
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** or sit comfortably with your back straight.
2. **Relax** your shoulders and let your arms hang loosely at your sides.
3. **Roll** your shoulders forward in a circular motion, moving them up, back, and down.
4. **Complete** 10 circles, then reverse the direction and do 10 circles backward.
5. **Alternate** between rolling both shoulders together and one at a time.
tip: Imagine you're drawing big circles with the tops of your shoulders! 🎨 It helps you keep the motion smooth and controlled.
short_description: Feel the tension melt away! Shoulder Circles are a simple yet effective way to stretch and relax your shoulder muscles. Perfect for beginners, this move will have your shoulders feeling loose and limber in no time! 🌀

name: Shoulder Press - With Bands
instructions: To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles and lift them so that the hands are at shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. Your elbows should be bent, with the upper arms and forearms in line to the torso. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, lift the handles up until your arms are fully extended overhead.
subtitle: Power Up Your Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** on a resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart. 
2. **Grab** the handles and **lift** them to shoulder height, palms facing forward. 
3. **Check** your elbows; they should be bent and in line with your torso. This is your starting position. 
4. **Exhale** and **press** the handles up until your arms are fully extended overhead. 
5. **Inhale** and **lower** the handles back to the starting position, with control. 
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping a steady pace.
tip: Imagine you're trying to push the ceiling up with your hands 🚀. This helps you engage your shoulders effectively!
short_description: Pump up your shoulders with this resistance band exercise! Perfect for beginners, it strengthens your shoulders and triceps. Get ready to push up and feel the burn!🔥

name: Shoulder Raise
instructions: Relax your arms to your sides and raise your shoulders up toward your ears, then back down.
subtitle: Shrug and Shine!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your arms relaxed by your sides.
2. **Inhale deeply** as you prepare to move.
3. **Lift** your shoulders up towards your ears.
4. **Hold** for a moment and feel the stretch.
5. **Exhale** as you **lower** your shoulders back down.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, feeling the tension melt away.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch your ears with your shoulders. 🎧 This mental picture helps you lift them higher!
short_description: Feel the tension melt away with the Shoulder Raise. Perfect for beginners, this stretch targets your shoulders and lats, helping you loosen up and relax. Get ready to shrug off the stress! 💆‍♂️

name: Shoulder Stretch
instructions: Reach your left arm across your body and hold it straight.
subtitle: Shoulder Hug Stretch
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall and relax your shoulders.
2. Reach your left arm across your body, keeping it straight.
3. Use your right hand to gently pull your left arm closer to your chest.
4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds while breathing deeply.
5. Repeat on the other side.
tip: Imagine you're hugging yourself – but just one arm at a time! 🤗
short_description: Give your shoulders some love with this gentle stretch. Perfect for beginners, it helps release tension and improve flexibility. Your shoulders will thank you! 😊

name: Side-Lying Floor Stretch
instructions: First lie on your left side, bending your left knee in front of you to stabilize your torso (use your abdominal muscles as well to hold you upright).

Straighten your right leg and rest the right foot on the floor behind your left. Straighten your right arm over your head and gently pull on your right wrist to stretch the entire right side of the body. Switch sides.
subtitle: Stretch Out and Relax
new_instructions:
1. Lie on your left side with your left knee bent in front of you.
2. Use your abs to keep your torso upright.
3. Extend your right leg and place your right foot on the floor behind your left leg.
4. Reach your right arm straight over your head.
5. Gently pull on your right wrist to stretch your right side.
6. Switch sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a long piece of taffy being gently stretched out. 🍬
short_description: The Side-Lying Floor Stretch is a great, relaxing stretch for your lats. It helps to improve flexibility and release tension. Perfect for winding down after a workout or a long day! 🧘‍♂️

name: Side Bridge
subtitle: Balance Like a Boss!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie** on your side with your legs straight and stacked on top of each other.
2. **Support** your upper body by placing your forearm on the ground directly under your shoulder.
3. **Lift** your hips off the ground, forming a straight line from your head to your feet.
4. **Hold** this position for as long as you can, keeping your body straight and tight.
5. **Lower** your hips back down to the ground slowly.
6. **Switch** sides and repeat the steps for the other side.
tip: Imagine you're a strong, sturdy bridge holding up a road 🌉. Keep everything tight and steady!
short_description: Side Bridge is a fantastic beginner move to strengthen your abs and shoulders. Hold your body like a steady bridge and feel the burn! Perfect for building core stability and shoulder strength. 🏋️‍♂️

name: Side Hop-Sprint
instructions: Stand to the side of a cone or hurdle.
Begin this drill by hopping sideways over the obstacle, rebounding out of your landing to hop back to where you started.
Hop for a prescribed number or repetitions as quickly as possible, and finish this drill by sprinting a short distance upon landing the last hop.
subtitle: Hop, Skip, Sprint!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** beside a cone or small hurdle.
2. **Hop** sideways over the obstacle and land softly.
3. **Rebound** quickly and hop back to your starting position.
4. **Repeat** the side hops for the set number of reps.
5. **Sprint** a short distance immediately after your last hop.
6. **Finish** strong with a big smile!
tip: 🦘 Imagine you're a kangaroo! Stay light on your feet and spring back quickly after each hop for maximum fun and efficiency.
short_description: Get ready to hop and sprint with this fun move! Side Hop-Sprint works your quads, calves, and more. It's like a playful dance that makes your legs stronger and faster. 🌟

name: Side Jackknife
subtitle: Twist and Crunch Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your side with your legs straight and stacked. 
2. **Place** your bottom arm extended on the floor and your top arm behind your head. 
3. **Lift** your top leg and bring your top elbow towards your knee, crunching your obliques. 
4. **Lower** back down to the starting position. 
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, then switch sides.
tip: Imagine you're a clamshell opening and closing. 🐚 Keep that motion smooth and controlled for the best burn!
short_description: Side Jackknife is a killer move for your abs! 💥 It's all about working those obliques with a fun twist-and-crunch action. Beginners, get ready to feel the burn and sculpt that midsection!

name: Side Lateral Raise
instructions: Pick a couple of dumbbells and stand with a straight torso and the dumbbells by your side at arms length with the palms of the hand facing you. This will be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso in a stationary position (no swinging), lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift and Shine: Lateral Raises!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a pair of dumbbells and **stand** tall with your arms at your sides. Keep palms facing you.
2. **Hold** your torso steady and **lift** the dumbbells out to your sides. Slightly bend your elbows and tilt your hands like you're pouring a drink.
3. **Raise** your arms until they're parallel to the floor. **Exhale** as you lift and **pause** for a second at the top.
4. **Slowly lower** the dumbbells back to the starting position while **inhaling**.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're a majestic bird spreading your wings! 🦅 Keep your movements controlled and graceful.
short_description: Strengthen and sculpt your shoulders with Side Lateral Raises! This beginner-friendly move isolates the shoulders, helping you build strength and definition. Grab those dumbbells and let's get lifting! 💪

name: Side Laterals to Front Raise
instructions: In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
At the top of the exercise move the weights out in front of you, keeping your arms extended.
Lower the weights with a controlled motion.
On the next repetition, raise the weights in front of you to shoulder height before moving the weights laterally to your sides.
Lower the weights to the starting position.
subtitle: Lift & Shine
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. **Lift** the weights to shoulder height in front of you, elbows slightly bent. No swinging!
3. **Move** the weights out in front, arms extended.
4. **Lower** the weights smoothly back to your sides.
5. **Raise** the weights again to shoulder height, but this time in front.
6. **Shift** the weights laterally to your sides and lower them to the start.
tip: Imagine you're painting a rainbow 🌈 with the weights—smooth and controlled movements!
short_description: Side Laterals to Front Raise is an awesome shoulder workout that'll make you feel strong and confident! 💪 It targets your shoulders and traps, giving you that powerful upper body look. Give it a try and bring out the best in you!

name: Side Leg Raises
instructions: Stand next to a chair, which you may hold onto as a support. Stand on one leg. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your leg straight, raise it as far out to the side as possible, and swing it back down, allowing it to cross the opposite leg.
Repeat this swinging motion 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion as you do so.
subtitle: Kick It Sideways!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall next to a chair for balance.
2. Lift one leg straight out to the side.
3. Swing it back down and cross it over the other leg.
4. Repeat this swinging motion 5-10 times.
5. Switch legs and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're painting a rainbow with your foot 🌈. Keep it smooth and wide!
short_description: Side Leg Raises are great for your inner thighs and balance. Perfect for beginners! Kick it out and feel the stretch. 🤸‍♀️

name: Side Lying Groin Stretch
instructions: Start off by lying on your right side and bend your right knee in front of you to stabilize the torso.
Rest your head on your right hand or shoulder. Lift your left leg upward and hold it by the back of the knee (easier) or the foot (harder).
Pull your left knee in toward your left shoulder and simultaneously press your foot or knee down to the floor. To intensify this stretch, straighten your left leg. Switch sides.
subtitle: Leg Stretch Party 🎉
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your right side and **bend** your right knee in front to keep steady.
2. **Rest** your head on your right hand or shoulder for comfort.
3. **Lift** your left leg upward and **hold** it behind the knee (easier) or the foot (harder).
4. **Pull** your left knee toward your left shoulder and **press** your foot or knee to the floor.
5. To **intensify**, **straighten** your left leg and feel the stretch!
6. **Switch sides** and repeat for balance.
tip: Imagine your legs are opening like a book 📖. Keep the movement slow and controlled for the best stretch!
short_description: Stretch and relax with this Side Lying Groin Stretch! Perfect for beginners to open up those adductors and hamstrings. It’s like giving your legs a gentle wake-up call! 🛌

name: Side Neck Stretch
instructions: Start with your shoulders relaxed, gently tilt your head towards your shoulder.
Assist stretch with a gentle pull on the side of the head.
subtitle: Stretch That Neck!
new_instructions:
1. **Relax** your shoulders and stand tall.
2. **Tilt** your head gently towards your right shoulder.
3. **Hold** for a few deep breaths, feeling the stretch along the left side of your neck.
4. **Assist** the stretch by gently pulling on the side of your head with your right hand.
5. **Return** to the starting position and repeat on the left side.
6. **Enjoy** the relief and repeat as needed!
tip: Imagine your neck is a piece of soft taffy 🍬, gently stretching it without yanking, to avoid snapping!
short_description: The Side Neck Stretch is perfect for easing neck tension and improving flexibility. It's a simple yet effective way to relax those neck muscles after a long day. 🧘‍♂️

name: Side Standing Long Jump
instructions: Begin standing with your feet hip width apart in an athletic stance. Your head and chest should be up, knees and hips slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Leaning to your right, extend through your hips, knees, and ankles to jump into the air. Block with the arms to lead the movement, jumping as far to your right as you can.
Land facing the same direction with your feet hip width apart, absorbing the impact through your lower body.
subtitle: Leap to the Side!
new_instructions:
1. **Start**: Stand with feet hip-width apart and in an athletic stance. Keep your head and chest up, and slightly bend your knees and hips.
2. **Lean and Jump**: Lean to your right, then power through your hips, knees, and ankles to jump to the right. Use your arms to help you leap as far as you can.
3. **Land**: Land safely with your feet hip-width apart. Absorb the impact through your lower body to protect your joints.
tip: 🦘 Imagine you're a kangaroo hopping to the side. Use your arms for momentum and aim to land softly!
short_description: The Side Standing Long Jump is a fun plyometric move that targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. It's perfect for boosting your power and agility. Ready to hop like a kangaroo? 🦘

name: Side To Side Chins
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing forward using a wide grip.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at a wide grip, bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

Pull your torso up while leaning to the left hand side until the bar almost touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space (no swinging) and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second of contraction, inhale as you go back to the starting position.

Now, pull your torso up while leaning to the right hand side until the bar almost touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second of contraction, inhale as you go back to the starting position.
Repeat steps 3-6 until you have performed the prescribed amount of repetitions for each side.
subtitle: Swinging Side Chins
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the pull-up bar with your palms facing forward and use a wide grip. 
2. **Lean** your torso back about 30 degrees and stick your chest out. This is your starting position. 
3. **Pull** your torso up while leaning to the left until the bar nearly touches your upper chest. Squeeze those back muscles! 
4. **Return** to the starting position and inhale. 
5. **Repeat** by pulling your torso up while leaning to the right. 
6. **Continue** alternating sides until you finish all your reps.
tip: Imagine you're a swinging monkey 🐒, but with control! Keep your core tight to avoid swinging.
short_description: Side to Side Chins are an awesome way to work your lats, biceps, and more! Feel the power as you pull side to side. Get ready to swing and squeeze! 💪

name: Side Wrist Pull
instructions: This stretch works best standing. Cross your left arm over the midline of your body and hold the left wrist in your right hand down at the level of your hips. Start the stretch with a bent left arm.
Slowly straighten, pull, and lift it up to shoulder height, as pictured. Feel this stretch originate in your back, not your shoulders, and don't pull too hard on the shoulders joint. Switch sides.
subtitle: Stretch Those Arms!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Cross Your Arm:** Cross your left arm over the midline of your body.
3. **Grab Your Wrist:** Hold your left wrist with your right hand at hip level.
4. **Stretch and Lift:** Slowly straighten and lift your left arm to shoulder height. Feel the stretch in your back.
5. **Switch Sides:** Gently release and switch to the other side.
tip: Imagine you're pulling taffy 🍬 – gentle and smooth to get a nice, even stretch without yanking.
short_description: Stretch those shoulders and forearms with the Side Wrist Pull! Perfect for beginners, this move helps improve flexibility and feels oh-so-good. Give it a go and feel the difference! 💪

name: Side to Side Box Shuffle
instructions: Stand to one side of the box with your left foot resting on the middle of it.
To begin, jump up and over to the other side of the box, landing with your right foot on top of the box and your left foot on the floor. Swing your arms to aid your movement.
Continue shuffling back and forth across the box.
subtitle: Fun Box Shuffle
new_instructions:
1. Stand beside a sturdy box with your left foot on top of it.
2. Jump up and over the box, landing with your right foot on it and left foot on the floor.
3. Use your arms to help propel you as you jump.
4. Keep shuffling side to side continuously for a set duration.
5. Remember to keep your core engaged and land softly to protect your joints.
tip: Imagine you’re dancing like a fun side-to-side groove! 🕺 Keep the rhythm and flow going!
short_description: Get your heart pumping with the Side to Side Box Shuffle! This beginner-friendly move will work your quads, calves, and more. Plus, it's like dancing with a box! 🕺

name: Single-Arm Cable Crossover
instructions: Begin by moving the pulleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.

Step forward in front of both pulleys with your arms extended in front of you, bringing your hands together. Your head and chest should be up as you lean forward, while your feet should be staggered. This will be your starting position.

Keeping your left arm in place, allow your right arm to extend out to the side, maintaining a slight bend at the elbow. The right arm should be perpendicular to the body at approximately shoulder level.
Return your arm back to the starting position by pulling your hand back to the midline of the body.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side. Continue alternating back and forth for the prescribed number of repetitions.
subtitle: Cross That Finish Line!
new_instructions:
1. Set up the pulleys high and pick your weights. Grab a handle in each hand.
2. Step forward with your feet staggered and extend your arms in front, bringing your hands together. Keep your head and chest up.
3. Hold your left arm steady and let your right arm stretch out to the side. Keep a slight bend in your elbow.
4. Pull your right hand back to the center, meeting your left hand. Feel that chest squeeze!
5. Hold for a second, then switch sides. Repeat the back-and-forth for your chosen reps.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a big, fluffy teddy bear! 🧸 Keep that gentle bend in your elbows for the perfect form.
short_description: Give your chest a great workout with Single-Arm Cable Crossover. It's a fun way to focus on each side of your chest individually. Feel the burn and get stronger, one arm at a time! 💪

name: Single-Arm Linear Jammer
instructions: Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight.
Raise the bar from the floor, taking it to your shoulders with one or both hands. Adopt a wide stance. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by extending the elbow, pressing the weight up. Move explosively, extending the hips and knees fully to produce maximal force.
Return to the starting position.
subtitle: Power Push with a Barbell
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up the Bar**: Position a bar in a landmine or sturdy corner and add some weight.
2. **Get Ready**: Lift the bar to your shoulder with one or both hands and stand with your feet wide apart.
3. **Push Up**: Explode upwards by pushing the bar up, extending your elbow, hips, and knees.
4. **Return**: Lower the bar back to your shoulder to get ready for the next rep.
tip: 💥 Picture you're launching a rocket! Push up with power and keep your body tight for a smooth lift-off.
short_description: Blast off with the Single-Arm Linear Jammer! This exercise powers up your shoulders, chest, and triceps for a strong upper body. Feel the burn and embrace the fun! 🚀

name: Single-Arm Push-Up
instructions: Begin laying prone on the ground. Move yourself into a position supporting your weight on your toes and one arm. Your working arm should be placed directly under the shoulder, fully extended. Your legs should be extended, and for this movement you may need a wider base, placing your feet further apart than in a normal push-up.
Maintain good posture, and place your free hand behind your back. This will be your starting position.
Lower yourself by allowing the elbow to flex until you touch the ground.
Descend slowly, and reverse direction be extending the arm to return to the starting position.
subtitle: One-Arm Wonder Push-Up
new_instructions:
1. **Start**: Lay face down on the ground. Prop yourself up on your toes and one arm, with that arm directly under your shoulder, fully straight. Spread your feet wider than a regular push-up for balance. 
2. **Set**: Keep a strong posture and place your free hand behind your back. Get ready to move!
3. **Lower**: Slowly bend your elbow to lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground.
4. **Push**: Extend your arm to push yourself back up to the starting position. Repeat with control and focus.
tip: 🦸‍♂️ **Imagine you're a superhero**: Picture yourself pushing the ground away like a powerful superhero. It'll help you keep your form solid and make the exercise more fun!
short_description: This push-up variation is a chest, shoulders, and triceps triple threat! It challenges your strength and balance while making you feel like a superhero 🦸‍♂️. Perfect for intermediate fitness fans looking to spice up their routine.

name: Single-Cone Sprint Drill
instructions: This drill teaches quick foot action. You need a single cone. Begin standing next to the cone with one arm back and one arm forward.
Chop the feet as quickly as possible, blocking with the arms. Circle the cone, keep your knees up, with violent foot action.
Rest after three trips around the cone.
subtitle: Quick Cone Dash
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Ready**: Place the cone on the ground and stand right next to it. One arm back, one arm forward, ready to dash.
2. **Fast Feet**: Start chopping your feet quickly, like you're running in place. Move those feet fast!
3. **Circle the Cone**: Begin circling the cone while keeping your knees up and making quick foot movements.
4. **Use Your Arms**: Pump your arms back and forth to help with balance and speed.
5. **Repeat**: Go three times around the cone, maintaining your pace.
6. **Rest and Recover**: Take a break after completing the three trips around the cone.
tip: Imagine the cone is a tiny volcano 🌋 that you need to circle quickly without touching its lava. Keep those feet moving fast!
short_description: The Single-Cone Sprint Drill is a fun and dynamic way to boost your speed and agility. It's like a quick dance around a cone that fires up your quads, calves, and glutes! Perfect for beginners. 🏃‍♂️💨

name: Single-Leg High Box Squat
instructions: Position a box in a rack. Secure a band or rope in place above the box.
Standing in front of it, step onto the box to a full standing position, letting your other leg remain unsupported. Hold onto the band for balance
. Continue stepping up and down on the same leg before switching to the opposite side.
subtitle: Step Up to Strength!
new_instructions:
1. Position a sturdy box in a safe spot.
2. Secure a band or rope above the box for balance.
3. Stand in front of the box and step onto it with one leg, standing tall.
4. Keep the other leg unsupported and hold the band or rope for balance.
5. Step up and down with the same leg, then switch to the other leg.
tip: Imagine you're stepping onto a sturdy mountain ledge 🏔️. Keep your balance and stay steady!
short_description: Boost your leg strength and stability with the Single-Leg High Box Squat! This fun move works your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Step up and feel the burn! 🔥

name: Single-Leg Hop Progression
instructions: Arrange a line of cones in front of you. Assume a relaxed standing position, balanced on one leg. Raise the knee of your opposite leg. This will be your starting position.
Hop forward, jumping and landing with the same leg over the cone.
Use a countermovement jump to hop from cone to cone.
At the end, turn around and go back on the other leg.
subtitle: Hop 'n' Pop: One-Leg Wonders!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** tall on one leg with the other knee raised.
2. **Jump** forward, landing on the same leg over a cone.
3. **Bounce** from cone to cone with a hop and a smile.
4. **Turn** around at the end and switch legs for the return.
5. **Repeat** the hops, keeping your balance and having fun!
tip: Imagine you're a playful kangaroo hopping from spot to spot. 🦘 Keep your core tight to stay balanced!
short_description: Get ready to boost those quads with single-leg hops! This fun exercise will improve your balance and strength. 🦵 Keep hopping and feel the burn!

name: Single-Leg Lateral Hop
instructions: Stand to the side of a cone or hurdle. To get into the start position, stand on one leg with your knee slightly bent.
To begin, execute a counterjump to hop sideways over the cone.
Land on your jumping leg, and immediately rebound out of it by jumping back to the start position.
Continue hopping back and forth.
subtitle: Hop Side to Side Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** next to a cone or hurdle on one leg with your knee slightly bent.
2. **Hop** sideways over the cone using a counterjump motion.
3. **Land** on your jumping leg softly and prepare to jump again.
4. **Rebound** immediately by hopping back to the start position.
5. **Repeat** the hops, moving back and forth continuously.
6. **Maintain** your balance by engaging your core and keeping your eyes forward.
tip: Imagine you're a playful bunny hopping over a log! 🐰 Keep it light and bouncy to maintain control and balance.
short_description: Get ready to hop like a pro with the Single-Leg Lateral Hop! This fun move strengthens your quads, calves, and more. Perfect for adding a playful twist to your workout! 🐇

name: Single-Leg Leg Extension
instructions: Seat yourself in the machine and adjust it so that you are positioned properly. The pad should be against the lower part of the shin but not in contact with the ankle. Adjust the seat so that the pivot point is in line with your knee. Select a weight appropriate for your abilities.
Maintaining good posture, fully extend one leg, pausing at the top of the motion.
Return to the starting position without letting the weight stop, keeping tension on the muscle.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: One-Leg Quad Power
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the machine and **adjust** the settings. The pad should touch your lower shin, but avoid your ankle.
2. **Align** the seat so the pivot point matches your knee. **Pick** a weight that suits your strength.
3. **Keep** good posture and **fully extend** one leg. **Pause** briefly at the top.
4. **Return** to the start without letting the weight stop, keeping tension on your quad.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps. **Switch** legs and do it again!
tip: Imagine you're **kicking a soccer ball** 🌟. Keep it smooth and controlled for the best workout!
short_description: Get ready to power up those quads with the Single-Leg Leg Extension! This beginner-friendly move isolates your quadriceps for strength and tone. It's like giving your legs a personal pep talk! 💪

name: Single-Leg Stride Jump
instructions: Stand to the side of a box with your inside foot on top of it, close to the edge.
Begin by swinging the arms upward as you push through the top leg, jumping upward as high as possible. Attempt to drive the opposite knee upward.
Land in the same position that you started, using your inside leg to decelerate the impact.
subtitle: Hop 'n' Pop!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand beside a box** with your inside foot on top, near the edge. 
2. **Swing your arms** upward and push through your top leg to jump as high as you can. 
3. **Drive your opposite knee** upward while in the air. 
4. **Land back** in the starting position, using your inside leg to absorb the impact. 
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, and then switch legs.
tip: 🦘 Imagine you're a kangaroo! Think of springing up lightly and landing softly. This helps with balance and reduces impact on your joints.
short_description: Get ready to leap with the Single-Leg Stride Jump! This move targets your quads, glutes, and calves, giving you a great plyometric boost. It's like hopping on clouds! ☁️

name: Single Dumbbell Raise
instructions: With a wide stance, hold a dumbell with both hands, grasping the head of the dumbbell instead of the handle. Your arms should be extended and hanging at the waist. This will be your starting position.
Raise the weight until it is above shoulder level, keeping your arms extended. Your torso and hips should remain stationary throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Raise the Roof!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** with feet wide apart, holding a dumbbell with both hands, grasping the head instead of the handle. Arms should hang down at the waist. This is your starting position.
2. **Lift** the weight straight up until it's above shoulder level, keeping your arms extended. Keep your torso and hips still.
3. **Pause** briefly at the top, feeling the burn in your shoulders.
4. **Lower** the weight back to the starting position slowly and with control.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions.
6. **Smile** because you're getting stronger!
tip: Imagine you're holding a giant ice cream cone 🏆—keep it steady and don't let it tip!
short_description: Single Dumbbell Raise is an awesome shoulder move for beginners. It targets your shoulders, forearms, and traps. Get ready to feel the burn and build some strength! 💪

name: Single Leg Butt Kick
instructions: Begin by standing on one leg, with the bent knee raised. This will be your start position.
Using a countermovement jump, take off upward by extending the hip, knee, and ankle of the grounded leg.
Immediately flex the knee and attempt to touch your butt with the heel of your jumping leg.
Return the leg to a partially bent position underneath the hips and land. Your opposite leg should stay in relatively the same position throughout the drill.
subtitle: Hop and Kick Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** on one leg, bending the other knee and lifting it up. Ready? Let's start!
2. **Jump** up by stretching your standing leg's hip, knee, and ankle. Feel the power!
3. **Kick** your butt with the heel of your jumping leg. Imagine you're a superhero!
4. **Land** softly, bringing the leg back under your hips with a slight bend. Keep your other leg steady and balanced. Great job!
tip: 🌟 Imagine you're kicking a star behind you. This helps you lift your leg higher and makes it more fun!
short_description: Feel the burn in your quads with the Single Leg Butt Kick! This beginner-friendly, bodyweight move is perfect for boosting leg strength and adding some fun to your routine. Jump in and kick it! 🌟

name: Single Leg Glute Bridge
instructions: Lay on the floor with your feet flat and knees bent.
Raise one leg off of the ground, pulling the knee to your chest. This will be your starting position.
Execute the movement by driving through the heel, extending your hip upward and raising your glutes off of the ground.
Extend as far as possible, pause and then return to the starting position.
subtitle: Lift and Tone with One Leg!
new_instructions:
1. Lay on the floor with your feet flat and knees bent.
2. Raise one leg off the ground and pull the knee to your chest. This is your starting position.
3. Push through the heel of your grounded foot and lift your hips upward, engaging your glutes.
4. Extend your hip as far as possible, then pause at the top.
5. Lower your hips back to the starting position with control.
6. Repeat and switch legs after completing your reps.
tip: Imagine pushing the floor away with your heel to lift your hips higher! 🚀
short_description: This exercise targets your glutes and hamstrings, helping you build strength and tone your backside. Perfect for a quick, equipment-free workout. 🍑

name: Single Leg Push-off
instructions: Stand on the ground with one foot resting on the box, heel close to the edge.
Push off with your foot on top of the box, trying to gain as much height as possible by extending through the hip and knee.
Land with the same foot on top of the box, returning your other foot back to the start position.
subtitle: Hop to the Top!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** on the ground with one foot resting on a box, heel close to the edge.
2. **Push off** with your foot on the box, extending through your hip and knee.
3. **Reach** for the sky, gaining as much height as possible.
4. **Land** back on the box with the same foot.
5. **Return** your other foot back to the start position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps before switching feet.
tip: Imagine you’re launching off a trampoline to touch the stars! 🌠
short_description: Get ready to power up those quads! Single Leg Push-offs are a fun way to boost your leg strength and coordination. Perfect for beginners, this move will have you hopping with joy in no time! 🦵

name: Sit-Up
instructions: Lie down on the floor placing your feet either under something that will not move or by having a partner hold them. Your legs should be bent at the knees.
Place your hands behind your head and lock them together by clasping your fingers. This is the starting position.
Elevate your upper body so that it creates an imaginary V-shape with your thighs. Breathe out when performing this part of the exercise.
Once you feel the contraction for a second, lower your upper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Ab Crunch Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your back and bend your knees, feet flat on the floor.
2. **Place hands** behind your head, fingers clasped.
3. **Lift up** your upper body to meet your thighs, making a V-shape. **Exhale** as you lift.
4. **Hold** the position briefly, feeling that awesome ab squeeze.
5. **Lower down** slowly back to the start while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the set number of reps and enjoy the burn!
tip: Imagine your abs as a sponge being squeezed out every time you crunch up! 🧽 Feel the squeeze for maximum effect.
short_description: Get ready to sculpt those abs with Sit-Ups! This beginner-friendly move targets your core, making your tummy tighter and stronger. Feel the burn and have some fun! 😅

name: Sit Squats
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your knees and hips, sitting back with your hips.
Continue until you have squatted a portion of the way down, but are above parallel, and quickly reverse the motion until you return to the starting position. Repeat for 5-10 repetitions.
subtitle: Sit and Squat Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Up:** Place your feet shoulder-width apart. This is your starting spot.
2. **Bend and Sit:** Bend your knees and hips, and pretend you're sitting back into a chair.
3. **Pause Midway:** Stop before you go too low, keep above parallel to the ground.
4. **Rise Up:** Push through your heels and stand back up.
5. **Repeat:** Do this for 5-10 times, feeling those leg muscles working!
tip: Imagine you're sitting down on a tiny chair behind you—don't let it disappear! 🪑
short_description: Sit Squats are a great way to fire up your legs, especially your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Perfect for beginners, this move is like sitting in a chair, but way more fun and effective! 🔥

name: Skating
instructions: Roller skating is a fun activity which can be effective in improving cardiorespiratory fitness and muscular endurance. It requires relatively good balance and coordination. It is necessary to learn the basics of skating including turning and stopping and to wear protective gear to avoid possible injury.

You can skate at a comfortable pace for 30 minutes straight. If you want a cardio challenge, do interval skating — speed skate two minutes of every five minutes, using the remaining three minutes to recover. A 150 lb person will typically burn about 175 calories in 30 minutes skating at a comfortable pace, similar to brisk walking.
subtitle: Skate Your Way to Fitness!
new_instructions:
1. **Gear Up**: Put on your roller skates and protective gear. Make sure everything fits snugly.

2. **Warm Up**: Do a light 5-minute warm-up with stretches and a slow skate to get your muscles ready.

3. **Start Rolling**: Begin skating at a comfortable pace. Keep your knees slightly bent and your body relaxed.

4. **Turn & Stop**: Practice turning by leaning in the direction you want to go. To stop, use the heel brake on your skates or perform a T-stop.

5. **Interval Skating**: For a cardio boost, speed skate for 2 minutes, then skate at a relaxed pace for 3 minutes. Repeat for 30 minutes.
tip: Imagine you're gliding like a swan on a lake 🦢. Keep your movements smooth and controlled for a better skating experience.
short_description: Skating is a fun cardio workout that improves your balance and burns calories. Glide your way to fitness and enjoy the ride! 🛼

name: Sled Drag - Harness
instructions: To begin, load the sled with the desired weight and attach the pulling strap. You can pull with handles, use a harness, or attach the pulling strap to a weight belt.
Whether pulling forwards or backwards, lean in the direction of travel and progress by extending through the hips and knees.
subtitle: Harness the Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Load** the sled with a weight you can handle.
2. **Attach** the harness securely to yourself and the sled.
3. **Lean** forward or backward, depending on your direction.
4. **Drive** through your hips and knees to start moving.
5. **Keep** a steady pace and maintain your form.
6. **Finish** by gradually slowing down before stopping.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero pulling a heavy object to save the day! 🦸‍♂️ Keep your core tight and your movements strong.
short_description: The Sled Drag with a Harness is an awesome way to build strength in your quads, calves, and glutes. It's like a power walk with extra oomph! Perfect for beginners looking to add some fun to their workout routine. 💥

name: Sled Overhead Backward Walk
instructions: Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.
Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Hold your hands directly above your head with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.
Walk backwards, keeping your arms raised above your head. Avoid jerky movements.
subtitle: Backwards Power Walk!
new_instructions:
1. Attach the sled: Secure the dual handles to a sled with a rope or chain and load it lightly.
2. Get ready: Face the sled, back up to create some tension in the line, and raise your hands above your head with elbows straight.
3. Start walking: Begin walking backwards, keeping your arms raised high and steady.
4. Move smoothly: Walk with even steps and avoid jerky movements.
5. Stay strong: Keep your core engaged and maintain good posture throughout.
tip: Imagine you're pulling a heavy load like a superhero towing a spaceship! 🦸‍♂️ It’ll help you keep your arms steady and your back strong.
short_description: The Sled Overhead Backward Walk is a fun way to build shoulder and leg strength. Walk backwards with a sled, keeping your arms up for an extra challenge. It's like a power walk, but way cooler! 💪

name: Sled Overhead Triceps Extension
instructions: Attach dual handles to a sled using a chain or rope. Load the sled to an appropriate load.

Facing away from the sled, step away until there is tension in the line. Raise your hands above your head, keeping them together, palms facing each other. Your elbows should be pointed upward with the elbows flexed. This will be your starting position.
