Extend through the elbow to straighten the arm. Ensure that your upper arm stays in position to isolate the triceps.
Upon full extension, step forward to take the slack out of the line. You may keep your feet staggered for more stability.
subtitle: Triceps Triumph
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** dual handles to a sled using a chain or rope and load it with an appropriate weight. 
2. **Face away** from the sled and step away until you feel tension in the line. Raise your hands above your head, keeping them together, palms facing each other. Point your elbows upward with elbows flexed. 
3. **Extend** your elbows to straighten your arms. Make sure your upper arms stay in position to isolate the triceps. 
4. **Step forward** after fully extending your arms to take the slack out of the line. You can keep your feet staggered for better stability.
tip: Imagine you're throwing a magic spell from above! 🪄 Keep a steady stance for balance.
short_description: Blast those triceps with the Sled Overhead Triceps Extension! This move isolates your triceps, helping you build strength and definition. 🚀 Ready to cast some fitness magic?

name: Sled Push
instructions: Load your pushing sled with the desired weight.

Take an athletic posture, leaning into the sled with your arms fully extended, grasping the handles. Push the sled as fast as possible, focusing on extending your hips and knees to strengthen your posterior chain.
subtitle: Slide and Glide Fun!
new_instructions:
1. **Load** the sled with your desired weight. 
2. **Get into position**: Lean into the sled, arms fully extended, and grab the handles. 
3. **Push off** with all your might, focusing on extending your hips and knees. 
4. **Maintain momentum**: Keep pushing as fast as possible. 
5. **Finish strong**: Push until you reach your goal distance.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero charging forward! 🦸‍♂️ Keep your core tight and push with power!
short_description: Feel the burn and embrace the challenge with the Sled Push! This beginner-friendly, full-body exercise works your legs, glutes, and more. Ready, set, push! 🚀

name: Sled Reverse Flye
instructions: Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.

Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Take both handles at arms length at about waist level. Bend the knees slightly and keep your chest and head up. This will be your starting position.
Without flexing the elbow, pull the handles upward and apart, performing a reverse fly with some external rotation. Your palms should be facing forward as you do this.
Return to the starting position, taking a couple steps back to take the slack out of the line.
subtitle: Sled Flye Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Attach dual handles to a sled with a rope or chain and load it with light weight.
2. Face the sled and back up until there's tension in the line. Hold the handles at arm's length around waist level. Bend your knees slightly, and keep your chest and head up. This is your starting position.
3. Without bending your elbows, pull the handles upward and apart. Perform a reverse fly with some external rotation. Your palms should face forward as you do this.
4. Return to the starting position and take a couple of steps back to remove any slack from the line.
5. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping steady tension throughout.
tip: Imagine you're a bird spreading its wings to fly! 🕊️ Keep your movements smooth and controlled.
short_description: The Sled Reverse Flye targets your shoulders with a fun pulling motion. It's perfect for beginners looking to add some variety to their routine. Plus, it feels awesome to move like you're ready to take flight! 🦅

name: Sled Row
instructions: Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to an appropriate weight. Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line.
With a handle in each hand, bend the knees slightly, keep your head and chest up, and begin with your arms extended.
To initiate the movement, flex the elbow as you retract your shoulder blades, pulling the sled towards you.
Take a step or two back to get tension in the line and repeat.
subtitle: Pull That Sled!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab Handles:** Attach dual handles to a sled with a rope or chain, and load the sled with a weight you can handle.
2. **Get Ready:** Face the sled, back up until there's tension in the line, and hold a handle in each hand.
3. **Set Your Stance:** Bend your knees slightly, keep your head and chest up, and extend your arms fully.
4. **Pull:** Flex your elbows and squeeze your shoulder blades as you pull the sled towards you.
5. **Step Back:** Take a step or two back to reset the tension in the line.
6. **Repeat:** Keep pulling and stepping back, feeling your back and arms working!
tip: 🎯 **Picture this:** Imagine you're starting a lawnmower—use a strong, smooth pull to move the sled. Consistency is key!
short_description: Get ready to fire up your middle back with the Sled Row! This fun, beginner-friendly move also targets your biceps and lats. Perfect for building strength while feeling like a powerhouse! 💪

name: Sledgehammer Swings
instructions: You will need a tire and a sledgehammer for this exercise. Stand in front of the tire about two feet away from it with a staggered stance. Grip the sledgehammer.
If you are right handed, your left hand should be at the bottom of the handle, and your right hand should be choking up closer to the head.

As you bring the sledge up, your right hand slides toward the head; as you swing down, your right hand will slide down to join your left hand. Slam it down as hard as you can against the tire. Control the bounce of the hammer off of the tire.
Repeat on the other side.
subtitle: Hammer Time Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand two feet away from a tire with a staggered stance, holding a sledgehammer.
2. Place your left hand at the bottom of the handle and right hand closer to the head if you're right-handed.
3. Lift the sledgehammer, sliding your right hand towards the head, then swing it down hard onto the tire.
4. Let the right hand slide down to join the left hand as you slam the hammer.
5. Control the bounce and prepare for the next swing.
6. Switch sides and repeat the motion.
tip: Imagine you're Thor summoning thunder as you swing! ⚡ This mindset boosts your power and energy.
short_description: Feel like a superhero with Sledgehammer Swings! This exercise targets your abs, shoulders, and more, turning you into a powerhouse. It's beginner-friendly but packs a punch! 🔨

name: Smith Incline Shoulder Raise
instructions: Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your shoulders are aligned right under the barbell.
Using a shoulder width pronated (palms forward) grip, lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe out, lift the bar up until your arms are fully extended. Note: The contraction should be felt around the shoulders.
After a second pause, bring the bar back down to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Sky-High Shoulder Lifts
new_instructions:
1. Place an incline bench under the Smith machine and adjust the barbell to a reachable height.
2. Select your weight, lie on the bench, and grip the bar with palms facing forward, shoulder-width apart.
3. Lift the bar from the rack, holding it straight over you with a slight bend in your elbows. This is your starting position.
4. Breathe out and push the bar up until your arms are fully extended, feeling the contraction in your shoulders.
5. Pause for a second, then slowly bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe in.
6. Do the prescribed number of reps and then safely rack the barbell.
tip: Imagine you're trying to push the ceiling higher with each lift. 🚀 Keep your core tight and control the movement!
short_description: The Smith Incline Shoulder Raise targets your shoulders with precision, giving you that strong, broad look. Perfect for beginners, this move isolates the shoulders for maximum effect. 🌟

name: Smith Machine Behind the Back Shrug
instructions: With the bar at thigh level, load an appropriate weight.

Stand with the bar behind you, taking a shoulder-width, pronated grip on the bar and unhook the weight. You should be standing up straight with your head and chest up and your arms extended. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by shrugging your shoulders straight up. Do not flex the arms or wrist during the movement.
After a brief pause return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.
subtitle: Shrug It Up, Behind the Back!
new_instructions:
1. Load the bar at thigh level with the right weight.
2. Stand tall with the bar behind you, gripping it shoulder-width apart.
3. Keep your head and chest up, and arms straight.
4. Shrug your shoulders straight up without moving your arms or wrists.
5. Pause briefly, then lower the weight back down.
6. Repeat for the desired reps, then rack the weight.
tip: Imagine squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades 📝. It'll help you get the most out of each shrug!
short_description: Feel the burn in your traps with the Smith Machine Behind the Back Shrug! This beginner-friendly move is perfect for targeting your traps and shoulders. Stand tall and shrug it up! 💪

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
instructions: Place a flat bench underneath the smith machine. Now place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the flat bench. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your middle chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, lock the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Chest Pumping Joyride
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Place a flat bench beneath the Smith machine and adjust the bar to a reachable height when lying down with almost extended arms. 
2. **Grip & Position:** Lie down on the bench, use a pronated grip wider than shoulder-width, unlock the bar, and hold it straight over you with locked arms—this is your starting position. 
3. **Lower the Bar:** Inhale and slowly lower the bar until it touches your middle chest. 
4. **Press Up:** Exhale, push the bar back to the starting position using your chest muscles, lock your arms, hold for a second, then slowly lower again. 
5. **Repeat:** Continue for the desired number of reps. 
6. **Finish Up:** When done, lock the bar back into the rack.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the bar away like a springy trampoline! 🎈 Bounce with control and feel the chest muscles work.
short_description: The Smith Machine Bench Press is a beginner-friendly, chest-pumping exercise. Great for building strength in your chest, shoulders, and triceps. Let's get pressing and feel those gains! 💪

name: Smith Machine Bent Over Row
instructions: Set the barbell attached to the smith machine to a height that is about 2 inches below your knees.
Bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up.

Now grasp the barbell using an overhand (pronated) grip and unlock it from the smith machine rack. Then let it hang directly in front of you as your arms hang extended perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keeping the torso stationary, lift the barbell as you breathe out, keeping the elbows close to the body and not doing any force with the forearm other than holding the weights. On the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Row Your Way Strong!
new_instructions:
1. **Set the bar**: Place the barbell on the Smith machine just below knee height.
2. **Bend Forward**: Slightly bend your knees and lean your torso forward, keeping your back straight and head up.
3. **Grab the bar**: Use an overhand grip to grasp the barbell and unlock it. Let it hang with your arms extended.
4. **Lift the bar**: Pull the barbell towards you, keeping elbows close and squeezing your back muscles. Hold for a second.
5. **Lower slowly**: Gradually lower the bar back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat**: Continue for the recommended number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're trying to squeeze a pencil between your shoulder blades! 📝 This helps activate the right muscles.
short_description: Ready to row your way to a stronger back? This move targets your middle back, biceps, lats, and shoulders. Perfect for beginners, it's a fun way to build strength! 💪

name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
instructions: Place a block or weight plate below the bar on the Smith machine. Set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step onto the plates with the balls of your feet and place the bar on the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with both hands facing forward. Rotate the bar to unrack it. This will be your starting position.

Raise your heels as high as possible by pushing off of the balls of your feet, flexing your calf at the top of the contraction. Your knees should remain extended. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Return slowly to the starting position as you breathe in while lowering your heels.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Calf Pump Power-Up!
new_instructions:
1. **Step Up**: Place a block or weight plate below the Smith machine bar. Set the bar at your shoulder height.
2. **Get Ready**: Step onto the plate with the balls of your feet. Rest the bar on the back of your shoulders.
3. **Grab and Lift**: Grip the bar with both hands facing forward. Rotate to lift the bar off its rack.
4. **Rise High**: Push off the balls of your feet, lifting your heels as high as you can. Flex those calves! Keep knees straight.
5. **Hold and Feel**: Stay at the top for a second, feeling the calf squeeze.
6. **Lower Down**: Slowly lower your heels back to start. Breathe in as you go down. Repeat!
tip: Imagine you're trying to peek over a tall fence – lift those heels high! 🦘
short_description: Pump up your calves with the Smith Machine Calf Raise! This exercise isolates the calf muscles, making them stronger and more defined. It’s a beginner-friendly move that adds fun to your leg day! 🦵

name: Smith Machine Close-Grip Bench Press
instructions: Place a flat bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the flat bench. Using a close and pronated grip (palms facing forward) that is around shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.

As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your middle chest. Tip: Make sure that as opposed to a regular bench press, you keep the elbows close to the torso at all times in order to maximize triceps involvement.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your triceps muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, lock the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Tricep Targeting with a Twist
new_instructions:
1. **Position the bench:** Place a flat bench under the Smith machine.
2. **Get ready:** Lie on the bench and grip the bar with a close grip (shoulder-width), palms facing forward. Unlock the bar and hold it straight over you with locked arms.
3. **Lower the bar:** Inhale and slowly lower the bar until it touches your middle chest. Keep your elbows close to your torso.
4. **Press up:** Exhale and push the bar up using your triceps, locking your arms at the top. Hold for a second.
5. **Repeat:** Slowly lower the bar again, taking twice as long to come down as you did to press up.
6. **Finish up:** When done, lock the bar back on the rack.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing an orange between your elbows as you press up. 🍊 This helps keep your elbows in and targets your triceps even more!
short_description: The Smith Machine Close-Grip Bench Press is a beginner-friendly exercise that hones in on your triceps while also working your chest and shoulders. It's perfect for building upper body strength with the added stability of the Smith machine. 💪

name: Smith Machine Decline Press
instructions: Position a decline bench in the rack so that the bar will be above your chest. Load an appropriate weight and take your place on the bench.
Rotate the bar to unhook it from the rack and fully extend your arms. Your back should be slightly arched and your shoulder blades retracted. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your arms, lowering the bar to your chest.
Pause briefly, and then extend your arms to push the weight back to the starting position.
After completing the desired number of repetitions, rotate the bar to rack the weight.
subtitle: Pump Up Your Chest!
new_instructions:
1. **Position** the decline bench in the rack with the bar above your chest. Load up the weight and hop on. 
2. **Unhook** the bar by rotating it and fully extend your arms. Keep your back slightly arched and shoulder blades pinched back. This is your starting pose.
3. **Lower** the bar slowly to your chest by bending your arms. Feel the stretch in your chest.
4. **Pause** for a moment, then **push** the weight back up by extending your arms. Return to your starting pose.
5. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps. Finally, **rotate** the bar to lock it back in the rack.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the weight away from your chest like you're shoving a door closed with force. 🚪💥
short_description: The Smith Machine Decline Press targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps. It's perfect for beginners looking to build strength and muscle. Get ready to feel the burn and pump up that chest! 💪🔥

name: Smith Machine Hang Power Clean
instructions: Position the bar at knee height and load it to an appropriate weight.

Take a pronated grip on the bar outside of shoulder width and unhook the bar from the machine. Your arms should be fully extended with your head and chest up. Your elbows should be pointed out with your shoulders back and down. Your hips should be back, loading the tension into the hamstrings. This will be your starting position.
Initate the movement by forcefully extending the hips and knees, accelerating into the bar. Ensure that you keep your arms straight during this part of the motion.
Upon full extension, rebend the hips and knees to lower your receiving position.
Allow the arms to flex at this point, rotating the elbows around the bar to receive it on your shoulders.
Extend through the hips and knees to come to a standing position with the bar racked on your shoulders to complete the movement.
subtitle: Clean Up with Power! 💪
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Position the bar at knee height and load it with the right weight for you.
2. **Grip & Position:** Grab the bar with a pronated grip, arms fully extended. Keep your head and chest up, shoulders back, and hips pushed back.
3. **Lift Off:** Forcefully extend your hips and knees to lift the bar, keeping your arms straight.
4. **Catch It:** Once fully extended, lower your hips and knees to receive the bar on your shoulders.
5. **Stand Tall:** Extend your hips and knees again to stand up straight, with the bar resting on your shoulders.
6. **Reset:** Lower the bar back to the starting position and get ready for the next rep.
tip: Imagine you're a spring ready to launch! Compress and then explode up with power. 🌟
short_description: The Smith Machine Hang Power Clean will fire up your hamstrings, glutes, and more! It's a dynamic move that'll make you feel like an athlete. Get ready to lift and feel awesome! 🏋️

name: Smith Machine Hip Raise
instructions: Position a bench in the rack and load the bar to an appropriate weight. Lie down on the bench, placing the bottom of your feet against the bar. Unlock the bar and extend your legs. You may need to use your hands to assist you. For added stability grasp the sides of the Smith Machine. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rotating your pelvis, flexing your spine to raise your hips off of the bench. Maintain a slight bend in the knees throughout the motion.
After a brief pause, return the hips to the bench.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
subtitle: Hip-Lifting Happiness
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Place a bench in the Smith Machine and load the bar with a suitable weight. Lie back on the bench and position your feet against the bar. Unlock the bar and extend your legs, using your hands for assistance if needed. For added stability, hold the sides of the machine.
2. **Lift Off**: Rotate your pelvis and flex your spine to lift your hips off the bench. Keep a slight bend in your knees.
3. **Hold**: Pause briefly at the top of the movement, feeling the squeeze in your abs.
4. **Lower**: Gently lower your hips back to the bench.
5. **Repeat**: Perform the desired number of repetitions, keeping the motion controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine you're trying to leave an imprint of your favorite emoji on the ceiling with your hips! 🍑 Keep the movement slow and controlled for maximum effect.
short_description: Lift your way to stronger abs with the Smith Machine Hip Raise! This exercise targets your core, giving you a solid foundation and a reason to smile every rep. Ready to lift off? 🚀

name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
instructions: Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your upper chest is aligned with the barbell. Using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your upper chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
subtitle: Push to the Peak!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Place an incline bench under the smith machine and adjust the barbell to a reachable height when lying down. 
2. **Get in Position:** Lie on the bench, align your upper chest with the barbell, and grip the bar wider than shoulder-width with palms facing forward. 
3. **Unlock & Start:** Unlock the bar and hold it straight above you with arms locked. This is your starting position. 
4. **Lower the Bar:** Inhale and slowly lower the bar until it touches your upper chest. 
5. **Press Up:** Exhale and push the bar up using your chest muscles until arms are locked again. Hold for a second. 
6. **Repeat:** Repeat for the desired number of reps, and when finished, rack the bar safely.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the bar away from your chest like you're sending it to the sky! 🌤️ Keep a steady rhythm for a smooth lift.
short_description: The Smith Machine Incline Bench Press is perfect for pumping up your chest with a steady and controlled movement. It's beginner-friendly, so get ready to feel strong and powerful! 💪

name: Smith Machine Leg Press
instructions: Position a Smith machine bar a couple feet off of the ground. Ensure that it is resting on the safeties. After loading the bar to an appropriate weight, lie underneath the bar. Place the middle of your feet on the bar, tucking your knees to your chest. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by driving through your feet to move the bar upward, extending the hips and knees. Do not lock out your knees.
At the top of the motion, pause briefly before returning to the starting position.
subtitle: Push Power: Leg Press Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Position the bar** on the Smith machine a couple of feet off the ground and ensure it's on the safeties. Load the bar with the right weight for you. 
2. **Lie down** underneath the bar and place the middle of your feet on it. Tuck your knees into your chest – this is your starting position. 
3. **Drive through your feet** to push the bar upward, extending your hips and knees. Remember, don't lock your knees! 
4. **Pause briefly** at the top of the movement. 
5. **Return slowly** to the starting position by bending your knees and hips.
tip: Imagine you're pushing a heavy sled up a hill 🌄. Keep your motion controlled and steady to avoid rolling back.
short_description: Get ready to power up those legs! The Smith Machine Leg Press targets your quads, glutes, hamstrings, and calves. It's like a leg day fiesta on a machine 🎉. Perfect for building strength and having fun!

name: Smith Machine One-Arm Upright Row
instructions: With the bar at thigh level, load an appropriate weight.

Take a wide grip on the bar and unhook the weight, removing your off hand from the bar. Your arm should be extended as you stand up straight with your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, raising the upper arm with the elbow pointed out. Continue until your upper arm is parallel to the floor.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.
subtitle: Lift and Smile with One Arm!
new_instructions:
1. **Load the bar**: Start with the bar at thigh level and add some weights.
2. **Get a grip**: Hold the bar with a wide grip, unhook the weight, and let go with your off hand.
3. **Stand tall**: Keep your arm extended, stand up straight, and lift your head and chest. This is your start!
4. **Lift up**: Bend your elbow and raise your arm, keeping your elbow pointed out until your upper arm is parallel to the floor.
5. **Pause and lower**: Hold briefly, then lower the weight back down slowly.
6. **Repeat**: Do the move for the number of reps you want, then hook the weight back.
tip: Imagine you're pulling up a heavy shopping bag with one arm – keep it steady and controlled! 🛍️
short_description: The Smith Machine One-Arm Upright Row targets your shoulders, biceps, and traps in one smooth motion. Perfect for beginners, this move will have you lifting and smiling with confidence! 😄

name: Smith Machine Overhead Shoulder Press
instructions: To begin, place a flat bench (or preferably one with back support) underneath a smith machine. Position the barbell at a height so that when seated on the flat bench, the arms must be almost fully extended to reach the barbell.

Once you have the correct height, sit slightly in behind the barbell so that there is an imaginary straight line from the tip of your nose to the barbell. Your feet should be stationary. Grab the barbell with the palms facing forward, unlock it and lift it up so that your arms are fully extended. This is the starting position.
Slowly begin to lower the barbell until it is level with your chin while inhaling.
Then lift the barbell back to the starting position using your shoulders while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Power Up Your Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Place a bench under the Smith machine. Adjust the barbell height so you can almost fully extend your arms when seated.
2. **Get Ready:** Sit down, positioning yourself slightly behind the bar. Align your nose with the bar and plant your feet firmly on the ground.
3. **Grip and Lift:** Grab the bar with palms facing forward. Unlock it and lift until your arms are fully extended. This is your starting position.
4. **Lower Slowly:** Inhale and slowly lower the bar to chin level.
5. **Press Up:** Exhale and push the bar back up to the starting position using your shoulders.
6. **Repeat:** Continue for the recommended number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine pushing the ceiling away with your hands! 🏋️‍♂️ Keep a steady rhythm for smooth, controlled movements.
short_description: This shoulder press targets your shoulders and triceps while stabilizing your upper body. It's perfect for beginners looking to build strength with guided machine support. 💪

name: Smith Machine Pistol Squat
instructions: To begin, first set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Step under it and position the bar across the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with your hands facing forward, unlock it and lift it off the rack by extending your legs. 3

Move one foot forward about 12 inches in front of the bar. Extend the other leg out in front of you, holding it off the ground. Look forward at all times and maintain a neutral or slightly arched spine. This will be your starting position.
Maintaining good posture, lower yourself by flexing the knee and hip, going down as far as flexibility allows.
Pause briefly at the bottom and then return to the starting position by driving through the heel of your foot, extending the knee and hip.
subtitle: One-Leg Wonder Squat
new_instructions:
1. **Set the bar**: Adjust the bar to shoulder height and step under it, resting it on your shoulders.
2. **Grip and lift**: Hold the bar with hands forward, unlock it, and lift by straightening your legs.
3. **Step forward**: Move one foot 12 inches ahead while extending the other leg forward off the ground.
4. **Lower down**: Keep good posture, bend your knee and hip to lower as much as you can.
5. **Push up**: Pause briefly, then push through your heel to stand back up by straightening your knee and hip.
tip: 🦵 Imagine you're a flamingo balancing on one leg. Keeping that focus will help you stay steady!
short_description: The Smith Machine Pistol Squat is a one-leg power move targeting quads, glutes, and more. It's a balance and strength challenge rolled into one. Feel the burn and embrace the wobble! 🦩

name: Smith Machine Reverse Calf Raises
instructions: Adjust the barbell on the smith machine to fit your height and align a raised platform right under the bar.
Stand on the platform with the heels of your feet secured on top of it with the balls of your feet extending off it. Position your toes facing forward with a shoulder width stance.

Now, place your shoulders under the barbell while maintaining the foot positioning described and push the barbell up by extending your hips and knees until your torso is standing erect. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position. Tip: The barbell on your back is only for balance purposes.

Raise the balls of your feet as you breathe out by extending your toes as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering the balls of your feet and toes.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Happy Heel Lifts
new_instructions:
1. Adjust the bar height on the Smith machine and place a raised platform below it. 
2. Stand on the platform with your heels secured and the balls of your feet hanging off. 
3. Position your shoulders under the bar and push up until you're standing tall. Keep knees slightly bent. 
4. Lift the balls of your feet by extending your toes and flexing your calves. Hold for a second. 
5. Lower back down slowly to the starting position. 
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're reaching for the stars with your toes! 🌟 This will help you get a full extension.
short_description: Pump up those calves with Happy Heel Lifts! This beginner-friendly move uses a Smith machine to isolate and strengthen your calves. Get ready to feel the burn and have some fun! 🦵

name: Smith Machine Squat
instructions: To begin, first set the bar on the height that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side (palms facing forward), unlock it and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Get Low, Stay Strong!
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the bar to match your height. Load it with the desired weight.
2. **Step** under the bar and place it across the back of your shoulders.
3. **Grip** the bar firmly with both hands, unlock it, and lift it by pushing with your legs.
4. **Position** your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out, keeping your back straight and head up.
5. **Lower** yourself by bending your knees until your thighs are just below parallel to the floor. Inhale as you go down.
6. **Push** through your heels to rise back up to the starting position, exhaling as you lift.
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into a tiny chair behind you to keep your knees from going past your toes. 🪑
short_description: Smith Machine Squats are fantastic for building lower body strength, targeting your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Plus, the machine offers great support for beginners. Let's squat our way to strong legs! 💪

name: Smith Machine Stiff-Legged Deadlift
instructions: To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the middle of your thighs. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.

Lift the bar up by fully extending your arms while keeping your back straight. Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narrower stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.

Keeping the knees stationary, lower the barbell to over the top of your feet by bending at the waist while keeping your back straight. Keep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the floor until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement

Start bringing your torso up straight again as soon as you feel the hamstrings stretch by extending your hips and waist until you are back at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Hamstring Magic Pull
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up**: Adjust the bar on the Smith machine to thigh height. Load it up and grab it with a palms-forward grip, shoulder-width apart.
2. **Lift and Stand**: Extend your arms to lift the bar, keeping your back straight. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
3. **Lower the Bar**: With knees steady, bend at the waist and lower the bar toward your feet. Keep your back straight and move forward until you feel your hamstrings stretch.
4. **Rise Up**: Once you feel that hamstring stretch, straighten your torso by extending your hips and waist to return to the start.
5. **Repeat**: Do the recommended number of repetitions. Keep that form in check!
tip: 🪄 Imagine you're a magician pulling a rope with your hamstrings to make the bar float. Keep that magic tension!
short_description: The Smith Machine Stiff-Legged Deadlift is great for targeting your hamstrings, glutes, and lower back. It's a fantastic move for building strength and flexibility. 💪✨

name: Smith Machine Upright Row
instructions: To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the middle of your thighs. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Lift the barbell up and fully extend your arms with your back straight. There should be a slight bend at the elbows. This is the starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the bar as you exhale. The bar should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the bar, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Happy Shoulder Lifts
new_instructions:
1. **Set the bar:** Place it around the middle of your thighs. Grab the bar with palms forward, shoulder-width apart. Consider wrist wraps for heavy weights.
2. **Start position:** Lift the bar, fully extending your arms with a slight elbow bend. Keep your back straight.
3. **Lift with shoulders:** Exhale and lift the bar using your side shoulders. Keep it close to your body and raise it near your chin. Remember, elbows lead the way!
4. **Pause and lower:** Pause at the top. Slowly lower the bar back, inhaling as you go.
5. **Repeat:** Continue for your desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a snug jacket. Keep the bar close and lead with your elbows to get that perfect form! 🧥
short_description: Pump up those shoulders and traps with the Smith Machine Upright Row! It's a fantastic exercise to build strength and get those muscles popping. Ready to feel the burn? 🔥

name: Smith Single-Leg Split Squat
instructions: To begin, place a flat bench 2-3 feet behind the smith machine. Then, set the bar on the height that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side (palms facing forward), unlock it and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.
Position your legs by placing one foot slightly forward under the bar and extending your other leg back and place the top of your foot on the bench. This will be your starting position

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knee as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calf becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knee should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knee is past that imaginary line (if it is past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot mainly as you straighten your leg again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement.
subtitle: Boost Your Booty with Smith Squats
new_instructions:
1. Set up a bench 2-3 feet behind the Smith machine and set the bar to shoulder height.
2. Step under the bar, resting it on your shoulders.
3. Grip the bar with both hands, palms forward, and lift it off the rack by pushing with your legs.
4. Place one foot forward under the bar and extend the other leg back, resting the top of your foot on the bench.
5. Lower the bar by bending your knee, keeping a straight posture until your upper leg is just below parallel to the floor.
6. Push through the heel of your front foot to lift the bar back to the start. Repeat for the recommended reps, then switch legs.
tip: Imagine you're sitting down on an invisible chair as you lower yourself. 🪑 This keeps your back straight and ensures proper form!
short_description: The Smith Single-Leg Split Squat is a killer move for your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It's like a one-way ticket to a stronger, more balanced lower body. Ready to feel the burn? 🔥

name: Snatch
instructions: Place your feet at a shoulder width stance with the barbell resting right above the connection between the toes and the rest of the foot.

With a palms facing down grip, bend at the knees and keeping the back flat grab the bar using a wider than shoulder width grip. Bring the hips down and make sure that your body drops as if you were going to sit on a chair. This will be your starting position.
Start pushing the floor as if it were a moving platform with your feet and simultaneously start lifting the barbell keeping it close to your legs.
As the bar reaches the middle of your thighs, push the floor with your legs and lift your body to a complete extension in an explosive motion.
Lift your shoulders back in a shrugging movement as you bring the bar up while lifting your elbows out to the side and keeping them above the bar for as long as possible.

Now in a very quick but powerful motion, you have to get your body under the barbell when it has reached a high enough point where it can be controlled and drop while locking your arms and holding the barbell overhead as you assume a squat position.
Finalize the movement by rising up out of the squat position to finish the lift. At the end of the lift both feet should be on line and the arms fully extended holding the barbell overhead.
subtitle: Power Up with the Snatch!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall:** Place your feet shoulder-width apart with the barbell over your toes.
2. **Grip it wide:** Bend your knees, keep your back flat, and grab the bar with a wide grip.
3. **Lift off:** Push through your feet and lift the bar close to your legs.
4. **Explode up:** As the bar hits mid-thigh, extend fully and shrug your shoulders.
5. **Drop and catch:** Quickly get under the barbell, arms locked overhead in a squat.
6. **Finish strong:** Stand up from the squat with the barbell overhead, feet aligned.
tip: Imagine you're jumping to reach the stars 🌟—this will help you get that explosive power!
short_description: The Snatch is an awesome full-body lift that boosts strength and power. Perfect for intermediate lifters looking to up their game! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Snatch Balance
instructions: Begin with the feet in the pulling position, the bar racked across the back of the shoulders, and the hands placed in a wide snatch grip.
Pop the bar with an abrupt dip and drive of the knees, and aggressively drive under the bar, transitioning the feet into the receiving position.
Receive the bar locked out overhead near the bottom of the squat. The torso should remain vertical, lowering the hips between the legs.
Continue to descend to full depth, and return to a standing position. Carefully lower the weight.
subtitle: Snatch and Squat Superstar!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** with your feet in pulling position, bar on your back, hands in a wide grip.
2. **Pop** the bar with a quick dip and drive your knees, diving under the bar.
3. **Catch** the bar overhead near the bottom of a squat, keep your torso vertical.
4. **Lower** your hips between your legs and descend fully into the squat.
5. **Stand** back up carefully and lower the bar back down.
tip: Think of the barbell like a rocket 🚀— explode with power and then guide it smoothly into orbit overhead!
short_description: Get ready to boost your strength and balance with the Snatch Balance! This move powers up your legs and shoulders, making you feel like a true lifting champion 🏋️‍♂️. Perfect for those looking to add some flair to their routine!

name: Snatch Deadlift
instructions: The snatch deadlift strengthens the first pull of the snatch. Begin with a wide snatch grip with the barbell placed on the platform. The feet should be directly under the hips, with the feet turned out. Squat down to the bar, keeping the back in absolute extension with the head facing forward.
Initiate the movement by driving through the heels, raising the hips. The back angle should remain the same until the bar passes the knees.
At that point, drive your hips through the bar as you lay back. Return the bar to the platform by reversing the motion.
subtitle: Snatch it like a Pro!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the barbell with a wide snatch grip. Feet should be under your hips, and toes turned out.
2. **Squat** down, keeping your back straight and head facing forward.
3. **Drive** through your heels to lift the bar, maintaining the same back angle until it passes your knees.
4. **Thrust** your hips forward as the bar rises, leaning back slightly.
5. **Lower** the bar back to the platform by reversing the steps.
tip: Imagine pushing the ground away from you with your heels, like launching a rocket 🚀.
short_description: The Snatch Deadlift is a powerful move that targets your hamstrings, glutes, and more! It's all about that strong lift-off, helping you nail the snatch. Feel the power and own it! 💥

name: Snatch Pull
instructions: With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take a wide snatch grip. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.

Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the pull. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward.

There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back. Full extension should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the extension for longer than necessary.
subtitle: Snatch It Up!
new_instructions:
1. Grab the bar with a wide snatch grip.
2. Lower your hips, keep weight on your heels, back straight, head forward, chest up.
3. Drive through your heels, extending your knees while keeping your arms straight.
4. As the bar reaches mid-thigh, extend your hips in a jumping motion.
5. At full extension, your body should be fully stretched and slightly leaning back.
tip: Imagine you're trying to jump explosively off the ground like a kangaroo 🦘. This helps you to focus on extending your hips, knees, and ankles powerfully!
short_description: The Snatch Pull is a dynamic exercise that targets your hamstrings, glutes, and more! It's like a power-packed jump that builds strength and speed. Give it a try for a full-body boost! 💥

name: Snatch Shrug
instructions: Begin with a wide grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. You can use a hook or overhand grip. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usually by loaded with heavier weight than a snatch, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.
subtitle: Lift and Shrug Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Start** with a wide grip on the barbell, hanging at mid-thigh. Keep your back straight and lean forward a bit.
2. **Hold** the bar with a hook or overhand grip.
3. **Shrug** your shoulders up towards your ears.
4. **Avoid** overloading the bar, as speed and form are crucial.
5. **Lower** the bar back to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping the motion smooth and controlled.
tip: Think of it like trying to touch your ears with your shoulders! 🤔 This helps activate the traps fully.
short_description: The Snatch Shrug is a dynamic move targeting your traps, forearms, and shoulders. It's perfect for building strength and power. Plus, it's a fun way to mix up your routine! 💪

name: Snatch from Blocks
instructions: Begin with a loaded barbell on boxes or stands of the desired height. A wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar, with the elbows pointed out. This will be the starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar from the boxes.

Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and allow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your feet into the receiving position, forcefully pull yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The feet should move to just outside the hips, turned out as necessary. Receive the bar with your body as low as possible and the arms fully extended overhead.
Keeping the bar aligned over the front of the heels, your head and chest up, drive through heels of the feet to move to a standing position. Carefully return the weight to the boxes.
subtitle: Lift Like a Champ!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab the Bar:** Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes turned out. Grip the barbell wide, keeping your chest up and eyes forward.
2. **First Pull:** Push through your heels to lift the bar off the blocks.
3. **Second Pull:** Extend your hips, knees, and ankles. Shrug your shoulders and pull the bar close to your body.
4. **Catch It:** Quickly pull yourself under the bar, landing in a squat with arms fully extended overhead.
5. **Stand Tall:** Drive through your heels to stand up straight, bar overhead.
6. **Return:** Carefully lower the bar back to the blocks.
tip: Imagine you are jumping to reach the stars 🌟. This helps you extend fully and generate more power!
short_description: Ready for a challenge? The Snatch from Blocks is an advanced lift that works your whole body, especially your quads and shoulders. It's all about power and precision—let's lift like a champ! 🏋️‍♂️

name: Speed Band Overhead Triceps
instructions: For this exercise anchor a band to the ground. We used an incline bench and anchored the band to the base, standing over the bench. Alternatively, this could be performed standing on the band.
To begin, pull the band behind your head, holding it with a pronated grip and your elbows up. This will be your starting position.
To perform the movement, extend through the elbow to to straighten your arms, ensuring that you keep your upper arm in place.
Pause, and then return to the starting position.
subtitle: Tricep Band Blast
new_instructions:
1. **Anchor** the resistance band to the ground or an incline bench. 
2. **Stand** over the bench or on the band, holding it with a pronated grip behind your head. Keep your elbows up. 
3. **Extend** your arms by straightening your elbows while keeping your upper arms steady. 
4. **Pause** briefly once your arms are fully extended. 
5. **Return** to the starting position with control.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping movements smooth.
tip: Imagine pushing the ceiling away with your hands to fully engage your triceps! 🚀
short_description: Blast your triceps with the Speed Band Overhead Triceps exercise! Using resistance bands, this move helps tone and strengthen your arms. Get ready to feel the burn! 🔥

name: Speed Box Squat
instructions: Attach bands to the bar that are securely anchored near the ground. You may need to choke the bands to get adequate tension.

Use a box of an appropriate height for this exercise. Load the bar to a weight that still requires effort, but isn't so heavy that speed is compromised. Typically, that will be between 50-70% of your one rep max.
Position the bar on your upper back, shoulder blades retracted, back arched and everything tight head to toe. This will be the starting position.
Unrack the bar and position yourself in front of the box. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box, ensuring that you descend under control and don't crash onto the surface.
Pause briefly, and explode off of the box, extending through the hips and knees.
subtitle: Squat & Pop
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** bands to the bar securely anchored near the ground. Adjust for adequate tension.
2. **Choose** a box of the right height. Load the bar with a weight that challenges but doesn't slow you down.
3. **Position** the bar on your upper back, retract your shoulder blades, arch your back, and tighten up from head to toe.
4. **Unrack** the bar and stand in front of the box. Lower yourself in a controlled manner until seated.
5. **Pause** briefly on the box, then explode up, extending through your hips and knees.
tip: Imagine you're a rocket launching off a pad 🚀—explode up with power after your brief pause!
short_description: Blast off with the Speed Box Squat! This move fires up your quads, glutes, and hamstrings, making your legs feel invincible. Perfect for powerlifters looking to add some fun to their routine! 💥

name: Speed Squats
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section).

Begin to lower the bar by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.

Begin to raise the bar as fast as possible without involving momentum as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position. Note: You should perform these exercises as fast as possible but without breaking perfect form and without involving momentum.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Quick Squat Blast
new_instructions:
1. Set up the barbell on a squat rack at shoulder height. Load it up and get ready!
2. Step under the bar and place it on the back of your shoulders. Grip firmly with both hands.
3. Push up with your legs and straighten your torso to lift the bar off the rack. Step back carefully.
4. Position your feet shoulder-width apart, with toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up and back straight.
5. Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are below parallel. Inhale as you go down.
6. Exhale and push through your heels to stand back up quickly. Repeat for the recommended reps.
tip: Imagine you're a spring, coiling down and then bursting up with power! 🌀 Keep it fast but controlled.
short_description: Speed Squats are a high-intensity compound exercise targeting your quads, glutes, and more. Feel the burn and boost your strength with every rep! 💥

name: Spell Caster
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a pronated grip. Your feet should be wide with your hips and knees extended. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by pulling both of the dumbbells to one side next to your hip, rotating your torso.
Keeping your arms straight and the dumbbells parallel to the ground, rotate your torso to swing the weights to your opposite side.
Continue alternating, rotating from one side to the other until the set is complete.
subtitle: Dumbbell Twists for Beginners
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a pair of dumbbells with both hands, palms facing down. **Stand** with your feet wide apart and keep your hips and knees straight. This is your starting position. 
2. **Twist** your torso to one side and **pull** the dumbbells to your hip. 
3. **Swing** the dumbbells across your body to the opposite side, keeping your arms straight and parallel to the ground. 
4. **Continue** rotating your torso and swinging the dumbbells from side to side until you've completed your set. 
5. **Remember** to keep your core tight and move fluidly.
6. **Finish** strong and feel the burn in your abs, glutes, and shoulders!
tip: Imagine you're stirring a giant pot of soup with the dumbbells. Keep your movements smooth and controlled! 🥄
short_description: Ready to twist and tone? The Spell Caster exercise is perfect for beginners to work their abs, glutes, and shoulders. Grab your dumbbells and let's get moving! 💪

name: Spider Crawl
instructions: Begin in a prone position on the floor. Support your weight on your hands and toes, with your feet together and your body straight. Your arms should be bent to 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by raising one foot off of the ground. Externally rotate the leg and bring the knee toward your elbow, as far forward as possible.
Return this leg to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
subtitle: Creep Like a Spider
new_instructions:
1. **Start** in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders and your body in a straight line. 
2. **Bend** your arms to 90 degrees, like you're lowering into a push-up. 
3. **Lift** one foot off the ground, turning your leg outward. 
4. **Crawl** by bringing your knee toward your elbow as far as you can. 
5. **Return** your leg to the starting position. 
6. **Repeat** on the other side, going back and forth like a spider!
tip: 🕷️ Picture yourself as Spider-Man sneaking up a wall. Keeping your body straight and low will help you move smoothly!
short_description: Channel your inner Spider-Man! This fun and sneaky move works your abs, chest, shoulders, and triceps. Get ready to crawl and feel the burn! 🕷️

name: Spider Curl
instructions: Start out by setting the bar on the part of the preacher bench that you would normally sit on. Make sure to align the barbell properly so that it is balanced and will not fall off.

Move to the front side of the preacher bench (the part where the arms usually lay) and position yourself to lay at a 45 degree slant with your torso and stomach pressed against the front side of the preacher bench.
Make sure that your feet (especially the toes) are well positioned on the floor and place your upper arms on top of the pad located on the inside part of the preacher bench.
Use your arms to grab the barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing up) at about shoulder width apart or slightly closer from each other.
Slowly begin to lift the barbell upwards and exhale. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the barbell back to the starting position as your breathe in. .
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Creepy-Crawly Bicep Boost
new_instructions:
1. **Set up the Bar**: Place the EZ bar on the seat of the preacher bench, making sure it's balanced.
2. **Position Yourself**: Move to the front of the bench and lay your torso and stomach at a 45-degree angle against it.
3. **Plant Your Feet**: Firmly position your feet, especially your toes, on the floor. Rest your upper arms on the bench pad.
4. **Grab the Bar**: Use a supinated grip (palms up) at shoulder-width or slightly closer.
5. **Lift the Bar**: Slowly lift the barbell upwards while exhaling. Squeeze your biceps at the top and hold for a second.
6. **Lower the Bar**: Gradually lower the barbell back to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a stress ball at the top of the curl to really engage those biceps! 💪
short_description: Pump up those biceps with Spider Curls! This isolation exercise uses an EZ bar to target your arms, making you feel strong and awesome. Get ready to feel the burn and have fun! 🕷️💥

name: Spinal Stretch
instructions: Sit in a chair so your back is straight and your feet planted on the floor.
Interlace your fingers behind your head, elbows out and your chin down.
Twist your upper body to one side about 3 times as far as you can. Then lean forward and twist your torso to reach your elbow to the floor on the inside of your knee.
Return to upright position and then repeat for your other side.
subtitle: Twist and Lean for a Happy Spine!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** in a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
2. **Interlace** your fingers behind your head, elbows out, and chin down.
3. **Twist** your upper body to one side as far as you can, about 3 times.
4. **Lean** forward and twist your torso to reach your elbow to the floor inside your knee.
5. **Return** to the upright position.
6. **Repeat** steps 3-5 for the other side.
tip: 🌀 Imagine you're wringing out a wet towel to get a deeper twist!
short_description: Get ready to feel the stretch in your back with the Spinal Stretch! This move helps improve flexibility and relieve tension in your middle back, lats, and neck. Perfect for a refreshing break! 🧘‍♂️

name: Split Clean
instructions: With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.

Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.

As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so.

Receive the bar with the feet split, aggressively moving one foot forward and one foot back. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom position, which will help in the recovery.
Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Bring the feet together as you stand up.
subtitle: Clean Split Fun
new_instructions:
1. Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, just outside your legs. Keep your back straight and look forward.
2. Push through your heels, extending your knees, and lift the bar to your knees while keeping your back angle the same.
3. Explode upwards by extending your hips, knees, and ankles like you're jumping. The bar should move up without using your arms.
4. Shrug your shoulders and flex your arms, rotating your elbows under the bar. Pull yourself down quickly.
5. Catch the bar by splitting your feet, one forward and one back. Rack the bar on your shoulders and descend to the bottom.
tip: Imagine you're jumping to reach a high shelf 📚. Use that explosive power to lift the bar!
short_description: The Split Clean is a dynamic full-body move that boosts strength and coordination. Perfect for intermediate lifters, it targets your legs, back, and shoulders. Give it a shot for a powerful workout! 💥

name: Split Jerk
instructions: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward.

Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible. Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders. At this moment as the feet leave the floor, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible.

In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athlete's effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should be moved to a split stance, one foot forward, one foot back, with the knees partially bent. Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead.
Return to a standing position, bringing the feet together.
subtitle: Split Jerk Joy
new_instructions:
1. **Start**: Stand tall with the barbell racked on your shoulders. Feet hip-width apart.
2. **Dip**: Bend your knees slightly, keeping your torso upright. No hip movement!
3. **Drive**: Push through your heels explosively. Move your head back as the bar rises.
4. **Split**: As feet leave the ground, jump into a split stance—one foot forward, one back.
5. **Catch**: Lock your arms overhead to catch the bar. Knees slightly bent.
6. **Stand**: Bring your feet back together and stand tall. Reset and repeat!
tip: Imagine you're a spring, coiling and uncoiling in a flash! 🌟 It helps with the explosive drive.
short_description: The Split Jerk is a power-packed move that boosts strength and coordination. Perfect for showing off those powerful legs and shoulders! 💥

name: Split Jump
instructions: Assume a lunge stance position with one foot forward with the knee bent, and the rear knee nearly touching the ground.
Ensure that the front knee is over the midline of the foot.
Extending through both legs, jump as high as possible, swinging your arms to gain lift.
As you jump, bring your feet together, and move them back to their initial positions as you land.
Absorb the impact by reverting back to the starting position.
subtitle: Jump for Joy!
new_instructions:
1. **Start** in a lunge position: one foot forward and one foot back, with your knees bent. 
2. **Check** that your front knee is right above your foot. 
3. **Jump** up high, pushing through both legs and swing your arms up to help you lift. 
4. **Bring** your feet together in mid-air. 
5. **Land** back in the lunge position you started in, with control. 
6. **Repeat** with a big smile!
tip: Imagine you're a rocket 🚀, blasting off and landing softly back on Earth. Keep it smooth and controlled!
short_description: Boost your heart rate and tone your legs with Split Jumps! This fun move works your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Ready to jump for joy? 😄

name: Split Snatch
instructions: Begin with a loaded barbell on the floor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar from the ground. The back angle should stay the same until the bar passes the knees.

Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and allow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your feet into the receiving position, forcefully pull yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The feet should move forcefully to a split position, one foot forward one foot back. Receive the bar with your body as low as possible and the arms fully extended overhead.
Keeping the bar aligned over the front of the heels, your head and chest up, drive through heels of the feet to move to a standing position, bringing your feet together.
Carefully return the weight to floor.
subtitle: Snatch It, Split It!
new_instructions:
1. Start with a loaded barbell on the floor, close to your shins. Feet hip-width apart, wide grip on the bar. Lower your hips, chest up, and look forward.
2. Drive through your heels to lift the bar. Keep your back angle steady until the bar passes your knees.
3. Extend through your hips, knees, and ankles. Drive the bar up, shrug your shoulders, and let your elbows flex to the side.
4. Move your feet into a split position as you pull yourself under the bar and elevate it overhead.
5. Align the bar over your heels, keep your head and chest up, and drive through your heels to stand up, bringing your feet together.
6. Carefully lower the weight back to the floor.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful rocket 🚀 launching the barbell into space—keep it close to your body for a smooth lift-off!
short_description: The Split Snatch is a dynamic, expert-level Olympic lift that targets your hamstrings and a host of other muscles. It's challenging but super rewarding, giving you the power boost of a superstar athlete! 🌟

name: Split Squat with Dumbbells
instructions: Position yourself into a staggered stance with the rear foot elevated and front foot forward.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand, letting them hang at the sides. This will be your starting position.
Begin by descending, flexing your knee and hip to lower your body down. Maintain good posture througout the movement. Keep the front knee in line with the foot as you perform the exercise.
At the bottom of the movement, drive through the heel to extend the knee and hip to return to the starting position.
subtitle: Leg Power with Dumbbells!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Get into a split stance, one foot forward and the other foot back on a bench or step. 
2. **Grab Dumbbells:** Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging by your sides. This is your starting position.
3. **Lower Down:** Bend your front knee and lower your body. Keep your back straight and your front knee over your ankle.
4. **Push Up:** Press through your front heel to rise back up to start. Keep your movements smooth and controlled.
5. **Repeat:** Complete the reps on one side, then switch legs and do it again.
6. **Feel the Burn:** Keep your core engaged and stay balanced throughout the move.
tip: Imagine you're lowering yourself like an elevator - smooth and controlled! 🚀
short_description: Get ready to power up those legs! Split Squats with Dumbbells target your quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Perfect for building strength and balance. Let's get moving! 💪

name: Split Squats
instructions: Being in a standing position. Jump into a split leg position, with one leg forward and one leg back, flexing the knees and lowering your hips slightly as you do so.
As you descend, immediately reverse direction, standing back up and jumping, reversing the position of your legs. Repeat 5-10 times on each leg.
subtitle: Jump and Split!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet together and arms at your sides.
2. **Jump** into a split leg position with one leg forward and one leg back.
3. **Bend your knees** slightly and lower your hips as you land.
4. **Push off** the ground and jump again, switching the position of your legs mid-air.
5. **Land softly** and get ready to jump again.
6. **Repeat** 5-10 times for each leg.
tip: Think of your legs like scissors ✂️, slicing through the air as you jump! Keep your core tight for better balance.
short_description: Split squats are a spicy move that gets your hamstrings, quads, and glutes burning! 🔥 Perfect for leveling up your leg game. Jump, switch, and feel the burn!

name: Squat Jerk
instructions: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible. Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.

At this moment as the feet leave the floor, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible. In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athlete's effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should move forcefully to just outside the hips, turned out as necessary. Receive the bar with your body in a full squat and the arms fully extended overhead.
Keeping the bar aligned over the front of the heels, your head and chest up, drive throught heels of the feet to move to a standing position. Carefully return the weight to floor.
subtitle: Explosive Squat Magic
new_instructions:
1. **Dip and Drive**: Start standing with the barbell racked on your shoulders. Dip slightly by bending your knees without moving your hips back. Reverse quickly and drive through your heels.
2. **Launch Up**: Push the barbell up powerfully as you straighten your legs. Move your head out of the way as the bar leaves your shoulders.
3. **Quick Feet**: In the brief moment your feet leave the floor, position them just outside your hips and turned out slightly. Catch the bar in a full squat with your arms fully extended overhead.
4. **Stand Tall**: Keep the bar over your heels, and with your head and chest up, push through your heels to stand up. Lower the bar safely back to the floor.
tip: Imagine you're a spring, coiling and uncoiling with explosive energy! 🌟 This will help you stay dynamic and powerful in your movements.
short_description: The Squat Jerk combines strength, speed, and flexibility into one explosive move! Perfect for showing off your power and control. Get ready to feel the burn and conquer this challenging move! 🔥

name: Squat with Bands
instructions: Set up the bands on the sleeves, secured to either band pegs, the rack, or dumbbells so that there is appropriate tension.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wide for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings. Keep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips as much as possible. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Lower bar position necessitates a greater torso lean to keep the bar over the heels. Continue until you break parallel, which is defined as the crease of the hip being in line with the top of the knee.

Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe, until you have returned to the starting position.
subtitle: Band-Powered Squat Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Secure the bands on the bar sleeves, attaching them to pegs, the rack, or dumbbells.
2. Step under the bar, placing it on your shoulders. Squeeze shoulder blades and rotate elbows forward.
3. Arch your lower back, lift the bar, and step back. Plant feet wide.
4. Keep your back, shoulders, and core tight. Push your knees and butt out, lowering yourself.
5. Lower until your hip crease is in line with your knee. Keep a forward lean.
6. Push through your heels, drive knees out, and rise back up.
tip: Imagine sitting back into a chair 🎭 to keep your balance and form perfect. Press through your heels like you're smashing a grape 🍇 for power!
short_description: Pump up your leg day with Squats and Bands! This move targets your quads, glutes, and more, giving you a full lower-body workout. Feel the burn and have some fun! 😄

name: Squat with Chains
instructions: To set up the chains, begin by looping the leader chain over the sleeves of the bar. The heavy chain should be attached using a snap hook. Adjust the length of the lead chain so that a few links are still on the floor at the top of the movement.

Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders.
