Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wide for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings. Keep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips as much as possible. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Lower bar position necessitates a greater torso lean to keep the bar over the heels. Continue until you break parallel, which is defined as the crease of the hip being in line with the top of the knee.

Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe, until you have returned to the starting position.
subtitle: Chain Squat Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Loop chains** over the barbell sleeves and secure them with snap hooks.
2. **Step under** the bar, place it on your shoulders, squeeze shoulder blades, and lift the bar off the rack.
3. **Stand wide** and keep your head forward, back, and core tight.
4. **Push knees and butt out** as you lower into a squat, keeping shins perpendicular.
5. **Break parallel** by lowering your hips below knee level.
6. **Drive up** through your heels, leading with your head, to return to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into a tiny chair behind you. 🍑 Keep your weight on your heels for better balance and power.
short_description: Pump up your leg day with Squat with Chains! This move targets your quads, glutes, and more, making you feel like a powerlifting superstar. 🌟 Ready to feel the burn and build serious strength?

name: Squat with Plate Movers
instructions: To begin, first set the bar on a rack to just below shoulder level. Position a weight plate on the ground a couple feet back from the rack. Once the bar is loaded, step under it and place the back of your shoulders across it.
Hold on to the bar with both hands and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straighten your torso.
Step away from the rack and adopt a wide stance with the toes slightly pointed out, with one foot on the weight plate. Keep your head up at all times. This will be your starting position.
Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees and hips. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees.
Raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heels of your feet as you extend the hips and knees.
At the top of the movement, side step, bringing your feet together on the opposite side of the plate.
Using your inside foot, push the weight plate, sliding it across the floor to where you were just standing.
Place your inside foot on the weight plate, adopting a wide stance for the next repetition.
subtitle: Squat & Slide Fun!
new_instructions:
1. Set up the barbell on a rack just below shoulder height and place a weight plate a couple of feet behind the rack.
2. Step under the bar, position it on the back of your shoulders, and lift it off the rack by pushing with your legs while straightening your torso.
3. Step back from the rack, adopt a wide stance with your toes slightly pointed out, and place one foot on the weight plate.
4. Lower yourself into a squat by bending your knees and hips until your thighs are just below parallel to the ground.
5. Push through your heels to stand back up, then side-step to bring your feet together on the opposite side of the plate.
tip: Think of the weight plate like a hockey puck 🏒—slide it smoothly across the floor for the best results!
short_description: The Squat with Plate Movers is a dynamic leg workout that combines strength and coordination. It's perfect for building strong quads, glutes, and hamstrings while keeping things fun and engaging. Give it a try and slide into stronger legs! 🦵💪

name: Squats - With Bands
instructions: To start out, make sure that the exercise band is at an even split between both the left and right side of the body. To do this, use your hands to grab both sides of the band and place both feet in the middle of the band. Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other.

When holding the bands, they should be the same height on each side. You should be using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) and have the handles of the bands next to your face for this exercise. This is the starting position.
Slowly start to bend the knees and lower the legs so that your thighs are parallel to the floor while exhaling.
Use the heel of your feet to push your body up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bounce Back with Bands!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab and Place**: Hold both sides of the band and step into the middle. Keep feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Set Your Grip**: Bring the band handles up next to your face with palms facing forward.
3. **Lower Down**: Bend your knees slowly, lowering your thighs until they're parallel to the floor. Exhale as you go down.
4. **Push Up**: Press through your heels to return to the starting position. Exhale as you push up.
5. **Repeat**: Go for the recommended number of repetitions and keep that form tight!
tip: Imagine sitting back into an invisible chair 🪑. It helps keep your knees safe and your form on point!
short_description: Squats with bands are a beginner-friendly way to fire up your quads, glutes, and more! Feel the burn and enjoy the bounce-back action! 🔥

name: Stairmaster
instructions: To begin, step onto the stairmaster and select the desired option from the menu. You can choose a manual setting, or you can select a program to run. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise.

Pump your legs up and down in an established rhythm, driving the pedals down but not all the way to the floor. It is recommended that you maintain your grip on the handles so that you don't fall. The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an appropriate intensity.

Stairmasters offer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usually have less impact than running outside. They are typically much harder than other cardio equipment. A 150 lb person will typically burn over 300 calories in 30 minutes, compared to about 175 calories walking.
subtitle: Step Up Your Cardio Game!
new_instructions:
1. **Step On**: Hop onto the Stairmaster and choose your settings. Go manual or pick a program.
2. **Start Stepping**: Press start and begin stepping, keeping a steady rhythm.
3. **Hold Tight**: Grip the handles to stay balanced and monitor your heart rate.
4. **Stay Steady**: Push the pedals down, but don't let them touch the floor.
5. **Keep Going**: Maintain a consistent pace and keep moving!
tip: 🌟 Imagine you're climbing to the top of a mountain. Keep your steps steady and your eyes on the prize! 🏔️
short_description: Get your heart pumping and legs burning with the Stairmaster! This machine simulates stair climbing, offering a fantastic cardio workout while toning your legs and glutes. 🚶‍♂️💦

name: Standing Alternating Dumbbell Press
instructions: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand. Raise the dumbbells to your shoulders with your palms facing forward and your elbows pointed out. This will be your starting position.
Extend one arm to press the dumbbell straight up, keeping your off hand in place. Do not lean or jerk the weight during the movement.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the opposite side, continuing to alternate between arms.
subtitle: Press Up, Smile On!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms forward, elbows out.
2. Extend one arm and press the dumbbell straight up, keeping the other hand steady.
3. Avoid leaning or jerking; keep the motion smooth.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then bring the weight back down.
5. Repeat with the other arm and keep alternating.
tip: Think of your arms like elevator doors opening and closing smoothly. 🚪 Stay in control!
short_description: Press up and power through with Standing Alternating Dumbbell Press! This beginner-friendly move targets your shoulders and triceps. Keep it smooth and steady, and you'll feel the burn in no time! 💪

name: Standing Barbell Calf Raise
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the bar on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck).
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position. Tip: For better range of motion you may also place the ball of your feet on a wooden block but be careful as this option requires more balance and a sturdy block.

Raise your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Boost Your Calves, Stand Tall!
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Position the barbell on a rack at shoulder height. Step under and rest it on your upper back, just below your neck. Grip firmly with both hands.
2. **Lift Off:** Push with your legs and straighten your torso to lift the barbell off the rack. Step back carefully.
3. **Stance:** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Keep your head up and back straight. Bend your knees slightly.
4. **Raise Up:** Lift your heels by extending your ankles. Flex your calves and hold for a second. Keep knees stationary.
5. **Lower Down:** Slowly lower your heels back to the ground, feeling the stretch in your calves. Repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a ballerina reaching for the stars on tiptoes 🌟. Stay balanced and controlled for best results!
short_description: Pump up those calves with the Standing Barbell Calf Raise! This move isolates your calf muscles, making them stronger and more defined. Plus, it’s beginner-friendly and super rewarding! 🦵

name: Standing Barbell Press Behind Neck
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for easier pick up of the bar. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your back should be kept straight while performing this exercise. This will be your starting position.
Elevate the barbell overhead by fully extending your arms while breathing out.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbell back down to the starting position by inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Press It Up, Behind the Neck!
new_instructions:
1. Set up: Place the bar on a rack at shoulder height. Load the bar with your desired weight.
2. Position: Step under the bar and rest it on the back of your shoulders, just below your neck. Grab the bar with both hands, wider than shoulder-width apart.
3. Lift Off: Push with your legs and straighten your torso to lift the bar off the rack. Step back and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
4. Press: Push the barbell overhead by fully extending your arms. Exhale as you press up.
5. Hold and Lower: Hold the barbell overhead for a second. Then, lower it back down to the starting position while inhaling.
6. Repeat: Continue for the number of reps you aim to complete.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling away with your hands 🏋️. This helps keep your motions strong and steady.
short_description: Strengthen your shoulders and triceps with the Standing Barbell Press Behind Neck. This exercise challenges your upper body and gives you that powerful, superhero feeling! 🦸‍♂️

name: Standing Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: With a dumbbell in one hand and the palm facing your torso, bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Make sure that you keep the head up.

The upper arm should be close to the torso and parallel to the floor while the forearm is pointing towards the floor as the hand holds the weight. Tip: There should be a 90-degree angle between the forearm and the upper arm. This is your starting position.

Keeping the upper arms stationary, use the triceps to lift the weights as you exhale until the forearms are parallel to the floor and the whole arm is extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Tricep Toner
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing your torso. **Bend** your knees a bit and **lean** forward at the waist until your back is almost parallel to the floor. Keep your head up!
2. **Position** your upper arm close to your torso and parallel to the floor. Your forearm should point down, forming a 90-degree angle with your upper arm. This is your starting spot.
3. **Lift** the dumbbell using your triceps as you exhale. Extend your arm until your forearm is parallel to the floor. Only your forearm moves!
4. **Hold** for a second at the top, then **lower** the dumbbell back to the start as you inhale.
5. **Repeat** for the prescribed reps, then **switch** arms and repeat.
tip: Imagine your forearm as a lever. Keep the movement smooth and controlled, like a crane lifting a load. 🚡
short_description: Tone those triceps with this fun and effective move! The Standing Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension isolates your triceps for maximum burn while also engaging your shoulders. Get ready to feel the burn and enjoy the gains! 💪

name: Standing Bent-Over Two-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: With a dumbbell in each hand and the palms facing your torso, bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Make sure that you keep the head up. The upper arms should be close to the torso and parallel to the floor while the forearms are pointing towards the floor as the hands hold the weights. Tip: There should be a 90-degree angle between the forearms and the upper arm. This is your starting position.

Keeping the upper arms stationary, use the triceps to lift the weights as you exhale until the forearms are parallel to the floor and the whole arms are extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbells back to their starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Tricep Toner Twister
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing in.
2. **Bend** your knees a bit and **lean** forward from your waist, keeping your back straight and head up.
3. **Hold** your upper arms close to your torso and parallel to the floor, with a 90-degree angle at your elbows.
4. **Extend** your forearms and lift the weights using your triceps until your arms are fully extended and parallel to the floor.
5. **Squeeze** your triceps at the top, then **lower** the dumbbells slowly back to starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping the rest of your body still.
tip: Imagine you're trying to gently push open a heavy door with the back of your hands 👐. This helps engage the triceps!
short_description: Get ready to sculpt those triceps! This move focuses on isolating and toning your triceps, giving you that sleek arm look. Grab some dumbbells and let’s get twisting! 💪

name: Standing Biceps Cable Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a cable curl bar that is attached to a low pulley. Grab the cable bar at shoulder width and keep the elbows close to the torso. The palm of your hands should be facing up (supinated grip). This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the curl bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Cable Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your torso upright and grab the cable curl bar attached to a low pulley. Keep your elbows close to your torso, and grip the bar with your palms facing up.
2. Hold your upper arms still and curl the bar by bending your elbows. Exhale as you lift the bar.
3. Keep lifting until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar reaches shoulder level. Squeeze your biceps and hold for a second.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position while inhaling.
5. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions. Enjoy the burn!
tip: Imagine you're lifting a trophy 🏆—keep your elbows steady and let your forearms do the work!
short_description: Get ready to flex those biceps with the Standing Biceps Cable Curl! This exercise isolates your biceps for a powerful pump. Grab the cable and feel the burn! 💪

name: Standing Biceps Stretch
instructions: Clasp your hands behind your back with your palms together, straighten arms and then rotate them so your palms face downward.
Raise your arms up and hold until you feel a stretch in your biceps.
subtitle: Big Bicep Bliss
new_instructions:
1. **Clasp** your hands behind your back with your palms together.
2. **Straighten** your arms fully.
3. **Rotate** your arms so your palms face downward.
4. **Raise** your arms slowly until you feel a stretch in your biceps.
5. **Hold** the stretch and take deep breaths.
6. **Release** gently and relax.
tip: Imagine you're trying to touch the sky with your fingertips 👐. It helps to really stretch those muscles!
short_description: Give your biceps some love with this simple stretch 🤗. Perfect for beginners, it’ll loosen up your chest and shoulders too. Hold and feel the bliss! 🌟

name: Standing Bradford Press
instructions: Place a loaded bar at shoulder level in a rack. With a pronated grip at shoulder width, begin with the bar racked across the front of your shoulders. This is your starting position.
Initiate the lift by extending the elbows to press the bar overhead. Avoid locking out the elbow as you move the weight behind your head.
Lower the bar down to the back of the head until your elbow forms a right angle.
Lift the bar back over your head by extending the elbows
Lower the bar down to the starting position.
Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Shoulder Shimmy Showdown
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell with your hands at shoulder width.
2. **Lift it up** to rest the barbell on the front of your shoulders, palms facing forward.
3. **Press up** by extending your elbows to lift the bar over your head, stopping before you fully lock out your elbows.
4. **Lower it down** behind your head until your elbows form a right angle.
5. **Lift again** to bring the bar back over your head and lower it to the starting position.
6. **Keep alternating** the front and back press until you've completed your set of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a human crane, smoothly lifting and lowering the bar. Keep the motion controlled, like you're picking up something precious! 🏗️
short_description: The Standing Bradford Press is a shoulder-strengthening superstar! It works your shoulders and triceps in a fun, alternating front-to-back motion. Perfect for beginners looking to build some upper body power! 💪

name: Standing Cable Chest Press
instructions: Position dual pulleys to chest height and select an appropriate weight. Stand a foot or two in front of the cables, holding one in each hand. You can stagger your stance for better stability.
Position the upper arm at a 90 degree angle with the shoulder blades together. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the rest of the body stationary, extend through the elbows to press the handles forward, drawing them together in front of you.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.
subtitle: Push and Squeeze
new_instructions:
1. **Set Up:** Stand in front of the cable machine, positioning the pulleys at chest height. Hold one handle in each hand, and step forward to stagger your stance for stability.
2. **Prepare:** Position your upper arms at a 90-degree angle with your shoulder blades together. This is your starting point.
3. **Push:** Keeping your body still, extend your elbows and press the handles forward, bringing them together in front of you.
4. **Squeeze:** Pause at the top of the movement, squeezing your chest muscles.
5. **Return:** Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position, keeping control of the weight throughout.
6. **Repeat:** Aim for 10-12 reps, focusing on form and control.
tip: Imagine you're hugging a big beach ball 🏖️ as you bring the cables together. This helps activate your chest muscles better!
short_description: The Standing Cable Chest Press is a fun way to strengthen your chest, shoulders, and triceps. It's perfect for beginners and gives you a great upper body workout. Let's get pushing! 💪

name: Standing Cable Lift
instructions: Connect a standard handle on a tower, and move the cable to the lowest pulley position.

With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your feet positioned shoulder width apart, squat down and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended.
In one motion, pull the handle up and across your body until your arms are in a fully-extended position above your head.
Keep your back straight and your arms close to your body as you pivot your back foot and straighten your legs to get a full range of motion.
Retract your arms and then your body. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
subtitle: Cable Lift Fun
new_instructions:
1. Set up the cable at the lowest position and attach a handle.
2. Stand with your side facing the cable and grab the handle with one hand. Step away until your arm is straight.
3. Squat down and grab the handle with both hands, arms fully extended.
4. Pull the handle up and across your body, extending your arms above your head.
5. Keep your back straight and pivot your back foot as you lift. Straighten your legs for full motion.
6. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
tip: Imagine you're zipping up a giant jacket! Keep the motion smooth and controlled. 🚶‍♂️
short_description: Get ready to power up your abs and shoulders with this fun cable exercise! The Standing Cable Lift is perfect for beginners and brings a full-body twist. 🌟

name: Standing Cable Wood Chop
instructions: Connect a standard handle to a tower, and move the cable to the highest pulley position.

With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your feet positioned shoulder width apart, reach upward with your other hand and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended.
In one motion, pull the handle down and across your body to your front knee while rotating your torso.
Keep your back and arms straight and core tight while you pivot your back foot and bend your knees to get a full range of motion.
Maintain your stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
subtitle: Wood Chop Whirlwind
new_instructions:
1. **Attach:** Connect a handle to the highest pulley position.
2. **Grab and Step:** Stand sideways to the cable, grab the handle with one hand, and step away.
3. **Double Grip:** Place your feet shoulder-width apart, grab the handle with both hands above your head.
4. **Chop:** Pull the handle down and across your body to your front knee, rotating your torso.
5. **Pivot and Bend:** Keep your back straight, core tight, pivot your back foot, and bend your knees.
6. **Return:** Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're chopping through a thick tree trunk 🪓. Keep your movements strong and controlled for the best results!
short_description: Get ready to twist and tone with the Standing Cable Wood Chop! This move targets your abs and shoulders, giving you a powerful core and upper body. Plus, it's a fun way to feel like a lumberjack! 🪵💪

name: Standing Calf Raises
instructions: Adjust the padded lever of the calf raise machine to fit your height.

Place your shoulders under the pads provided and position your toes facing forward (or using any of the two other positions described at the beginning of the chapter). The balls of your feet should be secured on top of the calf block with the heels extending off it. Push the lever up by extending your hips and knees until your torso is standing erect. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. Toes should be facing forward, outwards or inwards as described at the beginning of the chapter. This will be your starting position.

Raise your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Toe Tappers
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the calf raise machine to fit your height.
2. **Place** your shoulders under the pads and position your toes on the calf block, with heels hanging off.
3. **Push** up the lever by extending your hips and knees until standing straight; keep knees slightly bent.
4. **Lift** your heels as high as possible while keeping your knees stationary. Squeeze those calves!
5. **Lower** your heels back down slowly to the starting position.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended amount of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're trying to peek over a tall fence with each raise. 🌳👀
short_description: Give your calves a real burn with Standing Calf Raises! Perfect for beginners, this move targets those lower leg muscles, making you feel strong and steady. 🦵🔥

name: Standing Concentration Curl
instructions: Taking a dumbbell in your working hand, lean forward. Allow your working arm to hang perpendicular to the ground with the elbow pointing out. This will be your starting position.
Flex the elbow to curl the weight, keeping the upper arm stationary. At the top of the repetition, flex the biceps and pause.
Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Power-Up Curl
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell in one hand and lean forward slightly. 
2. Let your arm hang straight down with your elbow pointing out. This is your starting position.
3. Curl the dumbbell up by bending your elbow, keeping your upper arm still.
4. Squeeze your bicep at the top, then pause for a moment.
5. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine you're lifting a heavy treasure chest lid with your bicep! 💪
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Standing Concentration Curl! This beginner-friendly move isolates your biceps for maximum muscle growth. Get ready to feel the burn and show off those guns! 💥

name: Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise
instructions: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. Place the ball of the foot on a sturdy and stable wooden board (that is around 2-3 inches tall) while your heels extend off and touch the floor. This will be your starting position.

With the toes pointing either straight (to hit all parts equally), inwards (for emphasis on the outer head) or outwards (for emphasis on the inner head), raise the heels off the floor as you exhale by contracting the calves. Hold the top contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position by slowly lowering the heels.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
subtitle: Tiptoe to Strong Calves!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall**: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and keep your arms by your sides.
2. **Position your feet**: Place the balls of your feet on a 2-3 inch board, with your heels touching the floor.
3. **Choose your toe direction**: Point your toes straight, inwards, or outwards for different calf emphasis.
4. **Lift your heels**: Push through the balls of your feet and lift your heels as high as possible.
5. **Hold and squeeze**: At the top, squeeze your calves and hold for a second.
6. **Lower slowly**: Gently lower your heels back down and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're trying to peek over a tall fence 🏞️. This will help you get a full range of motion and really work those calves!
short_description: Pump up those calves with the Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise! This move isolates the calves for a focused burn and strength gain. Grab your dumbbells and let's tiptoe to stronger legs! 💪

name: Standing Dumbbell Press
instructions: Standing with your feet shoulder width apart, take a dumbbell in each hand. Raise the dumbbells to head height, the elbows out and about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Maintaining strict technique with no leg drive or leaning back, extend through the elbow to raise the weights together directly above your head.
Pause, and slowly return the weight to the starting position.
subtitle: Raise the Roof!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. **Lift** the dumbbells to head height, elbows out and bent at 90 degrees. This is your starting position.
3. **Press** the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended above your head.
4. **Pause** briefly at the top, feeling the burn in your shoulders.
5. **Lower** the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position with control.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your movements smooth and steady.
tip: Imagine you're pushing the ceiling away from you! 🚀 Keep your core tight to stay balanced.
short_description: Pump up those shoulders with the Standing Dumbbell Press! This beginner-friendly move strengthens your shoulders and triceps, giving you that powerful look. 💪 Get ready to raise the roof and feel the burn!

name: Standing Dumbbell Reverse Curl
instructions: To begin, stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your arms should be fully extended while your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.

While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Blaster Bonanza!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing down (pronated grip).
2. **Keep your upper arms still** and curl the weights up by bending your elbows. Only your forearms should move.
3. **Squeeze** your biceps at the top when the dumbbells reach shoulder level. Hold for a second.
4. **Slowly lower** the weights back to the starting position while breathing in.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your form tight.
tip: Imagine your biceps are like sponges soaking up all the strength 💪. Keep that squeeze at the top to make the most of each rep!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Standing Dumbbell Reverse Curl! This exercise isolates your biceps and forearms to give you that satisfying burn. Feel the power and enjoy the gains! 💥

name: Standing Dumbbell Straight-Arm Front Delt Raise Above Head
instructions: Hold the dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms facing your thighs.
Keep your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows but keep them locked. This will be your starting position.
Raise the dumbbells in a semicircular motion to arm's length overhead as you exhale.
Slowly return to the starting position using the same path as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift Up, Reach High!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the dumbbells and hold them in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs.
2. **Keep** your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows. This is your starting spot.
3. **Lift** the dumbbells in a half-circle motion until they're overhead as you breathe out.
4. **Lower** the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting spot as you breathe in.
5. **Repeat** these steps for your set number of repetitions.
tip: Imagine you're a strong superhero reaching for the sky! 🦸‍♂️
short_description: This move targets your shoulders, building strength and definition. Feel powerful as you lift those weights overhead! 💪

name: Standing Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: To begin, stand up with a dumbbell held by both hands. Your feet should be about shoulder width apart from each other. Slowly use both hands to grab the dumbbell and lift it over your head until both arms are fully extended.
The resistance should be resting in the palms of your hands with your thumbs around it. The palm of the hands should be facing up towards the ceiling. This will be your starting position.

Keeping your upper arms close to your head with elbows in and perpendicular to the floor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The upper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the dumbbell. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Triumph with Triceps!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell with both hands.
2. **Lift** the dumbbell over your head until your arms are fully extended. Palms should face up.
3. **Lower** the dumbbell in a semicircle behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Keep upper arms still.
4. **Raise** the dumbbell back to the starting position using your triceps. Exhale as you lift.
5. **Repeat** for your desired number of reps, keeping a steady pace!
tip: 🧘 Pretend you're tracing a rainbow with the dumbbell! Keep your upper arms still and let the forearms do the magic.
short_description: Boost your triceps power with the Standing Dumbbell Triceps Extension! This beginner-friendly move isolates the triceps, helping you build strength and definition. 🌟 Get ready to push your limits and feel the burn!

name: Standing Dumbbell Upright Row
instructions: Grasp a dumbbell in each hand with a pronated (palms forward) grip that is slightly less than shoulder width. The dumbbells should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This will be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbbells as you exhale. The dumbbells should be close to the body as you move it up and the elbows should drive the motion. Continue to lift them until they nearly touch your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbbells, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift Those Weights High!
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing forward, just below shoulder width. Rest them on your thighs.
2. Stand tall with a slight bend in your elbows. Keep your back straight—this is your starting point.
3. Lift the dumbbells using your shoulder muscles. Keep them close to your body and drive the motion with your elbows.
4. Raise the dumbbells until they almost touch your chin. Hold for a second. Remember, elbows higher than forearms!
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position. Inhale as you go down.
6. Repeat for the recommended number of reps. Keep it steady and controlled!
tip: Imagine pulling up your favorite pair of jeans—elbows high and close to the body! 👖
short_description: Feel the burn with Standing Dumbbell Upright Rows! This move targets your traps, biceps, and shoulders for a solid upper body workout. Keep those elbows high and enjoy the lift! 💪

name: Standing Elevated Quad Stretch
instructions: Start by standing with your back about two to three feet away from a bench or step.
Lift one leg behind you and rest your foot on the step,either on your instep or the ball of your foot, whichever you find most comfortable.
Keep your supporting knee slightly bent and avoid letting that knee extend out beyond your toes. Switch sides.
subtitle: Stretch and Smile
new_instructions:
1. Stand with your back 2-3 feet away from a bench or step.
2. Lift one leg behind you and rest your foot on the step, using your instep or the ball of your foot.
3. Slightly bend the knee of your supporting leg.
4. Avoid letting your supporting knee extend beyond your toes.
5. Hold the stretch, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
6. Switch sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're gently pulling your lifted foot towards your glutes like a puppet string 🎭. This will help you get a deeper stretch!
short_description: Get those quads feeling fantastic with this easy stretch! Stand tall, lift a leg, and rest it on a step for a deep quad stretch. Great for flexibility and feeling awesome! 🦵

name: Standing Front Barbell Raise Over Head
instructions: To begin, stand straight with a barbell in your hands. You should grip the bar with palms facing down and a closer than shoulder width grip apart from each other.
Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Your elbows should be slightly bent. This is the starting position.
Lift the barbell up until it is directly over your head while exhaling. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent when performing each repetition.
Once you feel the contraction, begin to lower the barbell back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift Up and Shine!
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with palms facing down, grip close. 
2. Keep your elbows slightly bent and take a deep breath.
3. Exhale and raise the barbell up smoothly until it's over your head.
4. Feel the squeeze in your shoulders at the top.
5. Inhale as you gently lower the barbell back to the starting position.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping your movements controlled.
tip: 👁️ Imagine you're pushing the barbell up to place it on a high shelf. This mental trick can help maintain good form.
short_description: Get ready to light up those shoulders with the Standing Front Barbell Raise Over Head. This move isolates your shoulder muscles, making them work hard and shine bright! 🌟

name: Standing Gastrocnemius Calf Stretch
instructions: Place your right heel on a step with your knee extended and lean forward to grab your right toe with your right hand. Your left knee should be slightly bent and your back should be straight.
Support your weight on your left leg and place your left hand on your left thigh.
Pull your right toes toward your knee until you feel a stretch in your calf.
subtitle: Happy Heel Stretch
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Stand near a step or raised platform.
2. **Place Heel**: Place your right heel on the step, keeping your knee straight.
3. **Lean Forward**: Lean forward and reach for your right toes with your right hand.
4. **Support**: Keep your left knee slightly bent, supporting yourself with your left hand on your left thigh.
5. **Feel the Stretch**: Gently pull your right toes towards your knee until you feel a stretch in your calf. Hold for a bit and switch legs!
tip: Imagine you're trying to bring your toes to kiss your knee – but gently! 😊
short_description: This calf stretch is a simple way to loosen up those tight muscles. Perfect for beginners, it helps increase flexibility in your calves and hamstrings. Give it a try and feel the difference! 🦵

name: Standing Hamstring and Calf Stretch
instructions: Being by looping a belt, band, or rope around one foot. While standing, place that foot forward.
Bend your back leg, while keeping the front one straight. Now raise the toes of your front foot off of the ground and lean forward.
Using the belt, pull on the top of the foot to increase the stretch in the calf. Hold for 10-20 seconds and repeat with the other foot.
subtitle: Stretch and Smile
new_instructions:
1. Loop a belt, band, or rope around one foot.
2. Stand tall and place that foot forward.
3. Bend your back leg while keeping the front one straight.
4. Raise the toes of your front foot off the ground.
5. Lean forward gently.
6. Pull on the belt to stretch your calf. Hold for 10-20 seconds. Repeat with the other foot.
tip: Imagine you're reaching for a cookie on a high shelf 🥠. This helps keep your back straight and deepen the stretch.
short_description: The Standing Hamstring and Calf Stretch is a beginner-friendly move that targets your hamstrings. It's perfect for a quick stretch session to loosen up those muscles and keep you flexible. 🌟

name: Standing Hip Circles
instructions: Begin standing on one leg, holding to a vertical support.
Raise the unsupported knee to 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Open the hip as far as possible, attempting to make a big circle with your knee.
Perform this movement slowly for a number of repetitions, and repeat on the other side.
subtitle: Hip Circle Fun
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall on one leg and hold onto something sturdy.
2. Lift your other knee up to a 90-degree angle.
3. Start making a big circle with your knee, moving slowly.
4. Open your hip as far as you can while circling.
5. Do this for a few reps, then switch legs.
tip: Imagine you're drawing a big pizza with your knee! 🍕 Make those circles round and even.
short_description: Standing Hip Circles are a great beginner move to get your hips loose and limber. It's like giving your hips a fun, little dance! 🕺

name: Standing Hip Flexors
instructions: Stand up straight with the spine vertical, the left foot slightly in front of the right.

Bend both knees and lift the back heel off the floor as you press the right hip forward. You can't get a thorough, deep stretch in this position, however, because it's hard to relax the hip flexor and stand on it at the same time. Switch sides.
subtitle: Hip Flexor Stretch Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Stand up straight with your left foot slightly in front of your right.
2. **Bend Knees**: Gently bend both knees and lift your right heel off the floor.
3. **Press Forward**: Push your right hip forward to feel the stretch.
4. **Hold**: Maintain this position for a few seconds, keeping your back straight.
5. **Switch Sides**: Return to the starting position and switch to the other side.
tip: Imagine your hips are a hinge, gently swinging forward with ease. 🦿
short_description: Stretch those hip flexors with this easy move. Great for beginners, it helps improve flexibility in your quadriceps. Feel the relief and keep those hips happy! 🧘‍♂️

name: Standing Inner-Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand up with a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso. Your legs should be at about shoulder's width apart from each other.
Rotate the palms of the hands so that they are facing inward in a neutral position. This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights out while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Your wrist should turn so that when the weights are fully elevated you have supinated grip (palms facing up).
Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Tip: Keep the forearms aligned with your outer deltoids.
Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position as your breathe in. Remember to rotate the wrists as you lower the weight in order to switch back to a neutral grip.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Curl Twist
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Rotate your palms inward so they face each other, starting in a neutral position.
3. Keep upper arms still and curl the weights while rotating your wrists so your palms face up at the top.
4. Once dumbbells are shoulder level, squeeze your biceps and hold for a second.
5. Slowly lower the weights, rotating your wrists back to start position and breathe in.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps, keeping good form.
tip: 🌀 Imagine you're scooping ice cream with your hands. Rotate your wrists smoothly to get that perfect curl!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Standing Inner-Biceps Curl! This move isolates your biceps, giving you a killer arm workout. Grab some dumbbells and let's get curling! 💪

name: Standing Lateral Stretch
instructions: Take a slightly wider than hip distance stance with your knees slightly bent.
Place your right hand on your right hip to support the spine.
Raise your left arm in a vertical line and place your left hand behind your head. Keep it there as you incline your torso to the right.
Keep your weight evenly distributed between both legs (don't lean into your left hip). Switch sides.
subtitle: Reach for the Sky 🌤️
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with feet slightly wider than hip-distance apart and knees slightly bent.
2. **Place** your right hand on your right hip to support your spine.
3. **Stretch** your left arm straight up and put your left hand behind your head.
4. **Lean** your torso gently to the right while keeping your spine long.
5. **Hold** the position for a few deep breaths, feeling the stretch in your side.
6. **Switch** sides and repeat the same steps.
tip: Imagine you're a tall tree swaying gently in the breeze 🌳. Keep your movements smooth and controlled!
short_description: Stretch out your sides and feel awesome with the Standing Lateral Stretch! It's a simple move that helps lengthen your abs and improve flexibility. Perfect for a quick, refreshing break! 🌟

name: Standing Leg Curl
instructions: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie with your torso bent at the waist facing forward around 30-45 degrees (since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment) with the pad of the lever on the back of your right leg (just a few inches under the calves) and the front of the right leg on top of the machine pad.
Keeping the torso bent forward, ensure your leg is fully stretched and grab the side handles of the machine. Position your toes straight. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl your right leg up as far as possible without lifting the upper leg from the pad. Once you hit the fully contracted position, hold it for a second.
As you inhale, bring the legs back to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Perform the same exercise now for the left leg.
subtitle: Hamstring Hero Curl
new_instructions:
1. **Adjust** the machine lever to fit your height and stand with your chest leaning slightly forward, about 30-45 degrees.
2. **Position** the pad so it rests just below your right calf and place your right leg on top of the machine pad.
3. **Grip** the handles on the sides of the machine and keep your right leg fully extended with your toes pointed straight.
4. **Curl** your right leg up as far as you can without moving your upper leg, then hold for a second.
5. **Lower** your leg back to the start position in a controlled motion. Repeat for the recommended reps.
6. **Switch** to your left leg and repeat the exercise.
tip: Think of your leg like a superhero cape 🦸‍♂️—keep it controlled as you curl up and release!
short_description: Standing Leg Curl is a fantastic, beginner-friendly exercise to target your hamstrings. Using a machine, you'll curl one leg at a time, making those hamstrings stronger with each rep. 🌟

name: Standing Long Jump
instructions: This drill is best done in sand or other soft landing surface. Ensure that you are able to measure distance. Stand in a partial squat stance with feet shoulder width apart.
Utilizing a big arm swing and a countermovement of the legs, jump forward as far as you can.
Attempt to land with your feet out in front you, reaching as far as possible with your legs.
Measure the distance from your landing point to the starting point and track results.
subtitle: Leap Forward Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** in a partial squat with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Swing** your arms back and bend your knees slightly.
3. **Jump** forward as far as you can while swinging your arms forward.
4. **Land** with your feet reaching out in front of you.
5. **Measure** the distance from where you started to where you landed.
6. **Track** your results and aim to improve!
tip: Imagine you're a superhero taking off for flight! 🦸‍♂️ Swing those arms and leap with confidence!
short_description: Get ready to leap into action with the Standing Long Jump! This exercise works your legs and core, helping you build explosive power. It's like flying without leaving the ground! 🦘

name: Standing Low-Pulley Deltoid Raise
instructions: Start by standing to the right side of a low pulley row. Use your left hand to come across the body and grab a single handle attached to the low pulley with a pronated grip (palms facing down). Rest your arm in front of you. Your right hand should grab the machine for better support and balance.
Make sure that your back is erect and your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
Begin to use the left hand and come across your body out until it is elevated to shoulder height while exhaling.
Feel the contraction at the top for a second and begin to slowly lower the handle back down to the original starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Shoulder Lift Magic!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** next to the low pulley, feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the handle with your left hand across your body, and your right hand on the machine for support.
2. **Straighten up** your back and get ready. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift** the handle across your body to shoulder height while you exhale. Feel the awesome shoulder burn!
4. **Hold** for a second at the top, then slowly bring the handle back down as you inhale.
5. **Repeat** for your set reps. Then, switch arms and do it again!
tip: 🧙‍♂️ Imagine you're casting a spell! Keep your movement smooth and controlled, like you're waving a magic wand. This keeps your form spot on!
short_description: Elevate your shoulder game with the Standing Low-Pulley Deltoid Raise! This beginner-friendly move targets your shoulders and forearms, giving you that sculpted look. Feel the magic with every lift! 🪄

name: Standing Low-Pulley One-Arm Triceps Extension
instructions: Grab a single handle with your left arm next to the low pulley machine. Turn away from the machine keeping the handle to the side of your body with your arm fully extended. Now use both hands to elevate the single handle directly above the head with the palm facing forward. Keep your upper arm completely vertical (perpendicular to the floor) and put your right hand on your left elbow to help keep it steady. This is the starting position.

Keeping your upper arms close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the floor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The upper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the single handle. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Tricep Toner Time
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the handle with your left hand and face away from the low pulley machine. **Extend** your left arm fully, keeping the handle by your side. 
2. **Lift** the handle above your head using both hands. Your left palm should face forward, and your right hand should support your left elbow. This is your starting position. 
3. **Lower** the handle in a semi-circle behind your head until your forearm touches your biceps. Inhale as you do this. Keep your upper arm still. 
4. **Raise** the handle back to the starting position by pushing with your triceps. Exhale as you do this. 
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions. 
6. **Switch** arms and repeat.
tip: Imagine your tricep as a spring, coiling and uncoiling. Keep it tight and controlled! 💪
short_description: Tone and strengthen your triceps with the Standing Low-Pulley One-Arm Triceps Extension! This move will sculpt your triceps while also engaging your chest and shoulders. Get ready to feel the burn and embrace the pump! 🔥

name: Standing Military Press
instructions: Start by placing a barbell that is about chest high on a squat rack. Once you have selected the weights, grab the barbell using a pronated (palms facing forward) grip. Make sure to grip the bar wider than shoulder width apart from each other.
Slightly bend the knees and place the barbell on your collar bone. Lift the barbell up keeping it lying on your chest. Take a step back and position your feet shoulder width apart from each other.

Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the collarbone slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Push Up Those Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. Place a barbell on a squat rack at chest height.
2. Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width apart, palms forward.
3. Bend your knees slightly and lift the barbell onto your collarbone.
4. Step back, feet shoulder-width apart.
5. Press the barbell overhead until your arms lock, then lower it slowly back to your collarbone. 
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you’re pushing the barbell through the roof! 🚀 This helps engage your shoulders fully.
short_description: The Standing Military Press is a powerhouse move for strong shoulders and triceps. It's a simple yet effective way to build upper body strength. Get ready to push your limits and feel the burn!🔥

name: Standing Olympic Plate Hand Squeeze
instructions: To begin, stand straight while holding a weight plate by the ridge at arm's length in each hand using a neutral grip (palms facing in). You feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. This will be your starting position.
Lower the plates until the fingers are nearly extended but can still hold weights. Inhale as you lower the plates.
Now raise the plates back to the starting position as you exhale by closing your hands.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.
subtitle: Plate Squeeze Power
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate in each hand by the ridge with palms facing in.
2. **Lower the plates** slowly until your fingers are almost extended, but still gripping the weights. Breathe in as you lower.
3. **Squeeze and lift** the plates back to the starting position by closing your hands. Breathe out as you lift.
4. **Repeat** for the recommended number of repetitions, keeping your movements controlled and steady.
tip: Imagine you're trying to squish a stress ball with each lift. 🏋️‍♂️ This helps engage your muscles more!
short_description: Get a grip on this fun forearm burn! The Standing Olympic Plate Hand Squeeze focuses on your forearms and biceps. It's perfect for building grip strength. 💪

name: Standing One-Arm Cable Curl
instructions: Start out by grabbing single handle next to the low pulley machine. Make sure you are far enough from the machine so that your arm is supporting the weight.

Make sure that your upper arm is stationary, perpendicular to the floor with elbows in and palms facing forward. Your non lifting arm should be grabbing your waist. This will allow you to keep your balance.
Slowly begin to curl the single handle upwards while keeping the upper arm stationary until your forearm touches your bicep while exhaling. Tip: Only the forearm should move.
Hold the contraction position as you squeeze the bicep and then lower the single handle back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms while performing this exercise.
subtitle: Single-Arm Cable Flex
new_instructions:
1. Grab the single handle next to the low pulley machine. Stand far enough so your arm supports the weight.
2. Keep your upper arm stationary, perpendicular to the floor with elbows in, and palms facing forward. Place your non-lifting hand on your waist for balance.
3. Slowly curl the handle upwards while keeping your upper arm still, exhaling as your forearm touches your bicep.
4. Squeeze your bicep at the top, then lower the handle back to the starting position while inhaling.
5. Repeat for the recommended reps.
6. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
tip: Imagine lifting a heavy shopping bag to your shoulder. 🛍️ Keep your upper arm steady to really work that bicep!
short_description: Pump up those biceps with the Standing One-Arm Cable Curl! This isolation move targets your biceps for a strong, sculpted look. Perfect for adding definition and strength! 💪

name: Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Curl Over Incline Bench
instructions: Stand on the back side of an incline bench as if you were going to be a spotter for someone. Have a dumbbell in one hand and rest it across the incline bench with a supinated (palms up) grip.

Position your non lifting hand at the corner or side of the incline bench. The chest should be pressed against the top part of the incline and your feet should be pressed against the floor at a wide stance. This is the starting position.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the dumbbell upward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms while performing this exercise.
subtitle: Bicep Boost on a Bench
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** behind an incline bench as if you're spotting someone. Hold a dumbbell with your palm facing up. 
2. **Place** your non-lifting hand on the bench for support. Press your chest against the top of the incline and stand with feet wide apart. This is your starting position. 
3. **Curl** the dumbbell upward while keeping your upper arm still. Only your forearm should move. Contract your biceps and lift the dumbbell to shoulder level. 
4. **Hold** the position for a second to feel the squeeze in your biceps.
5. **Lower** the dumbbell back to the starting position slowly. 
6. **Repeat** for the recommended reps, then switch arms and do it all over again.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a stress ball 🍊 in your bicep as you lift – this will help you focus on the muscle contraction!
short_description: Pump up your biceps with this focused curl exercise! Standing behind an incline bench, you'll isolate your biceps for maximum contraction and growth. Get ready to flex those guns! 💪

name: Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: To begin, stand up with a dumbbell held in one hand. Your feet should be about shoulder width apart from each other. Now fully extend the arm with the dumbbell over your head. Tip: The small finger of your hand should be facing the ceiling and the palm of your hand should be facing forward. The dumbbell should be above your head.
This will be your starting position.

Keeping your upper arm close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the floor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearm touch your bicep. Tip: The upper arm should remain stationary and only the forearm should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the dumbbell. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Tricep Topper Takedown 💪
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Grab a dumbbell with one hand and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arm fully above your head. 🌟
2. **Set Your Stance**: Ensure your palm faces forward and your little finger points to the ceiling. 🦸
3. **Lower Slowly**: Bend your elbow and lower the dumbbell in a semicircle behind your head. Keep your upper arm steady. 🌈
4. **Lift Up**: Use your triceps to push the dumbbell back up to the starting position. Exhale as you lift. 🏆
5. **Repeat**: Complete the desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat the motion.
tip: Imagine your upper arm is glued in place like a statue 🗿. Only your forearm should move to ensure you’re working your triceps perfectly!
short_description: Boost your triceps with the Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension! This move isolates your triceps, giving you strong, sculpted arms. Perfect for beginners. 💪

name: Standing Overhead Barbell Triceps Extension
instructions: To begin, stand up holding a barbell or e-z bar using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) with your hands closer than shoulder width apart from each other. Your feet should be about shoulder width apart.
Now elevate the barbell above your head until your arms are fully extended. Keep your elbows in. This will be your starting position.

Keeping your upper arms close to your head and elbows in, perpendicular to the floor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The upper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the barbell. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lift High for Strong Tris!
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a barbell with palms facing forward and hands close together. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Raise** the barbell above your head until your arms are straight. Keep elbows in tight.
3. **Lower** the barbell behind your head in a half-circle motion, keeping upper arms still. Breathe in.
4. **Lift** the barbell back up to the starting position using your triceps. Breathe out.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your form steady and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're lowering a drawbridge behind your head. Keep it smooth and controlled! 🚧
short_description: Get those triceps popping with the Standing Overhead Barbell Triceps Extension! This move isolates your tris for a serious burn. Feel the power and push through! 💥

name: Standing Palm-In One-Arm Dumbbell Press
instructions: Start by having a dumbbell in one hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Use your other arm to hold on to an incline bench to keep your balance.

Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbell up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arm. Note: Your forearm should be perpendicular to the floor. Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended. This the starting position.
While inhaling lower the weight down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.

Feel the contraction for a second and then lift the weight back up towards the starting position while exhaling. Remember to hold on to the incline bench and keep your feet positioned to keep balance during the exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: One-Arm Dumbbell Press Delight
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell with one hand and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold onto an incline bench with your free hand to keep your balance.
3. Slowly lift the dumbbell up to shoulder height, keeping your forearm perpendicular to the floor.
4. Push the dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended.
5. Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height while inhaling.
6. Repeat for the recommended reps, then switch arms.
tip: Imagine pushing the dumbbell through the roof! 🚀 Keep your core tight to stay balanced.
short_description: The One-Arm Dumbbell Press works your shoulders and triceps while improving balance. It's perfect for beginners looking to build strength. Give it a try and feel the burn! 💪

name: Standing Palms-In Dumbbell Press
instructions: Start by having a dumbbell in each hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbells up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arms. Note: Your forearms should be perpendicular to the floor. This the starting position.
Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise. Slowly lift the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended.
While inhaling lower the weights down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Press Up for Strong Shoulders!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Grab a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended to the sides. Keep feet shoulder-width apart.
2. **Lift Up**: Slowly raise the dumbbells until your arms make a 90-degree angle. Your forearms should be perpendicular to the floor. This is your starting position.
3. **Press**: Keep your neutral grip and lift the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended overhead.
4. **Lower Down**: Inhale and slowly bring the weights back down until your arms are at a 90-degree angle again.
5. **Repeat**: Continue for the recommended number of reps and feel those shoulders burn!
tip: 👊 Imagine you're pushing up the ceiling with your fists. Focus on a strong, controlled press to engage your shoulder muscles fully.
short_description: Pump up those shoulders and triceps with the Standing Palms-In Dumbbell Press! This move is fantastic for building upper body strength and definition. Get ready to press, lift, and feel the burn! 💪

name: Standing Palms-Up Barbell Behind The Back Wrist Curl
instructions: Start by standing straight and holding a barbell behind your glutes at arm's length while using a pronated grip (palms will be facing back away from the glutes) and having your hands shoulder width apart from each other.
You should be looking straight forward while your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, slowly elevate the barbell up by curling your wrist in a semi-circular motion towards the ceiling. Note: Your wrist should be the only body part moving for this exercise.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbell back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, lower the barbell down to the squat rack or the floor by bending the knees. Tip: It is easiest to either pick it up from a squat rack or have a partner hand it to you.
subtitle: Wrist Curl Magic
new_instructions:
1. Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell behind your glutes using a palms-up grip.
2. Keep your hands shoulder-width apart and look straight ahead.
3. Exhale and curl your wrists upward in a semi-circle motion, lifting the barbell.
4. Hold the curl for a second, then inhale and lower the barbell back down.
5. Repeat the curl for the recommended reps.
6. When done, carefully lower the barbell to a squat rack or the floor by bending your knees.
tip: Imagine you're casting a magic spell with your wrists! 🪄 Keep your forearms steady and let your wrists do the work.
short_description: Pump up those forearms with Wrist Curl Magic! This move isolates your wrists, making them stronger and more defined. Grab a barbell and let's get curling! 💪

name: Standing Pelvic Tilt
instructions: Start off with your feet hip-distance apart.
Bend your knees slightly to keep them soft and springy.
You may want to move your pelvis forward and backward and back few times before holding the tailbone forward in this stretch.
subtitle: Tilt Your Way to Strength
new_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet hip-distance apart.
2. Slightly bend your knees to keep them soft and springy.
3. Shift your pelvis forward and backward a few times to find your balance.
4. Hold your tailbone forward and feel the stretch in your lower back and glutes.
tip: 🦋 Imagine you’re a butterfly gently tilting its wings. Keep the movement smooth and controlled!
short_description: 🌟 Strengthen your lower back and glutes with the Standing Pelvic Tilt. It’s a simple move that packs a punch in improving flexibility and strength. Tilt and feel the magic!

name: Standing Rope Crunch
instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley and select an appropriate weight.
Stand with your back to the cable tower. Take the rope with both hands over your shoulders, holding it to your upper chest. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by flexing the spine, crunching the weight down as far as you can.
Hold the peak contraction for a moment before returning to the starting position.
subtitle: Crunch Time with Cables
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** the rope to a high pulley and **select** your weight.
2. **Stand** with your back to the cable tower and **grab** the rope with both hands over your shoulders, holding it to your upper chest. This is your starting position.
3. **Flex** your spine and **crunch** the weight down as far as you can go.
4. **Hold** the peak contraction for a moment.
5. **Return** to the starting position slowly and with control.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your form tight and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're folding your stomach like an accordion 🪗. This helps you really engage your abs and get the most out of each crunch!
short_description: Get ready to torch your abs with the Standing Rope Crunch! Using a cable machine, you'll crunch your way to a strong core. It's like a standing sit-up, but way cooler and more effective! 💪

name: Standing Soleus And Achilles Stretch
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-distance apart, one foot slightly in front of the other.
Bend both knees, keeping your back heel on the floor. Switch sides.
subtitle: Calf Stretch Time!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand** with feet hip-width apart, one foot a bit forward.
2. **Bend** both knees slightly.
3. **Keep** your back heel on the ground.
4. **Feel** the stretch in your calf.
5. **Hold** for 20-30 seconds.
6. **Switch** sides and repeat.
tip: Imagine your heels are glued to the floor like stickers 🧲. This helps you get a deeper stretch!
short_description: Stretch out those calves and Achilles with this simple move! Perfect for beginners, this stretch helps improve flexibility and can feel oh-so-good after a workout. 🦵✨

name: Standing Toe Touches
instructions: Stand with some space in front and behind you.
Bend at the waist, keeping your legs straight, until you can relax and let your upper body hang down in front of you. Let your arms and hands hang down naturally. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
subtitle: Touch Those Toes!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand up tall** with enough space around you.
2. **Bend forward** at the waist, keeping your legs straight.
3. **Let your upper body** hang down naturally.
4. **Relax your arms** and let them hang loosely.
5. **Hold this position** for 10 to 20 seconds.
6. **Slowly rise** back up to standing.
tip: Imagine you're a floppy puppet 🌟. Let your body hang loose for a deeper stretch!
short_description: Standing Toe Touches stretch your hamstrings and calves, helping you feel more flexible and relaxed. Hang and reach for those toes! 🚀

name: Standing Towel Triceps Extension
instructions: To begin, stand up with both arms fully extended above the head holding one end of a towel with both hands. Your elbows should be in and the arms perpendicular to the floor with the palms facing each other while your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.

Now communicate with your partner so that he/she can grip the other side of the towel to apply resistance. Keeping your upper arms close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the floor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The upper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the towel. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Towel Triceps Triumph!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart, gripping one end of a towel in each hand above your head.
2. **Communicate** with your partner so they can grab the other end of the towel to apply resistance.
3. **Lower** the towel in a semicircle behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms still.
4. **Touch** your forearms to your biceps, then **lift** the towel back up using your triceps.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps, keeping a steady, controlled pace.
tip: 💡 Imagine pulling a sword from its sheath behind your head—this helps keep your form sharp and focused!
short_description: Boost those triceps with this fun, partner exercise! The Standing Towel Triceps Extension is an awesome way to tone your arms while working with a buddy. 💪 Grab your towel and let's get moving!

name: Standing Two-Arm Overhead Throw
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding a medicine ball in both hands. To begin, reach the medicine ball deep behind your head as you bend the knees slightly and lean back.
Violently throw the ball forward, flexing at the hip and using your whole body to complete the movement.
The medicine ball can be thrown to a partner or to a wall, receiving it as it bounces back.
subtitle: Power Up with the Ball!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a medicine ball in both hands.
2. **Reach back** behind your head with the ball, bending your knees slightly and leaning back a bit.
3. **Throw forward** with all your might, using your whole body to push the ball.
4. **Flex your hips** as you throw to add more power.
5. **Catch the ball** if you're throwing it to a partner or let it bounce off a wall and grab it as it comes back.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero hurling a power ball to save the day! 🦸‍♂️ This mental image can help you put more energy into your throw.
short_description: Feel the power with the Standing Two-Arm Overhead Throw! This move will light up your shoulders, chest, and lats. Get ready to have fun and feel strong! 💪

name: Star Jump
instructions: Begin in a relaxed stance with your feet shoulder width apart and hold your arms close to the body.
To initiate the move, squat down halfway and explode back up as high as possible. Fully extend your entire body, spreading your legs and arms away from the body.
As you land, bring your limbs back in and absorb your impact through the legs.
subtitle: Jumping Jack Flash
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms by your sides.
2. **Bend your knees** slightly and squat halfway down.
3. **Jump up** explosively, spreading your legs wide and reaching your arms overhead to form a star shape.
4. **Land softly**, bringing your arms and legs back to the starting position.
5. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, keeping your movements quick and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're an energetic star shooting across the sky 🌠. Keep your core tight and land softly like you're on a cloud ☁️.
short_description: Star Jumps are a fun, high-energy move that gets your whole body involved. They work your legs, glutes, and shoulders, making you feel like a star 🌟. Perfect for adding some explosive power to your workout!

name: Step-up with Knee Raise
instructions: Stand facing a box or bench of an appropriate height with your feet together. This will be your starting position.

Begin the movement by stepping up, putting your left foot on the top of the bench. Extend through the hip and knee of your front leg to stand up on the box. As you stand on the box with your left leg, flex your right knee and hip, bringing your knee as high as you can.
Reverse this motion to step down off the box, and then repeat the sequence on the opposite leg.
