short_description: The Upward Stretch is a beginner-friendly move that helps loosen up your shoulders, chest, and lats. Perfect for starting your day or cooling down after a workout! 🌞

name: V-Bar Pulldown
instructions: Sit down on a pull-down machine with a V-Bar attached to the top pulley.
Adjust the knee pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads will prevent your body from being raised by the resistance attached to the bar.

Grab the V-bar with the palms facing each other (a neutral grip). Stick your chest out and lean yourself back slightly (around 30-degrees) in order to better engage the lats. This will be your starting position.

Using your lats, pull the bar down as you squeeze your shoulder blades. Continue until your chest nearly touches the V-bar. Exhale as you execute this motion. Tip: Keep the torso stationary throughout the movement.
After a second hold on the contracted position, slowly bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions.
subtitle: V-Bar Victory Pull
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the pull-down machine and attach the V-Bar to the top pulley.
2. **Adjust** the knee pad to your height to keep you grounded.
3. **Grab** the V-Bar with palms facing each other and lean back slightly, puffing out your chest.
4. **Pull** down the V-Bar using your lats, squeezing your shoulder blades together until the bar is near your chest. Exhale as you pull.
5. **Hold** the position for a second, then **slowly return** the bar to the starting position while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the prescribed number of reps, keeping your torso still.
tip: 🧲 Imagine your elbows are magnets pulling the bar to your chest. This helps engage your lats more effectively.
short_description: Get ready to sculpt your back and biceps with the V-Bar Pulldown! This move targets your lats and gives your upper body a solid workout. 💪 Perfect for those looking to build strength and muscle definition.

name: V-Bar Pullup
instructions: Start by placing the middle of the V-bar in the middle of the pull-up bar (assuming that the pull-up station you are using does not have neutral grip handles). The V-Bar handles will be facing down so that you can hang from the pull-up bar through the use of the handles.

Once you securely place the V-bar, take a hold of the bar from each side and hang from it. Stick your chest out and lean yourself back slightly in order to better engage the lats. This will be your starting position.

Using your lats, pull your torso up while leaning your head back slightly so that you do not hit yourself with the chin-up bar. Continue until your chest nearly touches the V-bar. Exhale as you execute this motion.
After a second hold on the contracted position, slowly lower your body back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions.
subtitle: V-Bar Victory Pull
new_instructions:
1. **Secure the V-Bar**: Place the middle of the V-Bar on the pull-up bar, ensuring the handles face down.
2. **Grab and Hang**: Hold the V-Bar handles from each side and hang. Stick your chest out and lean back slightly.
3. **Pull Up**: Using your lats, pull your torso up, leaning your head back a bit. Aim to bring your chest close to the V-Bar.
4. **Hold and Lower**: Hold at the top for a second, then slowly lower your body back to the start position. Inhale as you do this.
5. **Repeat**: Continue for the prescribed number of repetitions, maintaining good form.
tip: Imagine you're a superhero climbing to your victory! 🦸‍♂️ Keep your core tight and chest out to soar smoothly.
short_description: The V-Bar Pullup targets your lats, giving you a strong back and better posture. It’s a beginner-friendly move that’ll have you feeling like a superhero! 🦸‍♂️

name: Vertical Swing
instructions: Allow the dumbbell to hang at arms length between your legs, holding it with both hands. Keep your back straight and your head up.
Swing the dumbbell between your legs, flexing at the hips and bending the knees slightly.
Powerfully reverse the motion by extending at the hips, knees, and ankles to propel yourself upward, swinging the dumbell over your head.
As you land, absorb the impact through your legs and draw the dumbbell to your torso before the next repetition.
subtitle: Swing to the Sky
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a dumbbell with both hands and let it hang between your legs. Keep your back straight and your head up. 
2. **Swing** the dumbbell back between your legs by flexing at your hips and bending your knees slightly. 
3. **Powerfully extend** your hips, knees, and ankles to swing the dumbbell upward over your head. 
4. **Absorb** the landing impact through your legs, bringing the dumbbell back to your torso. 
5. **Repeat** the motion, keeping a smooth, controlled rhythm.
tip: Imagine you're launching a rocket 🚀. Your legs and hips are the fuel that propels the dumbbell up. Keep the motion fluid!
short_description: Launch that dumbbell skyward with the Vertical Swing! This move targets your hamstrings, glutes, and shoulders, giving you a powerful full-body workout. Get ready to swing and sweat! 💪

name: Walking, Treadmill
instructions: To begin, step onto the treadmill and select the desired option from the menu. Most treadmills have a manual setting, or you can select a program to run. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.

Treadmills offer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usually have less impact than walking outside. When walking, you should move at a moderate to fast pace, not a leisurely one. Being an activity of lower intensity, walking doesn't burn as many calories as some other activities, but still provides great benefit. A 150 lb person will burn about 175 calories walking 4 miles per hour for 30 minutes, compared to 450 calories running twice as fast. Maintain proper posture as you walk, and only hold onto the handles when necessary, such as when dismounting or checking your heart rate.
subtitle: Stride & Glide with a Smile!
new_instructions:
1. **Step Up**: Step onto the treadmill and choose a workout program or manual setting.
2. **Set Up**: Enter your age and weight to get a calorie burn estimate. Adjust the elevation for more intensity.
3. **Start Moving**: Walk at a moderate to fast pace. Keep it steady, we're not on a Sunday stroll!
4. **Posture Perfect**: Stand tall and keep your posture straight. Use the handles only when needed.
5. **Stay Strong**: Keep a consistent pace and enjoy the cardio benefits.
6. **Cool Down**: Gradually slow down before stepping off the treadmill.
tip: Imagine you're gliding on air like a hoverboard 🛹. Keep your steps light and smooth for the best experience!
short_description: Hop on the treadmill and get those legs moving! 🚶‍♂️ This beginner-friendly cardio workout targets your quads, calves, glutes, and hamstrings. Walk your way to fitness and have fun doing it!

name: Weighted Ball Hyperextension
instructions: To begin, lie down on an exercise ball with your torso pressing against the ball and parallel to the floor. The ball of your feet should be pressed against the floor to help keep you balanced. Place a weighted plate under your chin or behind your neck. This is the starting position.
Slowly raise your torso up by bending at the waist and lower back. Remember to exhale during this movement.
Hold the contraction on your lower back for a second and lower your torso back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.
subtitle: Back Boost on the Ball
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on an exercise ball with your torso pressing against it and your body parallel to the floor. Your feet should press against the ground to keep you stable.
2. **Hold** a weighted plate under your chin or behind your neck. This is your starting position.
3. **Lift** your torso slowly by bending at the waist and lower back. Exhale as you rise.
4. **Pause** for a second at the top to squeeze those back muscles.
5. **Lower** your torso back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps. Enjoy the burn!
tip: 🧘‍♂️ Imagine you're a superman flying! Keep your arms and legs straight and strong, just like a superhero.
short_description: Strengthen your lower back, glutes, and hamstrings with the Weighted Ball Hyperextension. This exercise is great for building a strong, resilient back. Fly high like a superhero! 🦸‍♂️

name: Weighted Ball Side Bend
instructions: To begin, lie down on an exercise ball with your left side of the torso (waist, hips and shoulder) pressed against the ball.

Your feet should be on the floor while your legs are crossed and hanging from the ball. Hold a weighted plate with your right hand directly to the right side of your head. Tip: Make sure the smooth side of the plate is resting against your head.
Place your left arm across your torso so that your palm is on your obliques. There should be a right angle between your left forearm and upper arm. This is the starting position.
Raise the side of your torso up by laterally flexing at the waist while exhaling.
Hold the contraction for a second and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch sides and repeat the exercise.
subtitle: Sculpt Your Sides with a Ball!
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on an exercise ball with your left side against it, waist, hips, and shoulder all touching the ball.
2. **Cross your legs** on the floor, holding a weighted plate with your right hand, pressed gently against the right side of your head.
3. **Place your left hand** on your obliques, making a right angle with your left forearm and upper arm. This is your starting position.
4. **Lift your torso** up sideways by flexing at the waist, and **exhale** as you do this.
5. **Pause** for a second at the top, then **lower yourself** back down slowly while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** the move for the recommended reps, then **switch sides** and repeat.
tip: Imagine you're a teapot tipping over - keep that line straight! 🫖 This will help engage your obliques better.
short_description: Work those abs with the Weighted Ball Side Bend! This move targets your obliques using an exercise ball and a weighted plate. It's a fun and challenging way to sculpt your waistline! 🔥

name: Weighted Bench Dip
instructions: For this exercise you will need to place a bench behind your back and another one in front of you. With the benches perpendicular to your body, hold on to one bench on its edge with the hands close to your body, separated at shoulder width. Your arms should be fully extended.

The legs will be extended forward on top of the other bench. Your legs should be parallel to the floor while your torso is to be perpendicular to the floor. Have your partner place the dumbbell on your lap. Note: This exercise is best performed with a partner as placing the weight on your lap can be challenging and cause injury without assistance. This will be your starting position.

Slowly lower your body as you inhale by bending at the elbows until you lower yourself far enough to where there is an angle slightly smaller than 90 degrees between the upper arm and the forearm. Tip: Keep the elbows as close as possible throughout the movement. Forearms should always be pointing down.
Using your triceps to bring your torso up again, lift yourself back to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Dip and Lift with Weights!
new_instructions:
1. Set up two benches, one behind and one in front, both perpendicular to your body. Sit and grip the back bench.
2. Extend your legs forward onto the front bench. Have a partner place a dumbbell on your lap.
3. Bend your elbows and slowly lower your body, keeping forearms vertical. Stop just before a 90-degree angle.
4. Push yourself back up using your triceps. Exhale as you lift.
5. Repeat for the recommended number of reps, keeping good form.
tip: Imagine you're a human seesaw; keep the movement smooth and controlled. 🏋️‍♀️
short_description: Crush those triceps with the Weighted Bench Dip! This move not only hammers your triceps but also gives your chest and shoulders some love. Plus, it's a fun way to challenge yourself with weights! 💪

name: Weighted Crunches
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle.
Hold a weight to your chest, or you may hold it extended above your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, exhale and slowly begin to roll your shoulders off the floor. Your shoulders should come up off the floor about 4 inches while your lower back remains on the floor.
At the top of the movement, flex your abs and hold for a brief pause.
Then inhale and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
subtitle: Crunch & Lift with a Twist
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on your back with your feet flat on the ground and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. **Grab a medicine ball** and hold it to your chest, or extend it above your torso.
3. **Exhale and crunch** by rolling your shoulders off the floor about 4 inches, keeping your lower back on the ground.
4. **Flex your abs** at the top and hold for a brief pause.
5. **Inhale and lower** back down slowly to the starting position.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a small orange between your abs as you crunch! 🍊 This helps engage your core better.
short_description: Get ready to fire up those abs! Weighted Crunches add an extra challenge with a medicine ball, making your core stronger and more defined. Perfect for beginners looking to level up their ab game! 💪

name: Weighted Jump Squat
instructions: Position a lightly loaded barbell across the back of your shoulders. You could also use a weighted vest, sandbag, or other type of resistance for this exercise.
The weight should be light enough that it doesn't slow you down significantly. Your feet should be just outside of shoulder width with your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.

Using a countermovement, squat partially down and immediately reverse your direction to explode off of the ground, extending through your hips, knees, and ankles. Maintain good posture throughout the jump.
As you return to the ground, absorb the impact through your legs.
subtitle: Leap with a Barbell!
new_instructions:
1. Place a barbell on your shoulders or wear a weighted vest. 
2. Stand with your feet just outside shoulder-width, head and chest up. 
3. Squat down slightly, then explode upwards into a jump. 
4. Extend your hips, knees, and ankles as you leap. 
5. Land softly, absorbing the impact through your legs. 
6. Reset and get ready for the next jump!
tip: 🎈 Imagine you're a spring-loaded rocket, powering up with every jump. Keep it light and explosive!
short_description: Blast off with the Weighted Jump Squat! This move powers up your quads, glutes, and more. It's like a squat and jump had a fitness baby! 🚀

name: Weighted Pull Ups
instructions: Attach a weight to a dip belt and secure it around your waist. Grab the pull-up bar with the palms of your hands facing forward. For a medium grip, your hands should be spaced at shoulder width. Both arms should be extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip.
You'll want to bring your torso back about 30 degrees while creating a curvature in your lower back and sticking your chest out. This will be your starting position.
Now, exhale and pull your torso up until your head is above your hands. Concentrate on squeezing yourshoulder blades back and down as you reach the top contracted position.
After a brief moment at the top contracted position, inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position with your arms extended and your lats fully stretched.
subtitle: Lift with Extra Oomph!
new_instructions:
1. **Attach** a weight to a dip belt and secure it around your waist.
2. **Grab** the pull-up bar with your palms facing forward, hands shoulder-width apart.
3. **Lean** back about 30 degrees, puff out your chest, and curve your lower back.
4. **Exhale** and pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar, squeezing your shoulder blades.
5. **Pause** briefly at the top, then **inhale** and lower yourself back to the start, fully extending your arms.
tip: Imagine you're pulling yourself up to peek over a tall fence to see something exciting on the other side! 🏞️
short_description: Amp up your pull-ups by adding weights! This exercise targets your lats and biceps, giving you a powerful back and arms. Feel the burn and embrace the challenge! 💪

name: Weighted Sissy Squat
instructions: Standing upright, with feet at shoulder width and toes raised, use one hand to hold onto the beams of a squat rack and the opposite arm to hold a plate on top of your chest. This is your starting position.

As you use one arm to hold yourself, bend at the knees and slowly lower your torso toward the ground by bringing your pelvis and knees forward. Inhale as you go down and stop when your upper and lower legs almost create a 90-degree angle. Hold the stretch position for a second.
After your one second hold, use your thigh muscles to bring your torso back up to the starting position. Exhale as you move up.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
subtitle: Quad-Burnin' Sissy Squats
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Up Tall**: Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes raised. Hold onto a squat rack with one hand and clutch a weight plate to your chest with the other.
2. **Lower Slowly**: Bend at your knees and slowly lower your torso toward the ground. Push your pelvis and knees forward as you inhale.
3. **Hit the Angle**: Stop lowering when your upper and lower legs form almost a 90-degree angle. Hold this position for a second.
4. **Push Back Up**: Use your thigh muscles to raise your torso back to the starting position. Exhale as you rise.
5. **Repeat**: Go for the recommended number of reps. Feel that quad burn!
tip: Imagine you're lowering yourself down an invisible slide 🎢. Keep it smooth and controlled for the best burn!
short_description: Feel the quad burn with Weighted Sissy Squats! This move targets your quadriceps while also giving your calves, glutes, and hamstrings some love. Get ready to squat like a pro! 🔥

name: Weighted Sit-Ups - With Bands
instructions: Start out by strapping the bands around the base of the decline bench. Place the handles towards the inside of the decline bench so that when lying down, you can reach for both of them.

Position your legs through the decline machine until they are secured. Now reach for the exercise bands with both hands. Use a pronated (palms forward) grip to grasp the handles. Position them near your collar bone and rotate your wrist to a neutral grip (palms facing the torso). Note: Your arms should remain stationary throughout the exercise. This is the starting position.

Move your torso upward until your upper body is perpendicular to the floor while exhaling. Hold the contraction for a second and lower your upper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Band-Powered Abs Pop
new_instructions:
1. **Strap** the bands around the base of a decline bench. Place handles inside so you can reach them when lying down. 
2. **Secure** your legs in the decline machine. Grab handles with a palms-forward grip and position them near your collarbone. Rotate wrists to a neutral grip (palms facing torso). Arms stay put!
3. **Lift** your torso up until your upper body is perpendicular to the floor. Exhale as you move up.
4. **Hold** the top position for a second, feeling your abs working.
5. **Lower** your upper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the recommended number of reps. Feel the burn!
tip: Imagine you're pulling yourself up with a giant rubber band! 🎯 Keep your focus on your abs doing the work.
short_description: Fire up your abs with Weighted Sit-Ups using bands! This move isolates your core for a powerful burn. Perfect for those ready to take their ab game to the next level. 🔥

name: Weighted Squat
instructions: Start by positioning two flat benches shoulder width apart from each other. Stand on top of them and wrap the weighted belt around your waist with the amount of weight you feel comfortable with. Make sure your toes are facing out.
Once you are standing straight up with the weight hanging in between your legs, position your arms so that they are fully extended to the side of your body. This is the starting position.

Begin by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that are perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.

Begin to move the body back up by pushing the floor of the flat bench with the ball of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat it like it's hot!
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** on two flat benches, feet shoulder-width apart. Wrap a weighted belt around your waist with a comfy amount of weight. Point your toes out. 
2. **Extend your arms** straight out to the sides and stand up straight with the weight hanging between your legs. This is your starting position.
3. **Bend your knees** and lower your body. Keep your posture straight and head up. Go down until your thighs are just below parallel to the floor. Inhale as you go.
4. **Push back up** by pressing the benches with the balls of your feet, straightening your legs to return to the start. Exhale as you go up.
5. **Repeat** for the recommended reps and feel the burn!
tip: Imagine you're sitting back into a tiny chair 🎭. Keep your balance and posture in check!
short_description: Pump up those legs with the Weighted Squat! This move targets your quads, glutes, and more. It’s a fantastic way to build strength and stability. Get ready to feel powerful! 💪

name: Wide-Grip Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench with feet firm on the floor. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the floor. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your middle chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest Builder Extraordinaire
new_instructions:
1. **Lie Down**: Settle on a flat bench with your feet planted firmly on the floor.
2. **Grip the Bar**: Use a wide, overhand grip, about 3 inches wider than shoulder-width on each side.
3. **Lift Off**: Push the bar off the rack and hold it straight above you with locked arms.
4. **Lower the Bar**: Inhale and slowly bring the bar down to your mid-chest.
5. **Push Up**: Exhale and press the bar back to the starting position, locking your arms and squeezing your chest.
6. **Repeat**: Continue for the recommended number of reps, keeping control throughout.
tip: Imagine pushing the bar as if you’re moving a stubborn door that won’t budge. 🚪 Engage your chest and triceps for maximum power!
short_description: Pump up your chest muscles with the Wide-Grip Barbell Bench Press! This move engages your chest, shoulders, and triceps for a powerful upper body workout. Feel strong and mighty with every press! 💪

name: Wide-Grip Decline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie back on a decline bench with the feet securely locked at the front of the bench. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the floor. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your lower chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Chest Power Decline Press
new_instructions:
1. **Lie down** on a decline bench, securing your feet at the front.
2. **Grip the bar** with a wide, palms-forward hold, about 3 inches wider than shoulder-width.
3. **Lift the bar** from the rack, holding it straight over you with locked arms. This is your starting position.
4. **Lower the bar** slowly to your lower chest as you breathe in, feeling the stretch.
5. **Push the bar** back up as you breathe out, using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest at the top.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of reps, taking twice as long to lower the bar as to lift it.
tip: Imagine you're squeezing a beach ball between your hands as you press up 🏖️. This helps engage your chest muscles even more!
short_description: Boost your chest power with the Wide-Grip Decline Barbell Bench Press! This move targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps, giving you a strong, sculpted upper body. It's like giving your pecs a high-five! 💪

name: Wide-Grip Decline Barbell Pullover
instructions: Lie down on a decline bench with both legs securely locked in position. Reach for the barbell behind the head using a pronated grip (palms facing out). Make sure to grab the barbell wider than shoulder width apart for this exercise. Slowly lift the barbell up from the floor by using your arms.
When positioned properly, your arms should be fully extended and perpendicular to the floor. This is the starting position.

Begin by moving the barbell back down in a semicircular motion as if you were going to place it on the floor, but instead, stop when the arms are parallel to the floor. Tip: Keep the arms fully extended at all times. The movement should only happen at the shoulder joint. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Now bring the barbell up while exhaling until you are back at the starting position. Remember to keep full control of the barbell at all times.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
When finished with your set, slowly lower the barbell back down until it is level with your head and release it.
subtitle: Chest Champion Lift
new_instructions:
1. **Lie Down**: Secure your legs on a decline bench and reach for the barbell behind your head with palms facing out.
2. **Lift Up**: Raise the barbell up from the floor using your arms until they are fully extended and perpendicular to the floor.
3. **Lower Slowly**: Move the barbell back down in a semicircular motion, stopping when your arms are parallel to the floor. Inhale as you lower.
4. **Lift Again**: Bring the barbell back up to the starting position while exhaling. Keep control!
5. **Repeat**: Continue the movement for the prescribed reps, keeping arms extended.
6. **Finish**: After your set, slowly lower the barbell to head level and release it.
tip: 🧠 Imagine your arms as strong, steady crane arms. Keep them straight and let your shoulders do the lifting!
short_description: Boost your chest game with the Wide-Grip Decline Barbell Pullover! This move targets your chest, shoulders, and triceps, giving you a powerful upper body workout. Ready to feel the burn? 💪

name: Wide-Grip Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit down on a pull-down machine with a wide bar attached to the top pulley. Make sure that you adjust the knee pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads will prevent your body from being raised by the resistance attached to the bar.

Grab the bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

As you breathe out, bring the bar down until it touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work except for holding the bar; therefore do not try to pull down the bar using the forearms.

After a second at the contracted position squeezing your shoulder blades together, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched. Inhale during this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lat Pulldown Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Sit** on the pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit your height.
2. **Grab** the bar with your palms facing forward and hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
3. **Lean** your torso back about 30 degrees, arching your lower back and pushing your chest out.
4. **Pull** the bar down to your upper chest by drawing your shoulders and upper arms down and back. Squeeze your back muscles.
5. **Slowly raise** the bar back to the starting position, fully extending your arms and stretching your lats. Inhale as you do this.
6. **Repeat** for the prescribed number of reps, keeping your upper torso stationary and focusing on your lats.
tip: 🧲 Imagine you are a magnet pulling the bar toward your chest. Keep your mind on your lats and feel the squeeze!
short_description: Get those lats and biceps working with the Wide-Grip Lat Pulldown! This fun compound move uses a cable machine to help you build strength and muscle. 💪

name: Wide-Grip Pulldown Behind The Neck
instructions: Sit down on a pull-down machine with a wide bar attached to the top pulley. Make sure that you adjust the knee pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads will prevent your body from being raised by the resistance attached to the bar.

Grab the bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso and head forward. Think of an imaginary line from the center of the bar down to the back of your neck. This is your starting position.

As you breathe out, bring the bar down until it touches the back of your neck by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work except for holding the bar; therefore do not try to pull down the bar using the forearms.

After a second on the contracted position squeezing your shoulder blades together, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched. Inhale during this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Pull for Power!
new_instructions:
1. **Sit down** on the pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit your height. This will keep you secure. 
2. **Grab the bar** with your palms facing forward, using a grip wider than your shoulders. 
3. **Lean forward** so your torso and head are in front of the bar. Imagine a line from the bar to the back of your neck. 
4. **Pull down** the bar until it touches the back of your neck. Focus on squeezing your back muscles. Keep your upper torso still and only move your arms. 
5. **Hold for a second** while squeezing your shoulder blades together. 
6. **Slowly raise** the bar back to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're a powerful crane, smoothly lifting and lowering a heavy load. Keep your movements controlled and steady. 🚜
short_description: Strengthen your lats, biceps, and shoulders with the Wide-Grip Pulldown Behind The Neck. This compound exercise will have you feeling strong and powerful! 💪

name: Wide-Grip Rear Pull-Up
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing forward using a wide grip.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar, bring your torso forward and head so that there is an imaginary line from the pull-up bar to the back of your neck. This is your starting position.

Pull your torso up until the bar is near the back of your neck. To do this, draw the shoulders and upper arms down and back while slightly leaning your head forward. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Lat Power Pull-Up Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** the pull-up bar with palms facing forward and a wide grip.
2. **Position** your body with arms extended, torso forward, and head slightly ahead so that there's a straight line from the bar to the back of your neck.
3. **Pull** your torso up until the bar is near the back of your neck. Focus on squeezing your back muscles. Exhale during this step.
4. **Hold** for a second at the top, feeling the contraction in your lats and back.
5. **Lower** yourself slowly back to the starting position while inhaling.
6. **Repeat** for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your movement controlled and steady.
tip: ✨ Imagine your lats as wings lifting you up. The stronger your wings, the higher you'll soar! 🦅
short_description: Wide-Grip Rear Pull-Up targets your lats, biceps, middle back, and shoulders. It's a powerful move to build upper body strength and get those wings flapping! Give it a go and feel the burn! 💥

name: Wide-Grip Standing Barbell Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at the wide outer handle. The palm of your hands should be facing forward. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Boosting Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall:** Grab a barbell with a wide grip and keep your palms facing forward. Stand up straight with your elbows close to your torso.
2. **Curl Up:** Keep your upper arms still, then curl the barbell up towards your shoulders as you breathe out. Focus on using your biceps.
3. **Squeeze:** When the bar reaches shoulder level, squeeze your biceps and hold for a second. Feel the burn!
4. **Lower Slowly:** Bring the barbell back down to the starting position slowly as you breathe in.
5. **Repeat:** Do the recommended number of repetitions and enjoy the bicep burn!
tip: Imagine you're holding a tray of your favorite snacks. Keep it steady and level as you curl the barbell up and down. 🍕
short_description: Get ready to flex those biceps with the Wide-Grip Standing Barbell Curl! This move isolates your biceps for maximum growth. Feel the pump and enjoy the burn! 💪

name: Wide Stance Barbell Squat
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a wider-than-shoulder-width stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance, and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position.

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel of your foot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Wider Squats, Stronger Legs!
new_instructions:
1. **Rack It Up**: Set the bar on a rack at shoulder height. Step under it and rest it on your shoulders. 
2. **Lift Off**: Grip the bar, push with your legs, and straighten your torso to lift it off the rack. 
3. **Step Back**: Step away from the rack. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Keep your head up and back straight. 
4. **Squat Down**: Slowly bend your knees. Lower until your thighs are below parallel to the floor. Inhale as you go down. 
5. **Power Up**: Push through your heels to straighten your legs and stand back up. Exhale as you rise. 
6. **Repeat**: Do the recommended number of reps. Keep your form all the way through.
tip: 👀 Imagine you're sitting back into a chair. This helps keep your knees behind your toes and your back straight!
short_description: Widen your stance for this power move! The Wide Stance Barbell Squat works your quads, glutes, and more. Feel the burn and build that lower body strength! 🔥

name: Wide Stance Stiff Legs
instructions: Begin with a barbell loaded on the floor. Adopt a wide stance, and then bend at the hips to grab the bar. Your hips should be as far back as possible, and your legs nearly straight. Keep your back straight, and your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.

Begin the movement be engaging the hips, driving them forward as you allow the arms to hang straight. Continue until you are standing straight up, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position. For successive reps, the weight need not touch the floor.
subtitle: Widen Your Stance, Lift Your Game!
new_instructions:
1. Stand with your feet wide apart and bend at your hips to grab the barbell on the floor.
2. Keep your hips back, legs almost straight, back straight, and chest up.
3. Engage your hips and drive them forward, lifting the barbell as you stand up straight.
4. Let your arms hang straight as you lift the barbell.
5. Slowly return the barbell to the starting position, but don't let it touch the floor.
6. Repeat for the desired number of reps, keeping form tight and controlled.
tip: Imagine you're trying to crack a walnut between your glutes as you lift. 🍑 Squeeze tight!
short_description: This compound movement targets your hamstrings, glutes, and lower back. Get ready to feel powerful and strong with each lift! 💪🏼

name: Wind Sprints
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar using a pronated grip. Your arms and legs should be extended. This will be your starting position.
Begin by quickly raising one knee as high as you can. Do not swing your body or your legs. 3
Immediately reverse the motion, returning that leg to the starting position. Simultaneously raise the opposite knee as high as possible.
Continue alternating between legs until the set is complete.
subtitle: Quick Knee Highs
new_instructions:
1. **Hang** from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you. Keep your arms and legs straight. This is your starting position.
2. **Lift** one knee up towards your chest as high as you can. Keep your body steady and avoid swinging.
3. **Switch** legs quickly, bringing the raised leg back down while lifting the other knee up.
4. **Repeat** these alternating movements, focusing on a fast and controlled motion.
5. **Keep Going** until you've completed your set, aiming for speed and precision.
tip: Imagine you're marching in place, but in the air! 🕴️ Keep your core tight like you're bracing for a punch.
short_description: Wind Sprints are a fantastic bodyweight exercise that targets your abs while giving you a cardio boost! 💨 Perfect for beginners, this move will get your heart racing and your core burning. Think of it as a vertical sprint in the air!

name: Windmills
instructions: Lie on your back with your arms extended out to the sides and your legs straight. This will be your starting position.
Lift one leg and quickly cross it over your body, attempting to touch the ground near the opposite hand.
Return to the starting position, and repeat with the opposite leg. Continue to alternate for 10-20 repetitions.
subtitle: Spin Those Legs!
new_instructions:
1. Lie down on your back with your arms spread wide like a T.
2. Keep your legs straight and lift one leg up.
3. Swing that leg across your body to try and touch the ground by your opposite hand.
4. Bring your leg back to the starting position.
5. Repeat with your other leg.
6. Keep alternating legs for 10-20 reps, like a windmill spinning!
tip: Imagine your legs are windshield wipers swishing side to side. 🧽🦵
short_description: Feel the stretch with Windmills! This exercise works your abductors, glutes, hamstrings, and lower back. Let's get those legs moving like a windmill! 🌬️

name: World's Greatest Stretch
instructions: This is a three-part stretch. Begin by lunging forward, with your front foot flat on the ground and on the toes of your back foot. With your knees bent, squat down until your knee is almost touching the ground. Keep your torso erect, and hold this position for 10-20 seconds.

Now, place the arm on the same side as your front leg on the ground, with the elbow next to the foot. Your other hand should be placed on the ground, parallel to your lead leg, to help support you during this portion of the stretch.

After 10-20 seconds, place your hands on either side of your front foot. Raise the toes of the front foot off of the ground, and straighten your leg. You may need to reposition your rear leg to do so. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then repeat the entire sequence for the other side.
subtitle: Stretch For Success!
new_instructions:
1. **Lunge Forward**: Start by lunging forward. Keep your front foot flat and your back foot on its toes. Bend your knees and squat down until your back knee is almost touching the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds.
2. **Hand Placement**: Place your hand (same side as your front leg) on the ground, elbow next to your foot. Your other hand should also be on the ground, parallel to your lead leg for support. Hold for 10-20 seconds.
3. **Foot Raise**: Place both hands on either side of your front foot. Lift the toes of your front foot off the ground and straighten your leg. Adjust your rear leg if needed. Hold for 10-20 seconds.
4. **Switch Sides**: Repeat on the other side.
tip: Imagine you're reaching for the stars with each stretch 🌟. This will help you extend fully and get the most out of your stretch.
short_description: Dubbed the 'World's Greatest Stretch' for a reason, this move targets your hamstrings, calves, glutes, and quads in one sequence. Perfect for a full-body stretch! 🌍

name: Wrist Circles
instructions: Start by standing straight with your feet being shoulder width apart from each other. Elevate your arms to the side of you until they are fully extended and parallel to the floor at a height that is evenly aligned with your shoulders. Tip: Your torso and arms should form the letter "T: Your palms should be facing down. This is the starting position.

Keeping your entire body stationary except for the wrists, begin to rotate both wrists forward in a circular motion. Tip: Pretend that you are trying to draw circles by using your hands as the brush. Breathe normally as you perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Whirly Wrist Warm-Up
new_instructions:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Lift your arms out to the sides, making a 'T' shape with your body.
3. Keep your palms facing down and your arms steady.
4. Start rotating your wrists in small circles forward.
5. Imagine you're drawing circles with your hands.
6. Keep breathing normally and enjoy the stretch!
tip: Pretend your hands are paintbrushes creating perfect circles in the air! 🎨
short_description: Warm up those wrists with Wrist Circles! This beginner-friendly move is perfect to get your forearms ready for action. 🌀 Keep it light and fun while you loosen up!

name: Wrist Roller
instructions: To begin, stand straight up grabbing a wrist roller using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your feet should be shoulder width apart.

Slowly lift both arms until they are fully extended and parallel to the floor in front of you. Note: Make sure the rope is not wrapped around the roller. Your entire body should be stationary except for the forearms. This is the starting position.
Rotate one wrist at a time in an upward motion to bring the weight up to the bar by rolling the rope around the roller.
Once the weight has reached the bar, slowly begin to lower the weight back down by rotating the wrist in a downward motion until the weight reaches the starting position.
Repeat for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.
subtitle: Forearm Fire-Up
new_instructions:
1. **Stand Tall**: Grab the wrist roller with your palms facing down. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart and stand up straight. 
2. **Extend Arms**: Lift your arms until they are straight and parallel to the ground. Keep your body still; only your forearms should move. 
3. **Roll Up**: Twist one wrist at a time to roll the weight up. Imagine you're winding a fishing reel. 
4. **Lower Slowly**: Once the weight reaches the top, slowly roll it back down by twisting your wrists in the opposite direction. 
5. **Repeat**: Do this for the number of reps your workout plan suggests. Feel the burn in your forearms!
tip: 🏋️‍♂️ Imagine you're reeling in a big fish—keep those movements steady and controlled for the best burn!
short_description: Get ready to light up your forearms with the Wrist Roller! This beginner-friendly move isolates the forearms and gives your shoulders a little action too. Feel the fire and reel in those gains! 🔥

name: Wrist Rotations with Straight Bar
instructions: Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Alternating between each of your hands, perform the movement by extending the wrist as though you were rolling up a newspaper. Continue alternating back and forth until failure.
Reverse the motion by flexing the wrist, rolling the opposite direction. Continue the alternating motion until failure.
subtitle: Wrist Whirl Fun
new_instructions:
1. **Grab** a barbell with both hands, palms down, shoulder-width apart. This is your starting position.
2. **Extend** your wrist with one hand as if rolling up a newspaper.
3. **Alternate** to the other hand and do the same motion.
4. **Keep going** until you feel the burn in your forearms.
5. **Reverse** the motion, flexing the wrist and rolling in the opposite direction.
6. **Alternate** back and forth until you can't go anymore!
tip: Imagine you're revving a motorcycle 🏍️. Feel the engine roar in your forearms!
short_description: Wrist Rotations with a Straight Bar are perfect for building strong forearms. Grab a barbell and get those wrists rolling! 💪

name: Yoke Walk
instructions: The yoke is usually done with a yoke apparatus, but is sometimes seen with refrigerators or other heavy objects.
Begin by racking the apparatus across the back of the shoulders. With your head looking forward and back arched, lift the yoke by driving through the heels.

Begin walking as quickly as possible using short, quick steps. You may hold the side posts of the yoke to help steady it and hold it in position. Continue for the given distance as fast as possible, usually 75-100 feet.
subtitle: Heavy Load Stroll
new_instructions:
1. **Rack It Up**: Begin by positioning the yoke apparatus across the back of your shoulders. Stand tall and keep your head looking forward.
2. **Lift and Drive**: Arch your back slightly and lift the yoke by pushing through your heels.
3. **Quick Steps**: Start walking as quickly as you can. Take short, fast steps.
4. **Steady Hands**: Hold the side posts of the yoke to keep it stable and in place.
5. **Distance Hustle**: Continue moving fast for the set distance, typically 75-100 feet.
tip: Imagine you're a human forklift! 🚜 Keep your core tight to balance the load and maintain good posture.
short_description: Take on the Yoke Walk to build serious strength and stability! Carrying heavy loads over a distance challenges your entire body. Get ready to feel powerful! 💪

name: Zercher Squats
instructions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. The correct height should be anywhere above the waist but below the chest. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, lock your hands together and place the bar on top of your arms in between the forearm and upper arm.
Lift the bar up so that it is resting on top of your forearms. If you are holding the bar properly, it should look as if you have your arms crossed but with a bar running across them.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discussion we will use the medium stance described above which targets overall development; however you can choose any of the three stances discussed in the foot stances section).

Begin to lower the bar by bending the knees as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees (which is the point in which the upper legs are below parallel to the floor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the ball of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Squat Hug Power!
new_instructions:
1. Set the bar: Place the barbell on a rack at about chest height. Lock your hands and rest the bar on your forearms, like you're giving it a big hug!
2. Lift and position: Stand tall, lift the barbell off the rack, and step back. Your legs should be shoulder-width apart, with toes slightly pointed out.
3. Stay straight: Keep your head up and back straight. This is your starting stance.
4. Squat time: Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are just below parallel to the floor. Imagine sitting back into an invisible chair.
5. Rise up: Push through your feet to stand back up, exhaling as you rise.
6. Repeat: Do the recommended number of reps, keeping that form tight!
tip: 🤔 Imagine you're sitting back into a chair that's just a bit too far behind you. This helps with balance and form!
short_description: Zercher Squats are a fun twist on the traditional squat, adding an extra challenge to your core and legs. Perfect for those looking to up their squat game and strengthen multiple muscles at once! 💪

name: Zottman Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
Make sure the palms of the hands are facing each other. This will be your starting position.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Your wrist should rotate so that you have a supinated (palms up) grip. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Now during the contracted position, rotate your wrist until you now have a pronated (palms facing down) grip with the thumb at a higher position than the pinky.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back down using the pronated grip.
As the dumbbells close your thighs, start rotating the wrist so that you go back to a neutral (palms facing your body) grip.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Bliss Curl
new_instructions:
1. **Stand tall** with a dumbbell in each hand, arms straight down, palms facing in.
2. **Curl up** the weights, turning your wrists so palms face up, squeezing those biceps.
3. **Pause briefly** at the top, feeling the burn, and then twist your wrists so palms face down.
4. **Lower slowly** back down, keeping control and returning to the start.
5. **Twist wrists** back to the start position as you near your thighs.
6. **Repeat** for your set number of reps, keeping movements smooth and strong.
tip: Imagine you're scooping up two big, delicious ice creams 🍦 with each curl. Keep it slow and steady to savor the squeeze!
short_description: Meet the Zottman Curl: a fun twist on the classic bicep curl! This move not only pumps your biceps but also gives your forearms some love. Feel the burn and enjoy the gains! 💪

name: Zottman Preacher Curl
instructions: Grab a dumbbell in each hand and place your upper arms on top of the preacher bench or the incline bench. The dumbbells should be held at shoulder height and the elbows should be flexed. Hold the dumbbells with the palms of your hands facing down. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbbells keeping the palms down until your upper arm is extended and your biceps are fully stretched.
Now rotate your wrists once you are at the bottom of the movement so that the palms of the hands are facing up.

As you exhale, use your biceps to curl the weights up until they are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder height. Again, remember that to ensure full contraction you need to bring that small finger higher than the thumb.
Squeeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and rotate your wrists so that the palms are facing down again.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
subtitle: Bicep Bliss Curl
new_instructions:
1. Grab a dumbbell in each hand and sit on a preacher bench. Keep your upper arms on the bench and your palms facing down.
2. Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells, stretching out your biceps.
3. Rotate your wrists so your palms face up when reaching the bottom.
4. Exhale and curl the weights up using your biceps until the dumbbells are at shoulder height.
5. Squeeze your biceps at the top, then rotate your wrists back to palms down.
6. Repeat for your set number of reps.
tip: Imagine you're scooping up your favorite ice cream 🍦. Keep that motion smooth and controlled!
short_description: Pump up those biceps and forearms with the Zottman Preacher Curl! This move isolates your muscles for a focused, effective workout. Feel the burn and enjoy the gains! 💪
